review_body: The hotel is in pretty good shape overall, but it could use renovation. We were told that it is slated for a make-over. The staff were friendly and the hotel's location is great, with easy access to public transportation. My major problem was the mattress, which seemed to be well used. It was exceedingly soft and provided no support. I developed severe lower back pain after two nights. Avoid staying at this hotel if you have any issues with your back.
user_name:
icek127
New York City, New York

review_body: Perfectly located right on union square. The hotel delivers exactly what you expect from a W. Good service, clean room, nice assortment of toiletries. Easy check in and and great restaurant on the ground floor.

We went into the city for a late Valentine's Day celebration mid-week. Room was fantastic but room service was too pricey. We had vouchers thankfully. Omelet looked like it was made from only one egg - smallest I have ever seen. We were allowed a late checkout and everyone was cordial.
user_name:
William J
Sound Beach, New York

review_body: We stayed at the W for 4 nights and it has a great location in Union Square - perfect if you like to be somewhere a little quieter, away from the real tourist hotspots yet close enough to everything. The hotel itself is dated from the reception area to the rooms, although it’s clean comfortable and user friendly. We were upset and surprised they cancelled access to our sons’ room after 2 nights as there was no credit card on the room- we had presumed both rooms were on our room credit card and this had worked fine for the first 2 nights. This caused confusion and delay in getting to bed fairly late one evening and was unnecessary and draconian. This was probably because our agent, Virgin holidays didn’t get our booking right, but that’s another story. I’m also still unsure why there is a daily credit card charge of 25 dollars for incidentals from the mini bar and room service, but we don’t really use either.The Irvington restaurant and bar are good, trendy and efficient and I’d recommend both. I just wish the rooms in the hotel had the same look and feel as they really are in need of a complete upgrade and make over. There is no Nespresso/ coffee machine in the room, but there is coffee offered at reception instead. Not ideal if you want an early morning cuppa in your PJ’s! We had to move room after the first night as we only had one of the two suites we’d booked and we were left to move all our luggage despite the hotel saying they would do this. The door staff are also a bit hit and miss - sometimes the heavy entrance door is held open for you and sometimes they leave you to struggle through - neither are big issues but it does leave the impression that this isn’t really a 5 star hotel. Would we come back? If the rates were much lower possibly and maybe if we booked direct, as the location is good and the beds comfy, however we paid top dollar for a five star hotel and holiday experience as recommended by Virgin holidays. They do need to revisit some of their recommendations and overall customer service. I suspect there are better options if you do your research. We would never use Virgin holidays again for a number of reasons, but that’s not the hotels fault. All in all it’s not a bad hotel at all - just not typical of the W brand and what you expect from it, so just be aware of that before you stay.

Flight arrived late at night and I needed room service. The phone was not working in the room, so I called via my cell phone. Front desk said they would call back and never did. Went down to the front desk in desperation and they refused to help. No apology, just “our order guy is out so too bad for you.” This was the night managers response as well as the morning manager and the check out clerk. It felt like they were all going out of their way to be rude and offer no apology. No concierge level at this Marriott affiliate either. The room was surprisingly nice compared to the dingy hallway and lobby, and they eventually fixed the phone. Frankly, there are MANY hotels in NYC at this price point, so be sure to chose another one.

I've been staying off and on at this W Hotel for five years now. The team are very New York, meaning that they are quick and sometimes aren't as friendly as other W Hotels around the world. Except for Magy Carty who always greets me with respect and makes me feel grateful for me choosing that W Hotel in Manhattan. I wouldn't continue to bing my business to this W if it weren't for Magy. She is truly an asset. We will see you soon Magy!

Fantastic Hotel. Great Views. Great Location. Close to everything but not overcrowded. Hotel Staff extremely friendly and accommodating. Room has all the amenities you need. Clean. Comfortable Beds. Great bathroom and water pressure and shower. Complimentary Coffee and Hot Apple Cider in the lobby welcome you. Definitely we will be back

Nice hotel, great location for our needs! Nelson at the Front desk took very good care of us at check-in. We have stayed here many times in the past few years. Due to our Platinum Elite status we were upgraded to a room on 21st floor. Room was clean, bed comfortable,very spacious & most importantly it was quiet.. I believe I read somewhere that the hotel is due for a big renovation.

Typically I do not choose W, as I prefer Westin properties for business. I chose this hotel as it was a Marriott brand near our business meetings.The check in was smooth, but no mention or offer for my Platinum Elite status.Hotel is clean, but bathrooms are datedOnly one option for food on property Decent room service menu options Loved having a mini bar as most hotels these days don't have them.

The hotel was in a great location but the hotel staff was not helpful. Coffee pots were not available, I was overcharged for my room and had to call too many times to get it fixed and got a big run around. I was charged for the mini bar that was to be credited for 25 dollars. The bed was not comfortable but I could have lived with that. This hotel is supposed to be in the Marriott chain and that is surprising as it’s lacking the amenities and staff that we used to from Marriott.

Mediocre experience and not the standard i expect of a W in a city like New York. Tired service from the front desk at check in and the room was not a great experience. New York has so many better options for the same price

This was a business trip. Our company is a preferred vendor. My wife and I could not be nicer more friendly people. We asked for a quiet room away from the elevators, and a view if possible but optional. When we arrived the front desk staff could not have been more indifferent. There was no line, no rush, but they rushed us through check-in like they had somewhere else to be. We were told there were no available upgrades. We asked about the quiet room away from the elevators and a view if possible. The response was more or less you get the room we give you and you don't have a choice. We were told it was a quiet room with a partial view. In fact the room shared a wall with the stairwell and all the elevators shafts. The elevator produced such a high pitched loud metal squeaking that it would wake the dead. Try taking a nap during the day but that was impossible with all the elevator traffic. At night traffic calmed down just enough for you to fall asleep before someone would use the elevator and the high pitch squeal would inevitably wake you up repeatedly all night long. The partial view was nothing but the brick wall of the adjacent building, no view period. After our check-in experience we didn't bother to complain to the front desk about the noise.The whole experience was a real shame because the room was a good size for New York. Bed was comfortable, heat worked well, plenty of space to unpack your suitcase and store clothing and bags in the wardrobe. Good counter space and water pressure in the bathroom. Decent size TV and the internet worked well. We had our doubts about how the $25 Daily Destination fee/credit would work but actually it worked out fine. We did use the in-room dining and the mini-bar and it was all accounted for accurately and they didn't try to screw us at check-out. The doormen were excellent help offering free umbrellas when it rained which we returned at the end of the day. We didn't use the lounge or restaurant because they were both very crowded and expensive with mediocre reviews online. Union Square is a great neighborhood. In the end I wish they would have listened to use and gave us a quiet room. Especially given our preferred vendor booking. That's all it would have taken for a positive stay.

My second trip here and just as good -love the location as you're close to Flatiron and Union sq where there is lots and easy to get around uptown or downtown. Bar is very good, always a good atmosphere. Rooms like all W hotels are a bit funky in terms of color but I've grown to like it. Will stay again for sure.

When being in new your you need to just deduct one or two stars to size up the hotels.Knowing that sirens will be wailing, you would expect that the W invested into proper sound insulation. Not the case. Depending on your room, you are practically sleeping on the street. Try to get a room facing the ugly backside of the hotel. Ideally high up as you will hear buzzing of the industrial ventilation units, at least I could.Interior modern flimsy, all cheap made stuff giving you a low sense of quality. Food, 2 star hotel level. Breakfast is no different than being at a 60$ hotel in NJ.You get 2-3 star hotel for your 4xx$ expense, nothing more. It’s 60$ for the hotel and 400$ for being in NY.NY hotels remain to have the worst value for money ratios among global tier 1 locations.

I was in the area for a holiday party and thought it would be a good idea given the brand and the name to pop in to the hotel bar restaurant for a bite and some drinks with friends. Worst idea ever. The service was amateur hour. The staff is very slow. They seemed stumped on how to seat 7 people in a more then half empty space. They seemed to have no idea how to accommodate a group of 7. Then proceeded to be weird about everything. They seemed like they wanted to go home at 10:30 and just didn’t want to give good service. Idk not feeling it.

The location is great with hundreds of nice restaurants nearby. There is next to no signage on the outside. I walked by two times to find the entrance. I was given a room on the sixteenth floor. The view of the city is terrible. The room is huge for New York City standard. The lobby, the hallway and room decor are bit outdated， especially on this overcast wintry December day. The staff are efficient and professional.

Stayed for 5 nights in November. The decor in our room looked like something a 3rd rate 1980s stylist would have come up with. And the air con was either booking or freezing. Needs a total refurb. Restaurant good with decent wine choices.

Lovely hotel in a good location. Comfortable beds and big rooms for New York. Would definitely stay here again. Can get quite noisy early morning when the market sets up but that’s not every day so it’s fine, and also dependant whether you’re looking out onto the square or not.

We all know the US is one of the less hospitable destinations for the discerned traveller, but the W at Union Square wins the prize of the least hospitable team in 2019 for sure.The way the staff interacts with the hotel guests is downright rude and inconsiderate. The management absolutely needs to put this team on a training and maybe send them abroad to see how it's done in other countries and to learn what it means to serve in hospitality industry.A few examples:- checking in: after 24hours on the road (incl the world's longest flight from Singapore to Newark), I checked in via the app and said I would arrive at 9. I arrived several hours before that but decided to go for a walk and watch NYC awake. Upon coming back at 9, there was no room available for me and I got to hear that I would need to wait until noon, which is normal check-in time. So much for the Your24 benefit that Starwood used to offer... I finally got a room at 1pm... When I asked if I could get my luggage to use the gym facilities to freshen up, the staff returned my bags and let me haul them to the gym only to find out there is no dressing room or shower in the gym... At no point was the staff helpful or understanding for my situation, nor did they offer alternatives. However, as I found out later, as a Platinum Ambassador guest, I have access to the nearby Swerve gym where I could have showered and freshened up, hours before checking in.- Upgrades: I didnt get a room upgrade although I booked weeks in advance and I am a platinum member for almost 8 years now.- Check-in: you know how the front-end staff explains you your status benefits when you check-in? not so in the W Union Square. I found out later and just by stumbling upon a tiny card in my key holder that a) I had access to a great gym outside the hotel; b) a $25 voucher for in-room dining and c) a laundry voucher which I could not use because I found out too late (you need to turn in laundry before 9am or otherwise wait until 6pm the next day to get it back).

I was a returning customer, stayed in June 7 nights with my family. I left my luggage when I was checking out (noon time). When I am back, I asked a place to open my luggage and put couple of stuff in to it. Receptionist said that they don’t a private place but I could do just over there. I was trying to do it as discrete as possible , near to the check in bar, suddenly the receptionist got mad and she said that I couldn’t do it there, and she called her manager. Poor manager came but couldn’t see anything wrong, but instead of calming me down she left. The bell boy understood that he wouldn’t get any tip, forget helping me even he didn’t open the door, pathetic.These final tips have a full impact for the next decisions. The place of the hotel is quite nice if you want to have access to mid and down town, but don’t expect more.

Just stayed here for 4 nights, awesome location but was so disappointed with the hotel, it's very tired, needs urgently updating, rooms were very average and are not as they look on the site, carpets were dirty, rooms small and yet I booked one of the more expensive doubles, tiny window.No interest in my level of Bonvoy which was poor as I always stay in Marriotts and W hotel, one of the worst W's I have ever stayed in. Gym was poor, small and very very average.Watch out for the very high tax's on top of the room charge.

I liked the location of this W, walking distance to Greenwich Village and lots of good restaurants in the area. What really annoyed me was a mandatory $25 Spa Destination charge that could be redeemed with purchases to room service or the mini-bar. If I want to use those I will, but don't pre-charge me for a service I did not opt in for. And no coffee maker! Most hotels at this price point have a Nespresso--this had nothing. The personnel were nice and the room was OK, but there are so many hotels in NYC to chose from, I won't be back,

This hotel is well located. Easy to walk to East Village, Flatiron, even Broadway area is walkable. The stuff is very nice and friendly. The rooms are large but that makes their poor design more unforgivable. Why have a barn door to the bathroom? (A real door would provide more privacy. ) Especially one with frosted glass? This results in the room being flooded with light if one of the occupants uses the bathroom while others are sleeping. The lack of accessible drawers is another puzzle. There is so much room, why have only a few musty drawers in the closet? And the bathroom is pretty small compared to the room. Theres just not enough counter space for a woman with much makeup and toiletries. And the bathroom feel less than sparkling. It’s not dirty exactly but it’s really in need of a refresh, grout and fixtures are tarnished. .The whole room needs an update. It’s seen better days. Also why are the hallways kept soooo cold? Same with the lobby. This hotel just doesn’t feel comfortable.

You would think that a room that you paid nearly $500- for one night would have a nice shower. I checked into the W at about 2:30 pm. Dropped off my bags and left for meetings & dinner. I returned to the room at midnight and went straight to bed. In the morning I went to shower and found what was a shower that you would expect in a flea bag motel off the side of the highway. St that point I wasn't going to ask for a new room, I was checking out. So I dealt with it and went on my way. Contacted my Ambassador Elite contact at Marriott, all I got was an apology. They should have at least compensated me with a partial refund or additional points.

No MSNBC on the cable TV! Fox News right there front and center. Front desk apologizes and says that it is a Marriott corporate decision. This is not a good way to do business, especially in NYC. The customer's needs should come first.

We had a very comfortable 5-night stay at the W. The room was very spacious and clean. We did not try any of the food & beverage outlets, yet they appeared to be very popular. The public areas were a bit limited - no real lobby space. The staff was very nice and engaging - also gave us great local restaurant and activity tips. Given its Union Square location - we were able to easily navigate around NYC using the metro that was right next to the hotel. At the time we were also charged an ‘amenity’ fee - kinda find it odd (given the justification upon check-put) and it seemed like a tricky revenue add-on that is customary in NYC hotels (in varying amounts).

We used W as a base for visiting relatives last weekend. We picked it because we could easily walk to our daughter’s apartment in Stuytown but it’s location is excellent for subway and bus excursions. We were well treated by every employee from the front door to desk staff to the invisible cleaning people. By NYC standards the room was large. It was clean and contrary to some reviews it looked fresh and stylish to us and we travel frequently. We had one odd difficulty. We prepaid the entire price and when we went to check out our bill reflected the prepay as an additional charge, thus the screen told us we owed twice what we had already paid. The desk staff apologized and the problem was rectified.

Not my first time at this hotel. The location is perfect. I love the neighborhood. Room was ok. Agree with other reviewers, time for an update. Staff at reception were courteous.Stayed there during UN week. Someone important was at the hotel too. Place was swamped with secret service type people. Lots of security inconvenience, but that’s not the hotel’s fault. It is what it is.I will add my voice to the complaints on the DESTINATION FEE. Awful!!!!! The hotel said it is to cover amenities “curated for guests’ enjoyment”. Amenities that are worthless. Access to a gym that is a few blocks away. Who needs a gym, you can get your exercise by walking all over NYC. Food credit that only works for room service and minibar; not the restaurant because the hotel doesn’t own the restaurant. But, you can charge your meal in the restaurant to your room. Huh? By the time you add the service charge, delivery charge etc for room service .... nothing cost $25 or less so you end up SPENDING money to take advantage of the food credit. Same thing with laundry service. As a LIFETIME GOLD ELITE member, I already get free wifi. In this day and age, WiFi should be included regardless. If the hotel is going to charge for WiFi, then it should be a SECURED WiFi. On top of that, the fee is taxed! So the $25 fee is actually $28+. The hotel industry argues that resort fees, destination fees etc offset revenues lost when guest book through third party booking services. May I suggest waiving the fee for Bonvoy members (especially elite status members) who book directly? These fees are dodgy money grabs.

We booked this hotel for our NYC trip thinking that it should be nice since W is under the Marriott group and I had a good experience when I stayed at W Hong Kong. The staff was not very friendly when we checked in. It almost turned us away when we stepped in the room. It is old and you can tell they did not do any upkeep of the room. The pillows are so thin making me wonder if they ever replace the pillows since they opened. I closed the drapes but in the morning the light shines in then I found out there is a gap between the window and the drape. Not to say NYC hotels are overpriced. Paying over $350 per night but left us a bad experience! We feel so embarrassed because we told our friends from Canada to stay there because of the brand.

Start with NYC hotels are overpriced so can’t complain much... however even it being a W, you would expect much more from this brand. Rooms are bland and due for an upgrade. Not much of a vibe in the lobby. Location is great but if you want any sort of atmosphere, I would not stay here.

A great hotel in a Great location.Titanium membership upgraded me to a corner suite with views over Union Square through to Freedom Tower.A fantastic location in Lower Manhattan right next to the Subway.Breakfast in the restaurant was great but I never look further than the Taco Bell on E14th St in this neighbourhood :-D

Since we step in the hotel , all the staff were very kind and give us and our dog a great welcome. Every single need was immediately addressed ... from a duplicate key , late check out request , etc Clean room and quick room service .We will be back here for sure

This hotel is overrated for NYC. The rooms are overdue for an update. Definitely overpriced. Doorman always on the cellphone, never handy when needed. Partner and I definitely experienced better in NYC.

Manhattan is one of those places with so many great options. However, for us it came down to location and cost per night. Our oldest works in town, so we wanted something that was in the middle of everything and had good access to subway, parks, and restaurants.We have long stayed with W and Westin properties. The W Union Square is a solid hotel property that is true to the brand, is minimal fuss, and has a bar and restaurant on-site that was good. Property does not have a pool or spa, but that’s quite typical for the area.Rooms are well-appointed, even the fairly basic Double Queen category we booked for 4 nights. It was plenty of room for us, considering it’s NYC. Bathrooms nice as well. They offer single use bottles of water still, but you may need to ask for them. All in all, we recommend W Union Square as a place to stay.

This is a great choice for place to stay in New York. It is close to the subway and very easy to get just about anyplace. It is nice to get out of the hustle and bustle to relax a bit, while the crazy is a few blocks away. The hotel is great and close to some fantastic still below the radar restaurants - like Villanelle.

Excellent choice of hotel near subway and convenient to Manhattan sites. Rooms were absolutely quiet with no street noise. Free coffee at reception and welcoming reception area. Staff were helpful, concierge onsite.

Most of the time when publishing hotel reviews, text is based on the accommodation itself, the quality of service provided to the basic and special needs of the guest, among others. But there is an area which plays a very important role when requested: the personal service area. Bad experience with them, recently. In reservation made by our Company, the number of the Corporate Credit card was not provided in writing, for compliance reason. Instead, provided by phone to the Hotel Reservation Center. All was well until we decided to confirm the operation by phone, directly with the Hotel front desk. The call was answered by DANIEL WISSELMAN. Rarely we have been treated so arrogantly, so aggressively, DANIEL denigrating the image of Marriott’s network, from which we are members. After this call, we contacted Mrs. May Fellores - Director of Welcome Office. From this point on every contact was held in writing, in case of any future reference need. All our correspondences went on with copy to Mr. Edward Baten, apparently the General Director of the Hotel, who never, ever, acknowledged reception of any of our e-mails. Meanwhile, Mrs. Fellores did a superior job, being extremely helpful, providing to the case a final solution. Just for the records, a General Manager should be more concern with client’s needs. As a result, W Hotel Union Square has been momentarily discontinued from our potential list of hotels to stay in NYC, depending now on Marriott Hotels Network return.

Sometimes I think the "W" in the name of this hotel chain stands for "weird," but this W hotel delivered everything a business traveler needed. This is not a budget hotel, but even at NYC rates, it earns its money. The staff was highly professional. The room was spacious, very comfortable, and quieter than I expected at a busy intersection across from Union Square.

Nice property but I had the feeling the property was reaching to be hip and modern. Plenty of activity aroudn the lobby and bar. Rooms feel a little dated for a modern hotel, or perhaps just not the right mix in my specific room. A little pricey for what was delivered. Still a very good property with lots of activity in the lobby.

Stayed at the W Union Square for 5 nights at end of June.  Positives:• Friendly professionals at the front desk• Lobby area is welcoming and visually appealing• My 18th floor room offered a nice view (avoid 19th floor -view obstructed by a wall)Negatives:• Certain W Hotels, including this one, have begun adding a compulsory $25 destination fee. Since it's a mandatory charge, it should simply be added to the room rate to make total room rate more transparent.• Rooms are somewhat dated and would benefit from a makeover. • After settling my bill, an additional charge of roughly $45 appeared on my card a few hours after departing. After 2 phone calls, the hotel manager acknowledged the error and credited back the mistaken charge.• Regrettably I had forgotten my electric toothbrush in the bathroom. For $35, the hotel would ship it to my US address via ground transportation. Instead, I decided to have Amazon deliver me a new one the next day for about the same price. I realize that returning property is typically not a complimentary service of non-luxury hotels. However, my thought was that upon having been a 15+ years frequent hotel guest of Starwood (now part of Marriott), the hotel would have simply mailed me the small item as a result of being a longtime loyal customer.

First time at this W and don't want to say that I expected more, but I wasn't wowed by this hotel. The room/size was ok but it seemed incredibly dated. The two most important things to me as a traveller are the comfort of the bed and pillows. The bed wasn't bad, but the pillows were awful. Both feather and foam. Very disappointing. Not sure I'd choose this W on my next visit to NYC.

This hotel is a few blocks from our office and listed as a corporate preferred hotel, but this is definitely not a hotel for business travelers. I was awakened 3 times early Monday morning between 3 am - 5 am by loud talking and laughing in the hallway and door slamming. I went out to investigate and found a hotel employee chatting it up with some ladies, all of whom acted indignant when I pointed out that it was 3 am and asked them to take their conversation inside their rooms. This combined with the leisurely service in the restaurant and the fact that I have to go talk to someone to check out suggests that this is not a place for business travelers who want to sleep and have their business handled in a hurry.

I am currently staying here and disappointed to find the carpet dirty, rust stains in the shower and grout, and cracks/ scratches on the wallpaper. I have been to the W many times and am shocked by the decline in quality and cleanliness standards.

I’ve stayed at many W hotels before, but what I enjoyed about this property is that it had a more adult feeling without the craziness of other W’s.Great location and in one of the best neighborhoods.. Gramercy.

I love the location, and the property itself ain't so shabby either, but the fees, man. So many additional fees get tacked onto your bill that you end up paying a totally different rate than you expected. The worst is the mandatory $25 destination fee, which I guess is the W's version of "resort fees". It just sucks, and it comes off as a scam, like the hotel thinks we're suckers who won't notice it. Seems really dishonest, tbh. The fees also make my employer and clients do a double take at my receipts and less likely to reimburse me for the stay, which also sucks. This used to be my place to stay in NYC, but not anymore.

First the good points:We were given a lovely upgrade and a birthday gift of cake and wine. We are Platinum Elite members. The room was huge with a good bathroom with tub and shower which all worked well.Bliss toiletries are lovely.The room was dark and quiet which made for a good night’s sleep.Breakfast was delicious.Staff were all courteous and friendly.Now the not so clever:Check in and out took ages with much confusion. No one was clear whether our breakfast was included or not. So far we seem to have been credited for one night but not the other.No mention on check in of the $25 tax, so we had no idea that we could have redeemed this on food and drink.Despite the trendy look, just behind the surface everything is a little bit tired.Hopefully with a bit more bedding in time, the kinks in check in/ pricing clarity will be sorted out.

Immediately when we step out of the car in front of the hotel, Jose rushes to greet us and warmly welcomes us back to the only hotel we stay at in NYC time and time again. Although it is quite early in the morning, they find us a room that is ready and we are all set to go explore the City in no time. The service at the W is equal to none. We are always well treated. Unfortunately, 2 of the elevators broke down during our stay and I can only imagine how difficult it is to get an elevator mechanic to make a service call during Easter weekend. Nonetheless, the staff took appropriate measures by allowing guests to use the service elevators. Our room was well lighted and spacious. Everything was impeccable and comfortable. A special mention to Jose whom is so king and attentive to our needs. We always look forward to staying at the W Union Square. Its location is also very convenient. You can easily walk to Empire State, Madison Square Park or the Meatpacking district. 14th Street Union Sq. station is a hub that offers many option for the subway and Park Avenue is easily accessible from all locations. Truly a perfect spot

The W Union Square is highlighted by a rarity in New York: spacious rooms at a decent price. While not as cheap as some hotels in Midtown, it gets great value from the well-appointed and large rooms, excellent and very responsive staff, and location right on Union Square. The decor might be a touch dated for all its modern ambitions, but the W bed is excellent as always. I’d much rather stay here than 20 blocks north for $50 less a night.

Love this place, location is amazing. Stayed at the W union square on 2013 and again in October 2018 - view from the upper floors to the Union Square is beautiful, service was very good, rooms quality and bathroom very good as well. Will definitely come back

Service at the location was exceptionally good. The staff was courteous friendly and helpful.I loved the location since it was close to my daughters dorm as well as college and had lots of restaurants and shopping nearby.Great bar at the hotel too

The location of the W Union Square is what keeps me booking there over and over. It is a treat to walk out of the lobby and be in Union Square with the farmer's market, restaurants, shopping, the Subway, movie theaters, a great stepping off spot to walk anywhere you want in the City. The rooms aren't anything too special. They are clean and in working order. They're fairly small, but it NYC. Lots of hotel rooms are small. As are apartments. You're not going to hang out in your room anyway. It's the Big Apple! Go explore. The lobby bar feels like a living room. So it is aptly named The Living Room. It is usually packed. The restaurant has changed over the years. I used to go specifically for Todd English's Olives when it was there. Irvington is the current lobby restaurant. I've eaten there a couple of times, but the atmosphere doesn't grab me. Again. The reason to stay at this hotel is the location in NYC.

Just got back from my second stay here. Really great hotel! All the hotel rooms in NYC are on the small side bc real estate is so expensive but not every hotel in NYC has a friendly helpful staff - they're great! Plus this neighborhood is perfect. Amazing shops and restaurants, convenient to subway but without the touristy feeling of midtown. Love it and will stay again!

I really liked this hotel and my view of the Freedom tower was lovely. The room was a decent size, and very clean, the bar in the hotel was lovely - unfortunately we had to leave too early to take advantage of breakfast. Will stay here again.
user_name:
Bullies65
Cold Spring Harbor, New York

review_body: Great stay and berry friendly staff! The location of the property is ideal for any NY traveler. The only issue I had with the hotel was my room was freezing! It was a bit of a snow storm outside so that could’ve played a big part. The hvac unit was blowing minimal warm air. It was late and we didn’t want to possible move or have maintenance come in and make a lot of noise. We asked for more blankets and we were fine. The rooms are a little tight, but the bathrooms are spacious. It’s a little outdated and worn, but the staff makes up for it. Such great people.

I stayed there for a week during business in New York. The location the strong point of the hotel being close to metro and close to the majority if the business. I stated in a Mega room overlooking the Union Square Services are good but it can be better. Rooms’ size is a little bit bugger than the Mew York average . The hotel is clean and also has a nice lively bar.

I know the area well, I used to live there. Being right on Union Square means walking to movies and restaurants. And a major subways hub is 2 blocks away. I was unfortunate that not a single member of the lobby staff could be bothered helping with the massive, very heavy, front doors or with garment bags and luggage. I was stunned watching 3 bell hops chatting and hanging out at the front desk - watching us struggle with the doors, the stairs, navigating to the front desk with a cumbersome amount of hand luggage and wheeled luggage and a heavily stuffed garment bag - pretending we weren't standing there! That we didn't need or deserve a warm welcome and a little help - or atleast an offer of assistance. Besides the location, the hotel bar and restaurant has excellent food, a wonderful cocktail & wine list - and we enjoyed ourselves there - no need to make reservations if the weather is bad - [it's been 11 degrees outside this week!] In terms of the room we were on a high floor facing East and had a bit of a view. The bed, pillow and blanket were very comfortable, But the top sheet covering the mattress felt like sand paper to my skin, was rough - totally different quality from the pillow cases and blanket encasement.

We've checked in on the 4th of Feb and been billed $1200 instead of a $100 deposit for a room that was already paid for. 48hrs later the money has not been credited as yet. We spent 6 months planning our stay in the city and all that has been offered is a $100 credit and an apology. It's the banks problem not theirs. A milestone bday ruined by appalling customer service and apathy.

ProsRoom: Room was not too cramped in terms of space.Destination Fee Credit: While I generally dislike destination fees, I am happy that I could use it against in-room dining (over priced but still) so not giving it a negative.Doorman: The doorman was friendly.ConsLighting: Room lighting is terrible especially by the bed. Needs more light to be able to work.Check-In Experience/Loyalty Recognition: I know this is a busy hotel and wasn't expecting a suite upgrade. I am happy with the upgrade I received. At check-in however, the check-in agent was extremely snobbish. Forget recognition of loyalty status, not even a welcome to the hotel message or greeting. Did not bother mentioning the breakfast amenity benefit (which fortunately I knew beforehand), asking for my choice etc. Absolutely terrible experience and such a negative attitude. He could have made it such a positive experience by actually informing me I had received an upgrade (which again I knew before hand but others may not realize) but he just didn't care about up-selling a nice thing the hotel had done to recognize my loyalty. Fortunately, doorman was friendly which is why I give the hotel a 4. Else, would have been a 3.

Clean, well presented rooms. Efficient and professional staff. Nice bar, food we tried was lovely. Such a great location. Gym is small and easily crowded but does the job. Little touches like delicious hot cider at reception are appreciated. Will definitely return.

The W New York - union Square is a fine hotel with a location that is hard to top. Centrally located in Manhattan you are walking distance to almost anything. I had a nice walk to MoMA, super close to the East Village, we could see the new World Trade from our window. So yeah, the location is hard to beat. With that said the rooms were nice, modern looking but a little dated, things like the tub and the windows were indicators that they spent money on remodeling this old building but didn't go all the way. I prefer a walk in shower, this was a tub that was too shallow to use as a tub. The windows were old and howled in the wind. Even with the age of the building the rooms were a nice size for NYC and the staff was very friendly, and the location is hard to beat!

If you want good customer service, check into the Hyatt. W and Marriott send conflicting messaging on their web sites and really don't care.................... If you have a Marriott gift card, it does not work at this W hotel. And the Marriott site does not mention it. If you get a gift card, check the gift card site for limitations. And if you have any problems with the gift cards, Marriott is of NO help.

This W offers a reasonably comfortable accommodation. Usually stay here when I visit NYC. Rooms and baths are a nice size and location is great. The mattress in the room I stayed in this time could be replaced. Also, the W chain had implemented a $25.00 per day hotel service charge that can be used for some hotel services. This is a result of the Marriott takeover. It makes Marriott more money but is not an advantage to the hotel guest. Not sure I will continue to stay here as a result.

Stayed one night for work, had a corner king bed room. The lobby is small, but the room was pretty large for New York City. Great views with large windows. The bathroom was a bit small but nice Bliss toiletries. The bed was quiet comfortable, and the room pretty quiet.Located across the street from Union Square and convenient to the subway. The bar was nice, and very busy for a Monday night.

The W chain used to mean something but my recent stay here was very disappointing. Rooms are tired and in need of updating. Issues include non functioning blackout blinds/drapes. Tired furniture and non functioning lights. A lot of service issues with housekeeping and delivery of amenities and water. For example, had a shirt laundered and was told it would be delivered the next morning. I waited two days and finally asked them about my shirt. Oops. Sorry we forgot. Other issues such as replacing toiletries, complimentary water and minibar items were not done. The hotel is in an excellent location for visiting New York but dollar for dollar there are better hotels to try.

Best location in the city at Union Square-you can walk 2 doors down for reasonably priced coffee at Dunkin Donuts! This hotel is definitely a “scene”-loud bumpin music in the lobby lounge area & always bustling with lots of people. Fun fact-in our room on the back side of the building, I could not make or receive cell calls, text messages or get my WiFi on phone to work. Lots of working the lobby...

On our first night we turned the duvet down to get in bed and found a rodent dropping stuck to the duvet. Phoned down to reception to ask for someone to come have a look, no one showed after 30 mins so had to call again. After 50mins someone did show up with half the bed linen needed to change a bed... also appeared a bit surprised that this is something we would complain about. Not happy with how this was resolved and have also contacted customer services.

The good part first, the rooms are big, the hotel is clean and it is in a great location.The bad outweighs the good. Terrible, terrible service. Check in was 20+ minutes. Lobby was chaos at all times. And worst of all, Lots and lots of unexpected fees, check your bill, ours had $200 in extra fees on it. They blamed the conversion to Marriott on it all, but that seems to easy. Also beware of the $25 a destination fee, you get nothing from it. Also had a park view room, but view completely blocked by crane so be careful on room choice. Pics on website are very deceiving. We felt like the whole experience was a money grab, not a pleasant stay.All in all a very disappointing experience and I will never go back. Kind of stunned Marriott/Starwood have keeps their name in this this property.

I am writing this review as we were just woken up by the sound of construction coming from the building directly next door. If you are planning on spending a family vacation and want to sleep in past 7 don’t stay here. The hotel even leaves you a note with two sets of ear plugs and warns you about the noise. I think the hotel should tell you about this inconvenience before you book but since they don’t I will. If you are on business and you need an alarm clock to wake up by 7 am than this place might be for you. If you like to sleep past 7 don’t stay here.

there are holes in the curtains, the bedroom decoration is from the 90's, the shower as well / far too expensive for the quality and do not order a pot of (very bad) coffee in your bedroom which will cost you 32 $ without services you should make a little effort to dress up and buy a nice one locally

We stayed at the W Union Square for 3 days. Check in was not particularly friendly, and when returned after discovering that our our assigned room had not been made, the receptionist was exceedingly brusk - no apology whatsoever.The rooms are desperately in need of renovation - they really are dated and showing wear. Bathrooms too are showing their age - our shower had the beginnings of mould in its corners. I have stayed at many W Hotels around the world - and am a huge fan of the brand; this property is a disappointment. On the positive side, the location of the hotel is excellent. - and the building's exterior spectacular. But refurbishment is long overdue.

There were 15 people in our group arriving at different times. They parent's rooms and children's rooms were on same floor as requested. They were very accommodating.We dealt with Nelson at the front desk. He was fabulous. That is really why I gave it 5 stars. A very pleasant visit. Great location.

I really enjoyed my room a lot. Very spacious. My biggest complaint though was that I asked for a quiet room and was given a room on the 19th floor. But the entire floor is surrounded by a cement structure that blocks the view! (I asked one couple about their room’s view when we got off the elevator and they told me their room was exactly the same!) You have to stand on a box that the hotel provides to look over this wall (see my picture below). I think they should let guests know as a courtesy. This was the second room I requested during my stay and I was just too tired to pack my things and switch rooms again. Location is convenient though to train and eateries.

As a Marriott/SPG Rewards family we have already taken our baby to a Marriott, a Courtyard, and two Residence Inns this year before our New York trip that featured a stay at the W. The hotel has an excellent Union Square location, but it was a struggle of a stay with a crawling eight-month-old. Firstly, the W has an unusually cramped lobby area with a lot of guests and employees loitering and a bottleneck at the door; it was a struggle to get the stroller in and out of the building. The room was also challenging - the high ceilings provided spectacular city views but also caused inefficient cooling and heating. The temperature on the floor was much colder than the thermostat said and our baby had a hard time sleeping both nights (he did well in other hotels with lower ceilings). Lastly, the bathroom did not have a solid door; instead it had a large horizontal plastic insert through which light shined into the main room, making it harder for baby to fall asleep. Avoid the W if you got a little one!

Overall a good hotel. Room was very quiet. Nice size room for NYC. Room safe was broken and they fixed promptly. Front desk staff pleasant. I think the service fee is unnecessary. A bit pricey for what you get. Restaurant had an amazing steel cut oatmeal.

Rooms were very nice. Staff was incredible. Wedding area was great. I was very happy with my stay. Everything was clean. The in house bar worked well for meeting up with friends. I was very impressed with my stay. The cost was high.

We generally like W hotels but for their size. No complaints here on size since we were upgraded to a suite. But we will never return. The bed was uncomfortable and the noise insane. We have been living in/staying in NYC forever and the noise was non-stop: car horns, fire trucks, etc. I don't know if the windows have not been upgraded or if being on the 3rd floor mattered that much but it was not a good night. Bathrooms old. Service helpful. Decor fine -- not great. Bar loud. And no free wifi! Towels good but they didn't make up for the mattress!

Have stayed here 6 times over the past 15 yearsGreat location and very central All great except for the $25 per night destination fee which can be credited to various purchases such as room service at high prices and fees

W Union Square is in an older landmark building which appears to have been refurbished into a hotel many years ago. It retains a lot of character while also offering some really gorgeous shared spaces like the Living Room lounge on the ground floor. It's directly across from the park and within walking distance of the East Village and Flatiron sections of the city. There were lots of people out and about in the area day and night. Service was good although check in was delayed as they could not locate my Marriott rewards info in the system, which ultimately was cleared up when I found my number and called down to the desk after getting to my room. The room was clean and inviting with the temperature set at 65 degrees which was perfect for me, and a nice respite from the hot muggy temperatures outside. The view from the room (816) was nothing worth looking at - the side of another building - but the interior of the space was nice. Really comfortable bed and a big mirror which made the room seem bigger, and the Bliss lemon and sage toiletries were awesome. The shower pressure was perfect. Closet was a bit tight for hanging clothes because the iron is tucked away in the same space. There were plenty of outlets for charging all the stuff needing a charge. Overall this is a great spot and you cannot beat the location.

My wife and I had a wonderful time on our return to NYC. The location is excellent and David del Valle the bellman was incredible - his knowledge of the local area and kindness from the minute we arrived was first class. We look forward to returning when we're next in the US.

Was in NY for a wedding and stayed at the W for the convenient location. Things I liked:— great service on check in— nice room; high ceiling— helpful doorman and bellhop—great location and convenient transportation Things I didn’t like:—laundry charge ripoff—room smelled of cigarettes despite the nonsmoking policy and the fact that they tried to air it out—double charged for room after checkout plus a mystery $1 additional charge without explanation—checkout manager needs to learn how to treat their customers. Details:They ripped me off on a dry cleaning charge. I had sent a dress to dry clean. The laundry form said a dress was $24 to clean. Imagine my surprise when I saw a $40 charge at checkout. When I challenged the increase and asked them why someone didn’t give me an option to decline the service they wouldn’t take responsibility for it stating “well we send it out and don’t do the laundry here.” Then he claimed that the dress was a party dress and required a hand wash. The “manager” offered me a 20% discount. I told him it was dishonest to overcharge me but he really didn’t care. I paid over $500 a night for this hotel and they didn’t want to do what’s right to fix this matter for a mere $8 difference. I got tired of arguing with the “manager” and has to get to the airport and left it as it. I told him I was going to blast him on TripAdvisor and he just shrugged his shoulders. (Btw, I double checked the label when I got home and the label clearly says “dry clean only” with no comment on “hand wash only” as he claimed.To add insult to injury, my credit card was charged again after checkout twice and I now see an extra $1 charge for some reason! Not happy at all!!!

First and foremost, this place is in dire need of an update. The furnishings look like they're from whenever the building was first converted to a hotel -- I think that was the 1990's. Everything is chipped and worn down. WORST OF ALL, each room is doused in a putrid "W Signature Scent". It's so bad you can't sleep. I switched rooms because of it, but there was barely and improvement on the alleged non-sprayed floor. The staff is incredibly nice, but this hotel is just terrible. TERRIBLE.
user_name:
NYAPBolt
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the W Union Square when we moved our daughter into her college dorm in August. This is a convenient location for that purpose, as it's near a few universities, as well as many other East Village destinations. The property is consistent with other W Hotels we have stayed at - it's a cookie-cutter place that's clean, the service is good, and served our needs well. The room wasn't huge or luxuriously appointed, but a well-appointed and clean room is more than fine, especially when you're not hunkering down for long periods of time. If you need a nice place to sleep after a day of sightseeing, business meetings, moving your child into college, or the like, you'll be happy here. The bathroom had a tub, but it was small, and you could tell that despite the "facelift," the bathroom was slightly lacking. A plus - the shower pressure was surprisingly strong, which was very nice, and not always the case at hotels, regardless of how many stars they might have. The barn door connecting the bathroom to the sleeping area was not soundproof...at all. Enough said. The restaurant and bar were attractive, and always bustling, but we never ate or drank there. We would stay here again, despite little, predictable imperfections.

Location can't be beat. We spend a lot of time in Manhattan and have been renting thru airbnb all summer. Although we've had a couple nice places, nothing has been this centrally located or this comfortable. It was a good reminder of how a nice it can be to have a hotel and all its amenities. The only downside was the condition off the shower: peeling caulk and an overall aspect that really wasn't acceptable. It was a blemish on what was otherwise a clean and enjoyable room. This is a great place to stay for a weekend get-away and is surrounded by dining options, all of which are within easy walking distance.

We were back to our "summer home" in NYC for the last time this year over Labour Day weekend. This was our 3rd visit this year to this wonderful hotel. Our usual friend Jose was off this weekend so our first contact was with Carl the attendant at the front door. He was very helpful with our arrival and was kind enough to go retrieve my phone I had left in my car even if it had already been dispatched to the parking lot. Carl also speaks French which was a surprise for. We then met Brigitte, the Hotel Manager (from Quebec) that greeted us with warmth and kindness. Our room was not ready (we arrived at 9:45) but we checked our bags and went to explore. The hotel promptly called us before lunch to inform us that our room was ready. We made a pit-stop to bring up our bags. After a long day of walking in the City we arrived to our room to find a surprise. 2 incredible fruit platters and a bottle of Prosecco. The management figured out that my wife's birthday had just passed and had the wonderful idea of treating us with this great attention. As usual, our stay was very pleasant. Our room was large by NYC standards and perfect. The staff was helpful as always and we had a great weekend. Only one disappointment. We got up early Monday morning to have breakfast at the hotel only to find out that the restaurant opened at 8 am instead of the usual 7 am. The hotel should advise guests in such case. We were hoping for an early departure back home and we had to find another place for breakfast. Otherwise, everything was perfect. Special thanks to Carl and Brigitte and please tell Jose we are sad to have missed him

I picked the W Hotel Union Square purely based on it's location and the W Hotel name. It's a nice hotel in a nice building in a great neighborhood, but other than getting a room on a high floor, there were no other member benefits offered. No roof deck, no complimentary hot breakfast, no member lounge, no happy hours, no complimentary wifi, and no drink tickets upon arrival. Things that I used to get at SPG hotels I no longer get. I'm a Gold Elite member, which used to offer me some benefits, but I guess not anymore. Not entirely sure why I'm loyal to SPG if there are no member benefits offered to members at my level.Also the HVAC in the building is weird. You can't put the unit into just cooling mode or just heating mode. It's always in both heating/cooling mode. In the middle of summer when it's 100 degrees outside, if the thermostat upon arrival is set to 68 and you turn it up to 72, the unit will start discharging hot air to heat the room up to 72.
user_name:
Rick S
Washington Dc, District Of Columbia

review_body: As a long-standing Platinum SPG member, I am really disappointed with my stay at this hotel:- Platinum members typically get free breakfast included in their rate. On my first morning when I went to the restaurant for breakfast I was told that my breakfast had to be charged separately and I could only get free breakfast if ordered in case of room service. No-one cared to tell me this at check-in and it was too late for me to go back into the room and order breakfast there.- On my second morning I obviously ordered breakfast in the room: 1 eggs benedict, 1 coffee, 1 orange juice and 1 toast basket. At check out there was a $75 (!!!) charge to my bill. After complaining, I am told that Platinum guests are only allowed to have free Continental breakfast, which I was never told at check-in or the first day after I complained. They eventually removed the cost of the Continental breakfast but they still charged me for the difference between $75 and the Continental breakfast.- The destination fee was not deducted from my room service bill until the moment I highlighted that it should be deducted.- There were SOMEBODY ELSE’S CLOTHED in several drawers of my room!! This is a sign that the room was not properly cleaned, and no-one cared to remove them after me highlighting this to the front desk.Overall, I felt a complete lack of personalised service, and it felt like the whole business model is aimed at extracting as much cash from you as they can. As an example: they charge you $9 to sell you a travel adapter when in other W Hotels around the world you can actually just borrow one from the front desk. Also, they charge you $9 (!!!) for the bottle of water in the room. Come on, in which world does a bottle of water have the same value as a travel adapter??Really substandard service compared to the W Hotels I typically go to all around Europe (eg, London, Barcelona, etc.).If you are looking for a fun experience, instead of staying at this hotel you are much better off staying at the Standard High Line.

I really enjoy staying at the W Union Square. The service is great, the rooms are bigger than normal for NY hotels and the area is really good for restaurants and nightlife options. Would definitely recommend it.

I can’t say enough about our stay at the W Union Square. We came from Dallas to move my son into his dorm at The New School. Never have I traveled with so much stuff and had to move so many suitcases, bags and boxes with no car. The staff was phenomenal-helped with all the bags, got us the right cabs and the right drivers to get us to the stores we needed (Bed Bath and Beyond), back to the hotel and then transport all that stuff to the dorm on move-in day. They are professionals for sure! The rooms were very spacious and clean. The location is perfect-we walked to East Village, West Village and the HighLine. Quick cab ride to midtown and the theatres. Great bar and lounge in the lobby. No complaints. This will be our preferred hotel on our many trips back. Thank you all for everything!

A quick overnight at this hotel offered us wonderful service, a spacious and clean room with a mesmerizing downtown view, and an incredibly comfortable bed. The experience began with an efficient and extremely friendly check-in experience (Sorry! I forgot the name of the staff member, but she was excellent in both her service and her attitude.) that included champagne. We found the room to be comfortable and quiet (even though it was directly across from the elevators), and the view was simply enchanting -- especially at night.Our stay ended with the same wonderful staff member handling our checkout. She remembered us from the day before and sent us on our way while we noted we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

This was our first time staying at/near Union Square. It's pretty centrally located with easy access to nearby Gramercy Park, Washington Square Park, Chelsea, SOHO, etc. all within a good walk (30+min) or a short cab ride. Hotel sits on northeast corner of Union Square and is easily accessible. Check in was easy; staff were pleasant. I had booked a "Wonderful King," and was given a "Spectacular King," which is something of an upgrade apparently. The room was just OK; perfectly acceptable, but nothing to write home about (well, except on Tripadvisor!). Odd in-room item: Three different water bottles - one was free, and not replenished after first night; one was $8, and the third was $9 (slightly larger bottle). Common areas in hotel were as expected -- lobby bar with direct access to on-site restaurant; mezzanine level seemed to be where all the business or social meetings were to happen. Best thing: The weekend farmers market in Union Square, immediately across the street from the hotel.

My reservation was for a suite one of the more expensive rooms and it was filthy. See photos. Called manager a women showed up and said “op sorry do you want me to clean it?” On that mood has been there for months. Also talked to another employee who said he was so embarrassed but management doesn’t care. Went to check out and the door just leaned against the wall in between the doors and watched the door hit me on the way out. Just I’m a great tipper and usually very positive! This was bad so you need to know

Cold staff. It was like it was a bother to check me in. Please. It is over 450USD a night.  Nice location but the hotel is over rated. Food was so so. Best to take a walk and go to a nice restaurant near by.

After all the friendly staff at W Lexington got let go, opted for a new New York W. As I also had business downtown took this one. Hotel and room are fine, but is it not as alive as Lexington used to be, partly because of the lay-out. Agree with a prior review that the appreciation for premier customers could be better, but that is that of an important aspect of a stay. Bed, amenities and facilities are in line with what one would expect.

Up until now, the W Leicester Square-London was my favorite. They still win a bit with the edgy design of the room but the overall experience here won out.Room decor was colorful, fun, comfortable; room felt large for a big city. Cleaned well each day although staff neglected to refill munchie bar and coffee pods on the coffee maker we requested.If you'll be using room service, the required additional $25 per day is ...ok. We didn'thave room service and ended up grabbing things from the munchie bar to use up our "credit". It was the staff that made this place outstanding. The lovely woman who checked us in--while dealing with the annoyances of software glitches from the SPG/ Marriott merger--remained calm and friendly throughout the process. The doorman remembered and used my name from the moment we arrived and was so friendly. The concierge researched a hotel purchase and went the extra mile to call when he discovered new information. We had an amazing conversation with a front desk clerk about his native Columbia and life in general--and he comped us several drinks when he heard an inspiring story from my husband and when he learned we were celebrating my mother's 82nd birthday. These are people who genuinely enjoy working with people and seem passionate about their work.And the location! What a refreshing change from being uptown. Union Square's Farmers Market was spectacular and the neighborhood is an easy walk, subway ride, Lyft/Uber?taxi ride to the wonderful neighborhoods of lower Manhattan.Looking forward to a return to this hotel this Fall!

This was my 4th time here and I love it every time. Excellent location and wonderful staff. Special thank you to all the doormen, who are always the first impression, but especially to the doorman David, and concierge Robert, who seemed to go the extra mile in terms of friendliness and helpfulness. May at the front desk was also terrific. It’s nice to have a friendly face when you’re away from home, and they really make you feel welcome and at home.

Boys weekend with my 13 year old son to celebrate end of school year and visit with family in from Ireland.From the guy who met us at the curb on Friday afternoon to set up the valet for our car (Lewis) to the guy who brought our car around on Sunday morning (Jose) the staff at this hotel (and the hotel itself went way beyond expectations.Check in was smooth. Helpful and polite front desk staff.Security in the elevators was very reassuring - access to floors is by room key only and your key ONLY allows you access to your floor.Room was super clean, really well furnished and appointed.Bar and lounge were lively - with great hotel team in both.

The rooms are a bit dated and there was an odor that filled the room. We asked the staff about the smell and were told it was their signature scent. I have stayed at many other W hotels, and they didn't smell like lemon Pledge.

We chose this hotel because we were looking for a place to stay near the Peloton studio and Dylan's Candy Bar. This hotel was in a central location near both places. The room we had was a little on the small, but the beautiful city view more than made up for it. The front desk and valet team were helpful and friendly. Would definitely return.

We had a great time last weekend. We were celebrating my daughter's 21st birthday and stayed here. Fabulous attention to detail, warm and friendly reception, prompt service etc.. I can't recommend this hotel enough!

I stayed at this W on points. The person who checked me in was just flat out rude and impersonal. No information given no questions asked. We checked in at 5pm. The woman who checked me out was not rude but definately not personal. I have been staying at W hotels around the world since 2000 and this was a first. I was quite surprised. Don't know what it is about the front desk staff at this place.... That said, the room we had at this W was well-sized and the views on the Grammery St. side of the building were wonderful. The lobby was more intimate and comfortable than the pictures. The location is central. I would pick this hotel based upon location alone.

It’s the first review I ever wrote on TripAdvisor, but unfortunately, it is to tell people how bad my experience was. The location is great, which right across the street from Union Square. They have good recognition of Platinum member and they gave me a decent suite upgrade. Those were great. But the destination fee this hotel charges is definitely a fraud. At check-in, the will tell you all those things that could be covered by this fee but when you see your folio then you will be shocked. They charge you the fee as they wanted but never provide you what they suppose to provide. Plus, the stuff there were very rude and having no willing to help you but to kick you out. Avoid this property at all cost unless a proper response is given by the management. Guys, if this hotel dare to treat their loyalist customer like that, what kind of service would everybody else receive? Think twice before making a reservation.

Traveled with friends for Mother's Day weekend and stayed at the W in Union Square. All of the hotel staff are efficient and the room was clean and very comfortable. We had 2 days of rain, which was unfortunate but we still loved the location of the hotel. As much as I'd like to recommend the hotel restaurant, we had a less than stellar breakfast experience. I will say they did the right thing from a service recovery perspective, but the food is simply bad. No free wifi, coffee in the lobby.

I was wake up early in the morning 7 AM for the construction work nearby, Harsh Electric Drill sound none stop, there's no way I can sleep, so I leave hotel at 8AM. Breakfast was in room dining only with limit options,There's many SPG/Marriott hotel I can redeem points on with better breakfast options, I'm really regret stay at this hotel, with 5K points redeem difference I will choose St.Regis NY in heartbeat.I write feedback Email to SPG customer service, hotel Welcome office assistance director reply email with my stay time list in March (which actually is in April 29th I clearly listed in the Email along with my reservation number), I think probably he/she just copy&paste these apology Email, from these small things you can see how the hotel act. If you get my time all wrong how can you send specific feedback to the rep I deal with during check in/check out ?

Being in the heart of Union Square is great. Being there staying in one of those old NYC buildings that make you feel like you could bump into a Vanderbilt or Rockefeller is something else entirely.It's got the W swank, the W funkiness, the W panache. Room (1910) was comfortable, with a huge bathroom - especially for NYC. Service was great - as was expected at a W. Convenient to everything. Got a very good weekend rate, paid for in advance.HIghly recommend this property.

Look... Great location... Great place... My only complaints are the attitude of the people when I checked in and the fact that I had to argue about a room charge about a bottle of water that I had not drank (there are 4 free bottles in the room, why would I drink one that costs 9 USD?)... Oh, and also, when I checked out, there was no one at the desk... literally NO ONE! I mean, it is true that it was super early, but still... In any case, again, this doesn't meant that the place is not very good. It is, W NYC Union Square looks great, perfect location, you are right in the middle of everything... Just be prepared and thick skinned and everything is going to be ok,,, Would I go back? Sure, why not?

The hotel is in such a convenient location to everything. It is stylish and the rooms are really large and comfortable. We checked in very late due to a flight delay and they were really nice at the front desk. If you forget anything they are also very accommodating and well stocked. I recommend taking a room without a view if you like quiet, my room was incredibly quiet despite the central location while a colleague in a room overlooking Union Square said the view was amazing but it was very noisy most of the time. Was disappointed to see a charge for wifi in the room folder but they comped this for us all for three days which was great. Will definitely stay again for either business or pleasure.

So far my favorite W in the US and NYC. The rooms are very nice, the decoration is modern, with nice colors. The bathroom is also spacious, we were 4 and we never felt squeezed. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I will come back.

Close to my apartment so it's convenient when we can't be in our apartment. Rooms are dark however and kind of feel like it's in a converted office building (which it is). Never have been in a room that faces the square. Other rooms that face side streets are fairly quiet.

We travel to NYC on average 3 to 4 times per year and we keep coming back to the W Union Square. First, the location is amazing. Just in front of Union Square with extensive subway access. You can walk practically anywhere: Empire State building, Meatpacking district, Flatiron, etc.. Plus, the farmer's market at Union Square is open Mondays, Wednesday, Fridays and Saturdays. You can sample fresh fruits and vegetables, cheese, fresh meats, fish, baked goods and even wines and spirits. Second reason for visiting the hotel is the amazing staff. I would like to make a very special mention to the doorman that usually works the morning and day shifts Fridays through Sunday. Unfortunately I never found out his name but he will remember us: the couple from Montreal with the blue car! He has been so kind and helpful to us.The rooms at the W are generally large than average and offer the highest level of comfort. The service is outstanding and any issue is always resolved immediately with a smile. We really feel at home. The only disappointment on our trip that is not related to the hotel at all is the closure of the Pavilion in Union Square park. It was one of the highlights of our previous visits. The restaurant and bar is now permanently closed. On the good side, we discovered the Irvington in the W Hotel. Great spot for a drink after a long day of walking. Make it a point to stop for happy hour.

First family vacation in NYC very intimidated not sure where to stay. Travel agent stirred us away from uptown and Times Square and to lower Manhattan. Oh how glad I am that she did! Hote W Union Square was a wonderful part of our NYC experience. Everyone was so kind and patient with us...From the front desk, restaurant staff to the doormen all amazing. I cannot wait to book our next trip to NYC we will be staying at this hotel!!!

this hotel has location going for it. union square is a nice area to stay in. Brigit is the real sunshine at this hotel. she is friendly and helpful! sometimes the fragrances in the room can be a bit strong because they do spray a lot of that W spray! The restaurant is also hit or miss. the burgers are good, but don't get the artichoke app. it is teeny. overall, this hotel is comfy and I will return!

From the moment I stepped in, I knew I chose the right hotel for my first NY experience!Folks are friendly and helpful and Super accommodating. If I have to name a reason why I will be back again, it is because of Nelson! He was a great help and recommended places to get my to do list completed. Will bring my family next time!!Cheers Jenn

Heavy construction going on next door. First trucks rolled in at 4am and the pounding started at 6am. Make sure you request room other than South facing. Front desk did not bother to advise me when I checked in. Double rooms are nice size for NYC but price is no bargain. Also, you have to request a coffee maker. They do not provide in room.

What I mean by the title is that this actually functions well as a business hotel, not a nightclub for tourists that happens to have hotel rooms. The reception mercifully doesn’t have pounding club music and is friendly and courteous.My room was amazing, on a high floor with a fabulous view looking south and over Union Square. The room was spacious, the bed very comfortable with a firm mattress, and a good sized bathroom with the usual Bliss Spa products. Plus a fluffy bathrobe and slippers.The room could have used a bit more strong lighting, but it was actually fine. There’s a big screen tv, safe, usual snacks and ironing board. Plus hair dryer.There are lots of good electric sockets/outlets in easy-to-access places. (Believe it or not, this is not an obvious bonus. Too many hotels are stingy with their sockets, and often we find ourselves moving furniture to get to them in order to charge mobile devices.)The room was quiet so I could get work done although I could hear the tv in another guest’s room.Excellent wifi - fast.The gym is not really designed for business travellers. It’s small and there are only a couple of treadmills, one stationary bike, and two ellipticals. Not many weight machines or free weights, but some space for stretching/yoga.I did not eat here, because the neighborhood is great for eating options. You have the farmers market on the weekends in Union Square and all the restaurants/cafes nearby. Plus really good shopping - Sephora across the street, Paragon Sports a block away (excellent sporting goods shop), Whole Foods across the square, Trader Joe’s around the block, excellent hipster coffee shop and breakfast sandwiches at Daily Provisions a block away, etc etc.The subway is a block away; Union Square is a major thoroughfare. You can get the N, R, 4, 6 (yellow/green lines).The only tricky thing for visitors is the entrance is not obvious for most cab drivers so you have to stay eagle eyed.

So, I usually enjoy my W’s. This one needs a little more work. For what we had planned for ourselves the hotel couldn’t have been more ideally located. Points for that. The restaurant/lounge/bar area is perfect. Points. Decor and cleanliness. Points. HOWEVER...and this is no joke...the only way we were able to achieve a hot water shower was to continuously flush the toilet. Yep! That didn’t feel right. Several times per shower we had to flush for each other or open the shower and reach around for the toilet handle. We called more than once and were told something would be done. Nada. Minus all points from above. Most of my angst about that was the waste of water. Thumbs down. This made my smaller point seem pointless. I also requested two extra pillows, as I always do. First at check in then two other times. Although promised - never delivered. I’ll give the W in DC a solid though and suggest you try to have drinks on their roof deck sometime. Amazing. Plan ahead. b
user_name:
inacountrynearu
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: It just lacks the nice finishes many would be used to at a W. The staff is good but the rooms are average, at best. Decent WiFi and a great deli next door for a breakfast sandwich. Great for midtown but $$$$

W Union Square has nice sized rooms for NYC. I have stayed at this hotel multiple times since the location is very convenient. The bar area is nice for a drink but could do with an upgrade in decor and so does the whole hotel to be honest. This must be the W that doesn't live up to the W standards when it comes to the flair and interior design. The benefit is the location, close to most things like good meals and people watching and in my case our office. Gym is small and dark. Breakfast is ok, but expensive.

I have stayed at this hotel multiple times and service has always been good. My last stay however I noticed a significant change. The manager was very rude at check in. When we requested late check out (which we are entitled to based on our Delta Medallion Status) I was told that Delta and SPG are not affiliated and treated as if I made a ludicrous request. Feels like the Marriot has completely changed the SPG brand. When staying at the W I shouldn’t feel like I am at a Fairfield Inn but that is what Marriot has done to all Starwood Hotels.

The location was the only issue The hotel room was very spacious The staff very helpful Very modern and clean And the lounge area and the bar area was alway very busy Good atmosphere . .........,,..................................................

Decent sized rooms for NYC, got an upgrade to a corner room which was a lovely surprise. The bar area is nice for a drink but could do with an upgrade in decor. The benefit is the location, Union Square, all the subways and great neighbourhoods for meals and people watching. Friendly staff who are helpful.

The rooms are comfortable. The lounge is great for a drink in the evening and the location at Union Square is so convenient. The staff is very nice and check in and out was easy. Barnes and Noble is nearby by too. Great store! There are many good restaurants in the area too.
user_name:
cjcxfile
New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel and great rooms, location is close to tourist attractions in Manhattan island. Staff are nice & service during stay was fantastic. SPG platinum membership benefit is honored. Very happy with stay and will return.

Great we had an upgrade as rooms are very small but moreover totally unpractical. The hotel is just anti eco and totally unsustainable. Change quickly please your practices are a crime against the planet

We stayed at the W Union Square because we were in NYC to see medical specialists. My daughter had a seizure in the room and paramedics had to be called. The hotel team was unbelievable in this situation. They could not have been more helpful: extending our stay, freezing ice packs for us, always meeting my daughter in a wheel chair. Their warmth and sincerely helpful attitude was off the charts. This is fantastically managed hotel!

Was fortunate enough to stay here during a business trip, so I had no choice with the location. Was a lovely hotel, unique rooms with some quirky design. The beds were lovely and comfy. The room came with everything you need - apart from tea/coffee making facilities, that was disappointing. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. We visited the bar twice during our stay, can recommend the Whiskey Sours! A great hotel with (almost) everything you need for a business trip.

Stayed here for business and the W always treats guests kindly and enthusiastically...We walked, took the subway or took Uber around the city, and the doorman always recognized us and made us feel welcome when we encountered him. He also recommended a nice Italian place down the block when we arrived the first night after a delayed flight.Clean, easy check in and left our luggage in storage the day we checked out because we couldn’t get into our second hotel until later...
