The hotel is great for a weekend getaway in New York. The location is great, the price with the deal we got was really reasonable, and the rooms were not too small for New York. They are tastefully decorated in a modern style. We also ate breakfast at the restaurant, which was very tasty, and fairly priced for New York. But what makes this hotel stand out is the staff. The housekeepers were always friendly, and they provided whatever reasonable request you have. In particular, Sebastian at the front desk was amazing. He remembered my kids names, which made them feel special. And he comped the older one a kids movie because my son had printed out to another customer that they had left their hat at check-in. Top notch customer service.

The service at W hotels can vary by location but the service has always been exceptional at the Union Square location. The location is great and provides central access to all that Manhattan has to offer. I want to share a special thanks and praise to Leonard at Guest services who was so incredibly nice and made our stay extra special!
user_name:
Amy O
New York City, New York

review_body: This W is in a great location and that is the best thing going for it. The room I had was fine for one night. It was a bit worn. It seemed the pay minibar took up more room than the bathroom. I was fine with all of that because it was just for one night but the service was indifferent. When I arrived, it was raining and I got out of the cab with my bags. There were two door men standing there and neither offered to help...did not even open the door(s)! When I came back from dinner there were no doorman at the front at all and there was not one person to be found at the front desk. Just strange.

I've had the pleasure of staying on property a few times the last two years. Last fall, a family emergency arose that pushed my trip. The hotel team, especially Tiffany, were amazing - supportive, understanding, personable. They helped me navigate my travel changes with ease and great humanity. They even called to ensure I had everything I needed once on site, knowing the disruption from family matters might weigh on me while I was away. They also know which specific room I favor and make every effort to provide it. Another high quality service step seldom found anymore. Staying in the same room helps keep it familiar, my home away from home when in NYC. I feel valued as a guest and value my relationship with the team and this property - one that continues to build over time. Couple all that with clean, comfortable accommodations, which supports my busy travel and work schedule, and it's a great pair. I am ever grateful to the team a W New York - Union Square.

This is a nice hotel in a great location, but seems to be getting a bit tired and worn. That said, it has some really nice rooms.What I would say is as a Plat 100 I checked in hoping for an upgrade on a 1 night sunday stay, seeing as the app showed every room type available (at 11pm when i checked in). Guy at front desk didn’t care about Platinum etc, handed me room key. I asked nicely if I was upgraded and he said: “yeah.” I asked for the category of room and I clearly was not. I asked nicely for an upgrade and he said: “no suites are available.” I said If I call my Ambasador will she confirm that? He said: “yeah.” Well, online more than 4 different types of suites were available my Ambasador confirmed. I went back to lobby and nicely asked the man at the desk...”oh! Something did just become available.”Modest jr suite, but wow, shameless on the part of the hotel. An 11pm check-in on a sunday night for a 1 night stay and still they pretend nothing more is available...

Standard W. My HVAC unit was barley blowing out warm air while it was -12 outside but it was no big deal really. Rooms just seem a little outdated. Reminded me more of a Sheraton. Great staff, great location.

the place was in a perfect location and very clean and quiet . we were able to walk out the door to every place we needed to go to. We were able to find a great deal so hope we can do that again. customer service was great too...

i don't think it is extraordinary for all of us to expect hot water in our hotel rooms. I checked in at 6 pm, noted the issue immediately. cook a cold shower and let the front desk know of the issue before heading out to dinner. when i returned at midnight, this was not addressed. the engineers came by and was unable to address the problem at 130 am. plan was for a shower in the morning before we headed out to enjoy the city, so you can understand my frustration at the situation i was in.i spoke with the evening manager who offered me limited options. the hotel was full so i was denied any options for transferring to another room. despite there being 10+ spg properties in NYC, the manager (Nicolas) would not transfer me to a sister hotel. I asked for compensation my reducing my hotel charge, which he denied because I was booked under the government employee rate. I was able to get a SPG Platinum customer service rep on the phone who was able to coordinate cancelling the second night of my hotel stay, but informed me that the manager would not budge. I immediately booked a stay at the St. Regis on 5th ave. for the next night which was a delight. I felt like the manager went the extra mile to try to NOT address the situation at hand, and really treated me like a second class guest because I booked the stay using the government employee rate. don't offer the rate if you're going to treat your customers differently. be kind and try to work with your customers when they approach you in private for a resolution to the problem.

We stayed at the W in Union Square on our way to Tanzania. Our stay was short and sweet. The location is great for small shopping and restaurants. Our room was the typical W Hotel style with nice beds a view of the city and normal W Hotel bathroom products. My only complaint was that I could hear the TV from the room next door in the middle of the night. I could have been extra sensitive as I was on MTS and perhaps the TV was super loud. The lounge area, bar, and restaurant have a nice vibe. I was also offered a welcome drink by the friendly staff. We were upgraded to a larger room as I was traveling with my 15 and 13-year-old. Overall, we enjoyed our short but brief stay at the W Hotel in Union Square!

This hotel is not of the level SPG standards would expect. The rooms,s are average, at best, staff ok, location good but you can do WAY better that this hotel. Frankly, just not top to the standards of a W, much less an upscale hotel in NY, First time here, but not for W hotels but this is a cut way below. We are are a 4+ star hotel travel, so put in in perspective but this is NOT a 4-star by any measure. Moreover, be prepared to pay for Internet 9we and to alert them to our Gold SPG status but they get very hard to get your to pa for Internet). Internet it terrible, bar is fair, restaurant 9for NY) is mediocre so there are just far better places to satay, The manager here must be new or detached, he/she is not a great oriented exec. In NY, you have to up your game but not here. Book this hotel as a last resort but definitely do not reach to for this one.We have travel the world and seek great hotel staff and facilities and this is just well below its stated level, The shower had mold all over but the room was "standard" nothing special but no big issues. Look elsewhere. To be fair, no major probs just a lower standard.

We got a great deal online to stay at the W it’s a cool hotel in a great location the staff were very nice the only thing I didn’t like was the toilet in the lobby bar is absolutely horrible it’s downstairs cold and dank

I really enjoyed the stay. Union Square is a great location and the hotel has a great vibe. Everything as expected for a W Hotel. Union Square itself is only a hundred yards away and hosts farmers markets and a Christmas Market. It's a nice area and a nice hotel.

Really expected so much better from this hotel. Far from the W’s usual standard. Rooms are old and have air conditioning issues- we’ve had to change rooms twice. Not good, I do not suggest choosing this hotel.

Checked in this afternoon....The location, the rooms, the interior is fabulous so would definitely recommend it. Where the hotel fell short is having adequate staff on duty...had to wait approx 50 minutes to get our luggage in the room...called three times and then had to go downstairs to get our luggage.... I one took ownership of the issue...Not the experience a guest should have to go through.Overall a cute property with a funky character.

It’s about location , location , location for this W hotel. It’s corners with Union Square, so it’s a great Center of operations for a New York City visit. But I guess their terrific locale pretty much ensures high occupancy so I didn’t feel they were trying too hard when it comes to service level. I may be a bit of a whiner here — I’m an SPG platinum, 100 night+ a year member so I guess I’m using a higher standard for hotels that are part of that chain. It’s decent enough as a hotel and ok service — it should just be better given how much it costs, I think.

My husband and I were pleased with our stay. The room was quite spacious compared to some hotels, quiet and clean. Our reservation included a $100 food/drink bonus and free continental breakfasts both mornings delivered to our room. Coffee was excellent. Not always the case!Loved the bar, lounge, and location. Food was excellent. Would definitely stay here again.

This property is top-notch, well-located and we couldn't have been happier. We were in the city for a wedding recently and really enjoyed the service from the great staff and the comfort of our room. Strong recommendation!
user_name:
Jeffrey R
Cedar Knolls, New Jersey

review_body: Great stay!Pros-Location was great. It was away from the crowds of Times Square but still had the NYC charm. Close to the subway, easy to get a taxi or Lyft, and near all the essentials you need as a tourist. I especially loved the Holiday Market and Farmers Market across the street. The small food mart next store had every drink you could imagine and delicious made to order sandwiches. Service was excellent. Special thank you to our HSK Svetkana (floor 6) and the helpful Concierge team. I loved how the Concierge team sent an email after we arrived offering assistance and replied within 30 minutes when I had a request. The rooms were well equipped and the bed was really comfortable. Great shower pressure. As an SPG Gold member, they honored late check out and upgraded our room size. Honestly the only con is they didn’t send me a survey so I could share my feedback.

In New York City for a week long business trip, and the conference hotel was the W at Union Square. The hotel is an interesting combination of some old-world charm and modern amenities, but when you look a little deeper it is awfully simpler. For example the night stands, TV stand, etc. do not have drawers ... they are simple wooden boxes on their side. Similar, one simple chair to relax in and an office chair. I would expect a lot more for the price.

I was disappointed in the W. The service wasn't great, the room was mediocre. The location is terrific, but there are other places to stay that I felt were better. There's not really a lobby (to meet someone in), really basically a bar. The staff were half hearted in helping with questions (I'm from NYC so there weren't any touristy questions, but more questions about the room and services). It just seemed overpriced for what we got.
user_name:
LJS13
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed in business recently. The hotel has some very nice old characteristics but the rooms have been modernized a bit with the minimalist approach. Very clean and quiet hotel in central union square location.

My wife and I came for a business trip. My second and her first time in NYC. Hotel was nice, people friendly. Workout room was ok, it suffices. The hotel room is rather small but sufficient. The hotel is about 1.3 miles from time square and 2.3 mikes from Central Park.

Thoroughly enjoyed staying at the W New York at Union Square. It's a comfortable hotel with a friendly staff. The location is excellent. There's a wonderful Farmer's Market right across the street in Union Square 4 days a week. There is also a subway station located in Union Square. There are plenty of specialty shops, grocery stores & restaurants within walking distance as well.

I've stayed at New York W Hotels in Times Square and on Lexington Avenue. The W Union Square is my favourite. It has an understated boutique feel, the rooms are a decent size and the restaurant is excellent.

If you are a Starwood member it is great because of the location. It definitely is not the nicest W, but not the worst either. NY has so many great hotels just make sure the value is there. General Area: they have a great lobby where people gather and work. Not a lot of plugins so make sure you are charged up, but they did a great job at utilizing the entire space so people can sit. Rooms: the room I had was ok, but again not the nicest room I have been in. They had a cheap little clock so no music system which I had to use the old iPhone in a glass trick. Staff: Like a lot of the SPG hotels anymore the staff was 50/50. Some go out of their way to make sure your stay is nice and the other half act like you are annoying them. This has become very frustrating to me as a person who travels a lot. Food: read my review on the Irvington. Worst restaurant experience I have ever had. There is an amazing little place right down the block called the house which again read my review. In all it is a nice hotel, but now that I have made platinum I think I will check out other places.

Right in Union square - a fantastic W hotel. Have stayed there many times always consistently very good. Nice rooms - good size and nice bathrooms. The bar at the hotel is approachable yet sophisticated. The location is great easy access to subway and restaurants / shopping all within minutes.

The hotel was a pleasant surprise. I was not sure about the neighborhood or what to expect but the front desk was very helpful and friendly, the room itself was large for NY and it was clean. There were plenty of outlets, plenty of light and it was comfortable. Breakfast was ok. Bar service was good the one evening I tried that. It was overall better than I expected and a nice stay.

I have enjoyed staying at the W many times, in New York, and, elsewhere.But, there is a lack of many things in this particular property, and, recently!The restaurants service, is horrible, the overall staff, is not very attentive,and, the regular maintenance, not very good?!This place, is usually wonderful? What's the matter? Fix it!
user_name:
eventsbythirteen
New York City, New York

review_body: If this were a Four Points or even a Sheraton, I might have thought to myself, "this is a decent hotel" and not given it another thought, and probably given it 4 stars. It is (mostly) clean, the staff were very friendly, and the location is ideal. However, as an SPG loyal customer, I have a certain set of expectations about each brand, which are expectations that I believe those who created the brand want to me have. Starwood has, in fact, been an industry leader in "lifestyle brands." We have stayed at many W properties before. In almost all ways, this property fails when it comes to living up to W brand standards and really is not worthy of the brand.When I think of a W hotel, I expect a property that is not as full service or as luxurious as a St. Regis, but I do think I will get something that is a step up in both service and also in look & feel from a Westin or Sheraton. Most importantly, I expect a W to be cool and beautiful and interesting. It needs to have a certain vibe in all experiences from checking in, to the room, the shower, public spaces, elevators, etc. I want to walk into the room and be inspired by the decor, and in NY, to feel like I am in a hip urban oasis. It should feel like a loft in SoHo. It should connect be to the elements of the W brand that are in the city outside the hotel. Instead here is what I found:-A room with spartan decor that feels outdated -Stained window coverings and cracked paint on the ceiling -A bathroom that feels like a cheap suburban hotel with a shower curtain (gross!) instead of a glass door and a hideous vanity that belongs in a Holiday Inn, with broken glass over the ugly light fixtures. - Only minimal amenities in the bathroom (no q-tips, cotton balls, shaving cream,slippers, etc..nothing that could help it feel little more high end) -The Platinum breakfast (free for SPG plat elite) was in-room dining only, which is annoying, and only includes coffee and pastries. This is another area where they could easily do more to make up for other areas. -Strange art in the elevator that looks like 90's suburban art. -There is minimal public space. For most W hotels, the "Living Room" is a kind of destination that helps set the tone, but this is lacking here. This property has the bones to be amazing. The views are gorgeous and, as I said, the staff were great and the location can't be beat. I am sure that, due to the location, it is a cash cow and that the owner has little incentive to invest until the conditions are such that people start to book away from the property. That being said: For those that expect a typical W experience, look elsewhere. Here you will get only a basic hotel, and you'd be better off saving your money and going Sheraton or Four Points, etc.

My room is really large with a nice view. Everything looks good. I guess looks were the priority. Service has been abysmal. The door man didn't open the door for me. He was on his phone. Actually, I opened the door for him. He remained on his phone as he followed me inside and bumped into me while I tried to open the door and pull my luggage through at the same time. He didn't tip.I checked in at 10pm. There were two people behind the desk and one other person was checking in. They were taking a pretty long time. One might think the second desk person would look up, say a word, make a gesture, something. Instead, they avoided eye contact and decided this would be a good time to wander around the lobby, pretending to be busy. Then they disappeared into the back.I had about ten minutes to study the odd door man from the lobby while I waited. I thought--for sure this guy is just a hotel guest who chose to dress in all black and stand at the door. No, he was the door man.OK, I checked in. Look at the room service menu. It says (literally) that you should order from "Whatever/Whenever." Above that, it says that all food stops at 6:30pm. Called to figure out what's up. It's a typo on all the pages. Apparently the "whatever" attitude extended to proofreading. The menu suggests you can order from the Irvington downstairs but that's barely true. You can't order off the Irvington menu.No means of coffee in the room. Called downstairs. Any caffeine? "Uhh... we can check maybe if we have a machine somewhere." Never mind. I was here three nights. I put the do not disturb sign on my door the whole time. Like I said, the room is nice. Just minimize interactions with the staff.

We had a "studio suite" for $556/night including taxes and fees. Upon check-in we went to our room to find the room clean except a toilet full of vomit. I've admittedly stayed in some sketchy places in my life, but never this. Then, upon returning from dinner (hopeful that the bathroom had been cleaned) we entered to find cockroaches scurrying from under the bed. Obviously, this W Hotel needs some serious attention in terms of cleaning and management of staff Definitely not worth the $!

Have been staying at this W as it is close to my daughter and niece's apartments. Bridget is so kind and helpful. She is a caring and takes special care to go the extra mile. Stella is also really nice! Hotel is very convenient to many restaurants and union square is a great neighborhood. My only complaint is that the lobby and lobby bar is freezing!!! They need to fix that!! My new home away from home! :)

Checked into the hotel early with no problems. The room is a good size and is clean. The main issue I’m having is the noise. I’ve had to work out of the room which is located on the 10th floor for a portion of the afternoon spending about 3 hours in there. It seems like the windows are not properly insulated as I can hear everything outside as if my windows open, which it is not. I’ve stayed in many NYC hotels and have never had one this loud. On top of this there is a lot of noise In the hallway as all conversations out there are 100% audible in the room. Would not choose this hotel for future stays.

The hotel has a great location of you like lower Manhattan. In my opinion in desperate need of renovating. A bit expensive but again you pay for the location which is prime. The staff in general were helpful and nice.

As loyal Starwood guests and frequent overnighters in NYC, the W Hotel in Union Square has become one of our easy go-to hotels. It's in the heart of Union Square excitement, convenient to a slew of amazing restaurants (including its own) and close to subways lines that make it simple to jet anywhere in the city). We've never had a bad experience, and when we have needed to switch our room, the front desk has gone the extra mile to make sure we are happy and well situated. The Red Door spa across the street gave a 10% discount for being hotel guests, and I love the popup farmers market right outside the front door on Saturday mornings. (If management sees this review, we'd like to say that we did not know Nelson (at check-in) personally before we arrived, but considered him a friend by the time we checked out. We'll return because of welcoming and accommodating staff like him!)

The location is great and yes there is construction nearby but if folks are being honest it is summer and construction is the fifth season. It is pointless to complain about neighbourhoood construction because it is outside of the control of the hotel. The front desk staff and Nelson in particular, were very friendly and happily answered our endless questions on everything from nearby restaurants to health care in the US. The rooms are generously sized, clean, with comfortable beds and ours at least had a great view.

...the place, even though there was a renovation some years ago becomes a little bit old and not as special as it used to be some time ago. Obviously the location is great, but as there is a big construction going on on the other side of the street, you will be woken up at 7 am by terrible construction noise. So even the views out of a corner room into Union Square can't take this away ... the hotel is missing out in advertising this to their clients, sorry, but if you are really client committed, please notify your clients in advance...Anyway, unfortunately not really a top choice anymore in a very competitive NY hotel market, and sitting on the laurels of the past is not enough.
user_name:
Matthias F
Palma de Mallorca, Spain

review_body: We found a deal online, but we had to call directly to the hotel because there was a custom request. We called W New York - Union Square to make a reservation for 2 rooms and 3 nights. We have an autistic son and we need connecting rooms. The person who took the call found the special rate that we found online for one of the rooms and we found a better rate for the other room with the NYU rate. Once in the hotel, we found out that he made both reservations with the NYU rate which was $50 more expensive per night in the other room. Also, the rooms were not even in the same floor, then they managed to find one in the same floor but not connecting, not even close. Not coming back and I do not recommend this hotel, but in the case you have to, then be careful when you make the reservation and double check that they send you the reservation with the correct rate and any special request noted in the confirmation.

The good- Great location. Clean, with a hip decor. Housekeeping was perfect. The not-so-good- *While the person being checked in, next to me was greeted with a very personable, friendly, front desk rep, I unfortunately, did not. I got the impression that the woman checking me in, wanted to be anywhere, but where she was at that moment. She seemed annoyed at any question I asked, and spoke so low I had to ask her several times to repeat herself. *It's a dog friendly hotel. If you have a dog that you want to travel to NY with, great. However, if you are someone who travels sans pet, and it's in the room next to you and barks ALL MORNING/DAY because it's owners left him in there, not so great. That being said, I did finally make a call to the front desk after I couldn't take it any longer and I'm not sure what they did, but the barking stopped. (Thankfully!)Overall it was a perfect location for my trip with my daughter. It's a bit pricey for a place that doesn't have a spa or even a sundry shop (but there is a CVS at the corner).I have stayed at many W Hotels and this one just seemed to miss the mark a bit.**Charles at the front door was awesome! Super helpful and extremely friendly!**

WUS is always a wonderful pleasure. All staff are professional. Most, if not all, are very warm, kind, and decent people. Front desk staff are amazing (Sebastian, Nelson, Eddie, Natalie, Margie, Pricilla, etc.). Room service and room stylists are terrific. Great location. Well maintained property. Best views can be had. Great Bliss products. Extremely relaxing place!

I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. The W Union Square has wonderful rooms and the best hotel staff I have ever encountered. My room was spacious and lovely and the view was fabulous. The bed was super comfortable, and the Bliss products are the best. I receive hand-written thank-you notes from the housekeeping for the tips I left each day. Such a nice touch. Director of Operations, Kevin Ballo, is doing a great job. I very much look forward to staying at this hotel again.

Nicely renovated older hotel building: many rooms are NYC smallish with some more comfortable ones. But, why no coffee makers in the rooms? You have to get dressed and go down to the lobby for complimentary coffee. Sheratons, Westins, St Regis and other Starwood hotels have coffee makers in rooms; why not the W? Take out the worthless mixbar with overpriced snacks and put in a coffee maker. Newspapers delivered to door only 40% of the time--otherwise back to the lobby. Bliss amenities are nice. Housekeeping is good. But nothing distinguishes this luxury priced hotel. Of course, good location if Union Square area is desired.

First of all we have been to many W hotels around the world and this is the worst one we had been to! Decoration was poor, service was not on point and food could have been better. Also they charged us 30$ for a double espresso! Ridiculous!!

First of all, I'd like to point out that I travel a lot and frequently stay at W Hotels worldwide.The W Hotel Union Square is in a very convenient location and the rooms are a decent size for New York. The bed was comfortable but here are the negatives: we had to ask for our slippers and our complimentary water bottles were never replenished. But it gets worse. Their customer service is horrible! The worst ever! We checked into the hotel around 11pm. There was no one to open doors and help with luggage, and there was only one check-in receptionist at the front desk who was already helping another guest. After she was done helping him, she did not even welcome or acknowledge us. She started typing away on her computer and with no eye contact said, "You may step up now." We had already waited 15 mins. My husband and I told her that this was unacceptable for W Hotel. She didn't even flinch or offer any apology and asked if we'd like a manger to contact us tomorrow. No manager contacted us the next day. So I emailed them. The welcome desk manager was understanding but we did not feel like she was really going out of her way to address our needs or change the overall service direction of the hotel. Our check out was also handled by the same lady who checked us in. Once again, she did not smile nor make us feel comfortable. We were juggling with a lot of bags and she didn't offer to get any help for us. There was once again no one at the front door to help us with our luggage.Throughout my 4 day stay at this hotel, I've rarely seen a doorman and if I did, they never acknowledged me or said hello. This hotel does not know anything about good service. Just two weeks ago, I stayed at the W Hotel in DC and they were great. Just last week, I stayed at the Hyatt in Union Square and they were also very accommodating.

This hotel was wonderful we had such a great time. A true taste of NYC can be had at this location. Forget the crowds of Times Square everything is easy to get to from here. Subway location nearby and restaurants on the park.
user_name:
Maureen E
north salem ny, United States

review_body: The staff went out of their way to make sure my stay was as pleasant and comfortable and hassle free as possible. From the front entrance to check-in to management, all were friendly and open to help.

This is a incredible hotel. Very helpful staff. Great location. Great bar in the lobby area. The rooms are incredible. The only problem is that in 2017 they have shower curtains and no glass shower enclosures. Over all very nice stay.

We were amazingly satisfy with the service and overall room. It is close to several shops and we would gladly stay there again. We will be recommending this hotel to friends and family for future trips.

This was our second stay in the W Hotel. We like the decor and location. The bathroom was large and the king size bed was very comfortable. We had everything we needed. The view of Union Square park made it even better!

HiI booked this hotel 2 months ago through spg website and i am gold spg member. I have requested room on high floors and guess what when i checked in around 6pm and they gave me room on 16th floor and i said i requested room on high floor. I was told it's going to take some time as they have nothing available yet. My question for them is they do not check client requests a day before when someone booked months ago. Anyways as my kids were tired after a flight so we took it. It wasn't easy room on 16th floor was very noisy and at some times when someone leave their car door open you could hear that chime so clearly its like you are standing next to that car. I am not sure if window insulation is so bad.

Loved this W - and the decor, which is NOT dated, just "cool" enough - Huge Mirror, modern design - good flow - beautiful bathroom counter - comfortable bed, much more to my taste and comfort level, and as someone said, helps you get back into the W thing. Stayed on my husband's points. Beautiful view from my room -l 1206. And you can see the construction, from my window, but came on Saturday, and on Sunday, no work so no noise problem for me.Saw Ashley C's one and only contribution, and I have to disagree, not overly perfumed, bathroom is not antiquated and is preferable to the glass capsules of the newest Ws - it has a tub, thank you, that you can sit on and shave your legs, sparklingly clean -and if you think a suite is a sweet, well - that speaks volumes. Easy access to Grand Central, easy walk into downtown Manhattan, or cross the street and take any number of trains to your destination. Hit the Greenmarket. Have a glass of wine at the Pavilion in the park. Didn't eat here for room service, never use it, I'd rather cross the street to Pret A Manger or better yet, Coffee Shop for Brazilian music to accompany my breakfast or brunch. Free coffee in the morning at concierge desk. Hotel bar - Irvington? - has comfy seating. One thing I would have liked - it's little, but - I forgot to bring q-tips and some hotels provide that tiny little packet...but I could buy them at RiteAid or any little store so no problem. Didn't see a shower cap either but that was probably my oversight.Stayed her twice before and will stay again.

The W Hotel Union Square helped me to get back to using the W Hotel Brand exclusively whenever I travel. That is, sometimes I like trying out new hotels, brands, etc. especially whenever I travel internationally, but this hotel helped me remember what I love about the W brand. Furthermore, the drive from this location was perfect for staying in Manhattan and going to the Barclays Center.

Love this hotel for weekend trips to the city. The Union Square neighborhood is fun on the weekends and we felt right at home here. We were celebrating my birthday this weekend, and wanted to be sure to get especially nice restaurant reservations. I reached out to Robert at the Concierge Desk, and he got us on the waitlist for the place we most wanted to go to. We were delighted to hear that a cancellation opened up a few days before, and so we had a wonderful dinner at Gramercy Tavern on Sunday night. Robert was also helpful in guiding me to a restaurant before our show Saturday night. I typically don't use the concierge service in hotels much, but for this weekend, it made all the difference to have his help. Enjoyed our stay and look forward to coming back soon! Thanks for making this special weekend so much fun.
user_name:
MBTinDC
Washington Dc, District Of Columbia

review_body: Pros:- Location- SPG points- Room size is nice (Fabulous Sweet)- Bliss amenitiesCons:- Extremely dated interior - bathroom spacious but antiquated. Cracked tiles, ancient shower- Service was adequate but not overly impressive - much closer to 3 star than 4- Cleaning scent throughout floors and rooms extremely strong - had to have housekeeping come open windows to air out the bedroom- Not their fault but there is construction on the south side of the hotel (across the street) which starts before 8am. I'm here for business so it's fine but if I were on vacation it would be a loud bummer- Room service service charges pricier than competition, food adequate and not consistent - some days the 2 egg scramble was too much to eat, others it seemed half the amount.

Very comfortable rooms in a hotel located within short walking distance to farmer's market, The Pavilion Restaurant, shops, and transit surrounding Union Square. About a 12 min walk to NYU in one direction and Eatilly at the Flatiron District in the other. Fantastic take-out coffee shop next door to hotel was a great way to start the morning before venturing out on the town.

I stayed at this W for many weeks over this year. What I liked the most about it was the location, with my office downtown I was barely 20 minutes away from Whitehall with the R,W and yet there were so many food and entertainment options to take in daily. The rooms were also quite large by New York standards, and I did get upgraded quite a few times. The building is also an iconic one by NYC standards and the emergency stairwells still have the look and feel of 1920's New York architecture.However the only major gripe I have about the hotel is the lack of room service (for those days where I just did not want to leave the room), lack of an Platinum lounge and that breakfast is very sparse unlike other SPG properties. Although it is served in the room, there isn't any variety in breakfast options (Bread basket + choice of juice and hot beverage), which becomes difficult especially if you are staying for long periods. I would suggest that management offer a credit towards usage of the Irvington restaurant in the hotel downstairs (which does serve breakfast), as well a certain number of drinks. This would ensure that Platinum members' needs, who stay longer for business reasons, are taken care of. Additionally this property doesn't seem to participate in SPG points promotions due to which I did not stay a few times.

We stayed at the W for a few days in June. I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the bedroom as most hotel rooms in NYC require you to be the height and stature of a 3 year old. The hotel benefits from a great location away fromthe madness of midtown and it was lovely to walk straight out of the hotel and spend an hour mooching around the Union Square market. It's surrounded by several wonderful neighborhoods that are full of excellent cafes, bars and shops. Like most W hotels I've stayed in the music in the bar and public areas is *loud* complete with an in house DJ on a Friday afternoon for the post work/weekend crowd. The drinks in the bar are delicious, and even though it's a hotel bar in Manhattan I found the prices reasonable. I always find the staff at W hotels extremely helpful and friendly; Union Square is no different.

This isn't your typical NYC room, it seemed to actually have normal space and a tall ceiling to give the room an even larger feeling. Stayed for 3 nights during a meeting we had at the hotel and it was wonderful. The gym is a bit smaller than normal but it served it's purpose and didn't seem to get much usage from the guests. The bed was comfortable and the outside noise level is typical of a big city. The location worked well with many shops and restaurants in the area, and a short 1 mile to the high-line and 2.2 miles to central park. All can be easily accessed via the subway which is right across the street at Union Sq. Park or it serves as a nice run.

This W has all that you'd expect - great bar, great rooms, great service great location. Its hard to fault really. A small gripe is that the service can be a bit slow to the room and to tables at the bar, but then again, everything in NYC is run at double the pace, so this might be your opportunity to slow it down a notch.

As a frequent traveler to New York City I have had the opportunity to stay in many hotels over the past several years. When available to Union Square is always my destination of choice. The location is Close to Greenwich Village, Washington Square Park is lovely and interesting any time a year but particularly in the summer,Chelsea and soho are also very close and you are a short subway ride to midtown or the World Trade Center. The staff is consistently excellent ,in particular,on my last trip Stella at the Front desk was wonderful, exceptionally helpful and made us feel like valued guests during every interaction that we had with her , The rest of the Front desk staff as well as the crew from cleaning folks to the doormen we're also very accommodating . A great place to stay.

This was my third time staying at this hotel. I got there early, around noon, and the front desk got me a corner room suite. Check in is 3 pm, so I was very happy. Rooms are spacious, clean and a ton of extras to service all you needs. Location across from Union Square makes it convenient to take in the sights. A lot of great restaurants within walking distance. Well worth the price.

Starting at the entrance the doormen are generally too busy talking to each other to deign to open the door or help with luggage.Check in early not a problem which is excellent, good check out time.Desk staff seem to have a problem interacting in a friendly way with anybody above the age of 35.Not a single smile from anybody on the desk in the four days we stayed there.Ask a question and it seems to be a problem.Full room rate taken from debit card on arrival, plus almost 50% extra should you want to raid the mini fridge of its whole contents. This is not explained at check in. When querying this we were told it's standard hotel practice around the world. Having stayed in many hotels around the world it's the first time we've encountered this.The debit card is charged to your bank account immediately but getting a refund if you haven't raided the mini bar takes, we are told two to three days plus extra days if a weekend occurs. A problem if you're planning on using your debit card later and the extra 50% has taken your account into dangerously low territory.The rooms are very nice, not exceptional but nice. However no tea or coffee making facilities in the room and only a small free bottle of still mineral water. Plenty of hip smart water in bottles in the room at an additional cost. No free wi if in the room but you can pay extra to get it. Hence the near 50% additonal charge I guess.Chamber staff are charming and friendly.At breakfast tea ordered, no milk supplied. Not a big problem unless it takes the waiter an age to bring it and then slams it on the table because you've caused them a problem and you're not a cool enough dude. By this time the water for the tea has turned from hot (ish) to tepid so fresh hot water asked for. A fair degree of eye rolling and under the breath tutting is not designed to make for a happy customer.Overall not the greatest customer experience.Good location, and if you like loud music in the reception area and are a cool hipster this is the place for you, but we'll give a miss next time and go somewhere that believes the customer is important to the business and not a nuisance to be tolerated.

We went back for a weekend in the city because we used to live in the neighborhood around Union Square. Felt like old times. The room was nice, although not cheap, but you get what you pay for. Great location and very good service. I'd go back.

Really love this location. My corner room was overlooking Union Square. So peaceful compared to Times Square. Close by subway stop, shopping and fine restaurants. You won't be disappointed. (parking is $71 a night)

The Restaurant is a regular restaurant, nothing more, nothing less.Need to say that elevators is a big issue in almost all Usa Hotels I've ever been apart for some case.By the way, the staff is nice and welcome, and the rooms are clean and modern.Of course you pay for a Strategic Position which let you enjoy a wonderful part of New York such as Union Square- Madison Square.I really don't like the fact that Wi-Fi is under payment.

I have been there alone, in a high room, The room was outstanding with all the facilities and the space was good enough.The bed was amazingly nice and big.The gym how ever was a bit small with no windows.The location is on union square very good location, but it doesn't really matter where u are you will get around and get to all places. Overall i was 100% pleased.

I stayed at the W New York for four nights. The hotel is perfectly located to enjoy a very nice neighbourhood. Restaurants, bars, cafes, etc. are all very close.Rooms are nice and well furnished, with many amenities. There is no shower cap, however. Wi-fi works very well also in the rooms.Service in the rooms is slightly fluctuating, from more to less accurate. One morning our dustbin was not emptied.Bedsheets were not changed in four nights, something really strange and not good for a hotel of that level.Staff is sometimes nice, other times more distant. One does not always feel welcomed.Low floors are quite noisy.I did not have breakfast in the hotel so I cannot judge.

We made a reservation at 2am & checked in at 2:30am after leaving a rented apartment that turned out to be a disaster. The front desk check in process was extremely slow although the reservation agent on the phone was very helpful. The room was comfortable & quiet (unlike the apartment we were staying in.) The bathrooms at this property could use a renovation. For an older W Hotel the accommodations are still good.Union Square is a great location, especially if you want to go to Grammercy Park, The Village, etc.

I stayed here for a few nights. The hotel is located across from Union Square and there are many amazing restaurants nearby. Check-in was okay. Rooms are small but well laid out. Water pressure in the tiny shower was great. AC worked well and two small windows opened a little. Gym has limited equipment (one lifecycle, a few treadmills and elliptical, some dumbbells, etc.). A spin bike would be nice. Conference facilities are so so. Meal area has many windows and natural light. Ball room is quite dark and tired.

Every year I spend about 3 weekends at the W Hotel, Union Square, NYC. Everything about this W is excellent and I've never been disappointed. Somehow they even remember my name as I get out of the taxi. Highly recommended.

Hotel is well located for transportation. The room was large with corner windows. Nice for a junior suite; a cheap way to give loyal patrons a "Suite Upgrade". Staff was very friendly. I always sleep well in their "Heavenly" beds. I loved the gym in the basement. We have stayed there a year earlier & LOVED it (got a "real" suite upgrade). This year it was nice but could definitely notice some changes. I think maybe the Marriott takeover might have something to do with it.

First trip to NYC and struck lucky with W Hotel on Union Sq. Super location, easy walking to Central Park and on the subway line, so ideally sited. Rooms were decent sized, clean and modern. Staff were friendly and helpful and really added to our enjoyment of our stay. Coffee in the lobby was a nice addition to the package.Would definitely return to stay at this hotel.

The rooms are creative and fun. The location is convenient for transportation. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby. Don't waste time eating at hotel. The coffee is even bad but the best food to find is just steps away.
user_name:
L87SGmichaelr
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel is in a great location within easy walking distance to subway, restaurants, and park. Very friendly staff - professional and service-oriented. Offered us an upgraded room without us even considering to ask. Room very clean and updated. Recommend this property without hesitation.

I love this hotel. The W Union Square is a awesome and the staff is very friendly. The rooms are beautiful and spacious. Nelson at the front desk was very nice and super accommodating. Make sure to ask for him at check in! The food at the lobby restaurant Irvington was really delicious. Make sure to stay here next time you are looking for a nice hotel in union square / gramercy area.

Union Square is the most ideal spot to stay in NYC. Close to everything without being part of the mid-town tourist mayhem. This property is a standard W. Modern, clean, swanky with helpful staff. The view from my room was quite bad, overlooking a dusty courtyard where construction was going on. I have stayed at the W in the Financial District before, which in my opinion is a slightly better hotel, but the location in Union Square is the main reason why I would stay here again as opposed to their sister properties in the city. There is no pool, but you're in NYC, why would you waist your time at a hotel pool anyways?

I am spg platinum and so consistently choose w hotels when possible. This one was a huge disappointment. Positives. Rooms were ok and checkin staff were friendly and concierge was great. Negatives, common areas in hotel were small to non existent and as the restaurant was not "owned" by the hotel, the platinum breakfast benefit was not included and instead we received in room dining continental breakfast that was frankly terrible. Check out front desk experience was not at all friendly. Added together I would not recommend. I moved for the next 2 nights to the hyatt union square across the square. Had a great experience. Would recommend there instead if choosing between the 2 unless the w hotel starts to treat its platinum members better.

My daughter, a resident of Manhattan, gifted us a room at the W-Union Square for a weekend in April, 2017. She knows the city well, and it's readily apparent why the W-Union Square was chosen. Immediately upon arrival, a large urn of fruited water (plentiful variety of fruits mixed to offer a hint of flavor; very refreshing) suggests a welcome thirst quencher while you register. Green apples are nearby for a quick snack while heading out for the day. The hotel is ultra secure - the elevator will not function without a key card - MATCHED to the floor of your room! Complimentary water is also in the room. Climate control is very efficient and quiet; the room was comfortable and appropriately decorated. Attention to detail is apparent throughout the hotel. Highly recommended.

The Westin New York Union Square is located well. It is right in the heart of union square and walking distance to many restaurants.Our family stayed here last September in a fabulous room with two queen sized beds. We loved the hotel. The only complaint I have is that the beds are more like full size beds. It is hard for two people to sleep on it. All rooms have mini bars.The fitness center is in the basement. The hotel accepts pets. The hotel has valet parking for a fee and complimentary wifi for starwood guests. The hotel is walking distance to a lot of cafes such as Irwings Coffee and a great breakfast restaurant called Friends of a Farmer. Max Brenners is nearby as well. It is also a 10-minute walk to Greenwich village. Regal Union Square Stadium 14 is also within walking distance.Times Square is a 40 minute walk. If you are planning to be within walking distance to the Times Square/Central park area, I would look for another hotel.We did not eat here but the hotel has a onsite restaurant. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

I stay at this property at least 1-2 times a year and have always had pleasant experiences. The rooms are nicely sized for NYC. Decor is modern/funky and gives the place personality. The restaurant/bar is great for breakfast/brunch or a drink/nightcap - always lively. Check-in can sometimes be slower than desired b/c they never seem to staff the front desk w/ more than 2 people. Very nice of them to offer lemon water and coffee out front all the time. Plenty of elevators to get you up and down. And my pet peeve, the rooms/walls are thick or insulated enough that you can get peace and quiet at night. Location on Park makes it easy to grab taxis or Ubers. Easy to walk to many places. 2 thumbs up here.

Love this part of town, waking up to see the the Union Square markets being set up. close to some of my favourite parks like Union Square, Gramercy, Madison, Flatiron building and a couple of good bookshops within a block or two.The hotel is a modern design focussed hotel , style and quality with comfortable and spacious rooms. Lots of good cafes and fashion stores within a few blocks.Broadway is only a 20 minute cab fare so it is still easy to get to other parts of town.

I visited this hotel with my partner back in December. After reading reviews about noise and the size of rooms in NY we were both really nervous about what we would find but this hotel rally surprised us! It's a short tube journey to time square and the station is literally a few minutes walk from the hotel. Because it's quite out of the 'centre', the hotel is lovely and quiet so a great place to recuperate at night after long long days on foot exploring!The bar is always buzzy at night and the drinks were good. We treated it solely as A base so can't say much more really but we would definitely stay here again for comfort and convenience.

Rooms in New York tend to be smaller than in other cities, but the rooms here are larger. Bathroom is significantly larger than the W on Lexington. LOVE the Bliss products as well as the robes. Not a luxury property, but utilitarian, safe and comfortable. Easy & efficient check in and check out. Air system worked well. On a business trip where all you need is a place to sleep for the 7 hours between end of business dinners and AM breakfast meetings, this hotel is perfect. Free wifi in the room, just have to get to log in page, provide last name & room #. Click on 1 day free use. Can do that each day if you want access. Fresh apples at front desk. Coffee in the AM (quality not great but it's free caffeine to help wake you As is the case in most hotels these days, overpriced water in room for purchase as well as mini fridge line-up, but there is a CVS a few steps away if you get a snack attack. New York is a noisy place 24/7, cars, horns, sirens, people yelling, etc. pretty good insulation from that depending on room location, but not 100%, even 20 floors up. Wouldn't feel like NYC without it.

We stayed at the W Union Square while looking at colleges for one of our kids. We used Starwood points and were upgraded to a large room which was very much appreciated. We loved staying in Union Square. There is so much going on with great restaurants, bakeries, and shopping. The hotel was perfectly located, close to everything including the subway. The staff was extremely nice. The hotel is clean and contemporary. On the negative side, there was no newspaper in the morning which was a disappointment. When getting directions from the front desk, I had to ask for an area map instead of just being given one. This is a small thing but it would have made a difference. Also, there was no magazine about what was going on in the city that week. Another small thing that would have bumped my rating up to 5 stars. All in all, it was a positive experience and I would stay here again.

Wonderful Hotel with the best staff in the city. Magy and Stella at the front desk are wonderful and will ensure you have the best possible experience while staying in NYC. Jose at the front door is always smiling and will point you in the right direction. Rooms are always clean and food is always delicious. My go to hotel whether in town on business or for a night away from the kids!

The hotel was wonderful. the rooms clean and well maintained. the space was a little small but all and all it was wonderful. The location was perfect we were able to walk to everything we wanted to see.

Get the "wonderful" room or suite. Our 5 year old loves the couch sleeper! Staff loves children and the location can not be beat. We usually come on fridays so that we can go to the Union Square market on Saturday. Plenty of great restaurants in the area as well and the Union Square subway station.

In a great location, this hotel has gone through several decors - I have stayed since it opened - and the current is not one of the best... nor the worst. A bit overdone, shoddy construction, and stained fabrics don't make it live up to the 6-star Starwood rating level. I am a Platinum member and even giving plenty of advance notice received only the minimum recognition (other Starwood properties make a better effort.) There are few exercise machines - one didn't work, I had to ask for the complimentary water everyday of my stay, and such. Not egregious, but not thoughtful.

A weekend for my daughter's wedding. We had the pleasure of staying at The W hotel in Union Square. We always wanted to stay and it was worth it. The staff was very efficient, professional and so helpful. I can't remember staying a hotel and having the staff be so helpful. The rooms were wonderful and comfortable. Has a good time at the bar and lounge. Can't wait to stay again. Kudos to David@the front door. He was so wonderful.

Nelson and Mark of the front desk staff made our over night stay at the W Union Square beyond a regular stay at a hotel, they created an experience. They were a highly professional duo, that were patient, kind, accommodating, fun, friendly and most helpful to our 60th Birthday party group outing in the city. Nelson with his winsome personality, delivered like a singing telegram, a lovely chorus of Happy Birthday at our friends hotel door room. We will long remember all of the personal attention that the W delivered and hope to return one day soon. THANK YOU!In addition: Great location for the subway, shopping,restaurants, and Union Square Market.

Great staff offered lots of assistance. Concierge reached out in advance with offers for reservations and ended up with two great restaurants before the show on Friday and Saturday night. Location is so convenient to head to theatre district or downtown for other plans. Rooms were very comfortable--plan to go back.

The W New York is a fantastic, modern, hip and centrally located hotel. Walkable to the Union Square subway as well as many fantastic bars and restaurants in Union Square and Gramercy Park. The hotel restaurant and bar are chic and comfy- I sat in both for several hours!The rooms are a decent size for NY standards, and the Bliss beauty products are a nice touch, as is the complimentary water and free wifi.

My husband was here on Business and I got to tag along. The hotel is beautiful. The bed is SOOOO Comfy. The Restaurant/Bar in the lobby is great. We loved talking with the bartenders. Interesting and tasty cocktails.

As a platinum member on SPG, I love Starwood hotels, and this used to be one of my favorites. Unfortunately the staff at the front counter was so rude and not helpful. Great restaurant and bar, but you can find another W with much friendlier staff. The rooms are near the elevators and very very loud.

My mom and I stayed at this hotel for a few days during the first week of March. The trip was for pleasure--my wedding dress fittings, but my mom and I both were working remotely for each of our respective jobs. I used to live in NY close to this hotel and I have stayed here many times and tend to choose it for the nostalgia of my old neighborhood. Also, it is generally a hotel that delivers on what you expect from a W. This trip was an exception, unfortunately.The wifi stopped working during our stay. The hotel gave no explanation and no ETA of when it would be resolved (it wasn't resolved, by the way, while we were there). In 2017 an internet connection is not an amenity it is truly a necessity. My mom and I had to struggle to find wifi and go completely out of our way to get our work done. Separately, on my last day, my room key stopped working after I went to the gym. This was annoying but this happens sometimes, I get it. After patiently waiting in a long check in line, I get a new key, go up to my room, and it still doesn't work. I go down, wait in a long line AGAIN, and tell the same guy who helped me that I was in a hurry at this point I needed to shower and I couldn't miss my flight. He was apologetic but totally missed the opportunity to redeem the situation. Instead of having someone come up with me to the room to make sure I got in, he told me that if it still didn't work I could call down to the lobby and he would send someone up. I honestly used to love staying at this hotel but after this experience I won't be returning.

I requested and received a wheel-chair accessible room near the elevator. The bathroom was HUGE with both shower and bath. The room, with two double beds, was spacious enough to accommodate three of us. I only had two real problems. First, I can't understand how the hotel, which had lots of outlets and ports to accommodate computer access, doesn't offer "free" WiFi, especially for the exorbitant room rates they charge. Second, we ordered breakfast room service, and they had no problem charging me over $100 for burnt French toast and bacon. There is a serious quality control problem there. We decided to eat out the next morning, both to save money and to hopefully get a better meal.

Great location, except when it's not. If there happens to be a protest in union square, be prepared to hear everything all night. Otherwise it is a friendly, hip hotel with great lobby/bar scene for meeting clients or friends
user_name:
Jess_Bkln
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff you have at The W- Union Square is amazing!! I had the WORST day traveling Saturday, March 25th. MY flight with Delta was changed three times, the last one being 45 minutes before scheduled departure. I of course missed my flight as a result, and the customer service was AWFUL. My flight was rescheduled and I finally made it to New York. I get to the hotel, after getting to the wrong W, and I try to check in. My first point of contact was Louise, the doorman. He was so polite and personable. I worked with Priscilla at the desk as she pulled up my reservation and tried to check me in, my business card, declined. Priscilla did all she could to assist me after we spoke with the credit card company. She went and got the manager, Suzy. Suzy came up with a solution after we spoke with my employer and realized it was a mix up on their end. Louise saw how frustrated I was, especially after they heard what kind of day I had up to that point. While Suzy handled my payment process, Louise came over with a “drink on me” card and told me to have a drink at the hotel bar and relax while Suzy handled everything else. They got me all check in and the room was amazing!I was so impressed with the customer service, I wanted to personally let everyone know, especially because so often people reach out to complain. I will ALWAYS stay at The W- Union Square when I come to NY!

We almost always stay at the W Midtown or Smyth in Tribeca, but we stayed here and it was great. Lobby was nice and intimate. Our room was huge and fantastic--much bigger than the W in Midtown. The location was great--we walked to Eatly, and just walked around to all these great restaurants. The only downside was that the doormen were super inattentive and not helpful.

We have stayed at the W many times and have always had a great room with a lovely Park view. From the apples and coffee at the front desk for weary travelers to the comfy beds, we consider the W a good bargain in pricey Manhattan.

Fab hotel situated in arguably the best neighborhood in NYC. Well run hotel situated right in the heart of Union Square near great shopping and restaurants. Quiet rooms with high ceilings and modern amenities. Our room on the 14th floor faced south with clear views of the freedom tower and lower Manhattan. Fresh from a recent facade facelift and living room refresh, this hotel is hard to beat. Plus, the GM is a peach. We happened to run into him at the hotel bar- the Irvington, a Gerber run restaurant and bar. We'll be back, Bill!

This is our 3rd time staying at the W. We are SPG preferred and gold members. The first 2 times we stayed we were upgraded to the Spectacular room and this time, the ABSOLUTELY AMAZING front desk upgraded us to a cool corner suite. Check in was a breeze - the front desk staff is extremely friendly and accommodating - please know, if they CAN, they will. Especially if you are Starwood. We had booked 2 rooms because we were bringing another couple who's was celebrating a birthday. Not only did the front desk upgrade one of our rooms to the cool corner suite, they gave us another upgraded room directly next to the suite so we could all be together and free drink cards because of the birthday! The area around Union Square is great - we were in the mood for sushi and went to Haru (across the street) which never disappointments. Easy access to the subway and the overall Union Square area is really lovely - Lots of great bars and speakeasys and restaurants and vibe.. Highly recommended area of NY. OK, the corner suite was AMAZING. The pictures on the W website of the suite really are on point. As soon as you walk in there is a closet and a mini bar with lots of snacks and drinks (pay as you go) and a great room that easily was large enough to entertain all 4 of us. The bedroom was down a small hallway and open (no door) - The bed (as always) was super comfy and I had a great nights sleep. The bathroom was in the hallway area and was very large with a standard shower, bathtub and nice big vanity with a big mirror. The bedroom was large and we had a great view of Union Square - they had put (from what i gathered) a small stool to stand up on and see over the ledge (since the windows were fairly high) The staff was attentive to our every need in a very timely manner and overall we have 0 negative things to say about this hotel. Another bonus to this hotel is there is a 12pm checkout! We asked for a later one and they had no problem accommodating us -- as stated above, if they can, they will - the front desk staff is really amazing. We will stay there every time we plan on visiting Union Square. The overall atmosphere of the entire hotel is great. contemporary mixed with vintage - The Irvington bar/lounge connected to the hotel was GREAT. the bartenders there are TOP NOTCH and the atmosphere was wonderful. we stopped there before brunch on our way out and were NOT disappointed. We look forward to our next stay!

We were pleasantly surprised with the size of the room, really big compared to most hotels in Manhattan. A king sized bed, desk, food center, and still plenty of room. The bathroom was big and clean. Great price, great location.

Before you read on: I was at the W Union Square twice for business over the past weeks. I am a 29-year-old business traveler, appreciate a good sleep and effortless experiences, and am normally quite easy to please.The W Union Square is located at the north-east corner of Union Sq and is thus in the coolest part of town if you're a tourist: both mid and downtown experiences are not far away, Soho etc. are just around the corner. For business travelers, the location depends on what you prefer: easy access to JFK/LGA/EWR vs. proximity to your office. My office is 5min walking, which is why I stay in the area. Transport to JFK is always 1-1.30h in the afternoon.As for the rooms: they are spacious for NYC, the bed is very comfy and the AC operates quietly. The bathroom is clean but seemed a bit aged both of the times. The only drawbacks that I've experienced are non-soundproofed windows (rare in NYC anyways), scarce amenity kit (no comb, file, shoe horn, ...). Compared to other W hotels I've been in, the rooms could definitely need an overhaul if they want to fit in the W design world.Service was great at the Front Desk, they got me nice quiet rooms (although no upgrade despite status, seemed pretty booked). Doormen are something you need to get used to. I had two big suitcases and would've loved if they opened the door for me when I was leaving. But then again, as soon as you ask they were very helpful.Overall a solid 4/5 rating, esp. when compared to the Standard East Village, which is my preferred hotel in the area.

Perfect place to use as a base to tour the city. They made us feel very welcomed and we loved the "whenever whatever" button on the phone. Always met our needs quickly. Brought us a coffee maker and daily coffee pods. Gave us a credit when there was some trouble with check-in. Close to subway, downtown, soho, and easy to get to uptown and broadway. Would stay there again!

Excellently located hotel with all that you need for a stay in NYC. The hotel is out of the rat race of Time Square and surrounds, and close to excellent cafes, restaurants and bars.Rooms are large by NYC standards. The bathroom whilst renovated is a little 'old style' - basin and shower over bath.Check-in and out was efficient and friendly

This hotel is suited to people who enjoy going out on the town. The downstairs bar is nice and the hotel location is central to everything in Manhattan. If you want to grab food or water, there is a whole foods on the square, several drug stores, and many restaurants within walking distance.

Love the neighborhood, the hotel, the bar and the employees. We definitely will be back!We highly recommend. This is a great part of town and not touristy or crowded. Lots of great places to dine and shop.

What a fantastic hotel! Location is great, right on Union Square, the building is a beautiful old NYC style beauty which has been done up in a modern but, appropriate for the style, way. The room I had was about level 7 and had fantastic views of the square, was huge with double height ceilings and a comfortable bed, was clean and well appointed. Service was excellent and the bar and restaurant on the ground floor were a great place to hang out, meet friends, grab a bar meal and have a tap beer. Overall one of the best hotels I have stayed in and cant fault it in any way

Comfortable bed. Fantastic bathroom toiletries (bliss spa) which were refilled daily. The location was great. The hotel front desk was helpful. No complaints! Had a great stay! Bar in lobby was fun and open late. The living room area in the lobby was comfy and funky!

I love W Hotels and this is my favorite one I've been in so far. The decor of the old style building is lovely and I really enjoyed the common spaces and lobbies on each floor. The Wholefoods across the street is very convenient for food and items you may need. The staff was prompt and great. What I expect from W and Starwood.

We arrived at 7am on a Friday and where accommodated with an early check in which was great having just flown in to NYC overnight. The room was neat and compact with ensuite bathroom to match. Beds where large and comfortable. We where there for 3 nights over the weekend and unfortunately found the rest of the interaction with the front desk to be very inconsistent. There also seemed to be a complete disconnect with the restaurant / bar located on the ground floor off the lobby. It seemed that it was almost totally separated from the hotel. Value for money its a great option that delivers a perfect place to stay in the area. If you're looking for great room service and attentive staff then this is not the space for you.

My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend getaway. The staff was friendly, the accommodations were perfect with a view of the square. Subway station across the street gave us fast access to everywhere we wanted to be. Union Square area had plenty to offer too. We enjoyed it so much! Would definitely stay here again!

With the merger of Marriott and SPG, I was excited to have some more choices in NYC. The W Union Square did not disappoint! Rooms have very high ceilings that make them feel spacious and some of the larger bathrooms I have had in the city. I requested a coffee maker in the room, which they gladly accommodated. The location is ideal if you want to be in lower Manhattan ... quick walk to Herald Square and the Flat Iron district. Great restaurants in the area and doormen are happy to advise. Beds are very comfortable and my room on 16th floor was void of street noise. I will be back!

This was our 4th or 5th stay at this hotel. The main reason why we often end here is location. The hotel itself is OK. The is nothing really special about it. But it allows for a nice stay while visiting NYC. Overall I recommend it!

Is the W brand on the decline these days? Can I blame the Marriott merger? I'm just asking because I used to think W hotels were basically perfect, but I'm starting to rethink my loyalty after this somewhat underwhelming visit (I'd say 3.5 stars), which came on the heels of a just-ok stay in another city.This is a great building, and our room was spacious and beautiful. Obviously the location is a huge part of why anyone stays here. The bathroom door was weird and didn't fully close, but that wasn't the big problem. The bed was perfect, that is one thing that never lets me down at a W.The biggest problem was that our room wasn't cleaned properly, and we are far from neat freaks. A dirty glass was put back on the sink on our second day there (I could see some of my lip gloss on it from the day before). At least it was my lipstick, though: On the afternoon of our second day we noticed a hair clip on the floor next to one side of the bed. This was kind of icky because unless it came from the room attendants themselves, it had been there since before we checked in. Making us think that not only had the room barely been cleaned when we were there, the room had barely been cleaned before we got there. The artsy molding/header above the bed was also coated in dust, and our bed wasn't fully finished being made up, either.Sure, we could have called the front desk and demanded a second cleaning, or asked to move or something. But we were only there for 2 nights and only discovered all of this about 16 hours before we planned to check out anyway. And the bottom line is that we shouldn't have to deal with such basic issues at a hotel that costs this much.I planned to mention something to the concierge when we checked out, but you know what? Similar to the concierge who checked us in, he never asked how anything was! Oh, well.As I said, I've loved the W brand for years but I feel like the honeymoon is over...:(

The location for the hotel is great! Although we did pick this hotel because it fit our agenda. Close to everything you want to be near. The hotel itself is clean and and cool and neat. The staff was very friendly. The gentleman we had for our valet, dropping off and picking up, was fantastic!! I, unfortunately, can't remember his name but he was great!! The room was a great size and especially for NYC. We were very surprised when we walked in and saw the room size. The view, like most NYC hotel views m, as expected was the outside wall of the building next door. Definitely will stay here again and will recommend to anyone looking for a central NYC location.

This hotel has Nice rooms with nice amenities. Convenient Location to Union Square restaurants and the subway. The Irvington bar and lounge area are excellent but drinks are expensive even for New York City.

When I checked in the staff were very accommodating and let me check in early. I was put into a room where there was construction literally outside my window. The staff moved me to a different room, no problem. The room and bathroom were large compared to other NYC hotels. My only complaint was the carpet in room 1414 could use replacing. The location is awesome with tons around. We were here for a wedding so we didn't dine in the restaurant downstairs but it looked really nice. There's coffee in the morning downstairs. You also have to pay for internet. I would definitely stay here again if looking for a place around union square. Also a shout out to the door guys...super nice!

Whenever I ask a hotel to give me their quietest room via an Internet request, it's a crap shoot as to whether or not it happens but the W completely accommodated my request by putting my husband, daughter, and me up at the very top of the building--far enough away from the honking and the ambulances to be able to get a good night's rest. And the view? Spectacular. Breathtaking. And mesmerizing. The room was very large and fit 3 adults beautifully. Everyone at the hotel is very friendly and made sure our stay was absolutely perfect. One of the doormen went above and beyond to talk to us about a certain college, and although we didn't get his name, we enjoyed talking to him (I think it was a Saturday morning conversation). I never mention the soap or other supplies because they're usually all about the same, and I usually bring my own because hotel soaps and shampoos aren't very good, but at the W, I really liked their products. They smelled terrific and the shampoo worked very well on even on my color treated hair. I also never mention the shower but it was freaking amazing. As someone who has lived in a drought for many, many years, it was incredible to be blasted with water. I'm sure my shower was shorter because it didn't take forever to rinse the soap out!The location can't be beat. We were anywhere we wanted to be in a few minutes time via a Lyft. And there was cheap shopping nearby. My daughter, a California native, didn't think to bring a coat, so we walked to Burlington Coat Factory and purchased a couple for her comfort.What can I say? If my daughter attends school in NYC, the W is the only hotel we'll stay in.

And take a room here, it is alright. I forgot I about this unmemorable stay until this past week when I found unauthorized charges by the W San Francisco on my credit card. It was not related to this earlier NY stay, but it just reminded me I had encountered its mediocrity before. The South Beach one is alright, I suppose. The W is just across the board awful at this point. I have a feeling it will be taken out of its misery soon.
user_name:
Am212ny
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel itself and rooms were excellent. All the staff but one was fantastic, perhaps she was just having a bad day. Definitely no major complaints about this W. The hotel is close to the train stop as well which was convenient. There is also a CVS next door.

I spent 2 nights here as part of my honeymoon. As it was only for 2 nights, we chose the lead in room. It was a decent size and . The shower however, took ages to heat up. We were on a low floor and the noise was not too bad.The hotel sent a bottle of bubbles and some chocolate covered strawberries and a card. It was a very thoughtful gesture.Our room attendant left a thank you note for the tip we left. In five weeks of travelling the USA, it was the only note received. I was very impressed as was not expecting one.The Hotel is in a great location for the fresh food market and we visited the Christmas one as well. There are plenty of food places like Whole Foods close by and the subway is close.I would definitely stay again but pay for a better room. Mainly as I think the next category may have a walk in shower not over a bath.

We were flying in from Tokyo and had booked two rooms from the night before so they would be ready for our 8AM arrival. The rooms were ready, clean and quiet as requested. I received a strange upgrade to a suite of sorts with only one window and stone balustrade blocking part of it.....though they kindly included a step in my room so I could view the park if I so choose. It was a little like a dungeon however as it had only one window, it was nice and dark and great for sleeping.....so it was perfect for me. This hotel does have some quirky rooms. Bed was soft and great and all requests were handled easily. One negative is that the Restaurant is now run by an outside vendor so if you are platinum member your breakfast benefit is now only served in your room....which is not ideal for us. When you are at the W Times square you have breakfast at Blue Fin and that is a far nicer perk. This hotel is located smack on Union square and could not be located better for any sightseeing etc. There must be 100 restaurants walkable in a 5 block radius....Location is spot on. Enjoy!

The room I got at first had heater problems, a clogged shower drain, pathetically weak shower water pressure, and worst of all, loud drilling every morning around 9am. I was sick and had just come from the West Coast, so I was pretty miserable getting woken up by drilling at 6am Pacific among the other problems. So I got fed up and asked to switch rooms away from the drilling. The heater situation improved, but the next morning the drilling was STILL happening near my room somehow, at which point I called the Starwood Preferred Guest Platinum and asked if they could do anything. They put me in touch with Matthew Quinonez, Executive Assistant to the General Manager, who proceeded to actually solve the problem by finally moving me somewhere quiet. Both of my new rooms didn't improve in shower drainage or water pressure but I was glad to just sleep properly. The hotel overcharged me for laundry and delivered it late, so I called in to ask what happened. A representative named Keys graciously canceled the charge for the issues that I had experienced. (I left some beer with the front desk staff for you man, hope it got to you.)Overall, despite the problems I encountered, the folks at the W were quite accommodating, so I'll definitely be back next time I'm in NYC.
