I had a great experience at the W Union Square. Staff were welcoming and helpful. Check-in was quick. I had a great room that was quiet and had lots of light. There were plenty of food and transit options around the hotel (I chose to go out for meals).
user_name:
Michael W O
New York, NY, United States

review_body: Very nice rooms- modern décor. Windows are small which is too bad since there location is quite good. Rooms don't have a coffee machine. Location is fantastic---you can walk to times square in about 20-25 min. There is a 24 hr pharmacy (CVS) that also sells snacks, etc pretty much next door. Right next to the hotel is a fantastic 24 hour market "Fraiche Max". They have a HUGE selection of hot and cold breakfast, lunch dinner items. Sandwiches, salad bar, soups...everything you can think of. Alos very good coffee and tea 24hrs. Highly recommend!

The type of hotel that makes you grossed out about staying in hotels...rooms are not cleaned well. Shower had hair blocking the drain, hairs on bathroom floor, sheets had stains...disappointed in that regard. Views were nice and location is super convenient.

Before staying at this hotel, I spoke with the concierge service to help me plan my surprise wedding proposal to my girlfriend. I received great tips on things the hotel can provide such as flower petals on the bed and getting a large table reserved for a large party (no spending minimums) in the Irvington bar/restaurant. My file was noted ahead of time that I was planning to get engaged that weekend and upon check-in I was upgraded or at least moved to a really nice room with a corner view of the park to set my weekend off on a great note. My girlfriend was already super impressed. Later that evening we received a complimentary bottle of prosecco sent to the room which was a super nice gesture and touch by the hotel management. I stayed in the wonderful room and it was surprisingly spacious for a NYC hotel room. The room was very clean and the lobby and bar/restaurant were excellent. I stayed on the tenth floor and it was very quiet. The hotel is located in a very convenient location near most of the red and green subway lines to either the west or east side of manhattan. If you can afford it or are willing to splurge, this is a great hotel. As with most W hotels, the staff and concierge service are top notch and can be very accommodating. I highly recommend staying at this hotel.

I stayed here for 1 night for business and was impressed with the friendly check-in staff, the size of the rooms and the nice gym. Sometimes the ambiance of a W is not a good fit for business travel, but I thought the bright, open lobby, adjoining restaurant and attentive staff were a nice surprise. The rooms are definitely spacious by any standards, especially in New York, and the location means it's quieter than other options and is ideal with the park right there plus lots of shopping just a block away.

We have always enjoyed staying in this hotel.We find the location convenient. Walk to most restaurants. 20 mins to Soho.The staff offers friendly good service and the concierge is knowledgeable and helpfulThe bar is lively.

I relocated to the W Union Square after a terrible stay at Sheraton TriBeCa.First impressions: rooms large for NYC, bathroom huge and Bliss toiletries generous size. Super comfortable bed and room well laid out.The location is excellent, nice to be away from madness of midtown and so many fantastic restaurants in this neighbourhood.Love the keyless room access via SPG app.I'm SPG Platinum so would have given a 5 star rating if perks were better, didn't seem to offer much to Platinum members compared to other properties but I'll definitely be back as this hotel ticks the box on all of the fundamental things that make for a good stay

One day, I have not received amenities and therefore decide to ask at the Front Desk on my way back to the room. Having waited 5 minutes for the Front Desk staff (no name allowed) to wrap up his service with one guest and knowing that two other groups of guests in front of me were to check in, I excused myself to those guests and jumped to the front of the line. To my surprise, he pointed me towards the back of the queue and gave me a lesson. He eventually asked for my room number and he proudly said "I'll even give you [more]".Is this how he treats gold preferred members/former platinum members? More importantly, is that how ANY guest should be treated at a SPG category 6 hotel? What if I had an emergency and need to rush back to my room?I guess in this scenario, there are certain ways which he could have approached it. I'm sure you would agree that his was not an option. He may have very slightly redeemed himself by asking for my room number and wanting to give me more amenities, except they never came - which makes it even worse!Best is that your MoD doesn’t care. Gave him an opportunity to comment, but I don’t have a reply. As a Group that “takes great pride in taking care of its guests” you could improve, especially if you are a Category 6 hotel.I will now consider staying elsewhere with much better service and that cares about what it advertises.

one- of the best places for accommodation' s, wineing & dining, taking in the sights with friends and family.the location is best in city, close within walking distance to every place and easy train everywhere else.

The location directly at Union Square is perfect to explore Manhattan. Unfortunately, the rooms have the distinct "W chic" and haven't been properly upgraded in a while. The breakfast that SPG Platinum members get served was quite a joke...

The W New York - Union Square is a lovely property, located on the northeast corner of Union Square, at 17th and Park, an excellent home base for any trip to New York. The hotel has a great boutique feel to it, seeing that this property was formerly the Guaranty Life building, dating back to the early 20th century. Much of the beaux-arts architectural features are still evident throughout the property, including the adornments surrounding the elevators.   The rooms themselves are quite nice, feeling particularly spacious due to their very high ceilings, with a modern flair and comfortable bedding. The headboard in each room is a stylized map of the Union Square area (and I hate to admit that I didn’t realize that until my fourth stay). Rooms on the upper floors facing south (on the 17th Street side) have a great view of Union Square, downtown Manhattan, and One World Trade. The bathrooms are stocked with Bliss products, and who doesn’t like to start off the day with some Soapy Suds?  Right off the lobby, there’s a nice on-property bar/restaurant named Irvington. You should definitely stop in for a drink while you’re at the hotel - perfect for a pre-theatre cocktail or a post-dinner night-cap. Try their barrel-aged Manhattan - it’s tops.  What makes this place special is its top-notch staff. Unlike many Manhattan properties, the personal touch is more than evident here, with the staff going above and beyond to make sure everything is just right. Before I arrived for my most recent stay, I got in touch with Natacia, the lovely Welcome Desk Talent Coach who I had met on a previous stay, to let her know that we’d be celebrating a close friend’s 50th birthday. Not only did she arrange for rooms with a great view of Union Square, but I’ve also nicknamed her the ‘birthday elf’ for being so nice as to have a bottle of prosecco delivered to the birthday boy’s room, where we enjoyed a celebratory glass (or three) before heading out for dinner.   There’s many more people I can say great things about, like Stella, who helped me with my reservation over the phone, to Tiffany, who made sure everything was just right at check-in, to the ever-so-riendly housekeeper assigned to my room over the weekend, with everyone doing their part to make sure that this was a picture-perfect stay. It’s people like these who keep me coming back to the W New York - Union Square, people who make us feel like welcome guests in their home, something I particularly appreciate when my travels bring me back to my hometown. Huzzah!

We stayed at the W for 4 nights while we were in the city visiting family and friends. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are very nice.... (no lock on the bathroom door?) and the service is first rate - room service, room cleaning, the concierge's desk/front desk. Room service food was good with the usual limited menu, their restaurant is very good. They'll valet your car -- it's MUCH better to be in NYC without a car, but we had to drive all over the place so needed one. Opposite the hotel is Union Square with all kinds of activities e.g. Farmers Market on weekends. RIGHT NEXT DOOR is a very well-stocked deli if you're suffering from in-room-dining-prices sticker shock! For those people who haven't been in NYC for many years, you should know that 14th street is looking great these days!

Stayed here with my two sons in two double rooms. three nights over new year. Very friendly welcome by the staff at check in. Rooms on 6th & 7th Floor. Big shortage of clothing storage if you had clothes that dont need hanging up. Struggled to get shower very hot in my room. There was a nice bar and restaurant attached to the hotel. Conveniently located hotel. New York is not the place for a bargain trip and is very expensive. Unfortunately i did not get all the reception staff names after the original check in but some were not as friendly as i would have liked. Rooms nice and warm. plenty of towels and toiletries.

We visited New York as a family and stayed at this hotel. I can't thank the hotel enough as the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were big and very well maintained. We asked for interconnecting rooms and the hotel managed to do this for us. We will definitely be back the next time we visit New York. Thanks W New York!

Very nice hotel and convenient location. Rooms are well furnished, have decently modern bathrooms, and are spacious for NYC. Staff was friendly and helpful, overall we have no complaints about our stay.

My wife and I stay at the W Union Square at least once a year. This year we brought two other couples for our annual visit to NY in December. We love staying at the hotel itself, because of it's location, the building itself and the rooms - which are all excellent. It is the spectacular service that really sets it apart. It starts with our arrival when the doorman, Jose, greets us by name every year! He immediately introduced himself to our friends and remembered their names throughout the stay. Jose has a way of welcoming every guest like they have just returned home. That level of personal service continues throughout every stay from check in to check out. Yes, the beds are comfortable, the rooms are surprisingly quiet for the location and we love the bar. The service is what really sets the W Union Square apart and we will return as often as possible.

We stay here every year around Christmas time and it is always the best stay we have when in NYC. Front desk is courteous and check in is always smooth. We have stayed here 4 times now and we will stay again next year!

My husband and I stay at this hotel at least once a year. We love the location, the rooms are spacious, and the service is very good. It's not the most updated hotel but I don't care about that. The beds are very comfortable, it's pretty quiet for sleeping, and I love the Bliss toiletries. Will stay here again and again!

Stayed here for two nights during the holiday season. The hotel is convenient and the hotel bar and lounge are popular. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Will stay here again whenever in the area.

My wife and I stayed at the W Union Square for a brief trip to New York. Two things we really appreciated: (1) We'd upgraded to a Mega Room a few days before arriving, and when one of those rooms wasn't available at check-in, the hotel upgraded us to a Cool Corner Suite for no additional charge. This room was spacious for NYC and had three windows, making the place bright and cheerful. (2) We requested a coffee maker when we checked in, but one wasn't available, so the hotel sent a pot of coffee via room service to us when we requested it later that evening. The room and the hotel as a whole were clean and comfortable; the location is excellent both for walking around downtown and for catching the subway. The only unpleasant detail of our trip was that the building across 17th Street from the hotel is being renovated, and the crew started in with jackhammers at 7:00 on Monday morning. Obviously, the hotel can't do anything about that. It's just life in New York. We very much enjoyed our stay and would recommend the W Union Square highly.

Just a step away from Union Sq to explore the amazing farmer's market and the Christmas village during the holiday season. The hotel isn't quite as hip as other newer choices but it's clean and comfortable.

I chose the W Union Square quite a bit for my trips to NYC. These are amongst the bigger rooms available and generally speaking present a great value for the price. The bathrooms are well sized as well and I really like Bliss products. Staff is always cheerful.

Recently stayed at this property and was not disappointed. The area isbystling the rooms very nice and personnel were very nice....it was raining as we were leaving the hotel and the door man went out of his way to get us an umbrella...great customer service....this was not first time we have stayed in a W hotel and it will not be the last....

I stayed here the night before my wedding with four best friends. Best time ever. Staff was beyond helpful and friendly. Huge room. Extended checkout and complimentary champagne - top notch! Thank u!!
user_name:
Anaid38
New York City, New York

review_body: We love the location of the W Union Square and stay there at least once a month during the fall and winter months. I wanted to say that the best part of our stay is Stella at the front desk. She is so warm, friendly, and it is wonderful to be greeted by her when you walk in. She makes you feel so welcome. For that reason alone, I would highly recommend staying at the W Union Square.
user_name:
BethJS165
New York City, New York

review_body: Though a reasonably regular visitor to the W I really never have to request assistance. This visit I did and Stella, Natalie and Heidy stepped right in to help. This team's truly genuine desire to help and their unflagging moral support over 2 days (while I recreated a computer crash deletion of a month in the making project) kept me sane and thus able to set to task. Even housekeeping was attentive to not interrupting my work. Thoughtful consideration! A rare gem!! Kudos and thanks to this trio!!

Stayed here for a wedding and once I got over the sticker shock ( the special wedding price is twice what I usually pay for a hotel), I enjoyed this hotel a lot. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The room was very spacious with a huge bathroom and shower. The bed was extremely comfortable and there was room to move around. Considering how expensive NYC can be, the price is fair. Excellent location that was an easy walk from Grand central ( straight down Park Avenue). Across the street from Union Square that had a farmer's market with anything fresh you would want and the weekend we were there, an excellent holiday market. Also, Whole Foods is on the other side of Union Square and offers affordable healthy lunch, Good shopping there too. Easy access from subway as well ( Union Square stop on 4/5/6 line). In house fitness center also. Will hold bags for you for early check in or leaving after check out if you want to explore the area befor returning home

Stayed here on first weekend visit to NYC. Certainly a busy hotel, and a welcome lobby. Room left something to be desired being dated, but still included the same style and atmosphere one would associate in general with this chain. Not as great as I had previously assumed it would be from some minor research, especially with other W hotels in area. Only real problem was with late-checkout: I had scheduled a late check-out before I even arrived at the hotel, and a late-check out at the hotel. After a late night with my girlfriend, this is exactly what was needed. However, it was not to be. A hotel employee came up to check on me thinking I had overstayed my welcome. According to him, we did not have a late check-out for 3:00pm, but he did apologize for the mixup with their front desk. The damage was done though, and we went ahead and got up. Next time I’ll certainly be trying another W in the area, but can expect at least average results out of this hotel.

After reading some recent reviews on trip advisor, I was a little anxious about our stay here. The staff is been extraordinary. Very accommodating and the hotel is lovely. A special shout out to Sebastian for the free ginger rail! Wink wink

I usually stayed at hotel near Central Park. However, I decided to stay at this hotel. Cause I wanted to stay in another/New hotel. Once I arrived at W New York Union Square, I confirmed my decision was correct. Hotel staffs were very professional and didn't take much time to complete check in. Room was okay size and was able to relax.Overall, I could enjoy my New York trip with staying this hotel.I would love to stay at this hotel if I would be in New York next time.

My wife and I spent a Saturday night at the W to celebrate her birthday. As a lifelong New Yorker I can be pretty judgmental about hotels and restaurants since we frequent the city all the time. But the W Union Square didn't fall short on any level. Service was great, we got a room upgrade as a SPG Gold member and the room and facilities were excellent. We had drinks at the bar which was upbeat and fun and everyone was very friendly. I recommend the W.

When I go to NYC, I prefer to stay at the W in Union Square. The rooms there are bigger than a lo of the W's and the staff is terrific, always making suggestions and willing to help. I also love the location.

Met family from Colorado the w make our visit the most memorable one we were treated like royalty best weekend we didn't want to leave the hotel lobby is a great place to hang out with family food excellant

My husband and I arrived at the hotel around 8 a.m. after taking a red eye flight. Although our room wasn't ready at that early hour, the staff at the desk suggested returning around 11-12, and we were able to stow our luggage with them while we headed out to forage for brunch. Our room was ready at 11:30, the room was clean and comfortable. Unfortunately, there was some sort of construction going on what sounded like directly outside our window; at least the noise subsided by the time we were ready to turn in for the night. Great location a couple of blocks from Union Square, where there's a farmer's market on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays; also at this time of year there was a Christmas market that had quality goods.

I stayed in this hotel just once. It is an older property refurbished. Enjoyed the location and local ambience. Service was good, our room fine. If you like Union Square this is a good choice. I was upgraded at this hotel.

Called into this bar - the Irvington - in the lobby of this building. It was just for a pre dinner beer. Lovely atmosphere - very good beer. A dish of dried pretzles and mustard is provided as a bonus (if that is your thing) and you can pick up a reasonable wifi signal.Good for taking the weight off. Bar food looked nice - but I didn't eat here.If I had to meet someone at or near Union Square - I would go here - have a beer, pick emails and stay warm and comfortable.
user_name:
steven_wilkinson
Bury St. Edmunds, United Kingdom

review_body: This room was clean and cozy.we liked the fashionable room.We were comfortable with this time.David was a friendly man.He helped us to get more comfortable.If he will be there,we'd like to return the hotel again. It might be next spring.Thank you for a great time.We are looking forward to visiting NY again!!

I stay in this hotel almost every time I travel to New York. I love the location but what really sets it apart are the extremely friendly, helpful and efficient staff. Many of them have been at the hotel for the 12+ years I have been staying there and they always seem to remember my preferences. It can be a bit hectic particularly if you are checking in on a Friday evening but they move people through efficiently and are never too busy to answer questions or offer advice.

My girlfriend and I stayed in the W Hotel Union Square for two nights right over halloween and we had the most fantastic stay ever in the city. The staff was extremly friendly to make the stay to what it was. We asked for a quiet room on a higher floor and received a great one with the best view on Union Square and downtown.We felt like at home and this was especially due to the staffs friendliness, openess and willingness to help at all times.I can assure every reader that we will be back in the W on our next trips to NYC.

I have stayed at this property since 2006 when I started travelling to New York regularly for work. It is awesome. The staff remember me, look after me and the hotel is cool but not too in your face. The location is wonderful for a stroll around Union Square and a sense of space in a claustrophobic city! The food is excellent, the amenities great and you feel fab about

Great staff and perfect location. Would be lucky to stay there again. Concierge gave great tips and insights as to where to go. The room was great. Good view and centrally located in the city to walk to amazing places

Here for an evening cocktail/meeting event. We were in the 2nd floor meeting space, which is quite lovely. High ceilings, beautiful decor. There is a dramatic staircase leading from the lobby to the 2nd floor where all you will find is this meeting space and public restrooms. All very clean and nice.The service was great. Banquet bartender very nice. The food was Pre- served at each table which was more of finger foods, but well done so there would not be any disruption during the speakers. The group was a professional woman's organization and we marvelled at the hook on the back of the chairs for our handbags. What a nice touch.Overall here only a couple of hours but enjoyed the hotel, service and food. Great location. Will definitely be back to try the restaurant.

This hotel is perfectly located right across the street from Union Square Park. The room was a bit small but they all are in the city. The staff were very friendly especially the doormen who were always in a good mood. We came early and our room wasnt ready so we walked to Macys at Herald Square, stopped at the Ganzvoort Rooftop bar on the way home. The view from our room was specular. We stayed over on a Fri night and were able to watch all the vendors set up for Sat morning street fair.The Irvington Restaurant had a great bar. We met friends and the bar was big and festive. The short ribs and pasta bolognese were great and the burgers were okay although they did come out a bit rare and we sent them back. The bar was so alive and beautiful. We will definitely be back. Icing on the cake was seeing our son at NYU.

Currently staying at this property and am very disappointed in the full experience from check in until now. We check out in the morning. Lets start. 1) I emailed the concierge team twice (on 2 diff emails) that we were celebrating a special event, my emails are still unanswered. 2) On check in, I asked for any available upgrades & the person at check in did not even look it up and simply said no sorry. 3) On entering my room, I know this wasn't meant for an SPG Platinum guest. Any time I arrive to an SPG hotel (in any country - I travel a lot), even if an upgrade is not available, there is usually at least a few free bottles of water. Again, none of that. 4) The AC doesn't work right. Set to 65 & no luck. Very, very disappointed. What a waste of money - I only picked SPG because I'm platinum and appreciate the above & beyond service. There are much better hotels in NYC for a lower price.

I arrived at 7pm and my room still was not ready, I had to wait over an hour in the lobby, causing me to lose my dinner reservations. After filing a complaint, I received an e-mail from Tiffany Pera (Director of Welcome Office) offering to speak with me about what had happened. I tried both calling her and e-mailing, and received no response. While the room was in very good condition, the lack of customer service made for a horrible experience.

We've stayed at this W hotel before and it's one we like better than some others. My husband and I are probably a little outside the demographic of most W hotels. They usually have a very big bar scene - sometimes to the extent we have a hard time getting into the hotel at night and certainly if we want to partake of the bar ourselves, it's near impossible. That is not so at this particular W. it is a bit on the quieter side and we like it like that. We've had larger and smaller rooms. This visit we only asked for a standard room. The room (especially the bed) was very comfortable. Previously we had been able to open the windows at this location (which we enjoy) and when we went to open the window on this visit there was definitely something wrong with the window. We reported it to the front desk who explained that the windows should've been locked shut and a new safety precaution. Our room was handicap accessible so the bathroom was fairly large, but oddly enough when we went to hang up our clothes we only had a low hanging bar. We were in town for a black tie wedding so I had no where to hang my gown except on the automatic door closure behind the door. Sort of strange.There is a bar in the lobby as well as a restaurant in the hotel. Very nice that they offer free coffee in the morning in the lobby and gave us a glass of prosecco when we arrived!This is really a nice hotel. The staff is great. Friendly and accommodating. Excellent location. Would certainly stay there again.

We have tried many Manhattan hotels but always return to the W New York - Union Square because of its friendly and professional staff, appealing accommodations and wonderful location that allows walking to many of the City's attractions. It is also "subway convenient" for travel to other, more distant locations. This continues to be our favorite and we have never been disappointed.

I stay at this hotel at least once a month for work the last 12 months. It's kitty corner from Union Square and situated on the Park Ave S which is a beautiful boulevard with lots of restaurants and useful businesses like Chase, Bank of America, Starbucks, etc. It's also very close to some of the best restaurants I've eaten at, such as Gramercy Tavern. Craving some shopping at Nordstrom Rack, Best Buy, Whole Foods? No problem, just a 3-5 minute walk away.So you get the point, the fantastic is great. How about the hotel? Well, it's a W Hotel which is one of Starwood's hipper properties. The Living Room lounge downstairs is quite nice (but oddly arranged): they play music in the evenings and you can grab a cocktail from the bar (part of the Irvington Restaurant) and some small bites. The rooms are really big for New York, but you can tell they're a bit dated. Unfortunately, the bathrooms are really old - you sometimes see signs of mold on the caulking in the shower, or that the caulking is coming apart - but at least it's functional.The two best things about the hotel are the beds and the bathroom amenities. The beds are super comfortable and the quality of the bedding material (sheets, blankets, pillows) is also very high. The amenities are the famous Bliss line of products which are fantastic.The complimentary internet is so-so at best, especially when the majority of rooms are occupied. It's enough for sending emails and casual browsing on the web, but don't expect to stream a lot of HD movies. (Who doesn't offer free Wifi to their Elite members these days?)I mentioned average service in the title - and here's why: The front desk is manned by folks who seem to be quite apathetic. They're not interested in providing top notch service to you - they just want to get you in the door and out of their hair. They don't try to go above and beyond, which is what I expect if I'm a regular at the hotel AND an SPG Elite (not to mention nights at this hotel often cost over $500). There is one person who is relatively friendly, but I only run into them at check-out (due to the time of their shift). I shipped some stuff to the hotel recently and got charged a ridiculous package fee. At an average $500 a night, why do they need to charge me $8 for retrieving a box from Amazon?In summary, if you're looking for hotels with humane room size in the area, this is a great one. Just don't expect the service to be top notch.

What a great team running this hotel! From the curb to check-in to room service to restaurant --- Fast, friendly, service-oriented and fun! Great bed, quiet room, nice bathroom all in a great neighborhood! I will be back!!

Between the W Hotel at Time Square and the W on Lexington, the is the newest and freshest feeling W Hotel in mid-townish area. Really enjoy the lobby, restaurant and rooms. Will definitely look to come to this W Hotel in the future!

We had a very pleasant stay at the W Union Square. We celebrated our 10th anniversary here and were upgraded to a big and spacious unit. We are long standing SPG Members and love the service that the SPG hotels generally provide, and the W Union Square delivered! The location was EXCELLENT - it was super easy to get anywhere in NYC by subway. We loved the vibe of the area and would most definitely stay at this hotel again when we visit NYC next.

Will stay again because it is such a fantastic location but no improvement in the staff. Doorman are the worst in NYC never help with bags, don't hail cabs and don't open doors I have no idea what they do. Room serviced at 7pm after a complaint and then done very poorly no rubbish put away no amenities replaced. Check in is a mess and unhelpful did hand me an umbrella when I asked but it was broken when I got outside. No seats available in the lobby it doubles as a bar and is always fullRooms are good and large

Recently had this hotel recommended to me and wasn't disappointed would definitely stay again and recommend to others.Location is great and found staff really good some good resteraunts close by .....

The W Union square made me feel welcome from getting out of the cab. It continued on to wonderful front desk staff. It was a Saturday and I was able to walk about the open market at Union Square. The location - the service it top!This will be my Hotel in NYC from now on - EXCELLENT SERVICE!

Very convenient for when we moved our child into NYU. The hotel is very familiar with the needs of parents of new college students, even helped arrange a car to transport our kid's stuff. Rooms are small (as are most in NYC.) But hotel staff was great. Nice happy hour in the bar. Sure I will stay again!

I spent two nights on a business trip in this hotel. It is in a location that is easy to get to most mid-town addresses. The lobby is fun, cool and hip as are most W Hotels. Where this hotel excels in in the room size for Manhattan. Many hotels on the island have very small rooms but this hotel is large for Manhattan. My bathroom also had a window (glass blocks) that really helped to light up the bathroom during the day. Housekeeping was good. I requested a coffeemaker in my room and they accommodated that with no problems. There is coffee in the lobby in the mornings. I did have a beer in the attached bar/cafe and the service was ok. I will mention that the fitness center only has two elliptical trainers and the ceiling is so short that if you are above 6'3" tall you will hit the ceiling! Very good hotel.

Rooms are more spacious and brighter than most W's I have stayed. The fitness center is small but it does the trick. Hot Coffee in the Lobby in the morning is a great bonus. They are pet friendly and conveniently located right next to the Union Square dog park. Most importantly all the staff (especially David!) are extremely friendly and make you feel very comfortable each time you enter and exit the hotel.
user_name:
MLGS1_
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is very nice! Nice decor upgrades modern with old time feel in this historic building. Check in & out were smooth & quick! The restaurant had a very unique menu, I'm a simple guy but found things to meat. Great time and great room nice and big for an NYC room. I would absolutely stay here again!

My husband and I stayed in the W Union Square for a long weekend to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary. First of all, the location is spectacular. There are fantastic restaurants around Gramercy within very easy walking distance, and the subway station is within a block right off the lovely Gramercy Square park. The lobby is classy and modern, and the restaurant/bar area is upscale yet comfortable. Had drinks and dessert at the bar, which was a good experience. We had booked a wonderful room, but were upgraded to a slightly larger room with a partial park view. The room was fairly modern looking, clean, and a good size for NYC. Everything was as it should be. Hotel staff were all helpful, professional, and friendly. All in all, a lovely experience. Would definitely stay there again!

We have stayed on Union Square a few times, but never at the W. Our other hotel experiences were okay, but not a wow. The W is a WOW!!! We stayed in a corner room and had fabulous views. The other hotel chain we stayed at before had us looking a a dirty brick wall. The restaurant and bar on the first floor are great. One great security feature is that you cannot use the elevator unless you have a room key and from the first floor you can only access the floor where you are staying. The room service menu that you can order on a card that you hang on your door at night is the most extensive I've seen. They basically have the whole menu on the card. The W is a little more expensive per night that it's Union Square competitors, but it is worth every penny. We loved our stay and our trip to New York City. We will be back!!

What a beautiful hotel! We stayed for one night for a concert. Our room was fabulous, and everything was very classy. A great hotel, will definitely be staying again. The area was also very convenient

My husband and I chose to celebrate our anniversary in NYC and we were not disappointed. The W Union Square is a wonderful hotel. The location is perfect. There's the Union Square Greenmarket, which we enjoyed as well as the surrounding shops and restaurants. We had our anniversary dinner at Irvington, the restaurant at the W. The food, staff and experience, all wonderful. The rooms are comfortable and large for NYC. We received an upgrade to a corner suite after originally having a fabulous room. Loved the suite, but honestly the fabulous room was fine too. Again I have to mention that the entire staff was wonderful. They were friendly, helpful and always professional. We have stayed in NYC many times and I have to admit that this was my best stay. I have no doubt that we will come back to the W Union Square.
user_name:
Dreux D
Surf City, NJ, United States

review_body: Stayed here with my 18 year old daughter. The location was convenient to downtown and there were many great restaurants options nearby. The entrance is under construction and the lobby is quite small but our room was s comfortable size with a nice view of the east side.

After selling out apartment on 13th St. 2 years ago, even though i work on 52nd St., we enjoy staying in the neighborhood from time to time to see friends and to play around town. Union sq. is by far the best area to be in NYC. The W is fantastic ! we had the " Fabulous" room on the 20th floor, facing south, nice size room,appointed well, just needed some art on the blank walls. All of the staff are exceptionally awesome , As always for us, its bitter sweet as we had an awesome time and fantastic views of the best city in the world and was able to see the building of our former apartment which we miss a lot. how fitting that during our stay, the bomb on 23rd street went off Saturday night , so, as always, non stop action, just the way we love it-- we're always in town and we'll be back for sure !

I love this hotel - love the location, the public areas of the hotel and when you get a Mega, Fabulous or Cool Corner - there is just nothing better. The reason for my poor rating is the hotel's continuing record of not adequately recognizing Starwood's most frequent guests. I'm a lifetime platinum member with an ambassador - meaning over 100 nights per year. I'm treated just like anyone else and when I can see other rooms available on the app and the front desk staff will say 'we're fully booked'. It's my own fault for continuing to stay here. My mistake. The W in Los Angeles on the other hand is fantastic and ALWAYS recognizes their most valued SPG guests.

We have been staying at the W Union Square for over 10 years - we love the overall ambience, the location, and the huge rooms (by NYC standards!). This time we stayed 4 nights and overall were very happy with the W. The large bowl of fresh apples in reception is a nice touch, and I also like the approach of the staff - they don't insist on carrying my bags upstairs or showing me how to turn on the lights in my room - I can manage tasks like these for myself! But they are always there and very helpful when needed.Only 2 minor points I would highlight: the public areas are quite cold (to my taste) which did not encourage me to linger in the bar or the lounge. Also the quality control on the laundry could be improved, one of my items came back without a food stain being removed (one wash back home and it's gone) and some items felt like they had not been thoroughly washed. These are relatively small issues and I will certainly return next time I am in NY.

I always enjoy staying/visiting W New York-Union Square!Is my favourite W hotel in NYC.The location is perfect in lower Manhattan!The very elegant 1911 Beaux-Art building overlooking Union Square Park surrounded by very good restaurants and bars.My favourite is Pete's Tavern, (oldest in NYC) Republic (tasty,yummy Asian fare) and Coffee Shop for breakfast and late night fare.I have not had the pleasure of dining in the hotel restaurant, but walking by it, looks very attractive and inviting.The rooms offers high ceilings, beautiful big windows of the equally beautiful view of Lower Manhattan and Freedom Tower at WTC.The hotel managers from Peter Yeung, their Director of Operations, Gradford 'G' Jean Louis, evening/overnight manager and rest of the staff are very efficient and always provide excellent service.

I've stayed in this property 3 times and I am always impressed with the size of the rooms especially for NYC. This last time we went with our baby and even with the crib in the room, there was plenty of space. The room is very clean, the bed is so comfortable and shower is pleasant. The only thing I wish they had was more soundproofing as you can hear neighbors at times. The staff is helpful and I love the complimentary morning coffee and afternoon cider or fruit water.

W hotel at union square New York USA Is the best hotel in regards to hospitality and location wise . Staffs are very cooperative and understands their duty well . During my 15 days trip to USA & all in 4.5 to 5 star properties I stayed in .. I liked the most & would say only W hotel union square New York

Very cool place, right across the street from Union Square and everything that happens there. There's a great bar scene in the lobby bar and the fruit-infused ice water at the reception desk is the best I've ever had (there was almost an entire fruit salad in the container - yum!). There was no coffee maker in my room, necessitating a morning run to Dunkin Donuts (luckily only 40 yards from the hotel's entrance), but the usual assortment of $9 bottles of water and $8 candy bars. For such a central location, I was surprised how quiet the room was at night - good night's sleep will be no problem.

We have stayed here a few times and have come to realize it is perfect for us and will be our go to W in NYC from now on. When we arrived the doorman met us immediately at the curb, took our bags and got the car to the valet within 2 minutes! We were met by Tiffany in the lobby who offered champagne before we even checked in. The person at the desk welcomed us with a friendly smile, immediately upgraded our room, offered us our SPG gifts and sent us on our way. The room was great! Clean, big, well appointed and the bathroom was spacious and very clean. We went to the bar where we were met with a big "hello", perfect way to start the weekend. If you need assistance with things to do in the city find Tanya (the W Insider) she is beautiful, friendly and seems to know all the cool places. Had a great time in the city, slept well and then went to breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Great service, great coffee and the food was delicious. On the way back to our room to get our bags we stopped and asked the bellman to retrieve our car and by the time we came back down it was waiting for us (couldn't have been 10 minutes). We will stay here from now on! Love this hotel!

We booked this hotel because of the "W" brand and it's location to Union Square. Although the hotel is just fine it did not meet our expectation. We were to receive some freebies included in our rate and had to asked for them after checking in. The service was also ok but the front desk staff and doormen looked uninterested in helping. (Kudos to the gentleman who retrieved our car at checkout as he was the exception providing excellent service loading the car and getting us in our way.) We had stowed luggage prior to the room being ready and when we returned we had to find the bell hop on our own. The room was clean and had nice large windows but nothing special overall. On a positive note, the restaurant is very good and we enjoyed a great lunch there and a drink at the bar the evening. The food and service was quite good in the restaurant.

I've stayed at W's before and was never thrilled with the hospitality or room. I go to NYC often and decided to take a chance on a new location and the W based on the trip advisor reviews and was glad I did.The location is fantastic to explore Chelsea, Greenwich Village and Soho. Union Square was bustling with activity during the day but was very quiet at night. The staff at the W were very professional, helpful and nice. The room itself was smaller than I expected based on the reviews but the beds were so comfortable and the room clean. We didn't try the bar or lounge but wanted to. The lounge was very inviting with very comfy looking sofas. Overall the stay was very nice and I'd stay there again.

We just eloped to NYC! Best decision ever! As this was going to be a "big day" for the two of us, we have decided to stay somewhere close to the City Clerk's office. Union Square it was. W New York Union Square was the perfect location! It is a 1 minute walk from a major Subway station; it is 3 to 6 min walk to shops, restaurants (Eataly, Gramercy Tavern, Eleven Madison Park, etc.), etc! Location can't be beat!Althought the location is busy, there were no noise issue at all. We slept very well!! We were fortunate as we were able to be granted an upgrade; our room was fantastic! The biggest room I have ever lived in NYC (approx. 400sq\f). Nicely decorated, extremely clean, tempature was perfect - overall the room was extremely comfortable! The toileteries are all Bliss products - absolutely fantastic!The service was great!! Receptionnist (Thank you Eddie!!), the Doormen, the Concierge, the Cleaning lady - every one was so nice!! We also got a nice suprise for our wedding day; we came back to our room to a bottle of Prosecco! Yummy bubble to celebrate our day! Thank you W!!We had a drink at the Irvington downstairs; the ambiance was so cool! We are looking forward to our next visit as we would love to dine at that restaurant. Merci beaucoup W New York Union Square!! Nous avons déjà hâte à notre prochaine visite!!!

The W is in a great location, close to restaurants, coffee chops and shopping. Great bar and restaurant!Great hotel service. We had a room with a view of Union Square park. At night we sat on the window ledge and watch the city lights. Definitely will stay their again!

Tiffany Pera and the entire front desk staff were extraordinary in the care the extended to my granddaughter and I. Their kindness and attention to making our trip wonderful was remarkable! I will definitely return when in NYC again.

This is a lovely hotel that I wished I had more time to enjoy. We were in and out for a one day meeting. The staff was great, and the rooms were very nice. Very comfortable bed and the linens were fresh and crisp and smelled nice. Cute decor. I would definately return again and recommend to others.(sorry for the late review!)

We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights while we were dropping off our daughter at college. The service was great - front desk, maid service, the living room, and the restaurant. We were upgraded to a nicer room when we checked in a few minutes early, and they accommodated everything we needed. Will definitely stay there again.
user_name:
kim r
Austin, Texas, United States

review_body: We come here on business every fall with our dogs. They are super great with animals. Its an awesome hotel is a great location. Compared to other hotel rooms in Manhattan these are huge. The neighborhood is just fabulous. I wish the rooms were a bit more sound proof. We could hear everything other guests in our hallway were up to and it drove our dogs nuts.

The W in Union Square is a perfect location...and the welcome we received was so accommodating. We were upgraded to a nicer room and had a beautiful view of Union square. Complementary fruit infused water and morning coffee topped off a great experience.

The hotel is fine. It's what you would expect from any W. In fact the rooms are large for an NYC hotel. My issue is the noise, the walls are thin and the doors are cheap so anything in the hallway sounds like its happening IN your room. All night and morning there are doors slamming, maids cleaning and talking, people yelling and all of it is clear as day in your room. I was in town to do some work that went late so I had to try and sleep during the day. It was nearly impossible with light streaming in around the curtains and constant noise. Now I have stayed at different hotel types all over the world and I think I have a fairly good understanding of what to expect. The outside noise is not something a hotel can control and a few sirens are to be expected in a big city but this hotel is just poorly planned. Currently listening to someone blow dry their hair in the next room over.

We were on a long weekend trip to just visit some of what NYC has to offer. This place has a GREAT location, walkable to the Highline, Times Square, Soho, Little Italy, Chinatown and so much more. Union Square seemed like it had constant activity between the farmer's market, street vendors and entertainers. So much fun. Plus there was a nice workout room, an excellent market right next door where we grabbed breakfast to eat in the park, a giant screen to enjoy the Olympics, and a nice view.

Everything about our stay at this W Hotel was great. If you are looking for the perfect location, this is the place. Easy access to the subway, and enough dining choices to fill any appetite, and the farmers market across the street was the best. From the greeters at the front door to the staff at the front desk, these associates truly made you feel good about your choice of this property.

When I go to NYC, my favorite place to stay is the W Union Square. I love the location and the service is the best. The bar action is pretty good too. From the check in desk to getting help from the concierge, they are always stepping up to the plate. And they serve free coffee in the morning!

My wife and I stayed here for the first time and thought it a very nice hotel in a fun area. It's easy to go both up and downtown from this location by foot or subway. The place is clean, well appointed, quiet, and friendly. They valet your car if you want but there is a garage 1 block away. Check out the farmers market in Union Square if you are there on a Saturday. Our favorite Restaraunt at ABC Kitchen is one block away.

We did a quick getaway overnight on a deal offered for Sunday night stays. It was great! The room savings and perks (2 free cocktails, free in room movie, free internet) really made this a good value. The hotel lobby is attractive, good spot for meeting up with friends. There's an on site restaurant and the rooms are large and nicely appointed. Great location for exploring NYC, There's unique shopping and restaurants within easy walking distance as well as tourist destinations. Staff were friendly and professional. Only minor complaint...no fridge in the room (only a cooler for the minibar) and some minor maintenance issues (tub stop was detached, drapes and some bathroom tile needed minor repair) Overall a lovely stay!

I really enjoyed this W hotel. I've been searching for a while a hotel in NYC that has large rooms a great location and price. This W is the one. From my experience for two days it has quiet rooms with plenty of space on the wonderful king room. Service was great. The location is perfect. You are surrounded by so many restaurants and main shops and short taxi rides to main attractions. I recommend it.

Great location for romantic or business trip. Everything was five star accommodations, staffs response for different pillows to borrowing an umbrella. Fresh coffee in lobby with wifi. Very secure, had someone try to go up in elevator but without ur key he left. Quiet rooms, even after I noticed leaving one day, that next room were family with small children( never heard them).

The staff here went out of their way to help us with a last minute date change When they were at almost full capacity. The room was great and worthy of the "W" title. The location of this W is close to a lot of awesome restaurants and bars.

Our "awesome" room was indeed awesome. Large by NYC standards. Staff very accomodating as we required a slight room change. Nice view and loved this location. Sat AM farmers market in Union Square was fabulous.

A hotel is so much more than bricks and mortar and a great location (which this place has). The folks that staff the W Union Square (WUS) are among the most professional in the industry. Yes, it's their job to provide service and hospitality though they are so excellent at it and do it with all their heart. Front desk staff (Sebastian, Eddie, Nelson, Stella, Natalie, Pricilla, and the girl from Lima), Whatever /Whenever (Vincent, etc.), Welcome Ambassadors (Frankie, Charles, and Robert), Room Stylists, managers and the staff at Irvington (hotel restaurant) are all superb!!! BTW the rooms are in great condition, many with outstanding views. Amenities are very nice. You use Bliss bath products, which are very invigorating and get to wear a really nice robe. This place is reasonably priced for what you get and you can often take advantage of their specials, including AAA rates. In conclusion, the WUS, as a place and as a collection of individuals, just makes you feel good.

I love staying at the W Union Square. Great lounge/bar area, delicious breakfast, great service. Close to metro, citibike stations, great farmers market, shops, restaurants, all within walking distance.

The entire staff at the hotel really stretches to make me feel welcome and treat their guests like rock stars. In particular, I'd like to give a shout out to Nelson at the Front Desk who is so sweet and accommodating...always. Great Hotel in a Great location!

I have stayed here just for a quick staycation and wished I could've stayed longer. Nelson checked us in and he was very warm and welcoming, he gave us a great room upgrade too. The hotel is right in Union Square and you can do alot of things around the area. I really commend the staff for taking good care of us.
user_name:
hotelierinnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed in this hotel during a business trip. The rooms are very comfortable, AC works well and the bathroom is appropriate. The whole hotel is very clean and the staff is friendly. Some shops, good restaurants and even tourist attractions are in walking distance.

The hotel is in a convenient location. The beds are comfy and the room is spacious by NYC standards. We stayed there two nights and enjoyed our stay. The staff was very helpful - in particular David - he helped us with an out of the ordinary request. Its may sound odd, but we needed some rope or wire to bundle up some large items that we needed to move to another location. Since it was a holiday weekend the stores were either closed or opening late. When David heard our plight, he went to work brainstorming on how to help. He found something that worked out perfect. It was such a blessing and we are very appreciative of his kindness.

I live in downtown NYC, but needed a hotel room for one night due to apartment move timing. The location is unbeatable - right at the corner of Union Square and across the street from a giant Sephora flagship store (huge plus for me) and all of the restaurants in the area, including fine dining like Union Square Cafe and Gramercy Tavern. The service was fantastic here - we had our small dog with us, and they delivered a giant plush doggie bed, bowls, and they had an evening treat delivery! That won me over. I've been coming to the bars downstairs for years too. Probably more touristy now, but still a good place to grab a cocktail. I'm definitely biased to this neighborhood, but the guys at the door are always friendly too. I love the modern look.
user_name:
serenade828
New York City, New York

review_body: The W Hotel on Union Square is one of those good properties that becomes excellent based on the quality of the staff. This is a team that has a strong focus on customer service, work hard to anticipate guest needs and go out of their way to be helpful. There may be properties that are a little more flashy, but in terms of the total experience as a guests, the W Hotel on Union Square is at the top of the list!

The W Union Square is easily my favorite Starwood property (Sheraton, Westin, W, etc.) in NYC. The location puts the Flatiron, Village, and LES at your fingertips, and the Financial District and Midtown are also both within easy reach. Rooms are spacious, service is attentive, and crowds are small and manageable (unlike most midtown hotels).

NYC is not as crowded on July 4th weekend so it is a good time to visit the City. The W at Union Square is very nice and convenient to lots of good restaurants, the Subway, and, of course, the activities in Union Square such as the farmer's market. We also ran to and from the Brooklyn Bridge early a couple of mornings which is always a special treat (about 6 miles round trip). The W was great hotel pick for us.
user_name:
Mark C
Nashville, Tennessee, United States

review_body: My time at the W union sq was very pleasant. The hotel is well designed, and the rooms are very large for NYC. The views on higher floors are excellent, and the staff was particularly kind in their welcome and service. This is my go to NYC hotel, and for good reason. The area is great, the hotel is great, but what really makes it is the kind staff.

2nd stay this year & I really think this is the most ideal family location for a trip to NYC. Great walkable area, good restaurants very close by (try ABC Cocina!) and Union Sq Park is a great green space to spend time outside. Free coffee in the lobby in the mornings is the bomb! Come down & sit in "living room" and people watch out the window.Room service menu could use a little more variety.Bliss bath products are so yummy.I'll definitely be back.

I booked on shorter notice than usual and the NYC room prices were a little higher than usual, but everything was great. When there was some early morning noise from work on the adjacent building, they moved and upgraded my room which was appreciated. I plan to return!

I've stayed at W Union Square about 6 times in the last 3 years because it is close to everything in Greenwich Village and easy to walk to the other fun areas in NY. Room is a decent size, Union Square has a great Farmer's Market, subway is a block away.

I have always stayed on the Upper East Side when I have traveled to NY but this time I was traveling with my daughter, her friend and mom, we decided to stay at the W Union Square. What a great decision. From the moment we arrived in the late afternoon of July 4 to the day we left on July 9 I couldn't have been happier with the hotel or staff. Sebastian Arbelaez greeted us when came into the hotel, he was so warm and helpful. Sebastian made sure we were comfortable with our room, had a refrigerator sent up and provided lots of options for restaurants in walking distance. Everyday he went out of his way to say hello when he saw us. The doorman, Jose Rodriguez, was friendly and always helped us to get into or out of the hotel. Really nice guy.Overall, the hotel is great. Rooms are really comfortable, bathrooms are large and the gym is great. One thing I liked a lot is that you need to swipe your room key to access a floor. That made me feel secure at night when we would get back late.I highly recommend this hotel and Union Square area.

If you want to visit Manhattan make sure you book a room at the W Union Square. Very comfy beds, good sized rooms, and a fantastic, responsive staff. Also a great view of lower Manhattan from the higher floors. We always stay here when visiting my daughter at NYU. Highly recommended.

My 15 year old daughter and I stayed at the W for five days 7/4 to 7/9. We arrived at the hotel late, tired from traveling all day, delayed flights and so on. Upon check-in we were greeted by a friendly, helpful young man by the name Sebastian Arbelaez. He was so welcoming and resourceful. He gave us tips on how to explored NYC and all the nice restaurants around the hotel. He made our stay much more comfortable by sending us a fridge and coffee maker alone with coffee. I must add that whenever he saw us he greeted us by our names. I found this very comforting as you must know the W is a quite big hotel but he went out of his way to make sure we were well taken care off. The hotel is centrally located. There are several restaurants, retail stores, banks and starbucks within walking distance. The rooms are very clean and large.The bellman/front door guys were awesome. Jose Rodriguez was always happy to open the door for us. My daughter is an animal lover and her heart melted when she saw Jose run to give one of his regular friends a treat. He was a tree legged dog and knew what to expect from Jose.I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We had an amazing experience.

The W Union Square delivers a Top of the Line Experience with Excellent Service to a Very Clean Room. Great Location, you can walk Everywhere in NYC. Farmers Market across the Street. The Lobbey area is perfect to relax an people watch.

Stayed overnight at the W for a birthday celebration with my sister, and we couldn't have picked a better hotel or location! The hotel looks like it has been recently renovated inside, and with good success. The staff were very pleasant, professional, and helpful throughout our stay. Special thanks to the front desk staff, including Stella and Eddie; and to Natacia for making my sister's birthday memorable for all the best reasons! We stayed in a Mega Doible room on a higher floor with great views of the Freedom Tower and partial views of Union Square Park. The room was spacious by NYV standards, with huge windows and comfy beds! I was worried about the room being right by the elevators, but we were never disturbed by noise - might have been a quiet evening, so I would ask about any big parties or events during your stay if near the elevators. We will definitely stay here again, and look forward to returning soon!

This was one of the best hotel experiences I've had in NYC. The location is superb. You can walk to many fabulous neighborhoods but are also a quick subway ride to Brooklyn and elsewhere. The staff were amazing. I was traveling with my daughter and had booked a king room on hotels.com. Upon check-in I asked if we could get 2 beds and were upgraded to a suite with a king bed and very comfy day bed on a high floor. I couldn't have asked for a better room. Housekeeping came promptly every day and we were immediately ordered a cab whenever we needed one. The lobby is comfortable. We had a late flight out and were able to relax in the lobby prior to going to the airport. Restaurant had a nice menu with reasonable (by NYC standards) prices. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Travelled from la Guardia, I was only here for a night but the surrounding area was busy and shops and a outdoor market just across the road. The bars and Restaurants were only short walk away. Rooms were nice and clean and the rooms were big for NYC standards.

Great location for exploring NYC if you are here to visit - definitely better than staying in crowded, corporate mid-town. Some of the rooms on higher floors have great views. The lobby itself is nothing special, but the lounge/restaurant area is pretty nice and has pretty good food and cocktails.
user_name:
X375IEelizabethg
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel has its stuff together. I was coming in on a late flight and received an email directly from a hotel employee asking me if everythIgs was ok; if I needed anything upon arrival, if I wanted to upgrade my room etc. I replied that I was about to land from China and received a note thanking me and informing me that they updated my reservation record with that detail. Upon arrival I was treated by the front desk nicely, upgraded (I have status with SPG) and up to my room for a well-deserved sleep within 3 minutes.

My wife and I LOVE the W New York - Union Square for its great service, wonderful staff, amazing rooms and the VERY BEST location in all of NYC. In fact, there's only one hotel we ever stay in when we come to New York and that is the W Union Square.

Fabulous Hotel in great part of Manhattan, adjacent to Union SquareGreat staff, who went out of their way to make us feel at home. Local area has manygreat restaurants, and shops. easy access to Midtown Theatre district as well as Financial District.

This hotel is located in a great neighborhood! It is right next to Union Square, shopping and public transportation. The neighborhood is busy without the crowds of the Times Square area. While we stayed there, Union Square featured a farmer's market in the afternoon/early evening. The hotel is in walking distance to pretty much everything (just depends on how far you want to walk). You can walk to Chelsea and the Meat Packing district fairly quick. We walked from the hotel to Washington Square Park, Meat Packing, Times Square, and Central Park with ease (it's great exercise). The room faced the interior of the hotel, so our view was into someone else's room/a brick wall. The decor in the room was lacking for a W hotel and the bathroom could have used an update, but it was clean and provided enough room for two people. The hotel bar fills up at night and is a nice place to grab a drink before heading to the room for the night. We ordered room service one night and it was delivered really quick (the chocolate cake is delicious). All of the staff we interacted with were friendly. Overall, the location is its best feature.

Great trip to the city with my 4 year old daughter. Comfortable room with all the necessary amenities. A lovely stay in a great location. Restaurant in the hotel was perfect and had a wide variety to accommodate a range of tastes.

In true W fashion this hotel delivers. We had a great room on the 14th floor overlooking the park. This is my first time staying in this neighborhood and I will be back. The neighborhood is vibrant but not crazy busy or full of tourist. There are a lot of great restaurants and pubs near the hotel and the park is beautiful. There are a lot of shops to buy things if you are a shopper also. The hotel lounge and bar is very nice. They treat you well and welcome you in. It was a pleasure staying here. The rooms are large and clean. It was quite and peaceful to stay here. We will be back here again!

The staff at the WHotel Union Square in nyc have the best customer service! They go above and beyond to accommodate you. Very refreshing when most hotels don't have good customer service. We would go back again!

Upon arrival there seemed to be some confusion with our reservations due to booking at SPG central. The hotel was full & the MOD, Olivia, was very professional in doing her best to clear up the confusion & accommodate our situation. She made an excellent offer to us if we would settle for what she had available for that night & could be moved the next day to the upgrade suite my husband had earned as platinum member. Luis was the bellman on duty that night. His kindness & very friendly yet professional personality made for a soft landing on an otherwise bumpy start. Thanks to both of them for helping to make our week of graduation festivities & home away from home very nice. The suite was fabulous overlooking Union Square. Loved all the windows even if it did make for noisy nights of sleeping but that is NY & the trade off was worth it to me! Still need to clear up some BIG overcharges on the bill at checkout but overall, we were treated very well, & all staff members were polite & friendly. We enjoyed all the accommodations & services provided by all. Thanks! P.S. Loved the full gym! One of the best I've been to in a hotel in a long time!

Stayed at the W Union Square while attending a 2 days meeting on their property. The rooms are larger than most NY hotel rooms, they're clean and modern. Great area to walk--lots of restaurant and bar options. Staff was excellent.

Terrific property. I was here for a meeting and really enjoyed the lobby bar. The location was a few blocks from where i normally stay in the city but I loved the proximity to the park. I'll return whenever I am in the city and meetings are close.

best location, biggest rooms, coolest location, great staff...great bar, great bathrooms, and bathroom products...the welcome staff and everyone were great, treated me as platinum member well...got a great upgrade

Great location and staff, very friendly and welcoming. Especially appreciated the help of the doormen getting in and out with our car. Rooms are chic and comfortable. Great bar in the lobby. Can't say enough about how much we enjoyed our stay. Thanks.

I have stayed at this W, and have also visited just to eat lunch or grab a late night cocktail...either way, it's a great spot in a great location. The restaurant uses fresh products from local growers, which is a definite plus. The bar has a lounging area which is nice for just hanging out and having good conversation with friends or business associates. If you stay at the hotel, ask for a room with a view of Union Square. If you don't care about the view, then ask for a quiet more interior room...but you will be looking directly into the next building. It's a personal preference but could make or break your stay depending on what you "thought" you would get. Btw, they were terrific about my late check out request. I was able to stay in my room until 4:00PM! That's really unheard of anywhere these days.

This was the fifth time I have stayed at this hotel and by far the best experience I have had there. The service at the front desk was excellent - and I loved arriving on a Friday afternoon to a glass of bubbly!!

The staff really makes all the difference in this hotel. Jose at curb side is the friendliest guy who always make you feel welcome back. He is personable, professional and great at what he does - He greets yo when you arrive and says until next time when you leave. He represents the positive personality of the hotel. Rooms are in general clean, well appointed and decent size for NY. The lobby is small, with a blend of art deco and contemporary style. Bar off the lobby is packed from 5:00 - 12:00.

The W at Union square is the ideal spot for seeing the city. It's just a short cab or subway ride to the major attractions the city offers. Plus you're surrounded by great restaurants such as ABC kitchen or ABC cucina, Craft , Hearth, Momofuko, Little Beet Table and many more...

My wife and I went east for our anniversary and booked a night at the W. The staff was wonderful, they took a pre-order for treats that were waiting for us in our room when we arrived. At check in and throughout our stay the front desk was helpful and friendly. The room was clean, and had a nice view as well.

The room was nice, with all the comfort, quiet, with Good areas, specially bathroom. the best Is the location, negar Union Square where there Is almost every day street market and from there go to downtown or uptown!

Enjoyed our stay here...3rd time. Close to everything except the noise in Times Square.Friendly staff and nice clean rooms.Building itself is heritage but we'll maintained and beautiful to see.Many great restaurants in this area of town and lots to see within walking distance.No problem grabbing a cab and going uptown if you needed.

We were visiting for one night in tr city. An absolutely perfect location with easy access to both midtown area and lower Manhattan. Service was top notch. We were upgraded with my Starwood Rewards Gold Card to a Fabulous Room that was huge for Manhattan. Great Bliss products in the bathroom. Our new go to place in the city.

Ariel with The W Union Square ROCKS! She went out of her way to make my stay super special and was very attentive during my stay! Will be coming back again to this amazing location! Highly recommend!!

We stayed in a corner suite room. Everything was just terrific about this hotel! The room was spacious! A large flat screen tv in siting area as well as a large flat screen in the bedroom as well. The bathroom was large and the shower was amazing! Awesome water pressure. The staff could not have been more friendly and accommodating! The location is great since it is close to many restaurants, shopping and the subway stop! We will definitely be staying here again!

This is a fantastic hotel in probably the best location in all of NYC (for either work or pleasure). You have every subway line at your doorstep, a party in the lobby at all hours, and just a fantastic staff.Like any New York hotel the rooms are small and not lot's of natural light. But they provide a desk (I was there for work) and it's all very functional. Much much better experience than the one I had at the The W in San Francisco.In all - if you can sport the money to stay here...do it.

The hotel is well located in New York. The rooms are large and well equiped. It was quiet up in the rooms but the lobby bar does have a lot of loud music and noise coming out at all hours but that could not be heard at all in the room. Room service was prompt and lots of options. Would recommend staying there and will stay again.
user_name:
m5carter
New York City, New York

review_body: I've stayed at several W hotels, and like the concept. The one at union sq is no exeption, even if it has been around for quite some years ( Maybe time for a slight touch up ??)Service was friendly, room big and nice for NYC, and generally value for money.

Tiffany is a wonderful hostess and made my birthday very special .Frankie was a great doorman and everyone else was also lovely!Everything was a phone call away and very prompt.Thank you for a lovely weekend,Ilona Ontell

My husband stayed here often for work and I had the pleasure of joining him a couple of times. The service was excellent, from the front desk to the bartenders. The rooms are very clean and modern. I love Bliss products at W hotels. The W is located on the corner of Union Square near everything. For the ladies, it is across the street from Sephora and Red Door Spa. I was able to walk into Red Door more than once and say, what do you have available? There is a farmers market in Union Square and Holiday Market in the Winter. Whole Foods is at the far end of the park if you need anything during your stay. Easy subway access and a great playground if you are traveling with kids. Overall, I was very impressed with this Hotel and would stay again if we didn't live here now!

The W Hotel in Union Square is a great spot. The very comfortably sized rooms, cleanliness, and services are not to be beat in Union Square. The sheets and beds are fantastic....as are the amenities. Better than all of that is the wonderful staff! Everyone from the Doormen to the Front Desk team , the Housekeeping staff and the Managers are second to none. I have been traveling there every week for 4 months and am never disappointed!

The place is just outstanding always. Everyone takes great care of you, from the front desk, to the Whatever/Whenever staff (i.e.:room service), to the room stylists, to the door people. Unbelievable location. Convenient to everything. Some great views of the city, to be had. Restaurant is decent, with a great bar. Rooms are extremely comfortable. Wonderful amenities including nice robes and bath products. Hard not to love this place.

My wife and I were on the City to visit friends and family for a few days and wanted to stay in the Union Square area. We were very happy with our decision to stay at the W Union Square. The location is great. Many things to see and do within walking distance and there is a major subway station a block away. The hotel itself is fun. The staff is nice the bar/restaurant has a good vibe and the room was generously sized for NYC. We will be staying there again soon.

If you're visiting from out of town and want a true New York experience, stay here. The location is in the heart of New York and getting around anywhere is easy.I also highly suggest the Cool Corner Suite. It's like living in a luxurious New York apartment. It's very spacious! The room was clean and neat. I felt so comfortable. We stayed on the 8th floor and the views were breathtaking.W hotels always have outstanding service but the W Union Square by far the most outstanding. The staff here are genuinely kind and very attentive.I am a room service junkie! They do offer a nice selection of food although I feel like they should offer some more different options. I will be staying here again soon!

We stayed in this some time ago and and liked it a lot.So, when W Union square had some "spring special", we did jump over.Everything was to our liking with the corner king size bed suite we booked: layout, size and decor of the room and the bathroom. Clean, bright, airy.It was a good stay with the special rate.

I usually stay in Times Square but my neice recommended that I give Union Square a try. It far exceeded my expectations. Kind, warm, helpful and friendly staff. My next trip to NY, I will be staying here at the W.

It was a perfect weekend. Everything was amazing from start to finish. This was a weekend to celebrate a friend's birthday and everyone at the hotel made it an amazing birthday weekend. I'd like to especially thank the Concierge Team of Robert, Bernardo, George and the others for organizing a wonderful birthday weekend. They went above and beyond to make sure we had a fabulous time. We could not have done it without them. AMAZING!

We checked into the W Hotel for three nights this past week. We chose to stay at this hotel over others because of the excellent service we receive each and every time we have stayed in the past. We always recommend this hotel when friends ask where to stay. The location is perfect: great shopping and restaurants in SOHO and Chelsea.The staff at this hotel is truly exceptional. The doormen are attentive and helpful. Stella Draksin-Okjan, who works at the Front Desk, is excellent. She always has a smile on her face, she is knowledgeable, attentive and a main reason why we return to this hotel again and again. This past visit, we mentioned that we were visiting the city to celebrate our daughter's 12th birthday. We left for the day and returned to our room to find "Happy Birthday" Balloons, candy and a note to our daughter wishing her a happy birthday, signed by the front desk staff, individually! It was over the top in service and typical of what makes this team of people so special. They seem to really enjoy their jobs and helping their guests. We love staying here! Thank you Stella and the whole staff for making our stay such a fun time!We will be back again soon!

We had a fantastic time at this hotel... Rooms were very clean, with very comfortable beds.... We our stay very much... The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming! I would highly recommend this hotel.. Great location!

I absolutely love the W Union SquareThe staff is very knowledgable and friendly The concord is the best The whatever whenever is so trueThe location is perfect too with the best farmers market across the street and some of the best restaurants within walking distance

My room was amazing and the staff at the hotel were very accommodating. I am really looking forward to my next visit. Such a wonderful hotel and a great location, close to so much and convenient to subways. It has become my hotel of choice.

This place was hands down the worst hotel I've ever stayed at... No one will help you with bags! They just stare at you and let you bring your own bags up to your room.. Then once I got to my room, I looked in the toilet and someone had used the toilet and forgot to flush! Wow! So gross! Called the front desk and they had someone clean in about an hour later... Waste of money. Wish I stayed somewhere else!

Great location. Near subway, shopping, restaurants, and of course Union Square. Large high ceiling and comfortable, nicely decorated room. Good price by NYC standards from numerous websites. Like that free coffee is served in morning in the lobby.

I had a problem with the bath in my room and rather than wait for me to have it repaired, they moved me to a new room. When that room also had a problem with the bath the manager on duty very quickly had engineering come up to fix it. She then offered me the appropriate level of apology and compensation and made me feel appreciated. While the hotel itself is but dated (you stay here for the location and the coolness factor I guess) the treatment by the staff more than makes up for it. Whatever/whenever really is the right description of the service level. Thanks!

By NY standards, this place was reasonably nice. It was clean. The decor was modern and tasteful. Everything worked. These things are all unusual in NY. On the downside, it was old, and in need of remodel. It was slightly understaffed at the front desk. The lobby was cramped and unimpressive. Not a bad place to stay. I will likely stay again. But it could be much nicer.
