Great hotel for a weekend stay with concert plans at Irving Plaza... The room was clean, food delicious, staff very pleasant. And Frank our (favorite) doorman was fantastic with recommendations of restaurants and places to see.

there are thousands of places you could stay in nyc. and my wife and I have stayed at many. but the reason we keep coming back to the w at union sq. not only is it a beautiful property , run by truly caring people, but it's close enough to all the action, but a little away so as not to be noisy.union sq. itself is also very lovely. lots of great restaurants walking distance. a whole foods mkt. and a great park to relax in.it's not cheap, but quality never is, but its a lot more reasonable than many places you could stay.around the corner from the w is a terrific italian rest. called florian, (highly rec.) and then for breakfast there is the coffee shop, a two minute walk awaytimes sq. and all the action is a quick subway or taxi awaywe stayed in a suite on this visit and if you can afford it, go for it, was so nice having breakfast in the room relaxing.if you are lucky enough to be here, you are lucky enough.

Love the W hotel properties in the Starwood chain. The W Union Square did not disappoint. Excellent check in experience, very friendly staff, very good gym facilities, good toiletries (bliss). If you stay on a weekend be sure to visit the farmers market in union square just across the street.

We visited NY and loved the W at Unions square. They accommodated us with a lovely room. It was big for NY size. We had a king bed, a roll away bed and used the pull out day bed. Even with all that we had plenty of space. The bathroom had a tub and shower. The concierge, Robert,was perfect. He secured us a reservation at Locanda Verde and it was awesome!! We loved the food, ambience and the fact it was in TriBeCa. Kids loved the area. We also biked Central Park, shopped Soho and saw Mathilda on Broadway! Loved it. Kids loved it all. The W helped make our stay comfortable and helped us get to all the activity we needed with our young family. Thanks W Union Square. We will be back.

This is a great location at Union Square. You are close to so many subway options and are just a few minutes from Washington Square Park or the Flatiron Building. I was a little concerned when we checked in to the hotel because the bar patrons were spilling (literally and figuratively) into the lobby and extremely loud and obnoxious. However, it was a Friday night and we did not encounter any more problems. As a matter-of-fact, we finished each day of sightseeing with a drink in the bar and never had trouble finding someplace to sit. The food and drinks were very good. The corner room is very spacious. However, the bathroom is one of the smallest I have ever encountered. Explain that one to me. When I say small, I mean so small that two people cannot be in there simultaneously, especially with the door open. It barely closes without hitting the toilet and vanity. Other than the bathroom, the room and hotel were great. The bed was very comfortable and it was nice having a small couch that made the room larger than a typical New York room. We especially enjoyed watching the rooftop parties on the buildings that we overlooked.

There were a number of things we liked about this hotel and a number of things we did not like. I'll start with the negative points so I can end on a positive.1. Expensive $$$$ - While we were lucky enough to have had our hotel paid for as a gift there is no way I would stay here on my own dime especially with the negatives.2. When you check in, the music in the lobby is so loud you can hardly hear the person at the registration desk. Never before have I experienced such loud music in a lobby??3. We went to the bar for a drink and while the music was loud in the lobby it was much louder in the lounge ... does nobody talk anymore?? We sure couldn't!!4. Lounge service was slow. We went there on a Friday night and there was one bartender working for an entire bar full of patrons ... we almost walked out when finally (after a 15 minute wait) we got served.5. Rooms are small as are the bathrooms. You can't have the closet door open and expect to walk by. Probably typical for Manhattan but again ... the price ????6. Everything comes at an extra charge even a bottle of water. We thought of having room service but there was a $10 delivery charge ... what??? isn't the high price of the food enough?We did however liked a number of things as follows:1. Location is fantastic ... my wife and I like to walk and you can walk almost anywhere in downtown New York from here.2. Room cleaning crew were invisible and very good, rooms were very clean as was the entire hotel.3. The "Living Room" is a nice place to sit, enjoy a coffee and people watch.4. All staff were friendly and helpful.All in all not worth the money ... some of the other things like the loud music etc could be a factor of age. I'm mid fifties and loud music is not my thing anymore. Younger people might actually enjoy it.

Great hotel with warm/friendly front staff, security. Well appointed, cool lobby/restaurant.Very nice gym facility. Spacious room by NYC standards that was very clean on 7th floor.Would definitely go back!

the front line staff at this hotel are the best in the business. To many to mention them all by name but if you meet Magy, Willy, Stella, Priscilla, or Sebastian you will be in great hands.I always feel like a member of the family when I am there

I can't say that I like the decor but it's a good hotel with excellent service. Incredibly convenient.The location can't be beat. I recommend it (aside from the decor) and lots of good stores and restaurants close by.

I have to say I am starting to see a big difference between the Starwood brand and the Marriott brand. It will be interesting to see what happens with both brands if the merger happens. That being said, I am a Starwood gold member and a Marriott platinum. I recently stayed at the JW Marriott Essex house for a business trip and 2 weeks later returned to the city and stayed here at this hotel for another business trip. You can read my review of the Essex house but my stay was disappointing. From the moment I checked in here at the W however the level of service greatly exceeded that of my experience at the Essex House. Upon check in I was upgraded to a corner room (at least I believe it was an upgrade, the hotel was booked through our meeting planner) and asked if I needed a 4pm late checkout which I did indeed. It's so nice automatically being offered the late check out versus having to beg for one. The room itself was very very nice. Great comfy bed, nice view, wonderful toiletries in the bathroom (I love the Bliss products) and overall, a very comfortable room. The housekeeper was outside and I needed some extra face wash and she was extremely friendly and accommodating.The front desk people were great with restaurant recommendations and directions. We had a meeting at the hotel and the food for breakfast and lunch that was served was very good. I would come back here again and had I not already booked the Westin Grand Central for my upcoming trip in a few days I would have returned here. Hopefully the Westin GC will meet the standards of Starwood that I experienced here at the W.

Half way through our stay and everything could not be better. Front staff-ALL-are amazingly cheerful,helpful and so professional. Jose at the door always has a smile and a story. Gets your car a cab or directions to wherever you are going. Also a wealth of information on places to visit -- big thanks for our morning coffee place-Irvings- just around the corner- they have pumpkin seed milk for those of us that have a nut/milk sensitivity. The decor hasn't changed in a while but they nailed it the first time so no need. Everything looks fresh and very well maintained. Rooms are well designed and very functional and most important the beds are some of the best that I have slept on. A BIG thanks to all for a most enjoyable stay.

We had to stay here recently with a work group. The hotel looks and feels very tired. It needs a make over from top to bottom. The guest rooms are dated and trying too hard to be funky. It just doesn't work. The foyer is also very tired as is the restaurant. Even the guest bathrooms on the ground floor need re modelling.

Stayed for 5 nights on business after staying for 2 nights at the W in San Francisco Union Square.The New York establishment was far superior. I have nothing but good things to say about it. At check in, was offered either a low floor (4th) with view of Union square or a high floor (17th) at the back that would be more quiet.I picked the 4th floor. The room and view was fantastic. However, it is very noisy in New York. If you have trouble sleeping or may be jet lagged, pick a room on the high floors. My colleague picked the 17th floor and didn't hear a sound whereas I was disturbed by traffic, sirens, work trucks and even screams from the street all night most nights.Bathroom and shower were high quality. Bed was massive king and extremely comfortable. Plenty of wardrobe space and room for luggage.The lobby bar was really cool. Always busy after work and had good selections of beer, wine and scotch. Good crowd in there. Also had a really high quality burger there for lunch after checking out.The gym was more than acceptable. Could easily do a full workout though some heavier dumbbell weights than 50lb would be a nice touch.All the staff were nice and helpful at each interaction over the 6 days. No issues, great job team W. If staying in mid town again I would return.

We have stayed there every year (maybe more) that we have come back to NYC. Every time, we truly enjoyed staying there as always...Now, for the smaller detailed, we paid extra for mega room and requested for shower stall but received ADA compliant bathroom which we did not want. Also, we had to ask twice to get a refrigerator that we did request before we arrived. So, if you need to request something, please do follow up with you arrive to the desk! With that said, it is definitely NOT a deal breaker! WE WILL BE BACK next year or sooner!
user_name:
Mike M
Colorado Springs, Colorado, United States

review_body: Great location being on Union Square. I am a returning guest to this location and also a SPG Gold member. This hotel does ZERO for SPG status. Infact with my SPG keyless entry I was anticipating and marked to to have a Mega room (one level above my purchased room) but upon check in I was giving the room I purchased. The SPG keyless app unfortunately at this location still required me to check in. Hotel cares little about SPG guests, where other NYC hotels actually do upgrade. I would skip this hotel, front desk wasn't very kind or helpful. Rooms are a little dated, they need a refresh.

W Union Square provided a new perspective on NY. Great location - away from tourist shops etc like Times Square. Lobby at W has a great lounge, bar and restaurant which was nicely busy. Food was modern and fresh - bar was innovative with some great staff (well done Sarah - who at busy times carried the calm vibe). Would definitely recommend this location and hotel for both business and leisure.

I am a big W hotel brand fan. Stayed at quite a few around the world. Always good. Always worth the money. As a Starwood member i received a few of there perks and that helps. Great location. Not as big as some of the others but that is to be expected. Remember folks it is also in a very old building, so expect smaller rooms and some evidence of age. My only complaint was that while at the lounge late nite and buying drinks, i was asked nay the waitress if i would give up my small table for a larger crowd?! Really?! Where then should i place my drink? On my head? After telling her know she attempted to insist for a bout a minute. Making me defend why I should keep my table! Unacceptable, that as a a guest i should be treated this way. And although the bar manager on duty was very polite in taking my complaint, not much was done. Unfortunately. This is not the type of behavior that any guest at any hotel should have to put up with. Other than that, it was a great stay. Never let one incident ruin your vacay

Excellent hotel. Great area. Smells great. I am a huge W fan. I have stayed at W all over the world. Yes they are not the best but they are hip, contemporary and stylish. Best of all they cater to you. This,one is no exception. Courteous. Pleasing. Things you as a guest require out of W. U ion square rocks. Great location. Come stay. Lol

Very well located, close to good shopping, restaurants and bars. Room was a nice corner view with a good bed and smallish bathroom. Front desk was very efficient and resolved a minor issue we had with excessive room heating in one go. We never saw lines at the front desk.Nice bar scene downstairs and Irvington restaurant was good for both breakfast and dinner / drinks.Gym in the basement was decent with four treadmills, two elliptical machines, two bikes and some other body building equipment.Wifi was complimentary with Starwood status and worked well.As a minor point New York street life can be a bit loud (e.g. ambulances) and sometimes we felt the windows in our room could have better soundproofing.

We favor the Starwood hotels bc of points & amenities-booked here for a college visit in NYC-perfection. You simply cannot beat the Union Square location. Gorgeous view of the Square & Freedom Tower. Tall windows with a big, beautiful view and lots of sunlight, a spacious room and the usual hysterically high priced mini bar items. Love the free coffee in the lobby til 10 am & the comfy lounge downstairs. This is a fantastic hotel and our go to spot to be out of the crazy touristy nonsense. You will love. :)

Stayed here for two nights this week in a flying visit to NYC. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Room was well kept. Banging from flag pole was slightly annoying but didn't interrupt my sleep a lighter sleeper might have suffered though. Gym was average but machines were clean and worked. The room service was quick and food was nice. It's biggest plus for me was location very convenient for me and walkable to plenty of the highlight of New York.

I had a room on one of the higher floors, facing Union Square. The window was high up on the wall and not very large, so don't expect a panorama, but the view is very nice. As one can expect from W the room was very comfortable, spacious, high quality bathroom with bath robe and excellent blinds. The room was also very quiet, which is key in NYC. The service and food is also of very high quality! Add the great location and you have a winner.
user_name:
arnehall
New York City, New York

review_body: If you want to stay somewhere near NYU, you have to consider the W Union Square. It's a great hotel. The rooms are spacious, the staff is extremely helpful, and the views of downtown NYC are spectacular. We have stayed here a couple of times now and will definitely come back to the W. Another plus is easy access to Union Square station. You can get to a Broadway theater within 15 minutes!

If you want or need to be near the Lower East Side this is an excellent choice. We thought about going even trendier at one of the real Lower East Side places, but this was very close and I suspect far more comfortable. The front desk checked us in early and was very accommodating about helping us choose a room (high floor in back). The luggage folks and doormen were super helpful and friendly. There's a pretty lively lobby bar, but you're better off at all the fun places nearby. The bed was great, the bathroom roomy and the reading chair comfortable. The window was a little funky. We had to step on a block (which was provided) to see over the concrete rail outside (on the 19th floor). But the room was very light.

My wife and I recently celebrated our first wedding anniversary in New York and stayed at the W Union Square. Before we even arrived, we were in contact with Tanya, who, upon knowing it was our anniversary, made our stay special from the moment we arrived. The room was beautiful, clean and had wonderful views of the park. We will certainly come back in the future. Thank you for making our trip so special!!

Jose out front was a great friendly spirit that made our stay extra fun. Rooms were nice, lower floors a little loud, lobby for drinks and coffee was a great meeting place. Breakfast was good but need a little extra time to relax. Great location, would stay again (and have stayed before).

Great location in hip and happening Union Square! We arrived very early after a red eye when the hotel was almost at full occupancy but they managed to accommodate us for early check-in, which was much appreciated. Service, rooms, location and hotel ingeneral were top notch!

Myself and my husband from Ireland, stayed 4 nights in this beautiful funky hip hotel. This was the start of our honeymoon before heading off to jamaica. The service and location was perfect. Walking distance to times square in or around 20/30 mins but trams were close by.. Bornado and Tanya where extremely helpful and could not do enough for us. First time in NYC and we got to experience times square NYE.. we got very lucky and managed to get up the front without queing altough stood for 8 hrs waiting, worth every minute. One negative comment about the W.. we came back to the hotel after our new yrs experience and was charged 60 dollars for 2 drinks each..Atmosphere was amazing, bar service was excellent but i found this quite expensive..Room very clean, spacious, modern, beds very comfy. We will be definetly be returning to the W new york - union square!!

We stayed right after the New Year and had a wonderful stay. The room was very modern, yet extremely comfortable. Staff was quick to get us checked in after a long overseas flight. Location was ideal for walking around the next morning (farmer's market is right across the street). Definitely looking forward to our next visit and hopefully longer stay.

I have stayed in this hotel many times before and always was great. Now I would rate it maybe two stars at most. The first few days there was almost no service in the living room bar, we actually started going to other places in the neighborhood to get drinks. The room cleaning was also abhorrent, they didn't remove empty glasses or clean at all expect making the bed, motel 6 would have done a better job. This is is my last time at this property, was once great but now so below average, you can do better almost anywhere else.

In New York to see some concerts, there's no better location than the W Union Square- 3 blocks from Webster Hall, 2 from Irving Plaza and a straight shot to Brooklyn on the L line just a block walk from the hotel.Checking in, they couldn't find my reservation. When I showed the front desk clerk my written confirmation she seem annoyed, and with the approval of the manager on duty, was given a room on the third floor (out of 21) in the back with bars on the small window and a view of a wall. This despite my SPG Gold status. I waited for the shift change, and a few hours later the very friendly and helpful front desk clerk switched me to a large room on the 15th floor with huge windows and a sweeping view all the way to One World Trade Center. So I guess you could call the service, "uneven." As with all W's, the lobby is hoping all evening. The crowded bar had great drinks and friendly servers, and I especially appreciated the great late-night burgers until 2am. Dinner at Lexington was great as well.Everything is close by, and especially appreciated is the Whole Foods and Trader Joes just off Union Square.The room was well appointed, but guys, how about a coffee maker? If you want rock and rollers, don't make them walk 3 blocks to Starbucks when they finally roll out of bed. Oh, and check your bill. I was charged $24 for M&M's from the mini-bar, which they graciously removed.

I must say this W is very sophisticated, I walked in and was forced to adjust myself to look at that grand staircase that's in the lobby and though this is a W.. Yes it is and a fine one at that, close to subway entrances and shopping. I upgraded to a Spectacular Room which had a huge bathroom. Room clean, shower hot (and full of BLISS products) also we had drinks at The Irvington one night service was awesome, so were our cocktails excellent bartenders. Hotel staff was also on point, housekeeping kept our room refreshed daily, check in and out painless. Also these rooms are some of the biggest in the area about 360 sq ft . big for N.Y. We had a great stay and will return.

I stay at this hotel every time I'm in NYC. I love the location and the hotel size is very good compared to other very small rooms I've stayed at in NY.The decor is very hip and modern, while the rooms are clean and good size bathroom. There's coffee and some kind of fruit in the lobby every morning. The service is pretty good, I've been able to get a room early sometimes. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby and close to the subway station. Walking distance to many places.The restaurant downstairs keeps changing, but always very good.

This W doesn't feel as polished as others I've stayed in, but I've also stayed in much worse places in NYC. Rooms are large (especially by NYC standards), the location is great, and it still has that hip vibe.The keyless entry is a nightmare to make work in the elevators - it takes 4 or 5 tries before the elevators unlock, at which point you've already been whisked to another floor or are busted standing awkwardly in the elevator with it not moving. I eventually had to get a key. (The door to the room consistently unlocked on the first try with my iPhone or Watch, so it must be a problem with the elevators.)I had a tough time with the room thermostat - it was a cold week when I visited but I had to set the temp to 76 before I felt like the room was bearable. The shower was small & dark, the towels had seen quite a bit of wear, and the sheets felt scratchy. It just didn't compare to stays at other Ws.All that said, I do love the Bliss bath products, the wifi is decent, and the staff is super-helpful. For a business trip, this was more than adequate. For a vacation, I would probably consider a different hotel.

Great location weekend of historic snow! Close to subway, great shopping , restaurants. Doormen were awesome, David and Charles. Tiffany at front desk was great, superb customer service. It was easy for us to get out. Room was spacious and very clean.

Check in- early was requested 3 hours prior to check in and it was honored. Personable front desk staff and location was perfect! Check out was a breeze as well. Late check out requested which was granted.

Nice property, good bed, excellent location, poor lighting in the room (as in all W hotels). Sunday morning I called and asked to have my room made up while I went out. I returned an hour 15 minutes later to find the housekeeper about to enter the room (she explained they begin late on Sunday) Fine. I said we will be going out again in a couple of hours and could she make up the room then. She said to just let housekeeping know when we leave Before leaving the room at about 1 PM I called on the phone and asked that the room be made up AND as I left the elevator I stopped by the front desk and repeated the same request. Both times I was assured “certainly.” I returned 2 and a quarter hours later and the housekeeper saw us in the hall and asked if we had notified anyone when we left—she had been waiting for notification that we were ready to have the room made up!! It still had not been done!I am a platinum preferred guest member and get free continental breakfast. But they do not allow you to take the breakfast in the restaurant--we were forced to have breakfast in the room—going to the restaurant is not allowed—which I didn't like. Moreover, the quality of the pastries is poor and we were asked what we wanted but one of us received a small, tasteless scone (rather than the promised danish, which itself was mediocre).

You cannot beat the location of this hotel--I used to think I HAD to be on the Upper East Side or near Times Square, but not anymore! The W Union Square is in a classy, quiet neighborhood easy walking distance to Union Square, Gramercy Park, Washington Square, Soho, West Village, Chelsea and more. They'll remember your name at the front desk, and the service is first class.

We came in for drinks inside the hotel. Irvington bar and grill. It was a little late so the kitchen was closed already. The bar is set up nicely and provides so alcoves to hide out in. The atmosphere is a good one. The bar area is also used for breakfast space which starts at 6 am. The entrance is unique with a floating staircase.

I loved this hotel. Actually way better than the W on Lexington in my opinion. It was in a great spot, could walk anywhere from here, lots of restaurants and shops all around. Hotel check in was super easy, staff was great. There are a bunch of elevators so did not have to wait more than a few seconds for one. The room itself was super nice! I had a huge kind bed and the room was spacious (super spacious by NY standards). Everything was very clean and comfortable and modern. Bathroom was also great and full of Bliss products - which makes me happy! Only stayed one night but would return when coming back to NY.

The staff is amazing. The room was beautiful and huge. Wish we had more time to really explore the area but we will be back. Right at Union Square - easy access to the subway system and getting a cab was a breeze, too.

The W Union Square is a great spot, in an excellent location. Great service and a place that meets and exceeds all of your needs. Food is good...rooms comfortable and clean, décor is cool and the tone is energetic.

I've stayed here several times over the past few years. You cannot beat this hotel's location, and it is a huge plus for the hotel. Right off Union Square with great shopping, farmer's market, restaurants, park, etc., close to Flatiron area, close to the Village, NYU, etc. In the heart of downtown. Otherwise, this hotel is okay - in recent stays, the elevators have been out of service, service has been inconsistent/non-responsive (i.e., for housekeeping requests). But - the rooms are spacious/functional and have high ceilings, there are some great views, etc. The hotel is in an old building and it is starting to show (the elevators in particular). Doesn't have the polished/smooth service of other W's, but has the vibe, location and feel. I think Wifi is free if you're starwood platinum. Not sure if it is free otherwise.

Very good hotel and accommodation. Brilliant location - right opposite to union square, in the heart of the city, having all food, atm and shopping areas quite close by. Was happy with the stay here for business purposes for a week. No complimentary breakfast - but the pros outweigh this con, big time.

This was my neighborhood in NYC for a long time and it's a great area to be in. Hotel is super convenient to many of the best parts of Manhattan by subway, walking or car. Our room was pretty big by Manhattan standards and it also had nice, high ceilings. Room was very clean. We had a daybed where a friend crashed one night (we stayed over NYE) and we asked the front desk that a duvet be brought up. They sent someone up from housekeeping to fully make it up like a proper bed, which was much appreciated. I was sick during most of my stay and got food delivery from several apps. Staff offered to bring it up to the room instead of going to the lobby to meet the delivery person (elevator only works with room keycard). Bed was very comfortable with soft sheets, minibar fridge had a little extra room for my own treats. Only downsides: Front desk was very understaffed (one person) both when I was checking in and out. Also, I'm a Platinum SPG member and nothing in the way of a larger room of upgrade was offered or even mentioned during check-in. Just got the room we booked. It might have been related to our first night there being NYE, but it would've been appreciated if something along the lines of "we're fully booked and I'm afraid we have no available upgraded rooms..." was mentioned. Especially since on my previous stay in the Sheraton the same thing happened, but it definitely wasn't a peak time. Overall, recommended. Our room was under $300 a night and a little above the basic category, which for a good Manhattan hotel in this area is an excellent deal, even for January. Hope to return on a future visit.

Very friendly, professional and easy to deal with. Room service was a little too expensive for the quality of food I received. Definitely pay attention to the fees they add on for room service. Convenient location to great restaurants, drug stores and shopping.

This W Hotel has a great location, adjacent to NYU and Greenwich Village. The lobby and bar on the first floor are beautiful. There is a cool, artsy feel throughout the property.The best part, of course is the room. It was beautiful with contemporary furniture and an awesome floor to ceiling mirror with a frame in the shape of flames. The bed was very good and the bathroom was very good as well.The staff in the lobby were extremely nice. The check in person, Maggie, remembered our names two days after we checked in. After tipping the bellman for holding our luggage, he gave us two drink tickets for their very nice bar. We used them for a night cap on our last night there.My only gripe about our room was the weak water pressure in the shower. It was a ninth floor room, but that should not make any difference.We have been to this hotel before and we will certainly return in the future.

Stayed here for the position to access areas we hadn't been as yet. Nice size room, nice bar and restaurant. The service is average but I think that may depend on the day as some good people there by time we left. Old building with good feel, would look at other options next time.

We live in NJ and go into the City often. The W is by far the best of the Ws in NYC for the price and location. The rooms are spacious, modern and clean. Many of the other Ws have very small rooms. The hotel is quiet so you can sleep without any disturbance. The restaurant is very good - we have had breakfast many times there. Front desk staff is efficient and friendly. The location is great as you are literally a block from Union Square. Several subway stops are easily accessible. Many great restaurants within walking distance.
user_name:
KC12N
Madison, New Jersey, United States

review_body: I've stayed at several of the W Hotels within North America through the years, including two of the other properties in NYC, but I've always wanted to stay at the Union Square location and I'm so glad I did! It was WWWWwwwonderful! I splurged and booked a "cool corner suite" and it was well laid out, spacious and "cool." I was on an upper floor so enjoyed a beautiful south-facing view of Union Square and the Freedom Tower. The room only had a queen bed though, not a king, so that may be a consideration for some. The bathroom was spacious as was the living area. Everything was clean and well taken care of and I enjoyed all the common areas as well. The concierge and front desk staff were really great and friendly, always providing a high level of service and care. They knew I was a woman travelling solo for a few days so they were always looking out for me. I also enjoyed the bar in the main lobby and felt safe everywhere in and around the neighbourhood. I highly recommend the Union Square neighbourhood! Such a wonderful place to walk around, great restaurants and shopping - and my fave spectator sport: people-watching. I can't wait to return to the W Hotel Union Square next time I'm in NYC!

As an SPG platinum member I have stayed at a number of Starwood properties all over the world. Stayed here for 3 nights with my family. We had 2 rooms both of which were upgraded when I called to see which rooms we were given the day before our checkin date. When we checked in we were promptly given our room keys, however the front desk representative gave no recognition for my platinum status. I wasn't looking for him to roll out the red carpet as I know there are tons of spg platinum members out there. However, that being said, wherever I go the front desk staff usually say something like, "thank you for being a valuable platinum member we are happy to have you here." No mention of my platinum choice benefits until I had to ask... At this property don't expect to be treated any differently if you have spg status. The next day I had misplaced my room key, so I had to go to the front to get a new key. I spent 5 minutes waiting as the front desk staff (I believe the same one that checked me in) was explaining to the guest (I hope it was a guest) the pros and cons of the cell phone he used... not paying any attention to the other guests in line. Upon checkout we left our bags at the front desk to quickly go back to our other friends room.... The luggage attendant came to the front to get the bags and without saying anything to us, said to the front desk girl, "hey mamma, good to see you, haven't seen you in a while".All in all, totally unprofessional service from the front desk staff. I get better service from front desk staff at the four points hotels I stay at on my business trips.... On the plus side the rooms were decent. Good size, bathrooms could be nicer, but all in all decent. I prefer the location of the w Union square, but the service I received at the Westin Times Square was light years better than the service at the w Union square.

When in NYC I recommend this W to the other W hotels, simply based on the fact of great location. This is a great area with not too many tourists. The hotel itself is very comfortable and well managed. Been here 2 times already and will return.

We stay here several times throughout the year and have never been disappointed. Service and amenities are spot on! We shared a great meal last night via room service and have to say that the flavors and presentation were as good as some of the city's best restaurants.

I really enjoyed staying at this location. Great concierge and front desk people, super helpful. Easy to walk to places, perfect location for subway. Amazing deal at the spa in front of it. The bar is fun, great food at the restaurant. I had an awesome view from my room, which was quiet, clean and pretty spacious.

Sometimes you never know what you're going to get with a W Hotel. Union Square was a pleasant surprise. It wasn't over the top trendy nor extremely loud as you can get sometimes with this brand. W Union Square are very well balanced. The rooms were a nice size as well for a New York hotel room. I visit the city about 4 times a year and I usually stay close to Central Park and Times Square. Union Square was a nice change of pace. Less crowds and a little more relaxing.

This hotel was in a great location, Union Square. The hotel had great decor, a great bathroom and the bed was heavenly. Definitely what you'd expect from a starwood and the W. The location is ideal because it is close to the subway and was great to walk around the union square farmers market on Saturday, amazing restaurants close by. All in all I'd say it was great hotel!

This is the second time we have stayed at this W location. It is our favorite W in NYC. The rooms are nicely appointed with a great bed. The staff despite other reviews was very helpful for us. There is shopping and great restaurants in the area. We will return.

My husband and I stayed at the W 12/11 to 12/13. Began badly when our room was not available until after 5:30. Natacia Beckford at the Welcome Desk gave us an upgrade to the Corner Suite and the hotel sent up a bottle of wine for the inconvenience. All staff members were friendly and helpful, doormen,concierge , restaurant and lounge staff. Housekeeping was excellent. Hotel is very generous with toiletries. And I love Bliss products.The Irvington restaurant in the hotel serves fine food. Love the location across from the farmers' Market. Near many shops, restaurants and clubs.We had in room continental breakfast included in our room package and it was delivered within 20 minutes and was more that ample .We are Starwood Gold members and stay at St Regis hotels which have excellent, refined service. But for a more boutique style, lively setting in the middle of an active location, try the W.117MAG117

I stayed with my family over Thanksgiving break. The hotel is in a great location, clean, and the service from housekeeping, doormen, and everyone is great except the front desk. Everyone else seems to have an attitude and what's worse - I got charged twice for our stay - luckily I checked my credit card statement and saw the charge. I didn't even get the charge shown to me when I checked out - it wasn't in my folio. So check your credit cards - you may have been charged twice! I am still trying to get this resolved. 3 calls into the hotel, one message for the billing guy, and nothing solved yet. A real shame, because under the right front desk leadership, this would have been a 5 star rating.

If you are doing business in lower Manhattan, this is a great hotel for that purpose. It does not compare well against other W's that I have stayed in terms of room amenities. Coffee machine in the room is almost a given in most 5 star hotels. My first experience using the cardless entry was mixed; worked a 100% for the elevators but not the door to the room. The lounge had a great atmosphere and I spent some time with business partners there.

The W in Union Square is a TERRIFIC hotel. We were in town celebrating my sweetie's 36th birthday. The hotel has a boutique/chic style (...which I LOVE). As a Gold status member, I received a free upgrade and late checkout (sweet!). The rooms are big and the decor is very trendy. Beautiful hotel and it doesn't feel cold and unwelcoming like other places. The location is perfect. Directly across the street from Union Square park and the subway. There are alot of restaurants, shops and bars in the area. But if you don't want to leave the hotel, there's a very nice bar/restaurant next to the lobby. I've always loved W hotels, but the staff at this location EXCEEDED my expectations and treated us like royalty. Tanja (W insider) and Bernardo (W concierge) were terrific! They were thoughtful, attentive and made sure we knew where all the best spots were in NY. I researched alot of different places, but Tanja and Bernardo had the inside scoop on where to hang out, which scene would fit our mood, and the best time/day to go to certain places. We even received a bottle of champagne in our room upon arrival to kick off our birthday celebration. During our conversation, I mentioned I liked Moscow Mule cocktails. The next day, Tanja/Bernardo left a very cute, Moscow Mule cocktail kit in our room. I was shocked and surprised and moved by their thoughtfulness. Stella checked us out and she was also a delight. Beautiful personality! We spent two nights at the W and spent our last night at Le Parker Meridien. We left the W thinking we would have the same (or better) experience at the Meridien. NOT! The Meridien is a very nice hotel (also a starwood hotel), but if you want to be pampered and treated like a queen or king...stay at the W. When we turned in for the night, I remember saying - "I miss my family at the W". And that was the honest to God truth. The W in Union Square is now my home away from home. Tanja, Bernardo, Stella - thank you for everything. You truly made our birthday celebration unforgettable.

My daughter and I had the best time staying at the W in Union Square. The location was perfect, only a 2 min walk to the metro, staff were nice and helpful, room was spacious. Our favorite place to stay when visiting NYC.

On arrival the doorman was extremely friendly welcoming us to the hotel so was the bellman and front desk staff.This is when it went a little off, on my reservation I had informed the hotel that we would be arriving at 8pm and I paid up front for my corner room. Well the front desk staff told me that they gave our room away because we had arrived late, but in the morning because we are staying for 4 nights they will move us tomorrow to our room. OK so no real fuss. Well you should have seen the room. 1920 ) if you are given this room ask for another).After we went to the room we decided to eat in the hotel restaurant which was hopping and very load which we enjoyed until we.go our food, my god their food is bad (just my opinion) and their service needs some work. Sit in the lounge area and have a drink eat elsewhere. The following morning we decide to chat with the front desk staff that in fact they are going to change our room. (5th Dec). The gentleman was very helpful but out of nowhere the other attendant (female) jumped into our conversation and said "I see you note but there is nothing we.can do"(words to that effect) in what we felt as an aggressive manner. The man gentleman dealing with us, took control of the situation and in his tone of voice making sure we are happy said he would.sort a new room out for us, which when we.go.back to they gave us a room overlooking the park. Wonderful view of NYC.We still have a couple of days at the hotel, at this point I would definitely come back and stay here, in fact I would next bring my kids because the location of the hotel in NYC is great.Let's see what the next couple of days bring us.

I've stayed in W hotels before and loved them; however, this one was beyond disappointing. The disappointment began when the doorman didn't hold either of the double doors for me when I arrived. He just watched me struggle with a large suitcase and a heavy carry-on and a handbag and told me there was a ramp to my left. When I checked in they told me I was getting a complimentary upgrade to a park view. When I got up to my room there was no view of a park it was of other buildings and the pebbles on the lower roof. Which, I would have been fine with had they not reset my expectations that I was getting a park view. The room itself was worn looking. The carpet was fraying between the bedroom and bathroom. The towels were small and rough like what I get in the gym. The bed was comfortable, but no blackout curtains so I couldn't sleep in. Also, there was some thing (maybe the phone?) that had flashing blue lights on one of the bedside tables. I just had to pull the plug out of the wall to stop it from flashing after I went to bed. The shower had almost no water pressure and was cold. I had goosebumps while I was in the shower! When I checked out, they didn't ask how my stay was and I volunteered that they look into the shower situation. There was no apologies for my cold shower or discount or any goodwill gesture of any kind. When I went outside to catch a cab, once again zero help with doors or bags. I travel frequently for business and pleasure as you can see from my review history and I have never experienced such poor service and quality in a hotel that cost $500 USD. Starwood, you need to step up your game.

I usually stay uptown, but on this business trip to NYC, I stayed at the W Union Square and I will come back again and again. My room was well-sized with a lovely view and I loved the location for shopping (ABC Home! Fishs Eddy! Etc, Etc) and proximity to great dining as well. As at most (all?) W locations, I enjoyed the Bliss Spa toiletries. Great linens and amenities throughout the room. Only wish they had a coffee maker for the mornings!Jose, one of the door greeters, was one of the most wonderful staff members I've encountered at a hotel - sweet as can be and super helpful. I also had the pleasure of talking to one of the housekeepers and she was delightful and welcoming as well, need to find out her name to compliment her personally!Thank you for a great NYC stay, W Union Square!

We stayed in a Fabulous Room (that's the class of room it was, not my adjective), and it was a great setup for our family. They made up the day bed to be our 4 yr old son's bed, which was great. And our 18 mo old just slept in the King sized bed with us although they asked if we wanted a crib.They let us check in at 7am but the only room they had available was a 4th floor room. They later moved us up to the 17th floor with a better view. That was nice of them.We had lots of requests which they accommodated in a timely manner - coffee machine, more coffee, a fridge, a spoon, etc. They brought us prosecco and an amazing fruit and cheese platter complimentary. Everybody was great.The location also was perfect for what we wanted. Union Sq has a great playground, a Barnes and Noble, the Christmas Markets, plenty of food, everything a family could need. Plenty of 24 hr open places for snacks or medicine or whatever.The subways nearby are good enough to get around all of Manhattan (4,5,6, N, Q, R). But you can easily walk to most of lower Manhattan anyway. We went to Irvington Farm Coffee most mornings and I grabbed cheese and meat for a party at Bedford Cheese Shop, both on Irving, right by the hotel.I didn't think I would like staying at Union Sq, but it was actually pretty awesome. I think this will be a go-to for us in the future. We come to NYC at least once a year and stay at friends, family and hotels to mix it up. We know all of Manhattan pretty well. And I think all in all, this was a great option for us.

I had to go to NY Eye and Ear for an operation. This was a perfect location, walkable to the Hospital. The room was spacious and when they remodeled they left the wonderful high ceilings. The bed was very comfortable and the room was well appointed. Our floor housekeeper Anna was outstanding and after returning from my operation, she couldn't do enough for me. All the staff was terrific.

We have been to the W Hotel Union Square 3 times in the past 2 years and we love this hotel. This is our home away from home. We can't wait to be back there in March for about a week! It is also centrally located and great location to the wonderful Union Square area!
user_name:
Mike M
Colorado Springs, Colorado, United States

review_body: I doubt that many people come to NYC to relax, and if that is one of your priorities, definitely do not stay at the W Union Square. Lobby looks and feels like a nightclub with up tempo music blaring at all hours. Elevator waits are interminable because of the high volume of guests coming in and out. No onsite gym, although hotel does provide guest passes to the neighboring Equinox.Criticisms aside, location is great and right opposite a subway station, food is excellent (though pricey) and rooms are surprisingly spacious by NYC standards.

I have stayed here for ten years! The staff look after me so well. They know me, the treat me like one of the family and nothing is a problem.What's more being close to Union Square means I feel like I have space in a crazy city like New York!

Stayed here because my employer was holding a conference in the hotel. The place suffers from a lack of attention to detail. As an example nearly 15 per cent of the light bulbs in the ballroom were broken, the lift lights were faulty, the hotel failed to deliver a requested morning paper and most annoying of all an alarm call booked for 5.45 came an hour earlier. On the lus side the bed was comfortable and the room was well serviced. The bar is a buzzy location. I probably would stay there again if I had limited choice but would prefer a hotel where details get better attention.

Since my last trip to the W Union Square 8-9 years ago, I've moved on to Westins and more "standard/upscale" hotels (though I do love the Starwood brand). I was recently in NYC for a conference and made the decision to stay an extra night (Saturday) at the W Union Square because I love the Saturday farmer's market and other destinations nearby. Though we arrived early and our room was not quite ready (understandable after a Friday night), I was thoroughly impressed with the customer service from the get-go. The doorman helped take our luggage from the cab and had pleasant conversation while we walked to the front desk.Once we were able to get into the room, I was again impressed. One: I remember the W Union Square being a bit tired and beat-up. This time, the hallways looked fresh and the man assisting with bags could not have been more helpful or considerate. And the room! What I remember being a tiny little cell (like so many NYC hotel rooms) had 11 foot ceilings (at least) and the décor was new/not beat-up. The bathroom was also ample in size. There were no scuffs on the walls as we walked past, nor were there any in the room. And it was QUIET! As for the rest of the service, you are doing it right, W Union Square. I called for additional pillows and they arrived within 20 minutes. My room service dinner arrived in less than 30. And checking out/checking bags could not have been easier. All around very impressed with the W Union Square. Its not easy to be a luxury hotel in NYC (especially a W whose brand includes attracting heavy partiers) but management is doing something right. Congrats.

I have drank and eaten in this property a number of times over the years. The bar/ lounge area is a wonderful place to get a drink in an upscale, casual setting. No too crowded, not too noisy. The new restaurant behind the lounge is a casual Mediterranean place. Perfect if you are in the area and need to meet people in prime location next to Union Square.
user_name:
seanworc
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel offers a perfect location for both the tourist and business travellers.The hotel is unique up deco architecture has been well restored and the rooms are well appointed. With a buzzing restaurant and bar the hotel is also located near many restaurants and bars. A very nice feature is the hotels direct proximity to Union Square where there is a regular farmers market.

For most NY hotels, I lower my level of expectation when it comes to overall cleanliness, service and size of rooms. Please keep this in mind as you read.We checked in fairly late and there were few rooms available. Our only other choice for a room with a nicer view was a disabled access room. We took it anyway. We didn't get a rundown of all the perks that my husband has with his Starwood status. We had to call in the next day to inquire about it. The room itself was spacious by NY standards, and the bathroom large as well. Although we did housekeeping daily, the room never quite felt very clean. But it is still leaps and bounds better than the other location on Lexington. Location is great. It's near the subway and enough hot spots that you don't feel you are in a dead zone. I couldn't imagine staying anywhere near Times Square. There's also the Halal Guys brick and mortar several blocks away which was great. All in all, I would return to this hotel again. But again, don't set your expectations very high in terms of service, rooms and cleanliness levels.

Is my favourite hotel to stay in lower Manhattan.I was here over the weekend for both the 40th NYC Marathon and Game 5 of the World Series later Sunday evening.Everything about my stay at W New York - Union Square was flawless and smooth as silk.Peter, their Director of Operations was the best, very personable and charming. I consider him being their GM.Their Welcome Desk, Stella and Natalie, Concierge and 'G", their great overnight manager always remember me when I check-in and pass by reception near the Lifts.I haven't had the pleasure to dine at their new restaurant 'Irvington' I believe after Todd English 'Olives'.But with so many nice, wonderful restaurants in the Union Square, Gramercy Park neighbourhood with the likes of Blue Water Grill, Union Square Café (hurry before they close by end of year) South Beach ambiance 'Coffee Shop', oldest saloon/restaurant in NYC, where O.Henry ( William Sydney Porter) wrote 'The Gift of the Magi' there at his booth at their fabulous bar, especially during the Christmas holidays with the lights covering the entire tin-pressed ceiling.For whatever price you pay for your room... is well worth it, for that old wise adage of 'location, location, location, for your hotel address is 201 Park Avenue South, if you look right at the hotel entrance you'll see the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building from Irvington Place and my favourite being a former Pan American World Airways In-flight Crew, I always get very sentimental when I look up at our former Pan Am Building at 200 Park Avenue.

I am an SPG member but this is the first W Hotel I've stayed in. The location was key for our needs so that was great and close to subway, etc. But I do have to echo other comments about the staff being unhelpful. The "doorman" is clearly just a prop because they never once actually opened the door, said a word or helped with luggage. Other than checking in, no actual human who worked there spoke to us. Maybe throw out a "hi" or "welcome back" every once in a while.

I am an SPG Gold member, and it doesn't matter how many nights you have stayed at an SPG property; stay at this one and you'll get nauseous of the thought of even stepping foot back in one. I booked a "Cool Corner Suite" and the only thing cool about it was the urine stain left on about 3 feet of wallpaper in the bathroom. I landed at 7 A.M. and got to the hotel at 8 A.M., I informed the staff i would be arriving early 72 hours prior to my arrival. My bags were taken and i sat in the lobby for 3 hours...really a great way to treat a paying customer! The $500 a night suite was probably the most pathetic excuse for a "suite" i have ever seen in my entire life. I'd compare the room i booked (2nd nicest room on the property) to that of a "No-tell motel". The decor is absolutely horrendous, i mean just look at the pictures i took. Oh and the park view room that i paid for; ya that was a complete crock of shi*. I HAVE BEEN ROBBED BY THIS HOTEL BRAND, DON'T DO THE SAME.

Other than the location, the best part about this hotel was the Concierge, Bernardo. I think he literally lives at the hotel because he was pretty much there our entire extended 3-day weekend. Bernardo made the stay stress free and enjoyable as he offered recommendations there were on point and excellent. When one thinks of the perfect concierge, then think of Bernardo, the concierge at the W in Union Station. He is what perfect customer service should be. Can't wait to go back to NYC!

I had an executive colleague visiting from Paris and staying at this hotel. She was already a little annoyed to stay here because she prefers to stay at 5 star hotels in midtown (we work for a luxury fashion brand and she is very senior). I was charged with the task of making sure she was taken care of and happy during her stay so I reached out to the hotel and was connected to the concierge, Bernardo Reyes. Bernardo made what could have been an unpleasant stay, a true EXPERIENCE.He worked with me to arrange things like daily car service, specific tea and food preferences but then he took it to another level. After a gallery tour my VP had mentioned she loved a particular artist. Bernardo, being so dialed in to the contemporary art scene in New York (not to mention conscientious) secured a print and personalized note from the artist for her! She discovered it in her room later that night and was very impressed. Working in the luxury sector, she very much appreciated the gesture. I will definitely recommend this hotel again because of Bernardo!

The hotel rooms are good, the banquet staff and rooms are great. The front desk staff is not friendly, nor very willing to help. The support staff at the banquet rooms were very helpful and friendly. The food was very good. The room service staff were helpful.

The location of the hotel can't be beat. If you want easy access to downtown nightlife then this is a very convenient location. The staff was friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, the hotel itself leaves something to be desired. I had a very large room on the top floor but the decor was dated and the furniture has seen better days. The bathroom was nothing to write home about. The next time I come to New York I may consider staying here again for the location but I would also carefully consider other hotel options.

I stay here most weeks for work. It's certainly not cheap but I am a loyal Starwood member and W union Square is in a great location and close to work. Nice area with lots of great food around. I could spend this entire review discussing the confused branding ( beautiful old building, EDM playing in lifts, strange room designs with clashing colours) but my gripe is with service. The same people check me in every week, but always act like they've never seen me before. They are cold and somewhat aggressive. I feel that hospitality may not be their calling. Whenever I arrive at the front door, there is never a doorman to help with luggage. On the odd occasion that I see the doorman, he doesn't open the door, instead stands there ignoring customers and mugging like he's looking for a fight. Have mentioned the issue to management but nothing has been done. A good hotel but service is a black mark on the SPG brand.

My wife and I travel a great deal both domestically as well as internationally and are long time loyal SPG customers. We've had the great fortune of getting to know many of the amazing SPG Insiders globally and have experienced "whatever whenever" hospitality from many but Tayna, W Insider Union Square stands out. Her knowledge and personalized service is exceptional. She's made the effort and invested the time to get to know our interests and patterns and her suggestions/recommendations have been unbelievable and amazing. Her knowledge of NYC not only includes music, fashion, culinary, events, etc but also is expansive to include the entire city not just the Union Square area. Tayna epitomes the W brand experience "Whatever Whenever!" I'm sure Starwood/W Hotels are aware how valuable she is but if not talk to some of the frequent platinum member guests that stay there and listen to the endless compliments of how well they were treated.

Hotel is a renovated heritage property so some quirky attributes. We booked a room with a view of union square. I wouldn't bother with this again...you really only saw this if you were standing as the windows aren't floor to ceiling. Having said that, love this area - lots of restaurants, shops, the square. Midway between Times Square and soho. Service was very good, beds comfortable. Would stay here again.

You can definitely do better for the price. We spent close to 800 dollars a night to stay in a box of a room. The bathroom was very decadent which was nice but otherwise the room was very claustrophobic. The shower floor was a little grimey.Though the hotel overlooks union square, we had a pretty miserable view of a brick wall across an alley. We tried to order room service multiple times. The staff for some reason was unable to take our order and told us that they would they would call us back. They never did call us back. When called to try and place our order again the woman on the phone snapped at us. This is a ridiculously poor level of service from what should be a 4 star hotel.The movies for rent are ridiculously priced. Renting a movie costs anywhere from 17-22 dollars. You could walk down the street to the movie theatre with a date and pay less.Here's the icing on the cake. I turned on the TV to just watch something as I fell asleep. The TV automatically starts on the hotel's on-demand channel. The instructions on the screen say to press the "guide" button to get live tv, which i did. For a moment before the live tv guide came on the screen, an image of a woman performing a sexual act appeared. I get that technical glitches will occur, but this is grotesquely inappropriate technical glitch. I love new york city. There are literally hundreds of choices to chose from. The level of service is not up to par with the price. There are some basic rules of running a hotel (like not snapping at customers, or surprising them with pornography) that just don't seem to apply here. This will most definitely be the last time I ever spend money on this hotel.

I was underwhelmed. The rooms were OK, the staff were not friendly, the service was OK. The price was expensive. The restaurant and bar was OK. Very average. I must say I was disappointed for a "W" hotel.

The people that run the front desk do a great job and are very friendly and helpful. Nelson is such a great guy, always smiling and happy to help with any of my needs. The guys at the front door are great, friendly and always wish you a nice day.MICKEY STEENBERGHE is so great to me and my family, he works like he owns the hotel, can't do enough to help.

Good location, fit out ok, with good enough 24 hour gym. Good sized desk and working space in room. However no in room coffee, breakfast doesn't start until 7am and room service menu is not extensive. They also try and charge for wifi. Staff friendly and helpful.

The W Hotel in Union Square is excellent. The rooms are very nice and service was excellent. The location is very central to many things we were very pleased with everything at the hotel. Overall a great stay.

2 weeks ago we held 2 executive meetings (Sept 15th and Sept 17th 2015) at the W Union Square hotel in NYC and I must say that everyone from the front door to the planning team to the catering managers and of course the front desk was amazing. Everything was in place, the hotel team was VERY helpful and responsive (day or night), the catering of the food was wonderful (especially since many of our guests had food allergies), the meeting room (The Great Rom), was well, great! I would not hesitate to hold our 2016 exec events again at the W Union Square!

I stayed at the hotel for a week. The Room was big and nice. Restaurant and bar are good options as well. Close to the subway, to nice stores and restaurants and easy if you want to go uptown by subway or walking.

For the second leg of my NY stay, I chose the W Union Square (suggestion of NY friend). This hotel has a trendy vibe and is in a terrific location. Union Square Park is minutes away (walking) - great place to relax and people watch. Also within walking distance you will find retail chains, specialty boutiques, salons etc. Food options range from street trucks and Panera to upper end places like Blue Water Grill, ABC Kitchen and the Grammery Tavern. The hotel has a very nice restaurant, the Irvington - good bar area. Subway access is two streets away and cabs were always available. The W has updated rooms, a gym, is very clean and provides excellent, friendly staff and concierge services! There could have been more lighting in the room, but the bath was great. Honored AAA which provided a discounted room rate. Times Square and Theatre District was walkable if you love to walk, otherwise an easy cab ride.
user_name:
Krista M
Oak Brook, Illinois, United States

review_body: I must admit, I don't understand the lighting at the W--Probably because it is at a minimum. The darkness does not add to the ambiance- rather, I find it unnerving. Sorry, can't get past this! The rooms are nicely done and quite comfortable and you are in the heart of Union Square and close to all mass transit.

I spent 5 days the end of August at the W in Union Square and loved it. I was there for a wedding and it was such a great location, everything you need is available within a block. Restaurants, drug stores, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Sephora, Elizabeth Arden, Barnes and Noble, etc. Just across the street in Union Square is the GreenMarket, which is a wonderful farmers market with everything from locally grown produce, bakery goods and art. Also in the square is a subway station so it's very easy to get anywhere!Nelson (from the South.....South Bronx) at the Front Desk wins the prize for "Mr. Congeniality" and is very helpful with anything you need. Charles at the door was very helpful also with luggage, cabs and many directions! In the lobby they have complementary fruit infused water all day long and in the mornings serve coffee and on the weekends add juice, breakfast bars and bottles of water to take with you. The "Living Room" between the lobby and the restaurant was a great place to gather and you could order drinks or appetizers to have there. I highly recommend this W!

the location of the W Union Square is just outstanding - yes, I agree , there are better W hotels in the world, but the service was great again this time, I revceived a complimentary upgrade and on the 17th floor it is quiet enough. The beds are great ( as always at the W's) , bathroom facilities are somewhat below par given the pricing and the brand.
user_name:
Matthias F
Palma de Mallorca, Spain

review_body: It's a nice hotel, not run down like many NY hotels. Good points, bar is nice and you can meet friends and have a drink, staff are really friendly, rooms are well decorated and beds are good. Food in the restaurant is really nice and well worth going but the selection is small. Now the only real bad part is he room size and the lifts. The rooms are tiny especially for the price. The bathrooms well you can't even get into the shower without breathing in. If you want a place to crash after a day out in NY then go for it.

Many hotels are inconsistent . . . one stay can be great and the next disappointing. We have stayed at the W Union Square many times over many years and have never been disappointed. The friendly, accommodating staff coupled with the attractive, comfortable rooms and unbeatable location make it our #1 favorite in Manhattan. Every time we are enticed to try another hotel we find ourselves returning here because it is THE BEST!

We recently stayed 3 nights in a room on the 11th floor. There was plenty of space, with a good outlook over Union Square. It was surprisingly quiet looking out onto Park Av S. Temperature control in the room was easy. Free refreshment was usually available in reception when we passed. Staff were all very friendly and helpful, especially security/doormen. Concierge was also helpful in answering queries we had. Our luggage was lost at JFK and hotel looked out for it and delivered to our room, which was appreciated. Thanks guys.Did not make use of the restaurant or bar but they seemed busy most of the time.

Wonderful hotel, spacious guest rooms and fantastic location. We came up for the US Open and it was a quick train ride to Grand Central to connect to the 7. Hotel staff are warm and friendly (Micky-Front Desk, Peter-Hotel Manager and Zuly at Irvington were exceptional.) Will definitely be back!

This hotel is a great location (northeast corner of Union Square). Walking distance to Chelsea, Washington Square Park, the West Village. I stayed for 8 days and booked a corner room with a great view of downtown and the east side. It was a nice size, great big windows, and quiet.

I love Union Square, best location in NYC. Great restaurants, farmers market and close to Greenwich and Soho. This W is pretty good, our room was huge for New York but we surely payed for it. A bit dark but we didnt mind. Good bathroom with a tub and separate shower. Ate at the bar once, quick meal but tasty, the bartender was great. For my stay the lounge wasnt that busy which was a nice surprise cause Ws get wild. Will definitely comeback.

The education and professionalism of Mikey ( Operations Manager ) , is exceptional. The motto is to make guest happy!!!!!!On our check-out we also want to thank the excellent service provided by the attendant Sebastian .We love stay in W Hotel Union Square , excellent service and location.Whenever we go to NYC , for sure we will be here.

The W is in a very central location in Union Square. The downstairs lobby has a great lounge that's busy almost every evening. The rooms are sizable and the doormen are very nice. This isn't the quietest hotel, but it's definitely in a great location especially for weekend trips.

We have stayed at most of the 4+ star hotels in and around Union Square over the past three years. This was our first stay at the W and it is as nice as the others, about equal to the Hyatt, though significantly more expensive. The front desk staff was very friendly, the suite we reserved was large, if sparsely furnished. The bathroom had both a standalone shower and bath, but no handheld shower, which was a strange exception. The safe was roomy enough for a large laptop. Wifi was $15/day (!).A good choice for the location or if space is important to you. Not as good a choice if cost is important.

I wanted so much to love this hotel. We stayed here 5 days to drop our son off at NYU. Looking for the hotel we will stay at for the next 4 years. This is not it. First Impression: Arrived at 12:30 am w 5 bags and no door person to help us even get in the the front door. Struggled on our own. $500 a night and no Doorman? I will say though Front Desk check in service was great.Had a room on 4th Floor, Park avenue. So loud. Woke up every night 3 or 4 times. Not the Hotel's fault just a warning.Back to the Doorman or lack thereof...I don't need/want a Doorman to open the door when I am only carrying my purse. I do want a doorman when I am carrying bags and boxes to my son's Dorm and hailing a cab. We had to struggle with doors on our own when moving suitcases, bags, boxes at 9:00am. Hailed our own cab at 7:00 pm on Friday to go to the theatre because no bellman/doorman in sight. Unacceptable for an NYC hotel. I have never had to hail my own cab at a hotel anywhere in the world. Understand you are trying to manage labor costs but this is first impression and basic service offered everywhere else!Elevators Suck! Doors close on you right after everyone gets off. Have your card ready! One of the 2 very small elevator went out of service on Saturday. Had to take service elevator. Waited so many times and we ended up taking the stairs several times. Waited 20 minutes on Sunday when checking out.Will finish on a positive note. Loved the room, bed and bathroom. Bar and breakfast great. Just too many missings to ignore.

I was pleasantly surprised when the friendly staff greeted us at the door of this very well run hotel close to almost everything in Manhattan. They helped us with all of our bags up to a spacious room with two large comfortable beds. Our room looked out over Union Square and had a great view of the Freedom Tower (One World Trade Center). The Union Square subway stop is close by and provides easy access to Broadway/Lincoln Center as well as the financial district. There are also many good local restaurants. I was very impressed by the kindness and attention of all the staff. Our room was made up early everyday. The front desk staff addressed all of our needs very quickly. The gym is pretty well equipped, but has a low ceiling, so it's tough to do military presses if you are into that. One other minor issue is that the elevators are a bit slow and small, but this is a pretty common issue in the city. One of the elevators went down one evening and the staff quickly guided a group of us to a service elevator. There is a restaurant in the hotel that is good but pretty pricey. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay!

Excellent. In NYC, it's all about location and noise. The rooms are a good size and we like the bar and restaurant. The bar is very popular. Slept well. No street noise. There is a great local farmer's market at the park on Saturdays.

I've stayed here several times and it's always hospitality with a smile and gracious demeanor. We were out late one night and the 1:30 AM room service could not have been better. We slept late the next day and I love when hotels figure out you don't want to be disturbed after skate night out! We had a suite and entertained friends during our stay and the staff were great in showing guests in. Looking forward to next visit.

One of my favourite hotels in New York, the W Union Square offers you everything you need in a modern and stylish environment.The rooms are wonderfully modern and a good size - superbly well-kept and the beds give a lovely night's sleep. The staff are SO helpful, friendly and efficient, you almost don't want to ask them for anything because you know they're going to go the extra mile to get you what you want. You almost want a little of that snooty arrogance you get at many smart hotels just so it makes you feel as though you're not giving trouble to someone nice!(To be balanced, a couple of the receptionists were a bit snooty - I watched one being very dismissive of an older lady at the desk when I was checking-in. But I didn't have any bad encounters myself).I travel for business a lot - so usually all I care about is sleeping well, getting a good breakfast, being able to work without interruptions, and having my car turn up on time to take me to meetings.I was able to this perfectly at the W and it took some of the work burden off.To relax, try the Living Room either for coffee, snacks or cocktails - especially during the day when it's not so lively.(The bars and restaurants here do get VERY busy and loud at night... with a crowd which looks like a mix of media types, rich kids, wannabes and prostitutes).The location on Union Square is brillant too - it means I can walk around the East Village which I adore and get to Chelsea and Greenwich Village - so when the work's all done I can be around the neighbourhoods I really like.All in all, a very good place to stay, especially if the client is paying the bill.

You will love the décor, location and service. The hotel goes to extreme lengths to help and serve in a manner of excellence. Best mattress ever. The W is centered between lower Manhattan and Midtown This location gives you a spider web hub to all the attractions. You can walk west to the Chelsea Pier and the incredible stroll along the Highline green trail. Plus you are in Union Square with quick access to the rail lines or a stroll in the square featuring local artists and games like dominoes or checkers. The hotel corner is perfect for quick in and out access and the lobby and rooms are so artistically appropriate. The meals were really really good. We had room service and experienced a breakfast inside the restaurant. Very excellent service.

Overall, we love this property. The location is great. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the bed is very good. He only things I would complain about is that the showers are due for a redo and charging $7 for a small bottle of water, even for a Starwood Platinum level guest is tacky. And the elevators are very slow, with one always under repair.

We recently stayed at the W Union Square and were surprised at how large our room was. For NY you expect it to be tiny, but it was a good size! Everyone we encountered at the hotel provided excellent customer service. The location was great and we would stay here again!

18th floor room with great south view. The staff and concierge were helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable, elegantly appointed and roomy. Extremely comfortable bed. Room service was prompt and delicious. The location is ideal. Perfect spot in a great neighborhood. I'll be back.

Great experience at W Union Square. Wifi tricky to connect but once you do, works great. Spacious rooms that feel recently remodeled. Super clean. Full size hair dryer. Iron and Ironing board in room.Breakfast restaurant a bit expensive but food great. 2 Starbucks within 2 blocks. CVS next door was convenient for water, drinks, & snacks. Another coffee bar right next door as well.Great location to enjoy the NYC Summer Streets:http://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/summerstreets/html/home/home.shtmlThey close some streets for 3 Saturdays in August; it allowed us to take a walk all the way to Wall Street and it goes all the way to the Brooklyn Bridge! Such a treat!I left my computer cord by accident on the desk after leaving; a nice guy in security helped to have it shipped back to me. Honest and helpful staff!Will definitely return and would recommend as a great location for NYC.

I've lived in the area, before, but this was my first hotel stay. Great staff: check-in was very smooth and my SPG room preferences were noted. While we were not offered a late checkout upon check-in, we checked out at 1 pm without any fuss. The room staff were quick and efficient. Bellboy was great. Prime location: lots to do around here. You can easily walk everywhere interesting in lower Manhattan. Grand Central's near, too.Fair value: Our stay was neither cheap nor outrageously expensive. We paid $286 per night, inclusive of tax and all the bizarre tolls that rent-seeking politicians of New York have created for you (Javits Fee? http://goo.gl/2MD5rP). In Manhattan, you will be hard-pressed to find a good room under $200, thanks to the city's bullying of AirBnB. So if you're paying $200, why not pay $300? You're already splitting the room with a friend or girlfriend, so the surcharge is halved, and . At least that was our logic. Feels cramped: it lacks some of the spaciousness that other SPG hotels are known for. Don't expect any big, open areas, wide hallways, or enormous rooms. This is lower Manhattan. You will not have much room to move indoors, and you'll want to be people watching, anyway.I know, that sounds like an argument to get a room at Holiday Inn Express or Four Points Sheraton, instead. We didn't, because we wanted Union Square's access to the entire city by MTA and Uber. Final notes: The good:- Irvington is good. Great for breakfast. Great cocktails too.The bad:- There is no fitness center. Or at least, we were never told about one.- There is no pool, sauna or hot tub.

In my many trips to NYC for work, I've always stayed in or around the midtown-times sq area. This time I wanted something different, away from the overly-tourist crowds, a location that forced me to explore the city and transit system more. With that said, I chose the W-Union Square location. First the hotel, sits on the NE corner of Union Square Park. The lobby and staff are very friendly and helpful to recommend great bars/restaurants in the surrounding area. They also hooked me up with an umbrella one morning while a torrential rain storm visited my commute, thanks W Hotel, you were a life saver! The room was very spacious, modern, clean and very well kept. Internet access was easy and worked great the whole week. Second, the location...the hotel is very close (short walk south) to the 14th St. subway which houses access to the 4,5,6 (east side) trains, in addition to the N, Q, R trains. Also, if you have time, Union Square Park offers a nice little urban oasis to take a quick lunch or coffee break during the day. Just south of Union Square is the NYU/Village area, which is roughly a 15-20 minute walk through great neighborhoods filled with bars and restaurants. I would definitely recommend the W Union Square park for an experience in a true NYC neighborhood, away from the standard issue hotels of midtown/times sq.

I usually stay here when I stay in Manhattan. While on an individual basis, the hotel's gym, lobby, restaurant, bar, club and staff aren't especially amazing - each are nice and combine well for a very pleasant experience.
