The W gets you a little bit of everything.The W is in a great location for many, but not for all. Union Square is well located with many shops, restaurants and residential areas nearby. The subway station is all well connected.Rooms are small, typical of Manhattan, and some rooms have odd layouts. It is worth it to pay more for a better room if you are going to stay here a while. The hotel is much smaller than other branded hotels so book in advance.

This W is a very nice property located in a great, central area in Manhattan, close to many great restaurants, subway and Union Square. I was able to use an upgrade so was lucky enough to stay in one of the suites with a glorious view from the 21st floor. I found the staff to be somewhat inconsistent, with some extremely accommodating and gracious, while others seemed a bit detached, distracted, though not rude. The Concierge WAS particularly friendly and knowledgeable. Many at the front desk seemed somehow a bit preoccupied; perhaps they were simply busy. I was surprised that the hotel did not always provide a doorman to open/close the door. Not a terribly big deal though I have come to expect this while staying at large, urban upscale properties around the world. Maybe it’s just New York….In case case, the hotel lacks a Club Lounge for Starwood members which was a disappointment, but oh well. The rooms, while a bit austere were very comfortable and well enough appointed and daily housekeeping was excellent. Also, with only two elevators, the wait time for the elevators can be a bit long.I LOVE the fact that this hotel featured the new Keyless Access via the iPhone Starwood app; the future here now! :) I DID have a problem with it as I had two consecutive reservations and their system still has a few software bugs to work out. Also, for frequent travelers with iPhone or Watch know that if you initially signed up for keyless entry with a different device you must unregister the device and re-register. I experienced an issue as I had initially registered with an iPhone that was recently replaced due to a hardware issue. But once we got that sorted out with a tech savvy manager’s help, it was awesome and worked flawlessly. Love it. Bottom line , I can recommend this property. It is a very nice hotel with only a short wish list of “if only’s...”

I was impressed with the way this property has upgraded its rooms. We were there 2 years ago and thought our room was tired. This time we had a great room with fresh appointments. The location is fantastic and you feel comfortable there. The only comment is that the staff is no outwardly friendly. You don't get that constant "hello, how are you, what can we do for you" from any of the staff. The door people were pleasant enough, but not warm. The same experience at the front desk. It wasn't unpleasant, just not that "Disney" approach of going out of their way to engage guests. All in all this was a great stay and I would return.

I like this hotel and have stayed here quite a few times as the location works well for what me. That said, it may not work well for you and the hotel while it has its upside has, for my money, a fatal flaw. Might as well get to the flaw first. The restaurant, which is in the lobby, is owned by another entity. That could or could not be a bad thing, but the reason it rubs me the wrong way is after paying close to $20 a day for wi-fi in the hotel you can not access it in the restaurant. I find that annoying and takes an otherwise solid hotel and puts it in another category. My previous visits I did not eat at the hotel and this time I only had breakfast, which, you was not all that good and the coffee was, how do I say this, horrible. So, that did it for me. Next time another location.

My daughter, two grandchildren (ages 4 and 9) and I shared two rooms at this hotel, where we've stayed before. The rooms were great, comfortable and clean, BLISS amenities, which I love,provided, and good food in the restaurant. The location is perfect for NYC. I do have one comment and one suggestion: when I arrived, the car service driver had my bags in hand and I had already tipped him extra just to put them inside the hotel.....the staff outside snatched the bags and said he wasn't allowed in. This was very disconcerting.Secondly, I was with two young children who wake up early and though I had brought things to entertain them we still wound up in the lobby early in the am waiting for the restaurant to open. It would be great if there were things in the room (coloring books, toys) or even a little section in the lobby/waiting area, for children. I did notice several young children staying there. Overall, however, it was a wonderful stay and I plan to return soon, with or without family

Third year in a row that we have stayed here. Was a little concerned when I read a few reviews that were less that flattering!! I'm pleased to say that everything is first class.ALL of the staff were cheerful accommodating and professional at every interaction. One thing is a must- a higher up room overlooking Union Square. You will not be disappointed.

This was our first stay at the hotel. It is right on Union Square which is central to so many things. All of the restaurants we ate at were right there. Our wonderful room on the 17th floor had no view but was loud with the constant buzz of building system noise. Better soundproof windows would fix this. The room is comfortable and large by NY standards and with a high ceiling. A small closet with built in drawers was enough for us. We found the bed to be comfortable. We encountered pleasant staff though the doormen were distracted. They have complementary coffee in the lobby from 6-10am, but none in the room. All in all we would try it again.

Summer stay. Staff was so accommodating and room was lovely. Great location, walked everywhere. I even got referrals from the concierge for a spa ( right across the street).Overall very pleasant experience, I will definitely return on my next visit and hope to make this my regular hotel when in the city.

Hotel has great view of Union Square Park if you are on the right side of property.Check in slow, ask for a room higher up.Rooms are good size " mega room".Hotel well maintained,they charge for bottled water"7" $,Internet 14.95 daily.Better than most hotels in area.

The team at W NYC Union Square are serious about service! Everyone from the IRD attendant, to the bartender (LOVE the watermelon margaritas!), to the Welcome Office manager, and especially the fantastic Jose at the Door, all deserve HUGE kudos. A must stay whenever staying in NYC.

The staff here is amazing - from start to finish, they were friendly, upbeat, and amazingly helpful. The hotel is very centrally located, the rooms were normal sized (which in NYC means HUGE), and clean, and the location was central to everything. Metro right outside the hotel and a great restaurant bar.

Doesn't get much better than this! Very nice hotel next to Union Square, guestrooms are average size (some would say larger than most you see in NYC), some sound-proofing issues (you're right on the street and with all the police/fire/ambulance sirens going day and night, pretty hard to block them all out). You know how when you go to a hotel you often get one (hopefully not more than that) staff member who is just not up to par in delivering good customer service? Not here - EVERYONE we interacted with were tip-top! From our more-than-friendly check-in, to always getting a "good morning" from housekeeping staff you encounter in the hallway (and they say it first), to the doormen, all were just as friendly and professional as you could hope for! For me, the level of service trumps room quality, so this place was simply awesome! Thanks for a terrific weekend, W New York - Union Square! Hope to visit you again soon!

Second time I come here and I have the same feeling that people here are not properly trained to be courteous. I am an SPG guess and when I checked in today the first thing that I was asked for what "What can I do for you?". Did not even want to look at my SPG Passbook on my phone. For someone walking into the lobby of a hotel with a luggage I found the question to be either offensive or not smart. Second, I had the bad experience to have my CC declined because it was the first time I was using it out of my state. The lady in the lobby was almost happy to see this misfortune happening to me. Well a phone call later I got things fixed with my CC and I was offered a room in the 19 floor. The room is the worst you can get in NYC = facing a wall or other rooms. I called the front desk to have it changed. After 4 attempts to get someone to answer my call I was offered the privilege to go down to either the 3rd or 5th floor and enjoy a view of the construction going on the building (scaffolding, noise...).At least I have a very expensive room on the 19th floor with no view and I am in NYC. Thank you W New York Union Square.

I stayed here several years ago with old sad rooms. I was reluctant to come back but this was where I was put up for business. It has cleaned up so much. The rooms were new and clean. Amenities were amazing. Bliss. The best. Concierge Bernarde and Tanya are the best. They helped make my stay amazing with individual attention that went over and above. I would stay here again. Good location. Great staff.

I have stayed at this hotel several times over the last 10 years. I keep coming back to it because of its fantastic location. Most of my recent stays have been for pleasure for 1-2 nights at a time. This past weekend we stayed for 2 nights and had a great room (corner room with great views). What makes this hotel so good is its ideal location. You are in the heart of Union Square and on the edge of the Flatiron district but also a short walk downtown to Soho. Room sizes are a decent size for NYC and the extra high ceilings make the rooms feel even larger. Bathrooms are ok, not great and starting to look like they could use a refresh. The hotel has a nice vibe to it and a great restaurant/bar on the first floor to grab a drink before heading out for the evening or a night cap after dinner. The past few times I've stayed here the service was inconsistent. On our most recent stay this past weekend we felt as if some of the staff wasn't on par. Example, on our way back from dinner Saturday night as we came through the door the doorman was sitting and texting on his phone as we went by him back into the hotel. When we checked out we carried our luggage downstairs. As we approached the front door the doorman starred at us and didn't offer to help us with our bags. I had to put my bags down, approach him and ask for help before he actually took our bags. If the hotel could consistently deliver attentive and friendly service across "all" its staff on a consistent basis I would rate it higher. I will definitely stay here again because of its location and decent rooms. I have already adjusted my expectations.

I've stayed at this hotel preciously without issue. This time, I booked a junior suite, arrived at the hotel around 2:00pm...checkin is at 3:00pm, and waited in the lobby. Just to be told that the previous occupants had a late checkout. Ummm it would've been nice if someone had told us before hand. So we had to take a lesser room, just to avoid waiting an additional hour. Not to mention, when we first arrived our bags remained unattended in the middle of the lobby even though it was known that we didn't have a room yet. We had to take a lesser room, on a different floor in order to avoid having to wait an additional hour for the room we originally booked. It wasn't hypoallergenic, as requested, and it wasn't as though we didn't make it clear what time we were coming. Since we had to take a lesser room I had to sleep on a pull out bed which is unacceptable since I have to pay as much money as anyone else. I will NEVER stay here again. The unprofessionally my was abundant and did not start off my ONE day in NYC correctly.

The Union Square Farmer's Market had booth after booth of fresh vegetables and fruits. The flower booths rivaled Pikes Place! I was amazed at the variety of local produce, and the quality and value was excellent. They also had baked goods, but I didn't check them out.

From the location to the quality of the rooms I will keep on coming back here. The staff always go above and beyond the call of duty and you feel like you are in the heart of the real city.There are plenty of places to eat out nearby.

I stay at the Union Square W Hotel once every 4 - 6 weeks and it has just undergone a refurb, Rooms a good size, however due to the architecture of the building, a high floor does not always mean a good view. This establishment's #1 benefit is it's location, the food at the restaurant is good but not great, service is great, overall a well rounded NY Hotel experience.

We always stay at the W Hotel Union Square. The rooms are spacious, and light.. The negative side of this hotel is that there are only 2 working elevators, so the wait can be extremely long (15 min)... also, the doorman are missing in action. We helped a woman, with a double stroller, and all of her shopping bags. She was trying to open the door and the doorman were super engaged in chatting with each other.. Other than that its a terrific hotel

I've stayed at some of the other NYC W's, as well as the Seattle W, and my experience has been hit-or-miss. Despite that, I've remained curious about the W Union Sq over the years. So I decided to stay here from May 27-30 in a Wonderful Room in room 1603, and I'm glad I did.Unlike my last 2 W stays, the bellhops were generally attentive. However, Jose was incredibly helpful and personable in assisting me with check-in, discussing the hotel's features and bringing my luggage to my room. And while W's are known for being trendy with slightly cool personnel, Jose gave a nice welcome to the hotel and a warm hello or nod in passing in the lobby for the remainder of my stay. So, if you're planning to stay at the W Union Square, find Jose; he'll be very helpful.In my experience with this and every other W I've stayed, the front desk just isn't efficient. There was 1 person at 3pm and I have yet to visit a W where there is an active separate SPG check-in/-out line. So, I think there was 1 person in front of me, and check-in took between 10-15 mins. **On the upside, and in all fairness re: recognition of SPG benefits, my requests for a high floor and corner or near corner room away from the lifts were both honored. Room 1603, a Wonderful Room, was exactly that: wonderful. I didn't need a large room or suite for this trip. The decor was exactly what you'd expect of a W, and I def enjoyed the choice in decor at the W Union Sq and my room. It is evident that form and function were taken into appropriate consideration to accommodate travelers and their needs across the spectrum. There was a fair amount of storage space for bags. It was on a high enough floor that street noise wasn't a problem with a great view of the Empire State Bldg. As for the location of this W, and for someone who used to live in Manhattan, I think the W Union Square has the best location of any W in NYC (unless, of course, you're in NYC on business and work on Wall St., then the W Downtown). Union Square quite literally brings all of NYC to the hotel's doorstep. Anything that you would need/want is in the vicinity of Union Sq. If you need to go farther, Union Sq/14th St. is a major junction for subways, providing convenience with little to no need for subway transfers. Also, this W is in a relatively quiet area as far as street noise is concerned -- compared to the majority of hotels you'll find in NYC.Some criticism...At the time (late May), the lifts were being worked on. I don't recall seeing signage advising guests when the lobby lifts were working or not. And, while I understand maintenance needs to be addressed, the passage way and vestibule-like area in back and to the right of the reg lobby lifts felt like I had left the W and its swanky decor and walking into a janitors closet. The area should have keep consistent with the hotel's decor. The lift bays/area on the 16th floor were also shabby for a SPG Cat. 6.I enjoyed my time at the W Union Square and would visit again.

W hotel never fails us. We stayed there for 4 nights. The location is right in Union Square, the park is across the street and on the weekend there's a lovely farmer's market going on and I could hang out there all day long and look at the people and the veggies and breads and performers. The staffs were friendly and extremely helpful, especially Tanya - our W Insider was fabulous. She recommended places for us to see and which are the restaurants and bars worth experiencing. We particularly like Dear Irving bar which serves fancy drinks & elevated bites and is located within 5 min walking distance from W hotel.

Overall enjoyed my stay of two nights but spent the overwhelming amount of time working/ The two things that hit me in the solar plexus were the price of the internet connection in the room and the price of breakfast which is a curse of all the large chain hotels in New York. The one that breaks this habit will clean up.. such as offering bed and breakfast for small surcharge up frontPeople at the reception, in the bar and restaurant were all very helpful and pleasant

We stay in the city a lot for concerts, weekends away & dinners with friends. As Starwood members we have used points to stay at all of the W & Westin hotels in NY but the Union Square W is our favorite. Beautiful building in great neighborhood location with restaurants, shopping & movie theaters right nearby as well as the farmers market in Union Square. We've been upgraded several times & the desk staff & doormen who take car of our car are great. Rooms are smallish but comfy, clean & nice bathrooms. If you want to get away from mid town madness try this gem downtown .

Stayed for two nights while my company was participating in an event held at Union Square. Great location, very nice rooms, surprisingly quiet. Everyone I dealt with on staff was very friendly, but I have to give an extra huge thanks to Stella at the front desk, whose warm helpfulness on a Saturday night may have saved my job!

nice place in a very nice location.been there so many times with my wife even when we were engaged.last trip for the 4th of july, we got an upgrade as well.staff always friendly, rooms are good.recommended to all my friends.

from the start to the finish our stay at the w was fantastic. we were greeted like family. every one we meet took such good care of my family.the restaurant and bar wasexcellant,great food and drink.tanya the w insider was one of the sweetest and nicest person s you can ever meet at this hotel.bernardo at the concierge desk took care of our every need100% with a smile. our doorman jose alwaysthere to help. after this trip my family doesnt want to stay anywhere but the w union square

I stay at many Starwood properties and as a platinum guest the service is almost always great. However this time we were taken care of beyond expectations. Tanya - our W Insider was fabulous with arranging for a special welcome and recommending places to see and restaurants to experience. It was my wife's first stay in the Union Square area of New York and we loved the trip. Our room was excellent, service was outstanding and all of the staff were great. Great location.

I love the W Union Square.Convenient to so much of NYC.Typically comfortable rooms and amenities.But the highlight is the staff.Friendly. Attentive. Exceptional demeanor even in the face of troublesome guests.Typically excellent, well trained staff for Starwood.Kudos W Union Square.

I have been staying here for 8 1/2 years. The location is amazing and all you need from great food, exercise and coffee is so close. Now the staff is a whole other topic, the team at the WUS is AMAZING! They make you feel like family. From Nelson at the Front Desk, Charles, David, Alex and Jose at the front door to Darlene in housekeeping. Oh, I can't forget Tanya and Chris!I don't stay anywhere else when I'm in NYC and there are certainly plenty of great places to stay in NYC. They are also dog friendly!

This was our 5th stay at the W UnionSquare. Good news...2 of the 3 elevators are back in service. We only had one short wait. The rooms are NYC small sure, and maybe getting a little tired. However,you can't beat the neighborhood. Union square is the best. Much less crazy than soho or mid town. Staff was helpful. I was given a lovely Platinum upgrade to a suite, thanks front desk! My 2 teen aged daughters think it's the coolest place on earth. We will be back.

I flew into NYC for a business meeting for the week. I am a very loyal SPG Corporate member so I have stayed in a vast amount of hotels in my life. Yet I had never stayed at a W Hotel. It all began upon checking and finding out that my 11th floor room had no elevator service and was forced to go through a maze to use service elevators which the hotel did not tell me about as they were taking my money. Secondly, after arriving into my decent room it was rather warm. So I waited a few hours and the temp was going up not down. Around 4pm I told the front desk of the issue and they offered to switch me room. I agreed but I would have to do so after I got back from my meeting. Upon my arrival back at the hotel I told the front desk person (MARIA) who was the rudest person I have ever met in my life. She asked "Are you really going to switch rooms now?" I said of course I have a 4pm check out and it extremely hot in that room. Finally I had to get the manager who was completely clueless to the situation then switched me room to another floor. I packed my things and with no help and 6 suitcases I had to maneuver through a maze to get to the service elevator again with no offering help from the hotel or even a luggage cart. Upon getting in the new room I realized that they had downgraded my room. Call me crazy but when there is a problem that is the hotels fault you would think they would atlas give you the same or better than you had. Instead I got a room that was half the size and when I told the manager he argued that it was the same. Call me crazy but when you got from a large shower and separate bathtub to a standup shower right beside the toilet and sink is not the same size. The bath robes were dirty the room had chipped paint everywhere and floor had all kinds of hair there was even a brown spot on the comforter.

I cannot even begin to describe how wonderful each and every staff member is at this location. Although there are many good hotels in the city, the people who work here is what keeps me coming back each and every time. From the doormen, the bar and restaurant staff, the concierge and the front desk and housekeeping, you are ensure a great visit from check in to check out! Stella Draksin has to be one of my most favorite people at the W. This is the kindest, sweetest person, and always makes me feel at home :) Tanya is cheerful and she always make a point of saying hi to me by name. Victor is another great addition to the awesome staff. Customer service is out of this world and the location is tough to beat. Thank you for everything!

We've stayed in two other W Hotels in NY, and this one may be the best. The room was spacious, king size bed very comfortable, bathroom large and well equipped. Staff is very friendly and location is superb! Wish room had one more chair, though. There is only a desk chair, which leaves half of a couple without a place to sit.

I'm a 10 year Platnium SPG guest. This property does a terrible job recognizing any sort of status or offering any upgrades or ammentites to top tier guests. Be forewarned - you are better off staying at other SPG properties in the area....but there is moreThe technology at the hotel is sub par and embarrassing how the staff uses it...The knew iPhone key app doesn't work properly here. The front desk couldn't properly work it and didn't understand how it worked on check in...I was sent a bill via email from another room in the hotel with my name on it and other room charges and credit card and personal address information. Very scary!The hotel later in my stay had the "key machine" go down and wanted to escort me up to my room since they couldn't make keysAll and all I would never stay here again. For $500 a night you are better off elsewhere with a staff and a hotel that recognizes loyalty better and can work their own technology.

I love the location in NYC. Close to everything and the staff is amazing. In particular Kwame is the hardest working man on the planet. I don't think this guy ever sleeps. Always with a smile and a bottle of water. Best door guy ever!tC

We stay at the W Union Square at least once a year as both my adult children live in the area. The rooms are different each time we come and we have learned to ask for certain amenities like a bath tub. Tanya, the manager?, was so kind and helpful. We came for a week and had a lovely room. Service was great. Will be here again next year...to be sure!!

We stayed just one night for the Yankees game and old timers day. We had a high floor and great view of the Freedom Tower, Union Square Park, etc. The room wasn't huge, but it was comfortable and the thermostat allied sufficient control to keep up cool enough all night - none of the "shut off the air at night" trick indulged in by so many hotels. The morning coffee in the lobby, NYTimes, and all around pleasant and helpful people were all appreciated. We stay in NY often and this combination of reasonably priced hotel and great area makes the Union Square W a place we come back to frequently.

I don't know why customer service at the hotel section can be so bad when the bar is run so well. As I walked in with two large bags I was never offered help and was told by the front desk I couldn't get into my room until 3:00. This makes sense but it was 2:40. I asked if there were any rooms available for checking in now. She rudely repeated 3:00 is check in. This same attitude appeared to be contagious through out the rest of the hotel staff. In the room there was one bar of soap for the sink. I was told it's also for the shower. I understand the minimalist theory but for $600 a night I woukd like the option of having two bars of soap.
user_name:
Hunter A
New York City, New York

review_body: Booked a room for 330.00/night for a quick trip to NYC, one month prior to arrival. I arrived and my room was not only tiny, but dark. I opened the curtains to find 4 massive buildings with a view of 5 inches of sunlight. It was horrible. There was an old bathroom, no tub and old dirty tile. 3 inches of hanging closet space.I went to the front desk with bags in hand and asked to be moved to another room. He threw his hands up in the air and said "if I change your room, then I will have to put someone else in it who paid more money!" I was shocked. He said the hotel was full and I was out of luck. I explained very nicely that the room was dark, and substandard to my W Hotels experience. I was stuck for 4 days in a dungeon. Don't stay in Room 916.

Stayed here and was put in a larger suite which was very nice compared to the other W hotels in Manhattan. The location is prime and the downstairs bar area is good. I had a couple unprofessional issues with my stay there and had to notify the manager. The manager was quick to respond and helped to solve the situation properly which was the mark of a good hotel. Would give it another try next time I'm in the union square area.

I brought friends from Austin here in May, and we all loved it!!! I worked in this building when it was The Guardian Life Insurance so the structure still holds a piece of my soul. It has all of the standard W amenities plus it is in a great location & my old neighborhood. Love!
user_name:
Luvs2TravelAnywhere
New York City, New York

review_body: So I've had poor experiences with the W before (Dallas, Doha), but I love the Union Square neighborhood so thought I'd give this edition of the W chain a try. And quite quickly, that sadly familiar, somewhat lackadaisical, resting on its laurels W experience started showing through pretty fast. Exhibit #1: double espresso at 0545? Sure, no problem. But 22 minutes. And $20! What else are they doing at 0545 - because ... Exhibit #2: ... breakfast only starts at 0700. Come on, in New York?! Really?Exhibit #3: front desk answers the phone by yelling "Front Desk" at me, like they imagine this is the way people do things in New York. Again, a 'come on' moment. What about 'Good Morning' first. Exhibit #4: parts of the room were just not cleaned. Hairs and fingerprints on shiny surfaces, and areas behind the desk, just not hoovered. OK, these are first world problems, you say, and normally I'd overlook these things. But the reason I mention them is that if you're paying a bit over $500 for a room as I did, I really think you have the right to expect something pretty seriously special. Even in New York. And once again, The W failed to deliver special. Only average. Hence the rating. W can, and should do better.

The room was fine: high floor, so we had a view of the West Side. Some quirky things: the shower door had no inside handle, so to close it you had to pull it shut, and move your hand quickly out of the way. Water bottles were in the room - at $7 or $9 each. Really? The package containing condoms, lubricant and breath mints was mixed in with the chips and cookies. All in all, an okay hotel, which we picked for the location.
user_name:
Ron S
Long Valley, New Jersey

review_body: Stayed for one night. As Starwood Gold members, got upgraded to a large a Wonderful Room. Spa like bathroom with Bliss toiletries and a great bed made for a wonderful stay! Stroll over to Union Park and enjoy the local vibe or a bite tea eat nearby! If you bring a car, park yourself at a nearby garage. You'll save $10-$20 on what the hotel charges guests.

When you've flown direct to New York spending 15 and a half hours in the air there are four words that you never want to hear and a hotel should never speak. 'We are full tonight.' Come to think of it if you have a booking then it doesn't matter if you've only travelled for half a minute. It's simply not acceptable. The hotel made arrangements to stay at another location and subsequently treated my wife and I well but it's tough to make up for that start. The hotel itself is situated in a great location overlooking union square which allows easy walking distance of all the villages and some of the best neighborhoods. The bar is noisy and fun mixing a work and social crowd in the early evening until the office workers head home. The rooms are well equipped, well looked after and well stocked in the minibar. Once you leave the bar and reception area it's quiet and relaxed. The gym is well equipped and cool which is just what you want. I'd stay here again but only if I know I am going to get my room!

Hot water in the morning took ten minutes to reach our room. Only one elevator worked, the others being serviced, why not do it at night???Finally got two to work. During this service process had to take service elevator, very dirty and bad odor.

MY FAVORITE PLACE to stay when I visit New York City!! I love the location ... the Hotel ... and most of all ... the service!! The people that work there make me feel at home when I am there for a visit!! On one visit, when I was going to get a cab to Bloomies, the doorman said it would be much quicker to take the subway ... at the time, I knew nothing about the subway ... well, he walked me over to the station ... helped me buy a pass ... and told me exactly what to do after I walked thru the turnstile ... and let's just say that I've been taking the subway ever since ....

I stay in a lot of hotels so expectations are high- this hotel was ok but I expected more. The shower needed a good scrub, the power outlet in the bathroom didn't work (for the hairdryer), no coffee machine in the room (as is almost standard now), and the noise is quite loud from the street. However, the lobby and restaurant are great meeting spots so if you're looking for a hotel that's easy for meetings, this was convenient. And in the evenings, the bar was quite nice.
user_name:
Jess_Bkln
New York City, New York

review_body: I will start by saying that I am not an "easy" customer. The Union Square W has been making my business travel tolerable over the past 6 months. I'm in the city at least 2-3 times per month and the service gets better with every single visit. In addition, the quality of the rooms has been improved by upgrades over the past couple of years. The entire staff from the GM Bill Bunce to Peter Yeung and the entire desk staff as well as the housekeeping crew....everyone has stepped up their game and it amazes me how they continue to wow me with excellent service every time I visit. I will only stay here when I am in the city as long as there are rooms available.

Where do I begin. First of all, it has been my experience that the "W" hotel brand is generally not service focused. And, those who stay there generally do not know what good service is as well - as demonstrated by their juvenile behavior.The attitude by many at the front desk is horrific. In-room dining is expensive and poor. Service at Irvington was consistently terrible and slow. Add to this a chaotic atmosphere combined with an elevator situation which caused 10 (not kidding) wait times along with a $600 room rate for a kind of basic room? No thanks. Save your money...or go to the Hyatt across the street.

We enjoyed our weekend with friends and family. Only one elevator was working so we used service elevators and were aided by the staff. Good service at the bar and room service. Helpful staff at the front door. Clean room. Farmers market across the street, good restaurants, beautiful flowers for sale, lots of really different people to watch, a parade, lots of dogs, many kinds of food to try, friendly atmosphere, helpful security people and spectacular camera shots. It was a magic weekend. We're going back as soon as we can.

Very classy hotel, great location, nice room, not enough outlets Great bar, small but classy lounge area. Very nice restaurant with great service. Lots of great restaurants right around the hotel. I would recommend this to anyone. A little pricey though.

Loved this hotel and Union Square is wonderful. The rooms are relatively large for NYC and the bar and restaurant is terrific. Excellent hotel with a cool vibe and great service.Of all the W's I've stayed in, this is one of the best.

Don't underestimate the importance of a great doorman in NYC---The W Union Square has one of the best. Part valet, part historian, part concierge, these gentleman are warm, welcoming and just terrific. David, in particular, made our trip very special. Great hotel, great location, nice rooms and overall welcoming.

We had booked and prepaid for a corner room with view and they did not honor it. What made me more aggravated was the staff on duty that night were not truthful about it. Also there were elevator issues the entire time we stayed there. Not consistently working, very inconvenient. Maid was outstanding, and some of the valet and door staff were first rate.JP

I have stayed in this hotel many times, sometimes as frequently as weekly. The rooms are always clean, the staff is very nice and I have always enjoyed my stays here. I am not the pickiest of hotel patrons, but I also enjoy quality and like to have a comfortable retreat at the end of a long day for relaxing and preparing for the next day. I have always been pleased at the W Union Square.

I must say this stay was my worst of any W property starting right from check in. When I got to the counter around 1am, there was one woman waiting with nobody at the counter. After a couple minutes, I asked her if she had been helped. She said the desk person had gone to get a manager. The attendant and manager returned a few more minutes later. By the time I am helped by the front desk woman, it's now been several minutes. She attempts to check me in but is having trouble "blocking a room". The manager is unable to assist as he is busy w the first customer. Approximately 10 - 15 minutes into my arrival, I am helped by the manager, who also can't seem to help me out with a room. He even offers me a room that the previous guest had complained smelled of cigarette smoke! I politely decline. By the time I am booked into a room right in front of the elevators it has been about half an hr since my arrival. I thought my troubles would end there but, alas, it was not meant to be. The next day, I spent approximately 12 minutes waiting for the elevator before I had to give up and call the front desk. The elevators had been functioning very slowly since my arrival but this was just ridiculous. He told me one elevator was out of service and another was busy (not sure what that means). He promised to send up an elevator with an attendee. I waited a few more minutes before giving up and taking the stairs. One cancelled uber charge later...The rooms are also nowhere near as modern looking as I have come to expect from a W. My bathroom looked quite dated. Overall, I am very unimpressed. I check out tomorrow and will see what comes of my complaints in person and update. I check into the Dream Hotel (W did not have any rooms available for an additional night) and am very glad that what I thought to be an inconvenience earlier may actually turn out to be a blessing in disguise.

Genuinely friendly and professional service made this the best of my three stays at the W Union Square. Excellent location, walk everywhere or jump on the Union Square 14th Street subway. Not the newest property but pretty well maintained.Nick and Stella at the Front Desk were tops with problem solving and tourist assistance. The housekeeping service (18th floor 16-17 May) did a great job.Look forward to stay number 4!

I have stayed at the W Hotel Union Square twice in the last three months. Their staff's commitment to providing a perfect stay was unparalleled. My room was beautiful, the bed luxurious, the entire staff courteous and extremely helpful.

If your visit mostly has you downtown this is a decent choice if you can afford it. Dep on your taste, rooms colored bright blue and red either thrillingly modern or Ikea showroom meets Alice in Wonderland (each W is designed differently). Very comfy with very good service and usual amenities. Bathtub and/or view rooms on request (dep on your $ level--pay more and get higher floor). $15 wi-fi is def a "luxe" hotel anachronism and a service faux-pas. Best nearby resto is Union Square Cafe--reserve in advance or arrive early for seat at the bar.
user_name:
Knohanz
New York City, New York

review_body: I'm a longtime SPG member and have been to all the W hotels in NYC. This one in Union Square is easily the best, and the service quality and fit and finish of the rooms is very good, meets my expectations. Actually I managed to get upgraded to a suite so it was even better :). The concierge directed us to a fun place nearby for brunch and the doorman showed us a shortcut to dinner the prior night. I heard the W New York (on Lexington) was a mess, so I was very glad to come back to Union Square for the exemplary service and experience I've come to expect from SPG properties. Highly recommend it!
user_name:
bulgogs
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is such a wonderful place to stay. The staff is so friendly and warm. The rooms are quite large for New York. The location can't be beat. I have stayed several times for work and never had a negative experience. In fact, I recently became ill and needed to go home right away. They were so accommodating. The gave me a 4pm late checkout and waived my cancellation for the next night. I highly recommend this hotel.

I recently expressed my dissatisfaction with the way this hotel treated platinum guests. I want to recognize the fact that they listened and really responded well. On my last two stays I have been given amazing upgraded rooms- really all I had asked forThe new restaurant is delightful and the proximity to great restaurants is awesome. Thank you for listening. I can now give a glowing 5 star review - well done W Union Square- I'll be back!!

Writing this from my room while taking a quick break from meetings. Guest room is a great size for NYC, clean, well appointed and very comfortable. Living Room (lobby) and lounge areas are very cool and have a very approachable staff. I am only on the 6th floor but have a great view of downtown and Union Square. Location is sensational with subway across the street and numerous restaurants/bars in the neighborhood. Union Square market is awesome and across the street. This place is a quintessential W and worth the premium. Looking forward to returning on a leisure visit.

In New York for a few days visiting relatives who live close to Union Square so the location was perfect for me but would have been great anyway given proximity of good bars, restaurants etc. I arrived a little weary from travel - too early for my official check in time - but was able to go straight to my room. The reception staff were friendly and efficient.The room was spotless and spacious. On my first evening, however, I had to telephone reception to report a problem with the bathroom. Maintenance staff arrived almost immediately and couldn't have been more helpful or apologetic. They had me moved swiftly to another room on the same floor - an upgrade by way of an apology. That room was superb - great views, well stocked and very comfortable.I'll definitely stay here again next time.

I came to my stay at this hotel with great expectations, because I have heard great things about the brand. When I arrived, a bit tired and anxious to go to my room, I was kept waiting for several minutes as the man at the desk methodically neatened his stacks of cards, and obsessively cleaned and wiped down his work surfaces. Too pretentious by far. There is a popular restaurant and bar on the ground floor, but it was too loud for me, and the hip loud music follows you into the elevator via the sound system. Ouch. The room was spacious and clean, and the bathroom was exceptional, but the gilded mirror, the metallic silver fake alligator skin seat upholstery, and the S & M style pillows, were just plain creepy. The conference hall on the second floor is old world beautiful (the hip designer didn't touch it). The elevators were so slow I gave up using them, and walked my seven floors in the lovely marble stair well (also untouched, and with no piped in music) for my three day stay. Someone younger, with different taste, might like it. I was happy to leave. There is a great show - The 39 Steps - across the street, however, and I enjoyed the convenience.

The W Hotel in the heart of Union Square in NYC is a great hotel. The rooms are spacious, the staff friendly and there is a trendy restaurant/bar onsite. The W is in a great location close to shopping, restaurants and parks. We stayed on the 15th floor facing the park and it was relatively quiet for being in the city. Subway access is nearby so going elsewhere in the city is easy.

If you want a hotel room that is as loud as inside of a plane, don't miss the W New York - Union Square. Earplugs included! Enjoy your unrelaxing, sleepless night!We arrived with a bigger group and had to wait more than 2 hours to get a room, which was booked already in advance. They delivered the wrong luggage to my room and I needed to go find my own luggage from downstairs.The room I got, 415, had a huge ventilation system just outside the window. It was really, really loud in there. I went to the front desk and asked them to change my room, to which they said that there was no room available at the moment, but one would become available within an hour or so. I went to dinner and when I got back, they claimed that I had never asked for a room change, which then changed to that they don't have any rooms available. Only thing they could offer were earplugs.In the room I used a decibel meter to my phone, which showed the room averaging at about 90 decibels. Funny thing is that on the next day while flying back home I got the same readings inside the airplane.

Although we live in the city, we stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway. When we came to check in , we found out that our room wouldn't have been ready for two hours because of repairs. Mickey at the front desk was great - he moved us to a different room that would have been about $30 less. To make up for that, he gave us a $50 credit towards room charges and free continental breakfast for two. I'm not sure how the other room would have been any different anyway - our room was really spacious and had a nice view of Union Square. We were able to get drinks at the lounge/bar area, which were delicious (but expensive, which is expected given that it's at a hotel in Manhattan). The continental breakfast was better than expected, but I wouldn't have paid the $29 per person for it. This is a really great location - it's near a lot of shopping and restaurants. You could easily walk to a lot of different downtown neighborhoods. It's also right on the 4/5/6 and N/Q/R, which makes going elsewhere in the city really easy. There's definitely an upscale vibe here, but more modern and relaxed than the luxury hotels in midtown (and less expensive, too).
user_name:
amalance
New York City, New York

review_body: Great concierge, comortable hotel in great location.Bernardo in concierge made the experience a very good one with some great dinner reservations and suggestions in general. Bernardo was a pleasure to deal with, friendly, thoughtful and excellent follow up. I will be back.Thank you

Stayed for second time - 2 nights. Location is great but price seems a bit high. Front desk interaction was positive. Room is well done and not too small. Had a few breakfast meetings in restaurant area and staff was attentive to my needs and provided good service. Gym is also good.Would recommend and will probably repeat.

Thank you Gerald Tellez and the rest of the knowledgeable and competent staff at W Union Square. Your directions and referrals of places to eat and best ways around the city were spot on. The view of Union Square was very impressive. Gerald recommended eating at Irvington. The restaurant in the hotel and I am glad we did. The staff was all smiles and the food was delicious. Thanks again Gerald. I will definitely be back!

This hotel exceeded our expectations on many levels. We are brand loyal to Starwood but this was our first W experience. It did not disappoint! We had two rooms with a lock-out door so our kids could have the double beds and we could have the king. The rooms were spacious, clean and well appointed.The Union Square area was very nice and had great restaurants and shops. The Front Desk always had a great recommendation for our meals and were always very helpful and courteous.We called a week before our arrival to request something special for our daughters birthday. What they did really shocked us and made our daughter feel extra special during the whole trip. It really was beyond our expectations. Thank you again, W!

A great location for a short trip. A foodies dream location. The Union Square green market adds to the flavor of the neighborhood. Many fine restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Our room was large by New York standards.

My husband and I spent 3 nights at the hotel. Stella at the front desk was able to rush a room for an early check in (noon) after a red eye. Manager Mickey was also very helpful. The bellmen and almost al the staff were very polite and helpful. Our room (2108) was large, bright and spacious. Now the downside. Even though we had a do not disturb sign on the door housekeeping banged on the door and tried to open it waking us up. Housekeeping was also very loud opening and slamming doors in the hallway. Our mini bar had not only not been serviced but when we went to use it, a half drunk bottle of wine was left in the fridge. Management apologized and gave a free bottle which was very nice. Housekeeping didn't come to clean our room until after 4 pm both days even though we had been gone since 10 a.m.. The elevators are under construction and it can take sometimes 10 minutes before you can get one! They forgot our wakeup call on our last day. Luckily I had an alarm which woke us up or we would have missed out flight! I would try this hotel again mainly because the staff is wonderful! Attention to details are lacking.

The manager denied access a friend of mine to come up to my room just because he couldn't remember my last name! By the way my last name is "BAYRAKTAROGLU". Most of my friends have no idea what my last name is. All the manager had to do is call my room and ask me. I had to go downstairs and bring him up. This is definitely not the hospitality W claims to have. I am very disappointed, never experienced such a treatment from W.

The problem with being a "hip" boutique style hotel is that it takes a lot more updating to keep it fresh. The room was large by NYC standards and everything was clean. It just seemed like some of the details are being let go. One example would be my room number was missing a digit, another was the caulk in the shower tub unit was very yellow and there was a rust streak from the grab handle. Nothing awful but I think they need to catch it soon. I thought the lobby bar was excellent had a lot of fun there! Great location

Quite impressed that I arrived at noon and was immediately able to check into a beautiful, clean, wonderful room! Such a relief after a long flight! I only wish I was given instruction about how to use the room key to operate the elevator. Eventually a bell hop gave me instruction. Interesting that during my stay I witnessed 2 other guests also needing help. It also would have been nice to be given additional hotel info at check in. For example, is there a restaurant in the hotel that offers breakfast? Fitness facility? We did go out to eat several times. We also used an online service for takeout food. This was a bit confusing as we gave instruction for delivery service to call our cell upon arrival, but instead the hotel security got involved. A bit awkward. We weren't sure if this meant we were to tip both the delivery service and the hotel security? The entire exterior of the hotel still has scaffolding due to the face lift. However, the remodel didn't cause any extra noise! We were quite pleased with our clean, efficiently serviced, big king room. Temperature was great! Ample room for suitcases, adequately stocked mini bar and bottled water. A bit disappointed that there wasn't free wifi from the room. It's free in hotel living area but too noisy of a location to get serious work accomplished.

This is probably my fourth stay at this hotel and I'm booked there again for Xmas. I was disappointed in this stay and realized that there are some bad rooms here - I guess I've been lucky until now.I got room 2008 - 20th floor and told it was good view because it was so high - previously I've only been on the 8th and 9th. The room unfortunately feels prison-like with a very skinny window. It makes the room dark and hardly any view. Previously I've had full sized windows to the ceiling so this was disappointing. I asked for a kettle and it was delivered quickly but the mug was not delivered. I called down for it and 30 minutes later, it hadn't arrived. I called down again and got an immediate apology and told it was a shift change and that someone would be right up. Someone came 20 minutes later with some paper cups - not helpful.Overall it's a good property in a great location. I've really enjoyed it although I wouldn't call it 'special'. I will be wary of which rooms they give me next time as they're not all created equal. Room service could really up their game based on this experience.

My wife checked in on Friday they swiped the credit card 3 times, the girl was very condescending and told her the card was no good. My wife gave her a different credit card but lo and behold they had charged the original card 3 times. We don't require much attention but respect is high on our list and we certainly weren't treated that way. Spent six figures on a wedding at a different W Hotel Starwood. Mean nothing at this place.

Check in: Very slow even though no on was in line. Couldn't make a key card that worked. Had to return to the front desk twice. Staff were cold and unwelcoming with a "I'm better than you" attitude. Room: A very nice view but was supposedly an upgraded room thanks to my SPG status. I wouldn't want to see a "regular" room if this was upgraded. If the W is trying to be upscale, they need to re-evaluate their plan. Restaurant: Please don't. Get out of the hotel to one of the much better, cheaper area restaurants. Hotel: Minimal pubic spaces. Decent gym and quiet work space near the gym. Lots of artfully arranged green apples...I suppose that's what they think will make the customer believe this hotel is worth it. Location: Although Union Square, like so much of NYC, has been overtaken by chain stores and restaurants, the location is still good with transportation options literally right outside your door and within easy walking distance of some great neighborhoods.

We used to live just off Union Square, so when we return with our kids, we like to stay in the same neighbourhood, so we can go to all our favourite old haunts. We've stayed at the W, Union Square, twice now… first when we had two kids; and now with 3, including a baby. The hotel rooms are looking a bit shabby, smell a bit smoky, and are outdated, but the service is good and the location is fantastic. We love the restaurants in the area (Gramercy Tavern, Casa Mono, ABC Kitchen, ABC Cocina, Union Square Cafe, Num Pang, Tarallucci e Vino, etc.), the shopping (on lower 5th Ave, Paragon Sports, etc), music (Irving Plaza), the Greenmarket, and kids playground. It's also easy to get anywhere in Manhattan via 14th Street/Union Square subway or taxi. The doormen and valets are always super nice and great with kids. The first time we stayed there, one of my sons said he wanted to "be a doorman when he grows up" because one of the doormen, Eddie, was so nice to him. The kids also enjoy the apples and cold drinks at reception, like at all W hotels. Breakfast at the hotel is OK… it's not as good as it was a few years ago, when we lived in the neighbourhood. The bagel with lox was especially disappointing on our most recent visit, particularly because NYC is known for such good bagels. And, with so many good choices in the neighbourhood for lunch and dinner, I wouldn't eat at the W for those meals.

Spent Friday and Saturday night at this hotel with my friend and her mother. Décor was swanky, rooms spacious, beds comfortable. The wait staff was helpful. The bathroom was a bit small for three women to share however the room had a full sized mirror. The views were not all that great out the rather tiny windows but overall our stay was pleasant.

I have stayed in this hotel a number of times, because it is close to my office. There were always something 'wrong', nothing serious, just nuisance stuff. This time it was the drain in the tub. SLOW! By the time I was finished, I was standing in 6" of water. Gross!Paying close to $500 a night, the tub drain should work properly.

Excellent location but dated hotel with weak customer care. We had to change room, first room had kitchen/ smoking smell - second was not much better - we were told it was an upgrade but the room was exactly the same quality. Rooms are not well appointed - hotel feels more like a 3 star hotel.

Great location certainly for visiting NYU students (our son is studying there) and slightly off Union Sq so not too manic when you step out. Good bars and brunch spots very close - especially welcome given the snow!We got a great price in the BA sale so not sure what regular rates are. The restaurant and bar were being refurbished when we were there so can't comment on those.Staff all very good.Room a decent for NYC, very clean, tiny wardrobe space though. Bathroom clean and efficient. Bed very very comfortable!All in all a great city hotel which we will use again when we come back.
user_name:
obefee
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: This hotel was probably one of the hottest properties in town ten or fifteen years ago. It's way overdue for a facelift. Rooms are pretty tired. Location is good. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Meal from the hotel bar was above average.

Great location with proximity to Union Square & Gramercy Park. If you happen to catch the Farmer's Market in Union Square, it's another great experience to have while staying in NYC. Hotel is in line with what one comes to expect from the W Hotel brand so for those who seek out the W Hotels, you'll feel right at home here.The hotel is comfortable for business travelers and leisure travelers alike. Rooms are spacious, noise level is average (can sleep comfortably at night without being disturbed by noise from other guests or city noise). No complaints.

I've stayed at many Ws in the US and all four of the New York locations. There were no major issues or problems with my stay here, and if you need to be in the union square area its a great location, but the actual rooms seemed a little below the normal W standard.Lobby was great- friendly staff, always some kind of complimentary beverages available, and a very 'grand' looking stairway. The lobby bar/restaurant was being renovated during our stay, but there was still some 'living room' space and they had complimentary breakfast items in the AM which made up for the construction space.Compared to other Ws this one was up to par in terms of overall cleanliness and character, but the room was a little blah. Nice bed and a few modern touches as usual, and great bliss products, but the room seemed a little old and plain. Bathroom was definitely older and not as fresh/modern as you'd expect in a W.If you're a fan of Ws, choose this one for the area. If you don't need to be in a specific section of NY, choose the Downtown W in lower Manhattan- definitely my fav of the 4 NY Ws.

I got to the hotel a few hours early, and they had someone get it 100% ready for me within minutes, on top of the complimentary drinks. The initial room was small and one comment to the manager and I was upgraded to the larger room. The front desk people gave me the best advice around town, told me of ways to save some extra money while in the city, and pointed me to places that were fun to go to but not too touristy. It was worth every penny.

This hotel is a great location and close to my daughters apartment, that is why I stay there.If you are a starwood preferred guest do not expect an upgrade unless you complain and then the next time they will upgrade you to a room one step up from their basic room.I really don't think they understand loyalty. Most starwood hotels do and certainly the Fairmont chain do. Will I stay there again, yes but only because it is where I want to be. The front desk staff can be either great or cold and arrogant.

We went to nyc to spend our honeymoon during christmas time. The hotel was crowded but it wasn't a big problem. We booked the corner suite. Awesome view of union square. Very clean bathrooms.Food was good we only tried the Breakfast that is usually served in the room. I would come back to that hotel that's for sure ! wifi is only free in the lobby. We took the 7 days package in the room. A bit pricey but that's NYC !

W Union Square is decoratively appointed, well-sized rooms, Wi-Fi, great location, and lovely ambience. Culturally interesting and welcoming. My go to NY business spot. In-room dining service was consistently good. Accommodated me when I arrived a day early for my reservation.

The staff is wonderful at this hotel and the location is great, however....granted, it was one of the coldest nights in NYC in years - no matter how warm I set the thermostat, the room felt like a refrigerator. I'm not one for heaters in the room when I'm sleeping but....this room was cold even with the heater set to 78'. The bathroom is quite frigid too when the weather is cold. For some reason, the heater only heats the area right in front of the heater vent, other areas of the room are c-c-cold. The elevators took a very long time - one morning I literally waited 10 minutes for the elevator. I understand they were working on one of the 3 elevators so that left 2 elevators for guests. On a positive note, I was there for a conference and the main conference room was beautiful! Again, the staff could not have been more accommodating, however, the hotel needs some a bit of warming up. If you stay there in the cold of winter, ask for an extra blanket - you'll need it!

Am a monthly guest for 8 to 10 years and submit a review every 2 or 3 years but going monthly gives me a perspective few people have. I can truly say that not one visit has ever been a disappointment and to the contrary, the W Union Square is a special hotel that always gets it right. The building is amazing, the warm and talented staff are great, and management is always superlative. Very few things go wrong and when they do, are immediately corrected. The views South and East are incredible. Rooms are spacey, well appointed, and well kept. You have the wonderful Bliss products and bathrobes. The front desk is friendly and efficient. If you're really lucky, Nelson or Eddie will check you in. The door staff are the best....maybe Keith will open the door and hail you a cab. House keeping is extremely professional and the "Stylists" are very good. Gerald is the greatest manager and always keeps everything going smoothly. The vibe of the place is so relaxing, it's THE place to call home when you stay in NYC. My girlfriend and I literally pick this place above any other when we are in the area.

I live a 5 min walk away and decided to book the day of because I was feeling a little under the weather and I wanted to soak in a bath, get room service and rest up.With my email confirmation # booked from their site the front desk clerk (who didn't look up or make eye contact) couldn't find my reservation by name or #. Took my phone with the email to the back office and about 7-8 min later was told there was a glitch and they had it sorted.The room was great, tall ceilings, big windows, comfortable bed. I know NY hotels and that it takes a pretty big suite to get a decent soaking tub, while small here it at least did the trick--but I don't think people are coming to this hotel for the bathroom.It's a great central location in Union Sq to venture out to other parts of the city.Ordered room service, got 25% off...not sure if that is an SPG perk? Which was nice because it offset the $7 delivery charge AND the 20% gratuity. I pressed the In Room Dining button on the phone, got one person who transferred me to another who then finally put me through to IRD. Delivery guy was friendly and super lovely.Great night sleep aided by Nyquil! Had the breakfast hangar put out on the door and promptly at 9:45 my eggs were delivered. Again 25% off which was nice and a new super friendly delivery guy.Loved that check out time was 12, didn't need to ask for any longer. When I went to check out I had to ask them to remove the Wifi ($14.95 for 24h of normal) since I booked from SPG direct and that is a listed benefit. Then she asked if I had a phone call to some number...nope please take that off. Also had my room charge on the bill which according to my email should have been prepaid as that is what the rate was listed as. After 5 min of confirming I wasn't double charged I made my way down to Bowery and back home.A few small hiccups but for people who like the W properties I would say this is much better than choosing the one in Times Sq or for that matter some of the other similar properties in this area.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Justin V
New York, New York, United States

review_body: Back in NYC for my annual retail pilgrimage. The W was the perfect base. Perfectly located at Union Square, a couple of blocks from the subway which made for easy access to all the amazing things NYC has to offer. I'm a big fan of the W, the staff at Whatever Whenever were outstanding - nothing was too hard for them. Love the Bliss products which were abundant. My only criticism - wifi. In other W locations such as Bali, Wifi is part of the deal - charging $15 a day for access from your room isn't OK (which would have been a $150 charge) As a Gold Starwoods member is was incredibly irritating to be told that all the promised benefits of membership were void (including free wifi) because my travel agent has booked my accommodation via Expedia. The person checking me in was beyond rude and frankly a horrible way to start my vacarion. Fortunately the team at Whatever Whenever stepped in and provided access free of charge. I'd absolutely stay here again - but I'll be checking the fine print

This was my second time staying at this property and it did not fail to disappoint. The room was clean and well-appointed, as usual. The room was small, but that is expected in New York. It was quiet and my trip was quick, so I did not get a chance to check out all aspects of the property. I will return.

The good: awesome locationThe bad: pretty much everything else. For a room that cost over $500 per night, they couldn't afford a coffee or Nespresso machine in the rooms? Nope, had to go down to the lobby to get a cup of watered down coffee. Also, the exterior rooms were noisier than other hotels in NY I've stayed in. The constant sirens, honking, trucks, etc from outside were far more noticeable than other places. And for God sake, turn off the freaking loud techno music in the elevators going 24/7. I don't want to hear this crap at 7 a.m. as I'm headed out to a meeting. So, if you're a late 20's to early 30's douche nozzle looking for a cool place to be seen and hang out, this is the place for you. However, if you're like us and just want a normal, nice hotel with regular amenities, then stay somewhere else.

clean and spacious rooms. slow elevators. staff was awesome. left something in the room and manager took me up service elevator to get it why my wife was in the car, solid. bar was very trendy we didnt have anything but looked like a good crowd...

When we travel for business we always stay at W hotels because of the concierges Whatever/Whenever service. I have to thank Robert and Bernardo for their help this week! They coordinated the ordering and pick up of many things for an important client meeting we had in NYC. Its like having your own events team and coordinators at no additional cost. They were FABULOUS! If you are traveling on business this hotel and their amazing staff make your life so much easier! Thank you both! We will be back.

I'm a lifetime platinum Starwood member that has gotten used to being given a decent upgrade at almost every single property I visit. It is always appreciated and I've come to expect it a bit. The reason I've named this review SHAME ON ME is fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me. I find myself again at the W union square and after being LIED to by a desk agent in 2014 who told me there were not upgrades available after I showed him my starwood app showing every room category available, I check in again today and have to literally beg for something other than an ADA room which I called ahead of time and told them I did not need. I am not looking for a Wow Suite or an extreme suite or even a studio suite. Just an upgraded room on an upper floor with a king bed - NO NO NO = again I'm in a room with 2 double beds and a tiny window. I spend over 100 nights per year in starwood hotels - I would suggest that the GM here reach out to the GM at the W in Los Angeles at Westwood ( his name is Mark Eberwein) to learn how to treat valued guests. They literally make you feel like a valued member of the familyParker Meridien here I come. I will be cancelling my 9 night stay in March to stay at another property. It's a shame because the W is in a great neighborhood - but at some point you have to move on if you are not being treated as you expect to be treated. My advice when visiting New York - STAY AT THE PARKER MERIDIEN

Overall: Great location, decent hotel, needs to improve to meet W standards.The bad: 1) The check-in - we are platinum members and the check in person did not know what the breakfast reward was or how it worked. He just told us to "call room service and ask them". 2) The sheets were terrible and super scratchy. I got rug burn on my back arm from sleeping (not joking!!).3) The doormen were non-existent. They opened the door once, and half the time i saw them standing around by the elevators.The good:1) Great location. Close to subways. It is in a populated area, so if you are sensitive to road noise (I don't care) then be sure to request a quieter room. 2) Checkout staff was great. She saved my impression from the first guy being flaky. She also apologized for the inadequacy of check-in. 3) The towels are large and you are provided four.We plan on staying there, are we have every year, it was just slightly disappointing this year. As a platinum member, do not get the breakfast as your reward. Its terrible - $30 bread basket (hello, carb overload - 3 pastries per person) + Coffee.
user_name:
Blondie2846
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We were in the city for the weekend celebrating my wife's Birthday....I called ahead because I wanted to make sure that everything was pre-arranged and perfect for my wife's stay. I spoke to Gene Middleton to arrange for chocolate covered strawberries, champagne and a hand written note to be in the room upon our arrival...and Tanya DeCosta took care of making sure the room was perfect and helped make some recommendations for our itinerary while in town. Both Gene and Tanya were incredibly helpful and very professional. The room was perfect, the amenities were right on time. Tanya even left a wonderful basket of local goodies for us to enjoy, as well.This was a great hotel experience, in a fantastic location.I can't say enough good things...it is important that the hotel is nice...but it is more important that the experience be fantastic. We were not disappointed...it was a superior experience and really helped to make my wife's birthday weekend in New York perfect.

I arrived at two in the afternoon after 30 hours of travel. My room was not ready, which I can understand. They took my number and promised to call me as soon as my room was ready. Two hours later I enquired again and was immediately given a room. No one bothered to call me!Once in the room, I was surprised and disappointed to find that the mini bar is switched off and all drinks are at room temperature!The shower is in the bath - my pet hate. And the 'Hotel info' section on the TV is 'under construction'.All round a disappointing experience. I only stayed here because the business was in the area. Generally, I would avoid the area and certainly the W Union Square!

Started my weekend at the Conrad in Battery Park City. Rooms are nice, Service was sub par. Parking arraignments are ludicrous. Check in clerk a bit snooty for my taste. I am pretty sure my level of education and personal finances at least matches or exceeds any of the hotel employees at the Conrad.but i don't look the part so i get it.i paid for the weekend but left immediately the next morning because the bed at the Conrad was too uncomfortable for my wife.Checked into the W. loved the cool unpretentious staff, the warm welcome and the chic decor.The absolute highlight of our stay was their concierge.  A hip,, personable, Latino gentleman, with a vast knowledge of the area,and the hotel. He made brunch reservations for my wife and me at Table and Spoon and it was a hit. My wife and i loved the food.He then arranged a complimentary dessert served to us at the end of our meal. This concierge is the class of the W. I hope the management knows this.PSThe beds at the W are far superior to that of the Conrad.The concierge at the W is the epitome of what a concierge show be. Hotels take note. The W AT UNION SQUARE WILL GET MY BUSINESS FROM NOW ON. . .

Our weekend in NYC was an anniversary gift, so our stay was all about pampering, indulgence and fun. We were offered a selection of all the NYC Starwood resorts and the W Union Square met all our needs.We stayed in a Spectacular King Room - stylish decor with a great view of the park and farmer's market (Saturday), comfy bed and Bliss bath products. The friendly, unpretentious staff went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. Coffee in the lobby until 10, but when I came down late, they went back and made me some. Hot apple cider was a welcome treat when we came back in from the cold later in the day. And the lobby area was a great place to watch the city go by, curl up with a book or stop for a drink. I really like this location. I generally favor downtown, but wanted easier access to museums and Chelsea for this trip, so Union Square was perfect. The Saturday Farmer's Market is great and I'm always game for browsing at the giant Barnes and Noble right across the street (although Strand, a few blocks down is my favorite) as it the Red Door spa. The Union Square Theater is right next door and there are shops and restaurants in every direction (I still get a kick out of visiting the always pretty/irritated hostess at Coffee Shop across the street at breakfast). It's an enjoyable walk to both the East and West Village, with plenty of cute little shops and coffee houses, and since Union Square is not the night life central, I slept well at this hotel. As for nightlife, there's always something happening right downstairs... and a subway stop a few steps away if that scene doesn't suit you.

This was my first stay in awhile. I booked a junior suite and ended up on the 21st floor. Room was super spacious and comfortable and clean. I like the W Bliss bath products, and its nice to have both a separate shower and bath tub. Although I would comment that if you are tall you might not like their showers because the shower head is installed very low. The only downside was that there must have been some sort of mechanical thing on the roof because it made noise the entire time I was there. The other thing is that one of the elevators is currently out of commission which makes for long waits, and at one point over the weekend they were down to only one elevator. I used the fitness center which was nice, and also had an excellent drink in the bar. The hotel itself is in a great location. I would definitely stay here again.

Nice location, good lobby bar and decent service, but on absolutely no level will you be happy with the hotel room for the price you pay. Besides comfortable beds, room condition and design are extremely disappointing. Ripped wallpaper, crumpled carpet, furniture color and design that boggles the mind and would be a C- for any design student handing in a project.For 280+tax on a mid January night, the level of competition will blow this one away. At the very least try the Hyatt at Union Square.

Stayed at the W several days ago and it was very nice. The location is amazing and very convenient. The room was clean and tidy and the bathroom amenities were nice. I was able to have a drink at the bar and our server was pleasant, prices reasonable and the space was very nice. Knocks? I have two small comments. One, the music in the lobby and elevator was a bit loud! Clearly they are targeting a younger, hipper crowd. Two, the front desk service and concierge could use some polish. I had several interactions with the front desk with multiple people which left me slightly disappointed. Examples: I needed some assistance with printing my airline boarding pass and the woman at the front desk didn't even listen to me or let me finish my sentence before referring me to their self service kiosk. (Not what I needed.) Next, my colleague asked concierge if he could store his luggage after checking out. He was told no and he had to go to the front desk. Finally, I was in the process of checking out and I asked if I could add a room gratuity to my bill. (I didn't have any cash to leave the room attendant.) I was told the W does not offer cash advances (not what I asked) and when I clarified my request, I was told, "No, the hotel doesn't do that. (Fine, I accept that.) I found some cash and asked if I could just run up to the room and I was told, "No - you already checked out." I asked for an escort so I could leave the cash in the room and I was told that they would have to call someone from housekeeping and it might take a moment. Arrgh! Was the service horrendous - absolutely not. But in my one night stay, I had a lot of "no"s thrown at me. I understand a hotel policy or security reasons prevent certain things from being possible, but clients should feel welcome during their stay and not feel they are imposing upon the front desk or concierge. Missed customer service opportunity.

The hotel rooms were great (corner room nice and spacious). The beds were great to sleep on and the room decor was very nice. The location of the hotel makes its convenient to catch the subway with lots of supermarkets close by. I would definitely stay here again if holidaying in New York! Away from the lights and noise of Times Square.

I was out for a walk on this cold January morning and I needed to use the facilities, so I popped into the W. Everyone I encountered was very friendly and welcoming, specifically Nelson at the front desk, William at the restaurant and the one and only Cesar! I was a bit early to wet my whistle, but Cesar didn't make me wait and stopped his setup to set me up. :-)... Sometimes the smallest gesture can make your day! Thanks Cesar for your kindness... (and for anyone so inclined to pay him a visit, he's not bad on the eyes either!)  Nelson, thank you for your warmth and William, thank you for your essence. Your energy is wonderful!Cheers

You should definitely stay here for the location. Union Square is convenient for all the major sights and you can walk to all of the main sights pretty easily. Main observation is that the rooms are pretty small (I am a Starwood platinum member who always gets a room upgrade so I dread to think what a standard room size is) and we had the classic 'NYC' view out the window; a wall about 20 feet from us and no view of the ground or the sky. Staff were average apart from the Whatever Whenever concierge who was terrible and could not have been less interested when we were trying to get some information about a club to head to. Overall, an ok stay in a great location. I have stayed at a lot of the W hotels and this one surprised me.

Thank you for an amazing wedding weekend. From the second we entered your hotel we were greeted by friendly warm smiling faces and assisted with my large wedding dress to the room. They even had champagne and chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room. What an amazing hotel staff you have. We would especially like to thank Peter Yeung.
