He is caring and thoughtful and went the extra mile. The property is beautiful the rooms spacious with spectacular views. They even let us take some great photos in their hallways and grand staircase. I couldn't have asked for a better wedding weekend.

My Wife and I find the W at Union square a great location. Easy access to the subway system and walking distance some great restaurants. The best green market located at union square is also a plus. The staff is most helpful ready to smooth out any little thing that may come up while on the road. On this visit Svetlana from house keeping and David and Earnie both front of house ambassadors were especially helpful. were both looking forward to a return visit...

We had never been to NYC At Christmas, but our family thought it would be nice to stay at the W and see the beautiful city and enjoy shows etc. The W New York-Union Square was a wonderful place to stay. Staff were wonderful and the room was beautiful. Everything was clean and neat. Bathroom was stocked and very clean. When we come back to NYC we will stay at the W

I have stayed at the W Union Square about 7 times over the past few years. My last stay was with my 11 year old daughter. It has always exceeded my expectations. Rooms are nice. Staff is exceptionally friendly and accommodating (Nelson (?) at front desk was very helpful). Room was VERY quiet. Location is perfect to go anywhere and everywhere in NYC. Restaurant is good. Will not stay anywhere else!

Stayed with this hotel in Mid Dec 2014. This hotel is located in the center between downtown up to central park. There is a subway station near to this hotel which is about 3-5 mins walk away.Check in process was fast and efficient. Was given a complimentary room upgrade which we really thankful as we stayed here for 7 nights. The room is spacious with a small bathub. Free Wifi provided at the lobby and the gym. This hotel also provide free green apples :DThere are many shops near this hotel. You can get food easily around this hotel. There is also Walgreen and Bestbuy and Burlington 5 mins away from this hotel. This hotel is not too far from everywhere in Manhattan!

Pros: Excellent locationVery Good ServiceDecent size rooms for the cityCons:Property is a bit past its prime (needs some work)Stayed for one night. Pricing was very good (between 200-300). We were celebrating my wife's birthday, so they freely gave us an upgrade and later a plate of birthday desserts. They happily accommodated an early checkin and late checkout. Beds were excellent. Southfacing window on a high floor gave us a great view of the park and Freedom Tower. Great bars and restaurants within just a couple blocks, didn't need to leave the hotel's vicinity.

Eddie was the GSA that checked me into the hotel. His collar was unbuttoned and tie was undone, which gave him a very unprofessional appearance. Additionally, he had an American flag lapel pin, and the flag was upside down. This is extremely disrespectful and a true disgrace to our country and especially those who fought and lost their lives for his freedom. Needless to say, corporate needs to tighten up their front desk. The original room that I was assigned was facing a bank of HVAC units that was producing an incredible amount of noise, and the old windows could not block it, so I asked to be moved. I was moved, but to another room facing yet another set of HVAC units. I gave up! The room in which I stayed in was dirty! The window frame was extremely dirty with heavy black dirt. Furthermore, there were some artifacts left behind by the previous guest, which is a clear indicator that the room was not properly cleaned nor was it inspected by the housekeeping supervisor. Additionally, the bathroom was very dirty, especially around the shower area and floor.The amenities in the bathroom was nice and there were ample towels, which was needed to layer the dirty floor after I stepped out of the shower. I left the hotel at 0645 and there wasn't a bill under my door, so I stopped by the front desk to check out and grab a cup of coffee since there isn't a coffee maker in the rooms. To my surprise, there wasn't a staff member to be found! That means I was unable to get a copy of my bill for my expense report, and now I will have to fight to get a copy of my bill.There are so many other nicer hotels to stay in New York. Please do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere.

For NYC over the Christmas/New Year holiday we expected high prices from anywhere...but with that should come high quality rooms and service. We checked into a room with other people's hair in the bathroom (in the shower and on the bath mat). Upon explaining to the front desk these issues (and the fact that we had all feather pillows though we requested no feathers due to allergies), they were apologetic and quick to respond. They switched out the pillows and removed the foreign hairs, but didn't look like they did anything else to clean the bathrooms. Overall, the rooms just felt dirty, and for $400/night, it shouldn't feel that way. My interactions with the front desk was good, but my mother said they were rude to her when she was also working through some issues with them.The front door men were good at opening the door for you about half of the time and the other half of the time they were too engaged their own conversations to notice you were coming in. The food and drink at their restaurant was decent though pricey...somewhat expected. The location was great though. And the mattresses were comfortable. Overall, would say this was an average hotel masquerading as a fancy boutique hotel.

If you wish a clean, comfortable well located Manhattan Hotel without overspending, I recommend the W @ Union Square. Plenty of hot water, great beds and well appointed rooms on the small size. Staff is great. Quite hard to find better in the $200 - 250., per night range.If you're up early, their complementary coffee @ the front desk is superb!The area is great: Tons of options for breakfast, lunch & dinner. You'll find most Subways within a block, two or three.

...for bringing our favorite NYC hotel back to its former splendor. For years, this was our go-to hotel until a noticeable drop in service in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy (my understanding is that this particular hotel was the temporary home to many emergency workers and displaced residents). Both the facilities and staff had become noticeably "tired," though we never voiced our complaints to the staff as the hotel had been so good to us in the past. Instead, on future trips to NYC we chose alternate SPG hotels (we are Platinum), however, sorely missed our preferred Union Square location and decided to give the hotel another try on this stay. So very glad we did! Although Joel (the new GM) had no prior knowledge of our concerns during previous stays, he succeeded to make this visit the most exemplary yet, and the best part of the experience was that the stellar service began within the first sixty seconds of our arrival and continued on through to checkout. "Above and beyond" doesn't even begin to cover the 5 star service we received, and on a sold-out evening no less! The view from our upgraded room was so jaw dropping we elected to cut our evening short and "slept in" as to spend more time in the room, which is a first for us.A big kudos to you and all of your staff for a job well done. A special shout out to Marcos at the bar, who may quite possibly be the best bartender ever!One complaint -- Although the few bars items we sampled from the kitchen were satisfying, we are missing Olives! On the plus side, it forced us to venture out and experience some local eateries that were amazing (separate reviews).

This is the second W I have stayed at in Manhattan and both experiences were very similar which I guess is what you should expect from a chain. While they are stylish and the staff very good, the rooms are not very comfortable. No matter what we tried, we could not get the room to cool off (and it was stuffy). The bed and pillows were not all that comfortable and the shower pressure was just okay. A regular size bottle of water in the room is $7 which is pretty crazy considering right next door at CVS you can get a 6 pack of the exact same water for less than this one bottle (so make sure you make a quick stop in CVS and stock up). On the plus side, for a NYC hotel room, this was a decent size.

My wife and I had a wonderful 4 night stay in November. The staff was wonderful, as was the "wonderful" room we were kindly upgraded to! To top it off, staying at Union Square made anything we planned doing in NYC a snap! We would love to visit NYC again, and stay at this lovely property!

Best location ever! to experience New York at it's best! this hotel has friendly staff. The only very small thing about this hotel is that they should have better sound proof windows, highly recommended

Stayed in a cool corner suite over Christmas.Room was great with modern and cool furnishings. Had some problems with heating initially but staff made an effort to resolve it quickly. Room service and cleaning lady were wonderful.Overall service was incredible with every request attended to promptly.Location is amazing and the view inspiring.Highly recommended.

I'm delighted with my decision to stay at the W Union Square for a 4-day December 2014 vacation. I am a 40 year old female, traveling solo, and wanted a comfy bed, a clean room, a subway-accessible location, a diverse guest clientele (for people-watching and for blending into), a place to lounge, and a friendly staff. The W Union Square provided all of this. Plus I really enjoyed the Union Square location-- strolled out on a Friday morning and was happy to see a Farmer's Market where I bought fresh fruit and bread. I didn't even end up using the subway system... I was able to walk to the Empire State Building, and to shopping, and to the comedy club, "The Stand." And for the rest, cabbing was easy, because the staff was always ready to hail a cab for me. The room was spacious and the bed and pillows were super-comfortable. The lounge area is cool, and the bar/restaurant was always ready to serve. Plus the hot apple cider and green apples at the front desk was a bonus.But mostly, what made the experience nice was the staff who worked there. The staff was excellent from check-in to check-out. The doormen, the concierges (George and Joseph), the front desk staff, and the Welcome Desk Talent Coach (Joel Davis), were all wonderfully professional, friendly, and helpful. They were always ready to provide tips or help, and make sure everything was going great. By the end, I felt like I had a few people to count on, and didn't even feel alone!p.s. This was my first stay at a Starwood hotel, so I automatically became a Starwood Preferred guest and was eligible for free internet. Didn't use it, though. Don't know how I'd feel if I had to pay for wi-fi....
user_name:
Caren S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is my third stay at a W hotel (the other 2 being W Seminyak Bali and W Taipei) and perhaps it isn't fair to compare to the other 2 newer establishments but it is quite vastly different. It didn't have the same vibe and trendy decor as the other 2 W Hotels, but it was pretty comfortable and clean anyway. Location was great, as you can easily catch the subway from Union Square. Lots of eateries around, no complains about that.However, service wasn't fantastic (except for some very friendly doormen) and it showed the first day we arrive... there were in-room dining trays lining the corridor to our room for the entire day and we were starting to worry about it starting to smell. On some days, housekeeping takes ages (more than half an hour and after 3 phone calls to Whatever/Whenever) to attend to your needs. We were also locked out of our room on our last day because for some reason the system failed to recognise that we have earlier requested for late check-out. Thereafter we were continually harassed by 3 different housekeepers attempting to clean our room because they were not aware that we were checking out late either. Overall, we feel that service needs to be improved and the hotel probably needs a facelift perhaps in keeping in line with the W theme and what W has grown to be famous for - hip and trendy vibe. It is starting to look a little tired as well, especially the elevator system.

My family and I were delighted to be at the W again. We opted to head into the City for the holiday and were most pleased with the rooms, service and location on Union Square. There were only two issues with our stay. One was the construction involving the elevators, but the inconvenience was truly minor. The second was that internet was not free - given the level of service and reputation of the hotel group, this came as a surprise. Just being back at the W, however, was great. Each staff member was more than eager to please, no matter what the request. Our rooms were elegant and inviting. Truly a memorable stay which will be repeated, internet or no internet.
user_name:
Carol M
Easton, Connecticut, United States

review_body: The W in Union Square is a fine hotel. The good: The staff are attentive, helpful and pleasant. Front person David de Valle gets a special mention as he stepped up and delivered great service. The rooms are spacious for a NYC hotel. A very nice fitness center.The not so good:I do not care for pillow top beds...my personal thing. I like a firm bed and this one gave me a backache. Charges for water ($7.00 a bottle...c'mon man!) Coffee until 10:00 am and then whisked away. A charge for internet in your room (it is free in the common lobby area though) These little extras really add to ones comfort as days go by. I have no major complaints here but just a few issues which if improved upon raise the bar even higher.

I stayed at this W during the first two days of a pre holiday trip with my teenage son utilizing free Starwood nights and could have not been more pleased. It was my first time at a W property and i had always been skeptical as i had heard about dark rooms ad more of a party scene, therefore I thought the second part of our stay would be better by staying at a traditional boutique hotel by 5th Ave., and could have not been more wrong. We were assigned a very nice room on the 14th floor with double beds and a very nice sight of Union Square. No noise level or so minimal that it was not an issue. Room was a very good size by NY standards, immaculate and had a very efficient and sparkling clean bathroom. The location of the hotel is excellent, walking distance from the Village and with easy access to subway line and plenty of food options near by. The front desk personnel was wonderful and provided a very warm welcome and attention. stayed at many different properties in NY over the years and at this star level, this was by far the best. I will certainly make the W Union Square a property of choice for future business trips to NYC and most likely for personal travel as well. Many thanks for a great stay!

Took my wife here to surprise her for her birthday and the hotel staff, particularly Tanya and the woman at reception (forgetting her name), were incredibly friendly and accommodating. I would say that they are responsible for my continued stay at W hotels in the future and a repeat visit to this one. Great experience! Thank you for an exceptional weekend!
user_location: Upper Nyack, New York, United States
user_name:
DanielK256
Upper Nyack, New York, United States

review_body: I have never had a Hotel treat me like a VIP like this place did, they went out of their way to make my stay easier for me.The room was spacious, the bathroom big and well light and very clean. I was in New York to see my daughter who ended up in the hospital and The W really helped me thru a difficult time.They also have a beautiful lounge/bar area scene. I will on all future trips be sure to stay here! Great location

We stayed there for 4 days, the concierge is great and over the top, super helpful. The front desk personal luke warm. Very expensive. The bar is great, great cocktails, a happening place. Adjacent to Union square.

david del valle was the most helpful bellman i have ever experienced. he is truly a special person, and i greatly appreciated all he did while i was staying at the hotel.from storing bags to delivering bags, to getting me in a taxi with alot of luggage, his service was exceptional.
user_name:
wgm2014
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for a long weekend in the city and couldn't have enjoyed our stay more. The hotel has an awesome location right on Union Square (great central stop on the metro and near a bunch of bars, restaurants, shops.) The staff was very friendly - so helpful and courteous. And lastly, the rooms are nicely decorated and well maintained. Our room had a wonderful view over the square, so was a nice treat. A wonderful hotel!

Maybe I don't completely get the "W concept" I recognize that these tend to be 4-star rather than 5-star properties but I think they tend to be more style than substance.The location for this property is awesome. I was staying with a friend and we were given a room on the top floor, the room wasn't huge but it worked. There were a few things that could use some work.- This was my second visit to this property and my first as a SPG Platinum. Check-in was efficient but they still had me listed as a Gold member (I had become Platinum after I booked and would of expected someone to verify the status levels prior to checking in, just to bring the service level up).- The closet had some trash from the previous guest(s), not a big deal, but something I would expect to be checked- There was long hair on the bathroom sink, neither of us have long hair- The vent in the bathroom hadn't been cleaned in ages- There was room service items in the hallways for a few hours- The desk staff while not rude they don't seem to be overly welcoming like you might find at an Aloft.- Only one elevator seemed to be working- The pillows on the furniture by the elevators looked tired

Stayed for five nights before Thanksgiving. Had business and extended the trip.Location: great, walking to a number of fantastic restaurants, subway near and always able to quickly find a cab or Uber. Also the Union Square farmers market has a good assortment even during November. And there are a number of good breakfast spots nearby - favorite was Breads Bakery.Room: Upgraded (platinum status) the second night to a corner room which was great. View fantastic, very quiet (except a few sirens - typical for City stays). The room was generous and the bathroom good. Everything was very clean. The first night we were in a standard room near the elevator which was noisy. The wifi in the room was very fast.Public areas: The lobby is fine - nothing great and there is a good lounge area with bar service from the restaurant. The work out room is a small botique style in the basement, a peak times the aerobic equipment was all in use; when the weather was nice I got some good early morning runs on the Highline - it is 4 or 5 long blocks away.Staff: They were attentive and had good attitudes. One woman worked hard to upgrade us the second night of our stay. The concierge was helpful but his suggestions were somewhat pedestrian in regard to restaurants - we found much better places doing our own reserach (we have very high standards / aspirations being from the SF Bay Area.) They also tried to recover well from a problem: a couple times the elevators were down to one or two, and so the wait times were ridiculous; after a while the staff started escorting us up and down via the service elevators which helped a lot. The door / bell staff where great at getting us cabs, directions and advice.We would definitely stay again.

Stayed here for our honeymoon in October 2010. Fantastic hotel in great location. Service was brilliant and hotel bar great place to have a drink and relax while watching the world go by. Access to the club as well as a resident. Would highly recommend.
user_name:
Charlotte W
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: We used this hotel as a base to visit most of the NY sites. We chose to walk, so it is doable if you are fit and don't mind walking. The subway is close by if you prefer.Rooms were pleasant and could not be faulted.Elevators were a bit of a nightmare sometimes as we had to wait a lot!BEWARE: we checked out of the hotel about 1030 and was told that there was nothing to pay (we expected this because we had not used the mini bar or any of the hotels paid facilities). Imagine our surprise when we arrived home and checked our bank statement on line. About $14 had been deducted from our account without us knowing about it! We have contacted the hotel by email for an explanation but have not yet received any reply.The only thing we can think of is that the hotel charged us to hold our luggage until abt 3pm. If this is the case, they never told us of any such charge at the time of our request.COME ON W HOTEL, CHECK YOUR EMAILS AND REPLY!

A bit of improvement but still not as W should be - that being said, the location remains excellent and knowing the shortcomings of the hotel, the level of disappointement is lower. In a positive side, rooms are nice, especially if you get an upgrade (difficult, even as a Platinum member); location is top notch; on less positive side, the breakfest is poor to very poor and the general quality off revive is a bit substandard.

I've stayed in NYC for business many times, and this was my first time at the W Union Square. Often times, W hotels remind me of the nineties - modern, faux flash decor, ambience etc. I was pleasantly surprised by the Union Square W. Here is what I liked:Great bedsRoomy roomsNice natural light and big windowFairly quietGREAT gym - new machines and roomyGreat, helpful staffI'll stay here again for sure on my next trip to NYC. Although my room was close to the elevator, it was relatively quiet. The only downside was my very loud neighbor whom I could hear in the hallway.

Very expensive, which makes me expect nice service. Instead, the people behind the counter weren't nice or welcoming at all. The room we stayed in was great. We didn't hear a lot of noise from outside and had a great view. The bath and shower are great as well. Wifi in the lobby is free, in your room for a fee.

This hotel is renovating its elevators. It appears that on a good day two of the elevators are working, at least for part of the day. Until they get this fixed, you'll spend more time than is necessary waiting for the elevator to come (and it's not like these are the most spacious elevators I've ever encountered either). In addition, sometimes guests end up packed in the elevator just because of the frustration caused by the wait. Staff is coping when they can by taking guests to the service elevator, but it's never clear when they'll help you and when they won't. The hotel is otherwise adequate, though nothing stands out. Lobby bar is cold and drafty in winter and hence not the most comfortable place to relax over a drink. I suspect a redesign of the doorways would go a long way to fix this, but right now it's not very inviting.

Very nice stay and very comfortable bed. I had a good experience with the staff that was extremely friendly in particular the bell boy at the entrance David Del Valle that assist us with all our heavy bags and escort us in the room after check in.The location was amazing and very close to the best attractions in town.

Wonderful stay. Wonderful staff. Very comfortable bed and clean modern room. Excellent location for boutique shopping and upscale restaurants. Great restaurant in hotel. Planning on returning to the W on our next NYC visit.

From check-in to check-out, I had a fantastic experience at the W Union Square. The staff was extremely friendly, and the rooms were clean and modern. The bed was very comfortable. I loved the immediate area, with plenty of shopping and restaurants yet more of a neighborhood feel than Times Square or other midtown locations. The only slightly negative experience was noise, in that there did not appear to be much soundproofing between rooms, nor insulation around the windows - you could really hear outside noise and feel a breeze near the windows. However, there is really not much that the W can do about this, and it was certainly bearable. Overall though, I would not only stay here again, I would classify this hotel as my new "first choice" when traveling to NYC. Great job W Union Square and congratulations to the management on running things so well.

Stayed in room 1510...very spacious, esp. by NYC standards. Two queen beds and a pretty view of Union Square park (there's an easy walk to the subway station in the park, if you want convenient access). Decent shopping nearby...but nothing like 5th Avenue or SoHo, of course. We used Uber or cabbed it to most of our destinations. ABC Homes, Kitchen and Cocina are within walking distance, which is perfect for shopping and lunch. Why not an 'A' for the W? Well, small things. The bathroom was a tired looking. The bar/lounge was crowded (not in a hip way...more in a tired families are hanging out, letting their toddlers run amok sort of way) and service there was slow. They promised us a paper each morning (even asked us our preference) and we received 2 during our 4 night stay. No coffee at the front desk when we went down one morning (they were going to replenish and asked us to wait, but we didn't want to stand around in our jammies). The room was loud (we could easily hear the people in the adjacent room...they really sounded like they were having a good time) but we traveled with a sound conditioner, so there! The front desk was super-unhelpful (as was one of the bellmen) on a couple of occasions, although some of the staff were great. Told we would get free wifi and had to call and "discuss" to confirm (ask for free wifi at check-in and make sure you get the name of the person, in case it's called into question). Totally not a deal-breaker, though, and we would stay here again.

Just stayed for 3 nights for a romantic weekend with my wife. We have stayed at this W a few years ago and the hotel did not disappoint. We booked a room with Starwood points and were upgraded to a "Spectacular" room on the 18th floor which helped limit the street noise and had a decent view. The room was very comfortable and recently refinished and the shower was one of the best hotel showers we have had! Also, we had sent a memo to the hotel about an early arrival and sure enough, our room was ready for check in by noon on a Thursday which was very convenient.The best thing about our stay though, was the service we received from the daytime concierge, Mr. Bernardo Reyes. We had lots of questions about restaurants, local transportation and sites to see. Bernardo was extremely knowledgeable about the local area, extremely courteous and patient at all times and very professional. He always had helpful additional recommendations regarding the areas we wanted to visit and even knew about some good local places to grab a cocktail or two. Union Square was a nice area to stay, away from the tumult of Times Square but very convenient to the subway system. We were glad that we chose this hotel over other Starwood properties in NYC and would definitely consider staying there again for our next visit.

The W Union Square takes their motto Whatever Whenever literally. The service went above and beyond. Every request big and small was attended to promptly and professionally. Thank you. The vibe and location nails the NY experience while providing the comforts you expect from a Starwood. Union Square is walking distance to lots of top bars and restaurants. A fabulous stay.

This was not my first time at this property and it never disappoints. Comfortable room, quality amenities, amazing location, friendly and helpful staff. Hopping, friendly lobby bar. Definitely coming back soon.

Anyone who says that New Yorkers are not friendly has never stayed at The W Union Square. Every staff member from the doormen to the desk personnel to the housekeepers and even the management go out of their way to make every guest feel welcome and important - an incredible group of highly competent people. The attractive and comfortable accommodations coupled with the perfect Manhattan location make this one of the City's top hotels. We will definitely return!

I love a W hotel- granted not all W hotels are created the same- but this one in Union Sq is a good one. The location is perfect- close to the Village/ Soho- Union Square area has great shopping and dinning options and the farmers market is fantastic. I travelled w my wife and 3 year old daughter who loved the playground in the park- swings, slides etc. super fun for the little ones. The hotel is in an old building- with that come some inconveniences- the elevators are small (and often full) but the rooms are surprisingly decent sized for NYC. Had an amazing view from the 15th floor of downtown NYC; Freedom Tower and all- made for some pretty amazing sunsets. Staff was nice and accommodating- stayed for quite a long time and they delivered a small refrigerator to the room- which was a nice touch. Wished they'd would more frequently sweep the floors- lots of old room service trays in the hallways but that'd be my only complaint. Great option for NYC. Enjoy!

Where to begin? My husband and I decided to take a vacation to NYC. It just happen to be the coldest weekend too!!! I now own a jacket, scarf and a sweater. That was a bit of adjustment since we live in the Caribbean with hot and humid climate all year long. Richard M. was a great help to us in getting our reservation all set for us. George M. the concierge helped us by sending us every bit of information of what to do while in NYC. George the information was great and very helpful and made our trip that much easier. When we first walked into the W Union Square we were greeted by Jose R. the ambassador, he was awesome, a great joy to see in the morning after getting up at 2am to catch a 5am flight. Then we meet Nelson B. who checked us into our room. Nelson was very professional and helpful and even recommended a couple of must see places. And of course we talked about the beaches back home!!! We will see you and your family in February. Bernardo R. the concierge is AWESOME!!!! Bernardo took care of us all 4 days. Thank you for the shopping recommendations. LOVED IT!!!!! Dinner at Tony’s DiNapoli was wonderful for our last evening there. Thank you!! We had breakfast one morning at the 201 Restaurant there at the W Union Square our server was Richard, he was the politest person I have ever came across. He was very well mannered. Loved his service. We met Tanya the W Insider and she was great and helped us out and even invited us to the W Pop-In. Thank you Tanya! Annette was the stylist who took great care of our room. She did a wonderful job and our room always smelt great. We did order In Room Dinning 2 days; I will tell you, that was the fastest service we have ever received from any in room dinning service in my entire life. I did not get the names of the two servers but they both were very polite and courteous. Unfortunately we had to return back to the sunny beaches but on our final departure we were greet by David D. he is GREAT made us laugh and not want to leave NYC. We will defiantly return to the W Union Square!!!! Great location and perfectly located in Union Sqaure.
user_name:
VQS_Home
Isla de Vieques, Puerto Rico

review_body: Spent two days here during a recent business trip to what was once my home town. Among the nicest Starwood properties in NYC, this W Hotel is very chic and located in a terrific part of Manhattan. Centrally located within walking distance of many good restaurants, subways intersection points, and Union Square park, you're fairly close to most things in NYC, but not too close! Hotel itself is well appointed and very clean. Nice restaurant and bar, and pretty nice rooms for NYC. You could do a lot worse in NYC than this, and probably not much better for the price, which like most decent or better hotels in NYC is fairly expensive. My only grip about this hotel was that like many in NYC the very nice rooms and bathrooms have what must be old plumbing b/c it can take 20min to get hot water - something you'd expect to be instantaneous if you're paying hundreds of $'s per nite. Would I stay here again? Yes. Should you? Maybe, depending on your budget, and preferences.

Overall the hotel staff was great. The room was large, clean and comfortable.Only problem with the room was the elevator noise in the bathroom. I was on the top floor so that was probably why. You could kind of hear it in the bed but it wasn't a huge issue. Now the drawbacks; the restaurant staff seems untrained and scattered, 1st visit to the bar, ordered drink waited 10 minutes and never saw the bartender again, 2nd visit, absolutely vacant scattered waiter, 3rd visit again had a waiter then he disappeared for a long time eventually the bartender noticed i needed a refill and brought it. I would stay again, I love Union Square and this hotel overall was worth the price. Also I did get an email back from management from the same comments I made on the survey. So they have great follow up.
user_name:
dcbates
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We used to live in NY and came for a weekend trip. Love this hotel, perfectly central location on Union Square. Lots of restaurants within walking distance and safe neighbor to walk around late at night, near NYU. Very convenient to access all of NYC. Subway station to multiple subway lines 1 block away: 2 stops from 5th Ave shopping and 2 stops from Prince St shopping. Hotel is modern and safe, keycard access to use elevator. Rooms are good sized (mega room). Tube in bathroom. Rooms are updated and comfortable and love the high end Bliss Spa bath products. Hotel is pricey but not bad by NY standard.

To find a village atmosphere in the heart of New York City,lovely park, lots of squirrels running around, walking through the park on a crisp autumn day, it's as good as it gets,surrounding area is lovely, so close to downtown and walking distance to shops and restaurants in the neighbourhood can't wait to visit again on our next trip ..

We spent several days here whilst working on a project, making good use of one the meeting rooms. They provided everything that our team might need and the afternoon snacks were of a very high standard, each day something different. The good sized comfortable rooms were like home from home. All of the staff went the extreme mile to look after the needs of the guests, with a smile. If I could humbly make one small suggestion, that would be to change the music in the elevators more often. After the 3rd day it became a little repetitive. What a great place to stay!

I've stayed many places in New York and this has been my favorite so far. I imagine this hotel sees its fair share of celebrities, but manages to make us "ordinary folk" feel special, cared for and welcome. Kudos!

There are few hotels in NY that offer the same level of convenience and location. My recent stay at the W Union Square felt like visiting a cherished friend. Keith met us at the door on arrival and greeted us by name. Reception was gracious and our room was comfortable, spacious and recently updated. Public areas are comfortable and a great place for meeting friends

I had a quick overnight trip and I wanted to be in walking distance of where my dinner party was being held - so I was limited on choices of hotels. I read the reviews and decided to try out the hotel. Because of the reviews I did request a high floor. When I arrived the gave me a corner room on the ninth floor. Natalie who checked me in was delightful. Even gave me free internet as well as additional points. I was not at the hotel very much and did not get to try much of what they had to offer as I arrived around 5 pm and left around 8 am the next morning. Everything was clean. The bathrooms are not large but you get what you pay for...I have attached photographs of the room. I would stay here again.

I love NYC and have always enjoyed the farmers market at Union Square. The location is great, near the subway, walking distance from Eataly, restaurants, and shopping. However, the hotel itself has some issues that need to be addressed. The front desk woman was less than pleasant when I arrived. It was not busy, she just didn't seem to enjoy her job. I was informed my room was "quiet" but then it appeared my view was facing internally and I was looking directly into at another person's room. However, the rooms with the outward street views were reportedly very noisy as per my colleagues irregardless of what floor people were on. Overall, the rooms are reasonably sized and clean but very dark especially if facing within the hotel. The restaurant/lounge seemed to be nice, trendy, and busy. The lounge service was above average despite our large party. The drink list is very standard but good with classic and new cocktail options. However, at dinner my colleague ordered a vegetarian entree and he was astonished to find pieces of glass in his food. Luckily enough, no one was hurt. The dish was sent back to the kitchen immediately. But we did not receive any complementary appetizers or desserts much less an apology from the manager which should have occurred immediately. I would say if you are just staying overnight, just enjoy the city and maybe meet your friends at the lounge if they are also staying at the same hotel. But venture outside for a great walk in the city and eat somewhere new or make a reservation at the classic restaurants such as Gotham Grill, Union Square, Gramercy Tavern., etc. all are within walking distance and have been churning out great food for decades and are still reliable and will make the dark and noisy hotel night stay worthwhile.

Had a diverse and fun stay at the W in Central square as part of their Surf Package! Fantastic farmers market just outside in the a.m, great dining and frolicking at night, Rockaway Beach the next day for surf lesson w/"the locals"- great time ~Drinks and good food at the Rockaway Beach Surf Club afterwards, and a few new friends! My girl and I had a blast, our concierge Tanya was lovely and efficient. Beds so comfy too, Bliss products in the bath, chic interior and fantastic view. Next time we'll stay longer!

We got an upgrade with our SPG points and staff was really helpful. The Union Suare location is very good as it is walking distance from the Union Square green line subway, it is walking distance from excellent restaurants and good shopping.My only complaint would be breakfast, small selection, medium quality. Dark restaurant. Just average. We preferred buying something from Wallgreens.

Stayed here at the beginning of October, coming from Boston on a business trip.This is not a typical W hotel, as I previously stayed at W in Paris and W Istanbul and expected more class and interior design chique. The hotel has very professional staff though, and rooms are quite spacious, comparing to other W hotels in NYC. On my last day in the morning I had strange sound coming out of my bathroom, and I asked staff to check it out. In 20 mins I received an email from Reception apologizing for the incovenience caused and they removed my internet charges and allowed to make a late check-out at 4pm which was very nice and professional. Overall, the hotel is not the most spectacular design and interior wise, but people make the whole difference at the end of the day :)

Just had another great stay at the W Union Square. I cannot say enough good things about this property. The staff is so pleasant and attentive. The room was lovely and clean courtesy of a well run housekeeping staff, and by any standard a big room (for NYC a huge room and quiet) with all the amenities. The W Union Square is the perfect combination of a boutique hotel and a large property-the warmth and personal feel of a boutique hotel with all the offerings of a large hotel. In addition, the W also sits right at Union Square with an abundance of restaurants and easy access to transportation of all types to travel in NYC. Natalie and all the front desk staff were fabulous, and along with them all the bellman and doormen were delightful. In addition, the lovely W insider was so nice. The management worked hard along with the staff to make for another exceptional stay-kudos to Gerald and Rich. The W Union Square is a standout!

Stayed overnight at the W for my birthday. I arrived to an upgraded room which was spacious and so comfortable. My husband contacted the hotel in advance to ask for something special and Tanya arranged the loveliest surprise when i arrived. Fresh flowers, champagne and beautiful cakes welcomed me. The location is terrific, the staff friendly and helpful and i would absolutely stay here again.

The hotel is in a great location. They were very accommodating (early check in). The rooms are clean, the service is stellar. The concierge made reservations for us for brunch. The bar is lively in the evening with great drinks. Will definitely stay here again!

My fiance and I had an awesome stay at the W Union Square last weekend in NYC. I had done a lot of research prior to booking at the W because I planned to propose to my girlfriend (now fiance) last weekend on a surprise trip to New York. I wanted to stay at a nicer place in the city since it would be a special weekend, and the W seemed to fit the bill. I sprung for a "corner" room, and the views did not disappoint. My fiance was blown away - we typically stay at "nicer" hotels, but the W Union Square was definitely a notch or two above many of the nicer places we've stayed in the past. In particular, I thought the size of the corner room was extremely spacious. I travel to NYC often for business and have stayed at quite a few Starwood properties. However, most of those rooms have always been on the smaller side. The corner suite was really spacious and had plenty of room for us to move around. Not to mention the great views from all angles. My girlfriend was not as familiar with NYC as I, so when the bellman brought our bags to the room, he was gracious enough to come show us notable buildings and areas of town by pointing them out to us through our windows. Our second day into the trip, we decided to order room service by hanging the door tag with our orders on the door before we went to bed that night. Our breakfast was prompt and delivered to us on a cart that we were able to keep with us for the entirety of our "breakfast in bed." (I have to make a side note here - we loved hanging out in our robes provided in the room! Something about a nice white robe that fees so luxurious and comfortable.) The food was delicious, although a bit pricey (which is to be expected at any W hotel). We had the pancakes (they were as big as your head!we probably could have shared them - huge portion, you get your money's worth) and the french toast - both which were really tasty.We had a lot of help from the hotel on deciding what to do for the weekend. I already had a proposal planned for Saturday night, but we honestly felt a bit lost as to what we should do during the day before the "big night." There was one person in particular who was especially helpful named Mark Rafeld from the front desk. I had talked to him on the phone during booking and let him in on my secret of the upcoming proposal, and he promised they'd take special care of us on our trip. I was able to go and find Mark while my girlfriend was showering on Saturday morning, and he helped me to plan the perfect day sightseeing in New York and even helped recommend a good matinee broadway show for us to see as an additional "surprise" for my now fiance. He definitely went above and beyond helping me to find ways to make our weekend special, and my fiance was so surprised by all of the great things we did thanks to his help. In addition, thanks to Mark and the help of the front office team, after I proposed on Saturday night, we returned to our hotel room to find a congratulatory note from the staff and a bottle of champagne chilling in the room. What a nice touch! I've honestly never met a more friendly and helpful front office team. From the door, to the desk, to the concierge, everything about our stay at the W Union Sq was amazing. We will certainly be back.

Union Square is a great location central to everything, close to the subway, shopping (Nordstrom Rack is across the street) and good food. The rooms were a good size from NYC, sleek, clean, and comfortable. The concierge is helpful if you have any questions. As per food, there is a great food market that's open in the summer months. A good mix of produce, pastries, meats and homemade foods. There's a great ramen place, Ippudo, a few blocks down and ABC is just around the corner great for brunch (try the crab toast).Would definitely stay again and recommend it.

Great location matched by efficient and friendly service. Prompt valet. Smooth and effortless check in and check out. Fast elevator. Although I'm not the biggest fan of their contemporary room decor, the views from our room was splendid. The common spaces of the hotel are so zen it seems to have a calming effect on the guests. Everyone seem prim and proper and not trying to attract some unnecessary attention.
user_name:
ebbtide123
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The W is centrally located, kitty-corner from Union Square. What this means is you can hop into any taxi and just say "Union Square" and you will get to within one block of the hotel. Wide taxi lanes around the Square means you can easily exit the cab at curbside, orient yourself and walk to this hotel sited at the corner of West 17th Street and Park Avenue. In Union Square you'll find subway lines A, C, E, R, N, Q and L. There are also surface buses running up and downtown, and the stop is right in front of the hotel.Citrus-flavored ice water is dispensed at the desk when you walk in. In the morning coffee takes its place. Umbrellas are available to guests if it is raining. Over our four night stay we asked for several items ranging from an additional refrigerator to scissors and slippers. All arrived at our door in less than ten minutes. The room was completely refreshed each day. One bottle of water was provided at no charge. None of the doors (closet, shower, entry) squeaked or caught when swung open. We couldn't return the iron to its holder after using it because its placement in the closet as somewhat awkward. But that was the only flaw in an otherwise wonderful Wonderful- class room, which featured three large mirrors, a deep window ledge and a very comfortable bed.The gym is in the basement and features four treadmills, two spin bikes, a weight machine and a set of free weights. Exercise balls and straps round out the equipment. The bikes and treadmills have video screens broadcasting movies, local TV and sport channels. individually wrapped headsets are provided along with terry-cloth towels, wet wipes, apples and clear cold water from a dispenser.Rounding out the hotel's amenities is its 'living room", the lobby extension that runs from the reception area to the restaurant/bar. It fronts Park Street, with tall windows, a variety of seating and scattered outlets to power your devices. WiFi is free for two hours.Dining within a two-block radius is sublime. Don't settle for Starbucks; there are good places nearby. Ask the concierge for recommendations, Bernardo seems to have been born into the job. The Union Square Farmer's market operates three days of the week. Staying here will make you feel like a star, and make you realize why celebrities of the day preferred to live in hotels.

I lived in NYC for several years and it's always feel good to come back again. Instead of staying in Times Square like other tourists, I prefer this W Hotel in Union Square as you can find yourself closer to local New Yorkers. Union Square has lots of good restaurants and bars, also fantastic farmer's market on the Saturday. The gym is awesome and I don't see many people, which is not too bad. I'd recommend to people who want the trendy W hotel but avoiding noisy Time Square crowd!!

I feel really good each time I came to the W Union Square. People are very friendly and kind. The rooms are big and comfortable and The Living Room Lounge is cool. "Nothing is perfect", you have to pay for the in-room wifi service and the area is noisy with ambulances, firefighters... but this is New York. Nevertheless, I really like this W.In the area you have plenty of restaurants and stores. Soho, Chelsea, Greenwich are at walking distance from the hotel. To get a cab is not a mission impossible and you have the Metro Station pretty close.

Was in town for our 10th anniversary, having stayed at the hotel before we always enjoy the location and peacefulness in the area. Within walking distance of many attractions in the union square area. Eddie at the front desk and everyone else went out of there way to make the stay very enjoyable!!!!!!

This was a wonderful stay at the W in a Union Square. Highlights was the "Fabulous" room, which was a great size....bathroom could have been slightly bigger but this is NYC and most W bathrooms tend to be smaller. The staff was amazing. From Tanya in hospitality, Eddie at the front desk and Bernardo in concierge. They went out of their way to make sure my wife's 40th weekend was a wonderful one. The caring service at this W proved that NYC can have friendly service without the attitude like the rest of the country. Thanks to Tanya for the wonderful surprise of chocolate covered strawberries for my wife's bday. Above and beyond.

Checking into the W hotel late on Friday evening, we were treated to a beautiful lobby with water and fruit when you walk in. Great location right off of Union Square train stop. The check in was quick and easy. My nephew, this trip was his birthday present, questioned the staff about the room. Was the bed big enough and did the room have wi fi and a charger for his iPhone? We had a beautiful room on the top floor. My nephew LOVED the room and the amenities. The Bliss beauty products and iPod docking station along the with the great view of Manhattan. The bed was comfortable. The staff was wonderful - offering suggestions about the area.

Unfortunately again we experience a not so pleasant stay at the W hotel chain. We really wanted this stay at the W Union Square to outshine all of the prior stays but it just did not happen. The only W that we would go back to would be the W in Washington. Everything was outstanding. Staff, service, location - everything was as expected.We noticed a pattern with the W hotels. I am not going to go into detail about what we did not like about the W hotels in downtown NYC, Chicago Lakeshore and W Union Square. Overall biggest fails, staff and their attitude, systems and procedures. I just wished they could get it right. It didn't happen at one hotel but at a number of W's. In fact all of the W's except the Washington Location. Understaffed, overworked, lack of desire to be at work, I don't know what it was!!! Still shaking my head!I was going to write a very long letter about all the issues we encountered at all the W's however, does anyone actually read the feedback? I have to say the bedding, and cleanliness of the hotels are always immaculate - I don't have an issue with that. It's the attitude of the staff and the inefficient service that rubs me the wrong way. I think we gave the W enough chances to redeem themselves. As Gold SPG members you would think that by now in this day and age If we request late check out - we wouldn't have been locked out of our room and having to provide ID in the middle of a hall way to security! A tip to the check in staff. Smiling is free - a welcoming face starts of a guests experience with a positive invitation to the hotel. - Maybe its a policy that the staff don't smile or that they don't give an overview of the hotel ie. gym, eating area etc. I don't know perhaps someone can inform me if that's a policy. Back to the Westin we go! - The staff smile, help you, advise you, give you information about the hotel and thank you for staying with the hotel. Or maybe I expected just a little more from the W chain?

I would like to start off by stating that I have 100 nights in hotels in 2014 alone--I know quality hospitality when I see it. When it comes to hotels, I am extremely picky, as they are essentially a second home to me. I have seen it all--dirty mattresses, rude employees, and everything in between.My recent stay at the W Union Square was nothing short of excellent. Let it be known that there are 3 W hotels in New York City, and I have stayed in all of them. This one takes the cake in both service, lighting, size of room, quality of service, location, and comfort. Check in was a breeze, and my platinum status was warmly welcomed. The gym is clean and functional. The rooms are well lit, have a great view, and more spacious than one would expect to get in premium New York City location.Around the hotel is everything anyone would need. A Whole Foods, a liquor store, TWO Starbucks', CVS, Duane Reade, a Sephora, a Lululemon, a train station, a Nordstrom Rack, and thousands of restaurants--what more could you ask for?All in all a wonderful establishment. Would stay again in a heartbeat. Without a doubt the best W in New York City.
user_name:
Andrew P
Atlanta, Georgia, United States

review_body: Returned form New York last month in August 2014.Went to New York with family for a city break. Location, staffs and the services were excellent. Had a free wi fi at room and at the lobby. Close to all amenities including restaurants and metro. Hotel was close to 5th Avenue and major street. Times square was within walking distance. We stayed at the seventh floor. Only problem we had was traffic noise.In the room we had complementary water bottles daily and electric cattle.
user_name:
Hafiz T
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: The W Hotel at Union Square is obviously located right off Union Square so if you want to be in that area, its a good place. The W is on the trendy side, but i found the staff to be professional and very helpful. I had a corner room and by NYC standards--it was extremely spacious and comfortable. They made up the day bed and offered to bring up a rollaway bed for my son at no charge which is very nice. I've been at other NYC hotels that want to charge you daily for the rollaway. The only bump in the road was lack of hot water in the shower once or twice--which was annoying, but it wasn't enough to keep me from going back. Solid performance.

While I have stayed in several other W's, I have not had the opportunity to stay here at the Union Square location. I arrived early last Thursday morning and was pleasantly surprised to be able to check into my room upon arrival which was wonderful after arriving on a red eye flight from the west coast. I do recognize that that is not always a possibility. The staff at the curb as well as the front desk were friendly, warm and I felt very welcomed upon my arrival. Everyone asked if there was anything they could do to make my stay more comfortably and enjoyable. My room was impeccably cleaned every day throughout my stay. I will look forward to my next visit to NYC and will definitely make my reservation at the W / Union Square

I've stayed at this W many times. It has become by hotel of choice in NYC. I've enjoyed excellent SPG recognition each time including meaningful upgrades. Two things: they REALLY need to work on improving elevator speed/availability and expand the fitness center which is what you'd expect at a Four Points. The location is second to none in terms of walking to the most interesting neighborhoods in Manhattan. Excellent restaurants in every direction. A shout out to Tanya, the new Insider. I met her while checking in. She's a great brand ambassador. All of the staff is very friendly and outgoing with the (very) notable exception of the doormen (bad attitudes). I look forward to returning.

I stayed here recently to take my daughter to college. The location was perfect . Our room was very nice and bigger than some other NY hotels we have stayed in. I loved the Bliss products in the room! Really nice! The staff was so nice and helpful on so many occasions.Really made us feel so welcome and took extra care to make sure we had all we needed. I did not have the chance to dine here this trip,but may try it next time. This will be my go to hotel while visiting New York.The rooms are very pretty and contemporary. The beds are super comfy as well. The rooms also were very quiet which is nice! We walked to Soho in just a few minutes and also some great neighborhood restaurants /cafes nearby.I look forward to staying here again very soon!

Great Hip Hotel, perfect location right at Union Square. Subway is across the street and plenty of restaurants and shops around. This is a great place to stay in NYC due to its close proximity to the Union Square station, which will get you almost anywhere in NYC, as well as the Union Square Market, which is packed with fresh fruits and foods every Saturday.
user_name:
Antonio L
Miami, Florida, United States

review_body: As a Platinum Starwood member you do come to expect a certain level of recognition - but even if I weren't, at any of the W properties in the world, ANYONE should be able to expect a high level of service befitting the Starwood name. This hotel was one of the worst if not the worst place I have stayed where everyone from the valet, to the check-in was indifferent about welcoming you and helping in any way. Firstly my taxi driver had put my luggage on the curb where the valet just simply ignored us and was texting on his phone. I took the bag in myself. At check-in they didn't know I had 2 separate bookings which I had called ahead to merge into one and I had to show them the confirmation email. Everything was done without a smile or acknowledgment that I was a valued guest. Room was dated and tiny window with no view - the small stool they give you to stand up so you can peer over the wall at some kind of view was insulting. The closet space was so small I ended up laying my clothes across the armchair as I didn't want my shirts to be creased in the tiny closet. Bathroom had a mildew smell - like something wet which hadn't dried properly. When you exit out of the elevator you are looking straight at the check in desk and all 2-3 people I saw never looked up once to say good morning or hello - they were staring at the computer screens! Concierge was helpful though giving directions to Brooklyn Bridge. The bell staff on day of departure had the cheek to stare at my luggage and ask if I needed help! I was dumbfounded. Left unhappy and will not go back.
user_name:
princessandthepea888
New York City, New York

review_body: We checked in here yesterday and the rooms were small(as are most rooms in NYC), the desk clerk gave us an accessiibility room to increase the size, unfortunately the closets were smaller and only half sized as a result but the bathroom was huge which definitely compensated. Staff in the restaurant are very friendly and service oriented.... Wifi was not in the rooms which was a hassle but in the restaurant close to the lobby was free for 2 hours at a time. The bed was so great, comfy pillows soft bed and nice large windows...I slept for 12 hours. The hotel is both boutiquey and funky....

There are so many hotels in NYC, we prefer to stay where the staff act like they want us there and make us feel welcome. I am platinum level with Starwood, and you would think that I would be treated with some level of respect. The person who checked me in, never said welcome, never said thank you for staying over 50 nights at Starwood, he said nothing. We were booked into a suite, and as platinum usually get upgraded. This time we were not, which was ok, but, were given a room that was called a suite, but, no bigger than a regular room, and we had no view. The view was of concrete panels in front of the window. They even give you a step stool in the room to stand on so you can see out the window over the concrete. This was a total waste of money. Most of the staff from the front desk, to the doorman are not very warm. The W on Lexington is much nicer as is the staff.

Renovated two years ago, the hotel is reasonably updated and guests generally benefit from a unique layout that yields more “good sized rooms” than not. Union Square location is convenient to many of the city’s best restaurants. Lower high rise and unique U-shaped layout facing into the building next to it creates strange views / noises / privacy, unless you have one of the few rooms that face towards the park (which are the best rooms and near the *relatively quiet* elevators). Service was good, responsive. A decade ago I considered this to be the best W in the city; but, on this visit, it seemed to me that it’s losing its edge; and the hotel’s dry cleaner (Red Cap Valet Services) wrecked a brand new shirt I brought for the trip (which it delivered late—likely related—but adequately reimbursed me for… except, of course, for the inconvenience on the trip and needing to go back to the store). + W bed, W amenities, W style+ Good sized rooms+ Great Union Square location with proximity to excellent restaurants and transportation+ Friendly, professional staff+ Reasonable value; can find rooms, at times, at reasonable (for NYC) prices- Painfully slow elevators- Recently renovated gym is a disappointment (basement location and—although not as busy as other NYC W’s—it is small with ceilings unfriendly to 6-footers when on treadmill / elliptical)- New 212 restaurant was a disappointment (service)- Drycleaner (Red Cap Valet Services) wrecked my shirt- Hotel didn’t email my folio until I requested it

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Perfect location as it's within walking distance to everything - shops in Soho, restaurants in the Village and the Union Square subway station is only half a block away. The hotel has a very boutique feel even though it's a W property. What really puts this hotel over the top is the staff. Everyone we encountered during our stay was very warm and helpful, especially our W Insider Tanya who went out of her way to make our trip special. I called in a few days ahead of our check-in to see if a few out of the ordinary requests were even possible. Not only were all of my requests met but my expectations were exceeded. Great Hotel!

A well located hotel in Union Square, close to good cafés and eateries. Easy walking distance to Central NY along Broadway. Very easy to get a taxi into the city, very helpful staff, and large clean rooms with free wifi.

Arrived just after noon on Friday, having booked two 'Fabulous Rooms' for four nights. Was happy to hear one was already made up so we could drop off our bags, change clothes and get our and enjoy the day. Got back a couple of hours later and got the key to the other room. Both rooms were bright, spacious, nicely furnished with very good bathrooms, good TV's comfortable beds and great views of Union Square and lower Manhattan. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. We loved the location as it was a short walk to many restaurants, shopping, parks and sights. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will certainly be back next time we come to New York.

Look, this hotel isn't lame. However, people are selling it as one of the most amazing in New York. It's not. It's fine. The location is the best part. The hotel is clean but the rooms are ok. It ain't a St. Regis or the Chatwal. The best thing about it is the proximity. Don't expect the hippest or most pristine. It's just alright.

I recently stayed 4 nights at this hotel. This was my second stay there and it is now my default option when visiting friends in NYC.The staff in general are very warm and hospitable but in particular Gerald and Tanya were extremely welcoming and ensured that my stay was perfect. As an SPG Gold Member there are numerous options (including 2 other W's in Manhattan) in and around NYC but I would recommend this one above all to everyone. Pro's:-large (for NYC) and very well maintained rooms-great location -receptive and friendly staff

Fantastic location near Union Square, I especially love the farmers markets on the weekend. This is a modern hotel - we had a very nicely appointed room that was very clean and new. The staff was very attentive and helpful. The price was reasonable for the location and quality (at least wrt NYC prices). There was some street noise, but not excessive.

Although I hadn't stayed at this particular W in over 10 years, I was very pleasantly surprised by how hip and modern it still was. The rooms were well apportioned and sized and the overall attention and service were excellent!
user_name:
Gerry E
New York City, New York

review_body: As a long time W Loyalist, I always enjoy staying at a property I've yet to visit. After a horrible experience at the W City Centre in Chicago, I must admit I was a tad skeptical about the W Union Square in NYC. PROS // Great, central location (close to everything)Nice, welcoming lobby and front desk staffGood sized, well-appointed room (Wunderful) and not too cramped Great onsite restaurant and in-room dining menuCONS // Concierge staff were lazy + inattentive to guest requestsDoor / Bellman staff unfriendly, unwelcoming (no offer to assist with bags, open doors, hail cabs, etc) Loud through the night (my wife couldn't sleep as all she could hear was horns honking and sirens from ambulances and fire trucks).. par for the course in NYC? Perhaps supplying earplugs in the room should be standard at this property?Overall a nice NYC hotel but definitely not the best available in the area. I would probably try out another hotel on my next visit to NYC instead of returning to the W Union Square. Nothing extraordinary made me want to return to this property.

Currently staying in room 311. Decent space. Problem was when I trusted Kwame the bellman that their new chef was really good. Got to the hotel around midnight and was starving. Saw the Penne Arrabiata and got the taste buds going. Made the order. What showed up was Olive Garden style penne...looked like basic penne and sauce...no chillies, no olive oil, no tomatoes. Terrible. Also missing the complementary water for SPG Platinums...the tag that goes on the bottle was there, but no actual bottle (see pictures)

This is probably the least impressive W hotel I've stayed at. Even though I'm a platinum member I got a room that was facing a wall with no views and the room was dark. The room is very outdated. It needs major upgrades and the bathroom was small like a European hotel. I stayed here during the week and moved to the Andaz for the weekend and had a much better experience for the same price.

The location is great! Union Square & close to Meat packing market and restaurant & Chelsea Market.We stayed in a Fabulous King with a daybed. But when we checked in, they was no daybed. But the rooms are big enough, compare to other NYC hotels rooms.They need to update the bathroom & small closet. It's was old bathtub with a weak shower in it. The standing water doesn't goes down fast for shower. Call for the maintenance to fix the drainage. They came up within half hour. Very friendly front desk staff.

A well located hotel in Union Square, close to good cafés and eateries. Easy walking distance to Central NY along Broadway. Very easy to get a taxi into the city, very helpful staff, and large clean rooms with free wifi.

If you want to go uptown or downtown this is the perfect place to stay.The hotel rooms are a good size and a large marble bathroom. The bar and restaurant are inviting and good.The staff at the hotel are informative and helpful, especially the doorman. We wanted to go out for coffee and he guided us to the perfect place. 71 Irving place. A coffee bar and bakery that is wonderful.The Union Square park, across the street, always has something going on. We hit the farmers market. A joy to shop and roam.

Located right in the heart of Union Square in New York, this W hotel was an ideal place to stay for my weekend stay with my two boys (20 and 15) - yeah, I know, they're not really boys anymore.We stayed in a mega-double room. It had two double beds and plenty of space for our stuff - though my kids are a bit of a mess. The bathroom was probably the only thing that was a little disappointing. It was small compared to the size of the room and not as slick and modern as the rest of the room.The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. They provided us with umbrellas each morning as there were early morning showers on Saturday and Sunday.The property is less than a block away from the subway station which could pretty much take you anywhere. The hotel's fitness center was being renovated while we were there, but they did offer free use of the Equinox on 19th and Broadway (about two'ish blocks away). That was a really nice feature :).I didn't try the food there, but the free coffee in the lobby was a welcome treat in the morning.I would recommend staying at this property. Have fun!

The location of this hotel is perfect. You are a 10 minute walk from East Village, West Village, Washington Square Park, etc, etc. Staff was awesome, Todd English restaurant was awesome, room service was awesome, view was awesome. Cannot wait to go back in a few months.

We have visited the W hotel at Union Square several times before, but this was an amazing visit. It was for a wedding anniversary of ours. The complementary services and flowers in our hotel room were, quite frankly, beyond belief. The flowers were so nice we took them back with us on the airplane! All in all, WOW!

This is the first time I've stayed at this particular W and it was everything I expected it to be. The employees were helpful, polite and friendly, my room was clean and available for an early check in, the location is perfect for multiple areas of interest (eating, walking, sightseeing).I'm looking forward to returning ASAP!

Really liked the location. Location is in close proximity to a subway hub so great to get around. Much more quiet than Times Square and great access to close restaurants. The fitness center was closed so let us go to nice local gym. Construction out front of the hotel but inside is very nice. Service is incredible and not one complaint. I highly recommend this hotel.

We decided to stay at W Union Square, because we love Soho! Every time we are in NYC, we try to stay around this hip and trendy area. Another reason why we chose W was because of their PAW policy - with an extra daily charge, we can stay here with our mini chihuahua. First off, we booked a room and were downgraded, without any staff members informing us. Only after some investigation I was told that in fact we were put in a worse room, even though we paid for a better one and the money was not refunded, because we had to stay at the pet-friendly floor - information that we were not aware of. To cut the story short, one of the Supervisors finally agreed to let us stay at the nicer room that we originally booked and it all worked out fine. The breakfast was nice, the room itself was big for New York standards and had a beautiful view of Union Square and the location could not have been better. Their concierge is extremely helpful and overall we had a great stay. Will be back again!

The W Union Square is my home away from home! I wouldn't (and won't) stay anyway else in the city. Conveniently located in the heart of Union Square, it is easily accessible to shops, restaurants, parks…you name it. The minute I walk in the door, I am greeted by name! The staff is just like family to me -- from Frankie at the door, to bellman Bobby, the service is simply impeccable. Nelson Baez offers phenomenal service as does Fazlu. But it all stems from the fabulous Director of Welcome Office Gerald T! His graciousness is unparalleled! No request os too great or too small and met with the utmost attention. The housekeeping staff is pleasant and attentive. The rooms are spacious and clean. What more can I say other than I LOVE this hotel and it is always a joy to stay at the W Union Square!

We stayed at the W Union Square for 2 nights. It was conveniently located in the heart of Union Square, walkable to many shops and restaurants and easy access to stepping out to a cab being available at anytime. The service was excellent. From the time we arrived to the time we departed. Everybody was helpful, informative and excited to help. Found out that there were Hawaii connections as soon as we arrived and Tanya was at our service. She was flawless. Jason at the front desk was fast and friendly and remembered our names as we walked by the front area. The concierge was fierce full of recommendations and NY life. We didn't get to meet Franky and David until the 2nd day and glad we did! They were so fun, friendly and at your service. We also had friends stay here and they loved it and went back a few days later. We will be back!

Staff knew me by name within hours of arrival. I had a small medical problem. I could have used the house Dr., but the conceirge pointed me to an Urgent Care facility is just a few blocks away.Room was very large by not only NYC standards, but any standard. Based on my experience, I will always insist on staying at The W wherever I travel.

I stayed recently with my family. It is a very cool hotel. The staff is very focused on taking care of the guests. It is a beautiful hotel in a premier location, right on Union Square.The hotel bar/ restaurant is also very nice.

We stayed in a good sized 1 br suite and were very happy. High floor with good views. Everything was very nice in the room but the shower head could have been a bit better. The lobby bar/restaurant was very good and the service was generally excellent. Since we were staying there to attend a wedding we were not looking for that perfect place but the W Union Square was surely one of the nicer hotels in the city. We were very pleased and would stay there again.

W hotels in NYC are very dicey; they're often overpriced and trade some level of glamour and design for functionality. Rooms are also notoriously tiny. Fortunately, I didn't have that problem at the W in Union Square. Not sure which room I was placed into, but it was plenty spacious enough for me and several guests to have a few drinks before a night in NYC. The Union Square neighborhood is wonderful, and public transportation was easy to access in the park itself. My only real complaint about the hotel were the elevators, which were very slow and often led to backlogs in the lobby. Besides that, this was an excellent stay.

I absolutely enjoyed myself at this hotel.It was very clean; the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I received an email from the manager during my stay and I found that was extremely professional.I thoroughly enjoyed my time here. I will be returning.

You know you're in the right place when you are greeted the way you'd like to be greeted upon getting home every evening as you approach the front door; when the staff remembers your name and your wishes and responds accordingly. Consistently. When the rooms have just enough 'chic' to make you feel you are somewhere special, when the folks on the other end of the line for room service remember how you like certain foods and when you are located in the midst of a special part of New York City it then all comes together. The W Union Square Hotel is just such a place. A recent stay reminded us once again why this is our favorite place to be when in New York.
user_name:
Rick B
Palm Beach Gardens, Florida

review_body: Last weekend was my second stay at this hotel and unfortunately was a negative experience, as opposed to my last visit. There was a considerable volume of guests but nevertheless, as this is a luxury hotel (and costly) I have high expectations. I ordered The Sunday NY Times; it never arrived (after 2 phone calls). Staff, though helpful, seemed overwhelmed. After check-out, I was exiting with my luggage only to see the doorman harassing the car service waiting for me at the curb (the service had been there for exactly 30 seconds), saying they weren't allowed to wait. I left a phone charger in the room and though I called several times (one time almost immediately after checkout) it was never located, and I had to make many phone calls the following day even to get this information (and the charger was never found). Overall, despite the physical comfort(great location and nice-sized rooms) a disappointment.

Just retuned from 4 days in NYC. The W at Union Square is within easy walking distance to shopping, restaurants, shows. The hotel itself is a typical W hotel. Nice decor, boutique feel.... I would make sure to ask for the complimentary Dasani water as the 2 bottles of Smart water in the room are $9.00 each. A bit extreme, even for New York! What makes this hotel 5 stars is the staff. They're amazing. Thanks again to Charlie for the great breakfast recommendations.

As a native new yorker, I have had my fair share of hotel experiences, amazing restaurants and trendy night life. But I have to say the W Hotel surprised me with its overall experience. Me and my fiancé recently got a new puppy and found that the W accommodated pets. Which is great! We got a pet friendly room with an amazing view of Union Square and great doggie amenities ( dog bed, bowl, organic treats and chew toy!) She was definitely spoiled. The room was spacious, modern and had tons of light. There were many pluses of being in that area, minutes from shopping in NOHO/SOHO, restaurants are everywhere round the hotel, during the day there is a farmers market in the park, and many street performers too. When we came back in that night we were told about the their newly renovated club in the basement level of the hotel. Not only was it under the hotel, there was a private entry for hotel guests! That of course put the icing on the cake. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for dog owners, young hip couples, and professionals who are looking to get away from the cheap, drabby, cream-colored, art deco chain hotels.
user_name:
bbmed55usa
New York City, New York

review_body: The W times square is one of my favs in NYC. The lobby is huge and their is free wifi throughout. The lobby bar is great and the staff is equally as nice. The rooms are a bit small, however this is NYC. I highly recommend the W
user_name:
Eric D
New York City, New York

review_body: There are 4 different W hotels in NYC, but this is my favorite - the location (in Union Square) is amazing, the staff friendly, the rooms surprisingly large and well appointed, and there is a great scene at the bar and restaurant in the lobby. Highly recommended.
user_name:
Jeremy R
New York City, New York

review_body: I just stayed for a week at the W Union Square with my husband. I can tell you that the staff bent over backwards to make sure we were comfortable and had the room we desired. The location of the hotel is the best & most central spot you can pick in Manhattan. The hotel is classy, clean and the staff are down to earth and friendly.
