I absolutely love this place and felt totally at home. This is my hotel pick for NYC.

W has taken an old building in Union Square and "W-ized" it very well. Hip decor that you'd expect, but aside from great water pressure in the shower (thanks to an old, big-pipe building) the thing that stands out is the friendly, responsive staff. From chambermaids to room service delivery to front desk, they make it a pleasure. Rates are reasonable (remember, this is NYC). A good option compared to some of New York's high end, high priced hotels, none of which can beat the W Union Square on service.

After a long wait between paydays a small ship came in and this gastronomy gal decied to treat my partner to a spoiled night in a great hotel, I enlisted the restaurant staff of the w hotels main floor eatery a great supervisor , sorry I never got your name but your worth a million. And the amazing MIMI a new import from the big easy only two weeks in newyork helped plan my surprise. The time arrived my wife thought it was a quick dinner before an ardous ride to queens in peak hour. The amazing morgan she of the amazing art work(in joke) priced the room made the bookings all I had to do was provide the credit card. The amazxing wilmer (just learned the supervisors name) managed his talented crew like a seasoned pro. Wilmer spoke to the chef a special menu was arranged as I live with serious dietary requirements, and ella arrived and the service was spectacular Mimi is and was amazing. The pasta aribiata was to die for Mimi found me a wine from the town I was born in, and for the first tome in a longtime my baby smiled she laughed the mission was a success. The W like all major properties still has some work to do there were a few minor hiccups, but with pro's like badir running crews like wilmer and mimi they don't have far to reach for the stars and as many as they deserve are theirs for the taking. In my forty years in the hospitality industry fewer meals have been better and when the room was a surprise for her at the end and it's exceptional quality was simply the cherry well done to the W hotel and all who sail in her. Mia G and Zeus
user_name:
Mia V
New York City, New York

review_body: Dear W Hotel Union Square:I along with my sister-in-law Nicole my daughter Clarke and my niece Ava, recently enjoyed an amazing stay at W Union Square. Besides feeling welcome and comfortable this stylish hotel delivered wonderfully on its signature service – and as such the real “stars” of this hotel must be mentioned by name as follows:Silotte Dauphine: an elegant, stunning and lovely French Lady, whom we met at the Concierge Desk. She was warm, informative and provided us with helpful tips for getting around Manhattan -- Silotte provided each of us with complimentary fold- up “mini” umbrellas noting their convenience for being easy to tuck away, before escorting us to the subway to ensure that we took the “correct” train to Brooklyn. She went above and beyond!!Bernardo Reyes: very cool and knowledgeable Concierge with great personal style and accessories – He took the time to create a personal type-written itinerary with Fourth of July recommendations (delivered to our room) that was customized to our adventure. Not only did he deftly navigate multiple locations for cool Noho, Soho & Nolita, boutiques for us he directed us to the legendary "cronut" line up where we were lucky to receive the last 4 cronuts of the day!! “He gets us!”Tanya Decosta: a lovely young woman - also part of the Concierge Team who hit the nail on the head with her recommendations for cool shops (Brooklyn Charm) and places to go that our 17 and 13-year-old girls fully embraced.Stella Draksin-Okjan, Welcome Desk: Great energy Super Fun, hilarious and friendly, with great advice! We sent our girls to Big Daddy’s for breakfast upon her recommendation and tackled Central Park with ease based on her tips.Eddie Ruiz, Welcome Desk: very professional and on top of things, he generously relocated our room so that we could enjoy an even better view of the city.The common thread among each of these individuals is that they are truly authentic, clearly love what they do, have a generosity of spirit, are proud to offer their knowledge and services, and have a talent for seamlessly anticipating guests’ needs in an extremely pleasant, kind and informative manner. – BRAVO! Each of them are to be congratulated for their exemplary service. Together these shared intangibles make the difference between having a good stay or having a memorable experience. Because of them we will definitely recommend W Union Square to our friends and family, and we will of course return to this hotel in a flash.With very best wishes,Patty & Clarke (Toronto)Nicole & Ava (Calgary)

Stayed at the W Union Square with my wife for a night in May for my birthday. Awesome rooms, friendly staff. They went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. Would definitely recommend. 5 stars!

I stayed at the W the night before my wedding and the night of my wedding. The experience was beyond horrible. A couple of weeks before checking in, we called and spoke to a manager about having a bottle of sparkling wine placed in our room on our wedding night and then having juice brought from room service the next morning. The day we were supposed to check in, we received a voicemail from a hotel employee telling us we needed to call back to clarify our asks. When we did, we were passed among three different people, all saying with some level of rudeness or attitude that they didn't know what we were talking about. We finally spoke to a manager, who assured us that our requests would be taken care of.When I arrived at the hotel with two bags and my wedding dress, there was no one to assist me, not even one doorman to open the two heavy front doors going into the hotel. I had to wait for another guest to exit and ask for help with the doors so I didn't damage my dress.At the front desk, I was told my reservation could not be found. I said this was impossible because we had just spoken to a manager thirty minutes prior about our reservation. The manager overheard this and checked me in himself. He apologized for the confusion and said he was going to have a fridge with the juice we wanted brought to our room before we returned from our wedding, so that we didn't have to be disturbed the next morning. This was the fourth time we had discussed this request. Of course, no juice ever appeared at any point.But worst of all, by far, was the treatment when we returned to the hotel after our wedding. Our keys had stopped working, so we went to the front desk to get them reactivated. While we were there asking for help, a woman behind the desk shot us a very dirty look. I asked her why she was glaring at us, and she responded by rolling her eyes and then verbally attacking us—raising her voice and trying to start an argument. I could not believe someone was treating us this way at the end of our wedding night. I was shaking and practically in tears.We went to our room after asking her name (Tamara Fleurose), and the other person from the front desk delivered two glasses of Champagne to us to apologize for Tamara's behavior. Unfortunately, they were brought to us on a dinner plate rather than a tray, and one fell and shattered glass all over our hotel room floor.I usually stay at W Hotels about five times a year. After this experience—having someone be so incredibly rude to me on my wedding night—it will be very hard for me ever to consider the W as an option in the future.I also sent Katherine, the "talent coach," an email about Tamara's behavior, but she never responded.
user_name:
amoore74
New York City, New York

review_body: It's my first W experience, would probably stay again because you can't beat the location, but they need to work on a few things. Took to long for shower and sink water to get hot; then it was too hot, and no extra blankets in the room. Room keys are very sensitive, keep away from all electronic devices or they become deactivated. Had to pay for the internet...really, shouldn't internet be included in the rate at that price.

very convenient location in NYC. everything you would like from a park for the kids to nightlife. easy access to the rest of the city by cab or subway as you wish. friendly helpful staff and all the amenities.

The W Union Square has Architecture and a sense of history that delights the eye. The interior is updated and well done. The location, right on Union Square, is unbeatable... a short walk to several great places to eat and bars/breweries.I found the price to be high, even for New York standards and was less than impressed with the SPG experience.

Love The W hotels period. My husband and I love the one in DC and the one in Times Square so we wanted to try another area on our weekend in NY. Loved the location, plenty of restaurants and retail stores in walking distance and extremely close to Canal St if you like shopping in China Town. The service at the hotel was impeccable. The have a breakfast service that really cool and the staff was very helpful when it came to choosing places to go and eat. Will definitely come back..

We decided to stay at the W for the weekend while we got married at City Hall.The staff went above and beyond when they found our we were getting married... a room upgrade, champagne and strawberries the day of with a hand-written card signed by all the staff (that we still have), a complimentary lift to the courthouse and everyone wishing us the best throughout the day.. The wonderful people at the W warmed our hearts and made a special day even more memorable with their thoughtfulness. Thank you!!

The W Hotel has a service catchphrase, 'Whatever/Whenever' and boy do they live it! Anything I needed, pretty much any time I needed it, I picked up the phoned and asked.From unusual international adaptors to birthday cakes and even a strongman to help close my luggage bags when too much shopping hampered my ability to pack.The staff was super helpful 24/7 and helped seamlessly integrate a first time business trip to New York into a two week adventure. Whether I was looking for a good time or some quiet time, I found that the hotel's ambience and environment was conducive to my every whim. New York is know for it's energy and the W doesn't disappoint!It was truly a pleasure.

I was really surprised with the W at Union Square. I've found some of the other W's irritatingly hip and cool but this one was so casual and laid back I'd stay there again. Everyone on the staff was friendly and we had a great corner room which was large and quiet. The bed was really comfortable and the amenities were great. The location was also fabulous, we walked to everything all over town, never took a cab.This one was a keeper!

Stayed at the W Union Square for 15 nights, on business. Will probably not stay again at this W when next in New York.-Pros: Good location on Union Square; great bed,;large room (SPG); very helpful concierge.Cons: Bathroom lacked a bath and the quality was not equivalent to other similarly priced hotels.'Extras' like room-service, water, getting a car to the airport, were all overpriced (e.g. $7 for bottle of water). Not a big issue given the great amenities around Union Square.Poor check-out experience: I had two separate bookings and reception were unable to provide a receipt covering the first of the two bookings - though they had been able to charge me - it required me to phone the hotel a couple of days later to obtain a receipt. Also, I had been promised by reception that it would be fine to check-out 1 day early and that there would be no charge for doing so. However, on the day, reception were 'unbelieving'. While the cancellation fee was eventually waived, I was not particularly impressed with the hassle..

This is my favorite hotel in NYC, it's still cool and fun to stay here. Whenever I'm in NYC for business I try to stay here (if I can get a good rate). The rooms are great, you never see any of the staff in the corridors but miraculously the rooms are made up on your return...The Bar and lounge are a great place to conduct business, everyone wants to meet you here.I look forward to my next trip here.

I came to NYC for a girls' weekend with my 20 year old daughter. The location of the W can not be beat. We went to east village, shopping along 5th Ave,etc., shows in Times square, shopping at Macy's in Herald Square -- and all without needing a cab (except for one rainy night where we opted for a driver over a wet walk in the rain.) The staff at the W is very helpful and accommodating. Our room was large and comfortable. Beds were great, safe in room, large closet, nice bathroom amenities. The market next door is open 24/7 and has wonderful breakfasts, plus anything else you could need during a stay. I had two very minor complaints -- (1) the shower curtain needs to be hung on a curved rod -- it sticks to your body during a shower -- that is not a big deal at all but still no fun! (2) $14.95/day for WiFi. C'mon... wifi should be free these days. Again not a big deal. My biggest complaint is there was a distinct smell in the room. Some sort of air freshener scent that was extremely offensive to me. It actually kept me up the first night and made my eyes tear the second night. But, when I checked out I mentioned it to the gentleman at the front desk and he said I should have told him right away. Apparently this is the W's "new scent" and I could have specified to NOT have it sprayed in my room. Also, they could have run some sort of air purifier to remove the smell from my room OR changed my room for me. He told the manager who sent me a personal email apologizing for the inconvenience and gave me a discount on my stay as a gesture to make things right. That is the way to win a loyal customer, and I would now consider myself just that. Thank you W for a great (albeit slightly smelly) stay in NYC! I'll be back!!

This hotel is absolutely fantastic. The location is first rate. The rooms are awesome, with really comfy beds, great bathrooms and great products. The restaurant is very pleasant, and even the club isn't bad. Fortunately it';s in the basement, so unlike other W Hotels, isn't noisy or disruptive at all.But the absolute best thing about the hotel are the staff. Unlike other NY hotels, they are always pleasant, and always make you feel like a valued guest. The hotel manager is absolutely exceptional. Whilst abroad, I had a crisis with stolen luggage, and he did far, far more than expected to help me resolve the problem. Overall, I couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Beautiful hotel, perfect location and perfect service. Dread staying in any other hotel in the city and will continue staying here....over 60 nights at the same hotel in just over a year I definitely call this hotel my home away from home.

Underwhelming W, nothing amazing, nothing special. Service was not that great, had to ask more than once for the same thing. Not at the top of my lists to stay in New York next time round, still a pretty decent experience...

We stayed as a family for a week between xmas and New Year. It didn't start well, as our booking was made through British Airways Holidays, and they didn't have a bed for our son (not sure how they expected three people to share a double bed). So after that was sort of sorted (a fold-out bed in our room), all was good; big room, great bathroom, fantastic view over Union Square and downtown. The lounge area was great (with wifi) and a fab place for drinks in the evening - we also ate at the restaurant there, which I would recommend. All in all, after the bumpy start, would stay here again - it really is a fantastic location.

I was looking forward to staying at this property as I have always been a Starwood fan and am an SPG member. The location was perfect for strolling around the key areas of the city I wanted to see. The service levels were as expected from any Starwood property though I was a little bit shocked to have found the bathroom not as clean as one would expect as there was hair in the shower drain. When we needed to change rooms it took awhile for the concierge service to appear (10 mins approx) and when we requested replishment of the complimentary water that also took a good 10 - 15mins. Overall though the other services were what I would expect from any Starwood property that I would stay in.

My recent stay at the W New York Union Square was outstanding. I don't have a negative thing to say about the hotel, its staff, or my stay. The staff treats you like you are at a tiny high end resort making you feel you are the most important person in the hotel. They do go above and beyond.....like Stella making sure my brothers room was ready for an early check in, or running into Rob the doorman at dinner off property. He asked how our stay was going, and wrote down restaurant recommendations for us for the next night....and this was when he was off duty! The highlight of my experience was Katherine Woods their "Welcome Desk Talent Coach'. Katherine went way out of her way to help me with a complicated reservation change I needed to make. The management gets an A+ because the attitude of the staff comes from a great management team. It may sound like I am a W New York Union Square employee...but Im not. I'm just a picky world traveler that appreciates it when a hotel "gets it right". I cant wait for my next stay!

The W Hotel beds live up to their reputation. Best night's sleep in a hotel. I was fortunate to have a very quiet room. And, the best part of my day was David del Valle, the door man, who knew where everything was and made sure that I had a taxi when I needed it, helped me get boxes over to FedEx, predicted the weather, and was a great "trip advisor"!

On previous trips to NY, we have stayed at Sheraton or Hilton on Times Square for the convenience. My husband who comes to NY on business recommended we stay here since Union Square is a good location, more of a local authentic NY experience and less tourists. We loved the hotel and location - the Farmer's Market every day outside the hotel, the Union Square Park and subway (only 4 stops to Times Square. Subway is at the diagonal corner of square from the hotel) and all the restaurants near by. It was walking distance to Greenwich Village, Madison Square, and my husband could bike along the river from hotel (he brought his bike). See my Union Square “Beats Time Square - Loved it! It has everything! Relaxation, food, shopping, convenience” review for more details on why Union Square beats Times Square. This hotel gives you the convenience and close to fantastic amenities without the mobs of tourists and crowded sidewalks. It gives you the fun and energy of NY while also giving you a slower, relaxing options as well.We stayed Memorial Day weekend for three nights on Starwood points. We would definitly return to the hotel and recommend it. We had great, prompt service at the hotel. From Eddie who checked us in and gave us a room overlooking Union Square and was friendly and professional to the maid who quickly got us a repairman to unplug our toilet (husband's fault; not the toilet's), and the service in the "Living Room" bar (get the coconut rum drink with pineapple and cranberry juice), it was all good. Cocktails were in the $13 range. The room was clean and decorated in blue and orange with black wooden, modern furniture that had space for clothes and shoes that you didn't want to bother putting in the closet drawers. Room was a normal size with a desk, desk chair, and a reading chair. Bathroom was a good size and the shower was big enough for three people. The glass doors are so much nicer than a shower curtain. Sink in the bathroom had plenty of room for my bag of cosmetics. Wonderful collection of the Bliss products (shampoo, conditioner, facial wash, lemon & sage bath gel, soap, shower cap with nail file and wooden tool for cleaning under the nails). Safe in the closet. Minibar fridge with warning that it does not chill like a normal fridge. We got 2 free bottles of Dasani bottled water for being Starwood Preferred Guests (1 each day). There was also $7 bottles of water you could buy. Go to the 24 hour CVS next door and you can buy a 6 pack of the same brand of water for the same price.We were on the 6th floor and could hear the traffic noise at night but I guess it is just part of the charm of staying in the big city and hearing the city sounds. No coffee maker in the room but Starbucks, Panera, and Dunkin Donuts, and delis are around the square. If you feel like walking a few blocks, Think Coffee and Joe The Art of Coffee are near by for a really good cup of coffee.The lobby doesn't have any chairs, just a front desk and a concierage. There were fresh green apples on the lobby desk. In the afternoon, there was fruit water and one morning, there was good coffee. No tea. There might have been coffee there other mornings but we didn't notice it. You can get breakfast delivered to your room and the restaurant is open for breakfast - dinner. Next door is a deli with pancakes and bacon for $7 and pretty good sandwiches (got one for the Amtrak train ride home). For breakfast, we normally went to the Farmer's market for fruit and a pastry and then walked to a coffee shop. Beware the street vendor selling fruit across the street from hotel. The rasperries were good and only $3, but he tried to give me only a $1 change when I gave him a $5 until I questioned him on it.Taking the subway to Penn Station to catch the Amtrak train, it took about 45 minutes from the hotel to the connecting station and then walking a few blocks to Penn Station.

I was in NY for a one night stay on memorial day wkd. It was my first time staying here and I was very impressed. The location was great!! there was a nice spa in the area that I tried and it was super easy to catch a cab!The highlight was the lovely staff. Stella Draskin checked me in with a very welcoming smile. She was able to get us checked in a couple hours before check in time which allowed us to get a head start on our short but very busy stay. We had a very nice room on a high floor with a view.The doorman, Keith Brown was BEYOND helpful. He gave us great directions, helped us get cabs and was full of laughter and jokes. Over all everyone was freindly and looked like they enjoyed thier jobs. You dont see this attitude often in busy big cities during holiday weekends. I highly reccomend this place and will be back again soon!

Perfect location for walking and a short cab to wonderful restaurants...... from Italian to Greek to Seafood...... Staff is very customer service friendly... Just remember you get into a Black Car instead of a Yellow Cab..... plan on paying twice as much..... not good......

The W Union Square is a perfect location to get out of the fray of the tourist activity, yet close enough to shoot up to Times Sq et al for a dose or two.The staff was amazing, and I am shocked to hear reviews of poor customer service. I was very impressed at how friendly (and handsome!) each and every staff member was. The hotel was very clean, and smelled clean and was very comfortable. Rooms quite large for a NYC note. Will definitely go back; thanks W!!!

My boyfriend and I arrived and stayed here for a family wedding. We were promised a room with a great view. When we finally got the room it was a terrible view. If people cannot deliver a great room they shouldn't say they can or promise. My boyfriend called the front desk to complain and the very man he spoke to denied even speaking to him at all. As we waited in the lobby we constantly received rude stares and comments from the staff at Olives. Reminding us it was reserved for people paying for food and drinks.We got lots of attitude from staff members here as well aside from the room cleaners who are extremely nice. Find a different hotel this place is not worth the price. Completely over priced and no free wifi in the rooms. It's an old building turned into a W hotel..... And the work they have done is very poor. Yellow caulking in showers, banged up furniture. I have stayed in hostels with better customer service. Avoid it!!

It's New York and it's the W, so expect the rooms to be small. But, you can also expect impeccable service--they do anything you want--and a well equipped fitness room downstairs.The location is perfect for anything you have to do in the city, as Union Square has a few subway lines and you can walk pretty much anywhere in downtown if you want. Great place from which to explore.

This review will be short-the only reason I stayed at the W New York-Union Square was because it was conveniently located near my daughter's NYU dorm. I arrived around 1am and was greeted by no one or helped with my bag. My daughter had already checked in, but I had to get a key to get access to the elevator. We had a premier room with 2 double beds-wasn't anything special. Bathroom had a typical tub/shower combo, 1 sink with vanity. I stayed 4 nights and I might have gotten the door held for me once or twice as I entered or exited the hotel. Service was non-existent. My daughter needed a taxi to get to Grand Central and there was no one at the curb to help hail one during rush hour. We didn't eat at the restaurant, so i can't comment on that. But I hope she is assigned to new dorm elsewhere in the city, because I won't be staying at this W again.

Hotel was contemporary and had an all around great funky vibe. We were upgraded to a fantastic top floor corner suite (thank you W). The room was more than generously sized, and the bed super super comfortable. Check in was efficient but slow. However no hotel facilities were explained to us at all (where was the bar, breakfast, etc) And for our first time here this would have been appreciated.The bar was also great but service extremely slow.Room service super efficient with great service.Only real negative was the lack of smiles and hellos.In three days not one door person opened the front door of the hotel or offered a greeting or welcome back.Check out was perfunctory but did not engage with us or even smile (not even a "how was your stay")The best smiles and warm greetings were from housekeeping and room service. Thank you.This is a great hotel. Perfect location. Great rooms.But smile ... It goes a long way. It's NYC!

Truly, W Hotel - Union Square lives up to “Whatever, Whenever.”“Whatever” you want it’s all right there… Shopping, great restaurants, people watching, delicious cocktails all within the hotel or just step right outside and there you have it. “Whenever” …. It’s New York! The city that never sleeps. I only write reviews if it’s deserved and for 5 years I’ve never been disappointed by this specific W Hotel. The staff is professional and attentive, and as a former New Yorker I have high expectations. That’s just one of the main reasons I always come back. Best W Hotel!

Was in NY for business and this was my first stay at the W Union Square. Prior to this stay I was more in midtown and Times Square where the rooms there were no bigger than a shoe box. I was pleasantly surprised by the sizes of the rooms at the W Union Square. The staff was extremely friendly, gym had more than enough equipment and the cleaning service did an excellent job to restocking everything on a daily basis.My only gripe with all W hotels is that you don't get an in-room coffee maker for the mornings when you wanna see no one but still get your caffeine fix. However, there is complimentary coffee in the lobby each morning (just off the elevator).

We found the W New York at Union Square to be the perfect hotel choice for our visit to New York City last week. The hotel is in a wonderful location with a friendly staff. Our room was large, clean, and quiet with a very comfortable bed. We were directed, by the concierge, to two delicious breakfast restaurants just around the corner on Irving Street. The hotel bar was a very popular spot each night. All in all, we highly recommend the W at Union Square for your next New York visit.

I have stayed at this W many times. I am a huge fan. Great location. Love the neighborhood. So many great new spots within walking distance. The Union Square market across the street is a wonder NYC experience. It's a short cab ride to mid town or soho...but not nearly as crowded and hurried. The rooms are typical W rooms. Hip, small. Love the bar on the first floor. Staff couldn't have been nicer. Without a doubt, I'll be back

The W Hotel in Union Square is what I expect of a W Hotel. This hotel had good size rooms for New York. Decor and furnishings where nice. We had a view of the park. The staff was friendly and helpful. This hotel is centrally located. Subway stations is within walking distance of the hotel. There is also shopping and restaurants in the area. Would definitely stay there again.

If you are a Starwood spg member (and even if you aren't) look no further, this is the place where you will want to stay. Perfect location, staff which is attentive, polite and fas. Good rooms and quiet nights. I will be back.

One of the best hotels in the city for extended stays or a quick jaunt. The expert staff, immaculate rooms and facilities are infused with one of the best neighborhoods in Manhattan.We stayed in a corner room on the 5th floor which was huge. Separate bed room and large living room connected by a hallway. The large bath has both a tub and separate full shower. The views of the park are beautiful and every imaginable restaurant serving just about anything you can think of is truly a 5-7 minute walk. the door men and security are the best and will have bags ready, doors open and car service ready in minutes.There is the standard W Living Room and a restaurant on site called Olives which has very good food and more importantly a solid bar with nice guys mixing it up back there.Cannot say one negative thing about this hotel (rare for me) as it is as close to perfect as you could want. You get what you pay for in this case.Thank You W!

I stayed at the W Union Square from April 18-21, 2014, travelling with a friend for a mixed business/pleasure trip. I have been to NYC six times. This was my first stay at this hotel. We stayed in a Spectacular King Room on the 17th floor -- outside the ice machine room, but it wasn't a problem at all. The room was clean and had a nice view of Union Square. I found it spacious by NYC standards. I loved the convenient location of this hotel. There are lots of amenities nearby. It was easy to pop out and grab food and come back to the room to eat or go shopping and come back and drop off purchases. Cab rides to bars and nightlife was only around $8 from the hotel. The subway was only a two-minute walk.Our last meal before departing was at OLiVES in the lobby. I enjoyed the whipped ricotta ravioli and calamari. Next door to the hotel is a 24 hour CVS (kind of a like a Shoppers Drug Mart with a small grocery section for all you Canucks out there) and a place called Bread and Butter where you can pick up coffees and sandwiches. Both were good and reasonably priced. They also have booze for you hounds out there.The hotel concierge helped secure reservations at STK in the Meatpacking District, which was fully booked on Open Table a month prior (little did we know, it was because of the TriBeCa Film Festival). During dessert, our waiter presented us with Prosecco "compliments of our concierge," which was a nice touch and impressed the client we dined with that night.The cab ride to the hotel from JFK was only $30. On the way home, the hotel arranged a private car, which matched the cab price.I have recommended this hotel to friends and will definitely stay here when I visit NYC again.

My wife and I stayed here one Saturday night in April. The location was great. Easy access by subway from laguardia airport. The subway ran about 4 stops express from Harlem to union square station.The square is full of market vendors on Saturday. There is a drug store next door and a liquor store on the other side if you want some drinks for the room. Whole foods is at the opposite end of the square and has great options for prepared foods and snacks for take home.The hotel is a great starting point for walking the city and easy access to the two main subway lines. We travelled all over the city by foot and subway. We didn't use wifi but bought a t-mobile pay as you go sim card for my non-USA iPhone. Only wished the room had a soaker tub instead of just a shower after walking all day in NYC.Can't wait to go back!

Every time I head to NYC this is my first choice. Location is great and the W vibe is consistent and always inviting. The rooms are great, always clean and often with a nice view. And so refreshing to be treated like a valued customer by the excellent staff from check in to check out. Olives is a great place to eat and the bar has gone the extra distance by getting several well chose taps for the beer enthusiast. The vibe amps up at night too so there's a fun atmosphere to kick off or round out your night in the city. So you win in both directions. Can't wait to return.

As expected the Hotel was contemporary, chic and had an all around great vibe. The room was generously sized, and the bed incredibly comfortable. The sounds of the City only lightly penetrated the room windows, but it really only added to the whole staying in Union Square experience. Room service was a little pricey, but definitely worth it. The star of the show however was the Welcome Desk Manager, David. We were in a bind at check-in, and he found a solution almost immediately, relieving us of a burden we were not prepared to deal with. To those who say, with boutique comes attitude, I say meet David. He is a true professional, and and an asset to the Starwood organization, and W Hotel family.

Date of visit: Saturday, 19 AprilLocation: right across Union Square. Of the 4 current W's in NYC, best location to bars of various neighborhoods, avoiding the touristy Times SquareLooks: As you enter the main entrance, the party seeps out from the Living Room bar on your right. It's, as per usual for a W Hotel, dark and sexy. The check-in counter is straight ahead, in a slightly claustrophobic corner under the winding staircase.Amenities: The Living Room bar was definitely lively, with an open space to see and be seen. Very conducive for mingling, not so much for quiet canoodling. I did not get a drink here, but those velvet couches looked comfortable.Room: The room was small, but served its purpose as a place to sleep. I really liked the different textured wallpapers, and reptile-skinned details on the table and shoe bench. The TV was a large enough size to comfortably enjoy from bed, though you can definitely feel a slight draft from the window. I had at the awesome view of brick wall, and an alley.Verdict: For the price, I'd hope for a little better SPG Platinum recognition (at least a sincere welcome, but maybe that's a New Yorker thing to skip the pleasantries). But, really, you're here for a sexy room near other nightlife spots. Personally, the location doesn't justify its price - the frequent guest treatment should've, but it fell short this time around.

The hotel definitely met standards of W hotels. We stayed for an extended weekend, and upon check in were given a great room with a fantastic view of the park. Although it was an upgraded room, we visited some other rooms and they held pretty good standards as well. The room layout was great (again, had a corner room with a couch). Overall a positive experience. The two issues we did have, management fixed imminently (both minor). The social areas were somewhat small given W hotels, but the location made up for the lack of places to "hang out". You are within walking distance of New York's prime nightlife, and right across the street from main subway stops. The stay was fantastic.

you cant really go wrong with the w. this hotel is in a great location and the room was clean and comfortable. we stayed here on our wedding night and the front desk sent up a bottle of champagne, which was very nice.

This was our first visit to a W Hotel and it was amazing. Friendly and helpful staff, excellent room service, wonderful location! A special thanks to Bill and the staff for making our amazing weekend wedding celebration with our son so wonderful!

I love the W hotels but was expecting more. The rooms are ok, service is good, staff is friendly. The elevator is the worse part of all. Takes too much to go up and down. Room service and food was pretty good, and the location is also nice. But as I said not enough for a W!

As W's go, this one is a bit lacking. My key gripe is service. My expectations of New York City hotels are low to begin with; the W Union Square met those expectations. Generally disengaged staff, the Whatever Whenever desk really puts the "whatever" into the job (didn't even look away from the computer screen when I started talking!), and the staff in the restaurant, while courteous, were slow and clumsy.Room service was OK. I ordered an arugula salad that seemed to have about three pounds of tightly-packed arugula. Fine, but... jeez.Other reviews notwithstanding, my room had a single, narrow window that was blocked bottom to midpoint by cinderblock on the outside. (They provided a step inside so you could see over it to the roof of another building 19 floors up.) I assume this is an exception in the hotel, however.Pros: comfy bed, clean room, fast Internet.

I've stayed in a number of W Hotels and this one certainly isn't the nicest or coolest one (W Santiago!), but the location can't be beat. You can walk to just about everything or a pretty short cab ride. The hotel itself is nice and clean, but doesn't have a ton of amenities (it does have a nice gym in the basement).

I have always wanted to stay here at the W Union Square Hotel and finally got my wish! My husband and I stayed in a "Wonderful" size room and it was spacious and comfortable. My only gripe was that we could hear our neighbors talking in the middle of the night. Otherwise, we loved the amenities, enjoyed the free coffee in the morning, and absolutely loved the central Union Square location. I look forward to staying here again soon!

My husband and I visit NYC annually and this was our first time staying at the W New York. We will definitely be back! The location is perfect, especially if you want to visit some of neighborhoods without the drama and hype of Midtown. The service is excellent; David Delvalle really attended to all our needs and was truly accommodating, friendly, and went above and beyond to ensure we were having a great time He even brought us cocktail tickets on the first day to help us ease into our vacation. People like David Delvalle are exactly why New Yorkers are always referred to as the "nicest people in the world."

My husband and I stayed here while we were celebrating his birthday. I emailed ahead of time to let them know it was a special occasion and they gave us a great room upgrade, sent an amazing dessert platter to our room and gave my husband a little present. It was really fantastic. The room was spacious and clean. The bathroom is pretty basic and our tub stopper wasn't working. The hotel decor is very modern and there is a great bar in the lobby. Best of all is the location of the hotel. It's in the heart of Union Square which is a central hub for the subway and is surrounded by great restaurants. We will definitely be returning.
user_name:
Bigapplemama1
New York City, New York

review_body: Our room at the W was spacious and very quiet and the location of this hotel is fantastic. So close to lots of good restaurants and subway. The doormen were not great, sometimes they were there, sometimes not. It was particularly irritating when my daughter and I needed a cab that the doorman was talking with a friend on the sidewalk, oblivious, until I walked into the street and hailed my own cab, at which point he came up and asked if we needed a cab as we got into it. There are no coffee makers in the room, you need to ask for one. The first morning we were there I trekked down to the lobby to get a cup of coffee and asked that a coffee maker be brought to our room. This never happened.

My wife and I were visiting our college student son and the W Union Square turned out to be an excellent choice. The room was spacious, especially for NYC. The staff were friendly and efficient at check-in, check-out and in between. (The doormen could have been a little more helpful in getting cabs in the rain, but all in all a minor quibble.) The location is excellent - right off the Square and near the subway and lost of restaurant choices.They have lobby coffee in the morning and as for sleeping, the room was pretty quiet for the City. Only heard an occasional ambulance but otherwise not much traffic noise. The rooms and the lobby are all nicely appointed and clean. The W definitely beats out other hotels we have tried in the area.

We just returned from a weekend in NYC with the kids and had a simply wonderful time at the W Union Square. I always enjoy the W hotels, but this one was particularly clean and staffed with helpful and friendly employees. Some highlights:1. We were greeted with a smile as we pulled up, immediately our bags were whisked inside by the bellman and our car was taken by valet within moments. By the time we got inside to check-in, the bellman knew my children's names and they were fast friends. Very dear.2. We arrived early, expecting a wait for our room. No wait at all- room was ready.3. When our romantic getaway changed into a family trip last minute- we expected a problem given that we had booked a king room. They tried to Switch us to two doubles without my even asking- but we're unable to given that the hotel was full. Instead, they rolled a great cot to the room- it was perfect.4. It was pouring rain and cold- when we returned back to the hotel after exploring all afternoon, we enjoyed lovely cocktails in the lobby lounge while the kids were treated to the BEST hot cocoa ever. When we ventured out to dinner later that night- the bellman ran down the street in the rain to get us a cab at changeover time during a rain storm. We so appreciated it!5. The room was spacious and filled with all the great amenities you would expect from a W: great beds, towels, powerful shower and of course all the great bliss spa products.6. Brunch was divine. Red velvet pancakes...really?? Yum!Thank you, W Union Square!

Stayed a week, so I got to learn a few things. I really like the location, would depend on your specific needs, but property is located midtown, right off Union Square, and convenient to most everything. Subway access, good restaurants, bars all close in. Hopping bar off the lobby area, that has foodservice that I just used for a couple of breakfasts. Spotty service, slow, but food was OK. Exercise room was small but adequate for what hotels offer. Rooms were comfy, make sure you put out your DND sign as housekeeping likes to make rooms up on the early side. Some issues with slow hot water. Biggest issue is with street noise. I don't know the room configurations, but I would recommend checking out an interior room. That would be my biggest complaint, loud road noise, otherwise check on in.

Stayed here for a night while attending a one day conference and have stayed here one night previously. I always feel more hip than I really am as a 50 year old father when I stay in a W and this one was no exception. Lively first floor bar and restaurant scene, a bigger room than I might have expected for a fashionable New York hotel and friendly and helpful staff. Typical of a W, the floor plan and meeting rooms can be funky ie really large, narrow, ornate and/or dark but everything here worked fine. If you needed to be in the Union Square area, this would certainly be a reasonable choice although perhaps not for the budget minded.

I've stayed here many times. The property is very cool and the rooms are larger than typical in NYC and very modern. Great location on the park with a huge choice of nearby restaurants Much less touristy than Times Square and much more fun than downtown. Quieter, too. Service is always outstanding and the onsite restaurant, lounge, and fitness room are great. I've stayed at dozens of hotels in NYC and this remains a standout.
user_name:
Harry G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We had not stayed in the Union Square area before and we found it perfect for our Anniversary getaway.Hotel is perfectly located with plenty of shops, restaurants, etc very close by.Had dinner first night at Olivers restaurant in the hotel, great ambiance, great food an excellent experience.Front Desk staff, bell staff and door staff very attentive, professional and well informed when one had a question.Rooms very well appointed, HK service consistent and everything worked perfectly in the room.Had to call down to FD at 4am as needed some medicine from the CVS on the corner, person who took the call went herself and had my medicine to me within 10 minutes.This is the hotel that I will try and stay in NY from now on!

I can't remember having such good service at a New York hotel (much less any hotel we've stayed at for a long time. We generally only stay at hotels rated 4 or 5 stars, and we average 3 or 4 trips to NYC a year for the past 7-8 years. When we arrived, we received a call just checking that everything was to our liking (which it was). We stayed 4 nights during the month of February and everyone was very pleasant and helpful the entire stay, right up to our last day. We had to stow our bags at the front desk after checking out because our flight didn't leave until early evening. We received great advice on how to get to the airport and a final email from management checking to see if we needed anything further. The bellman (David del Valk) was so pleasant and helpful when we came to pick up our bags. Our last several visits before this one we had been staying in the hotels in the Meatpacking District and none of them held a candle to the W. We will definitely be staying there for our next trip to NYC.

My daughter and I stayed at the W Union Square monday night. I sent this email today to the manager…..let it serve as my review!I just wanted to send a short note to tell you what a great hotel you are running. W Union Square has always been the hotel our family visits in NYC. My husband was your biggest fan. The staff is always unflaggingly cheerful & polite (especially Keith who always seems to be at the front door unless it is a Monday). Natalie at the front desk is charming and Jose got us a cab yesterday, and somehow made the simple exchange feel like a favor from an old friend. Mr. Mendez has been incredibly helpful in arranging last minute stays and answering my inane questions. It is hard to hire & retain good people and I am sure in the world of hotel management there are more complaints than kudos. We only stay in NYC a few nights a year, but we will always stay with you. thank youChristine

I brought my mom to the city for 2 nights for her birthday. We stayed on points and were treated so well by everyone - especially Nelson at the front desk. When he found out it was her birthday he insisted on sending a gift to the room. After we got back from dinner and our show that night a bottle of wine and mini cupcakes with a sweet note were waiting for us in the room. Highly recommend this W property.

I have stayed at and reviewed this hotel before and some stays have been better than others. My last stay was just Great and I commend the Team they have working at this hotel. The Location of this hotel in Union Square is just Perfect. You can get to Soho in three subway stops or a $8 taxi ride. You can access all the Museums via train, directly across the street from this hotel. There are hundreds of great restaurants in walking distance AND you are close to Chelsea and the Meat packing district. This hotels location cannot be beat. W bed was delicious and all toiletries were Bliss and high quality. Internet speeds were good and breakfast at Olives was delicious each morning. Nice place to start your day. The rooms have high ceilings and big windows as this was not a purpose built W but a bank that was converted....It does make a difference with many sizes and shapes of rooms etc. They recently underwent a soft renovation and changed color schemes and carpets etc. The hotel is in good shape. Everyone said hello and goodbye, the concierge services helped me out on several occasions....kudos to them. I would recommend this hotel to everyone....it is a favorite of mine. Safe travels to all! Enjoy NYC!

cannot say anything bad about our stay. from the minute we pulled up to the hotel until we drove away 2 days later the staff was wonderful. they kept asking if there was anything they could do for us and went out of there way to make us feel comfortable. they were always pleasant and polite.the accommodations were perfect. the room was spacious and clean. it was a pleasure staying there.

I spent a weekend at this property, visiting my son. The staff was very accomodating, the room super cool with views of the square.My only complaint was the request for a high floor. We checked in early but needed to wait until check in time to get our room, even with all of that we were only given the 6th floor in a hotel of 20+ floors. a bit dissapointing.That is my only complaint. You are close to everything, easy metro hop, The New School and lots of great restaurants.

The W is great, noisy, modern, good views and location, decent service but the loud music and poor lighting bores you after a couple of days. Great for a weekend and don't go for business although the internet connection was not bad.

My daughter (40 y.o.) and I recently stayed at the W New York- Union Square and every minute was fantastic- from courteous and efficient service to great rooms (my room was upgraded) to wonderful food in their restaurant. We were celebrating her birthday and I can't imagine a better hotel experience. The building is old and handsome (and very solid). A friend met us for breakfast before we checked out and was very impressed with the quality of service and the brunch.Five stars and kudos!!! She and I are going to go back twice a year for birthday celebrations and I am already looking forward to returning.

The exercise room was deficient in several ways. First, the bikes were broken so that when you pedaled it changed levels constantly. The pedal straps had been torn off, too. Treadmill had no tv and the room itself was heated as if it was a sauna.Finally, the front desk clerks were rude and unhelpful. When I asked where the stirrers for the coffee were I was told "sorry" with no suggestions or willingness to consider alternatives... like a spoon! I don't mean to be petty but as a Starwood member I expected more.

Pretty typical W experience. "Cool" W vibe, though hotel is actually very nice, built inside an old building. Upgraded to a large room with a view east side towards the Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridges. Location is great on Union Square, with numerous subway lines all over Manhattan. Lots of restaurants and shops in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, so didn't try the hotel bar or restaurant. Staff generally friendly and helpful but a bit standoffish. Obviously rates can vary widely, but if I can get a good rate, I'd consider staying here again (my previous stay was in 2002).

it's amazing that this hotel is in such a terrific area of new york city and is such a fantastic deal. unfortunately i was only staying one night but from check in to check out, it was a wonderful experience. desk and bell staff were very helpful. the room size was more than adequate and the bed was extremely comfortable. bathroom was quite spacious with lovely amenities. bar and restaurant, both fun and energetic - food was very good. delighted that i was able to ask for a coffee maker in my room -- made the morning that much nicer. hope to come back.

W Union Square is the best hotel to stay at in NYC. Not only is the location great- but the staff and accomodations are 5 star. The hotel vibe is fun/energetic and accomodations are always clean/nice....and the entire staff is so pleasant and helpful. Additionally, the costs are affordable.

I was lucky enough to be a guest at this hotel on a friend's points.The rooms were very clean, great odor throughout. Really spacious, beds were super comfortable and the view was actually decent (of Union Square).The staff was very friendly, doorman was funny and attentive.The warm apple cider was amazing especially as the weather was a bit on the cooler side.The location was great, there is a Whole Foods across Union Square (2 minutes), the subway to connect to everything is in the park itself. Eataly is a 10 minute walk.I highly recommend this hotel.

Reserved a suite, upon check-in was told that the prior guests were more important and were not leaving until 4 pm so the suite would not be ready until 5 or 6. We're given a regular room. Were also told the suite was really no better than the regular room. Then why is it so much more money? When took the regular room and got upstairs called down and spoke with manager who informed us that the guests had left the suite and it could be ours but we should look at it first. Looked and the manager was right, it is no better than regular room. Shame on the W for charging so much for nothing more, and shame on W for telling us that we aren't as important as other guests. My son lives in NYC and I was looking for a go to hotel closer to his apartment, I will go back to the Chelsea Pines even though it is farther away, you lost my business.

I'm in NYC regularly for business travel and this is now my go-to spot whenever I'm in the city (for both business and pleasure).Reasons to be a regular: 1. Great service throughout the hotel (from the door-men to the cleaning staff). Front desk staff are friendly, professional efficient and very helpful. The welcome desk team is also excellent and have accommodated any number of above-and-beyond requests. Two particular call-outs who epitomize the stellar service I've had here: A) Marc Rafeld, one of the welcome desk managers is my regular point of contact at the hotel – and one of the best I've ever dealt with. Whether it's arranging restaurant reservations, handling last minute room reservation changes or making sure my room is ready for early check-in- he always makes sure my stay is excellent. B) Tamara- who works nights at the front desk, has likely made me more room keys than anyone in the history of any hotel… and always with a pleasant smile. 2. Best location in the city- walking distance from Union Square station (you can get pretty much anywhere in the city from here). Excellent dining choices all around. 3. Rooms are a good size (by NYC standard) and are really pretty well equipped (e.g., charger for my iPod, etc).

My daughter lives on the lower east side of New York and I visit her a lot - I'll be staying at the W Union Square from now on. We were in town for a difficult situation last month and everyone from the manager to the cleaning staff did everything in their power to make us as comfortable as possible and help us.The personal attention we got was unrivaled. Our room was very big by NY standards, clean, and comfortable. The location, just off Union Square, can't be beat, with everything you need just blocks away and a busy subway station with lots of lines. I've already booked 2 more trips there.

My room was fairly spacious by Manhattan standards. Very cozy bed. The best part is the restaurant, Olive, on the ground floor. Excellent food. The W Hotel is on the pricey side, but you can still get great deals if you shop around online.

We just returned from of trip to New York City. Our stay at the W New York- Union Square was nothing but perfect. From check-in, to room service, to concierge service. Staff was professional, fun and helpful. Our room over looked Union Square with a beautiful view of the Freedom Tower.The room was impeccably clean. (something, from experience, can be tricky in a big city) We used the gym facilities, as it was 19 or so degrees outside, not exactly running weather. The cardio equipment seemed well tuned up and the gym area was very clean. Highly recommend the location. Safe, and easy access to subway and cab rides anywhere. Keep up the great work, W- Union Square!

The rooms are spacious and well maintained. The hotel has a nice, funky feel to it. The service was excellent, with staff exceptionally friendly and thoughtful. We stayed there during our honeymoon and the hotel sent us a bottle of wine and some cheese to celebrate. Every morning, free coffee is provided in the lobby. The location of the hotel is also fantastic.

Thia W is a very short walk to Nordstrom Rack, Red Door, Strand Books, Walgreen, Whole Foods, the subway. Olives, its in- house restaurant serves great,reasonably priced breakfast. The rock-shrimp omelette with cheddar grits ($15) & Florentine pizza ($13) are superb! The Bliss toiletries - fabulous! Beware! The Dasani water is free & placed in a dark corner. The Smart Water is not free & placed at your bedside & sink ($7-9)! The price is printed on a card in very small, light grey font!

This location is amazing and the team makes me feel at home...I am a lifetime platinum and this is always my first choice in NYC! I can't say enough things about the amazing staff! Also great to have a great spot in the lobby for drinks or dinner...

The hotel is well positioned for anyone that wants to explore NY as it is so central. The hotel is trendy and you will find hipsters drinking coffee in the bar downstairs. The room we had was a little noisy but on the whole a very good place.

We had another great stay at the W Union Square NYC. Our check in was seemless. We requested and received an early check-in. Our room is comfortable with a great view of Union Square Park. The concierge desk helped us locate a restaurant for dinner. We were able to print our airline boarding passes for free in the business center.Also, during a previous visit to the hotel we inadvertently left some cash in the room safe. The hotel security staff retrieved and held it for us and returned it to us upon our arrival.We have frequently stayed at the W Union Square. We will continue to do so in the future and will recommend this hotel,to others.

So I haven't stayed here (W Union Square) for a while because of the ongoing renovation etc.I just had the opportunity to stay here 2 times in one week...not only an amazing experience but a relaxing one where I wasn't constantly bombarded with information and over-hype.I got all I needed from everyone...Front desk.. Eddie and Stella XOXOXO amazing...The cleaning people...very terrific...Heather the Bartender...yes I drink ...LOL fantastic...The Door people all remembered me...don't know why but...Keith etc were amazing as always...Anyway I highly recommend this Hotel a little pricey --- but what price do you put on your travel SANITY...

We stayed at the hotel during a move between apartments in New York. We were accompanied by our dog, and the pet-friendly policy was great for us. We all felt welcome and well care for. The room was beautifully decorated and comfortable. The room service food was outstanding. The hotel provided a new toy, pet bowl, and bed for our dog. The doorman even had treats for her!
user_name:
RobinNYC2013
New York City, New York

review_body: I had a remarkable stay at the W Union Square recently and felt compelled to share my experience. From the first step in the door, the entire staff made us feel like valued customers. The front desk staff was helpful, kind, efficient, and accommodating. The room service staff was excellent, and the concierge and valet staff were fantastic as well. The rooms were clean and well maintained. I will definitely stay there again. Thank you to the entire W staff for an incredible stay!

I came here as a surprise birthday gift from my boyfriend :)The hotel is in a great location in Union Square! Our experience with the hotel staff was so great! Check-in went very smoothly and as we were heading to the elevators, we were greeted by one of the managers, Marc, who was aware it was my birthday and wished me a happy birthday! How kind of him! We got a room on the 11th floor with really great sunlight coming in from 3 huge windows. My bf later told me they were called picture windows and we had them facing East and South so we got great light all day! We had a nice view of union square and the park. The room was very modern with a day bed/couch, flat screen with tons of new movies still out in theaters that you could purchase, great BLISS amenities including face wash and good body lotion. The accents around the room and small pillows seemed edgy and cool and the room was very clean. Since we got there earlier in the day, we ended up going out to hang out and when we returned to change before dinner, I was greeted with a plate of treats including a bottle of natural spring water, cupcakes and chocolate covered strawberries, with the words "Happy Birthday" written on it with a personalized card from yet another manager, Bill. What a nice surprise! :)The staff was super friendly and helpful throughout our short stay. From the front desk to the bar, the managers and staff walking around, everyone was so professional and willing to assist in any way. Housekeeping was quick when extra towels were requested and we also (actually just I) got to get some additional BLISS products! I was sitting in the Olive bar lounge area waiting for my boyfriend at the bar and a staff member walked by and asked to make sure I was okay. It was very reassuring to find that the staff was so caring and welcoming! Even on our way out, the manager we first met, Marc, caught us, wished me a happy birthday again and wished us a safe trip home! He remembered! I would definitely come back again and recommend this hotel!!! Thanks again to Marc and the rest of the W hotel staff for making my birthday celebration a memorable one! =)

I highly recommend this hotel. The location can't be beat as a perfectly situated base for walking to all of the most interesting neighborhoods in Manhattan. I really like the design and vibe of this particular W. It's more subtle and less of a pretentious scene that many of its sister properties. I really like the recent redesign of the rooms. The color scheme and other design elements like the topographical wall panels are gorgeous. Staff is friendly and attentive. Elevators and luggage service are regrettably slow.Probably the only real negative is the small and dimly let gym which doesn't meet the standards of the hotel.

Service at this hotel is fantastic! From the moment we drove up the staff was super friendly and took excellent care of us. It was wet and snowy out and the gentleman helping us from the car took great care to make sure that we didnt get our feet and clothes messed up. Very quick to check us in. Gave us great directions to find a wedding card. My beau accidently dropped some very important papers in the wet dirty street and the wonderful staff took it to a copier and had it comepletely reprinted and rebinded. It was delivered to our room the next morning! The hotel was clean and quiet. And in a great location! If you are going to a function at the Manhattan Penthouse then this hotel is a GREAT location! We will be back!

Very impressed with staff at W New York Union Square. We needed to check in early in order to get ready for our son's wedding and the staff worked really hard to get us a room. Everyone was so friendly including the doorman, the bell hop, and all the front desk people. They also helped usenormously when we had a minor clothing problem. Everything else about the hotel is also first rate - rooms clean, good size, great views and very cozy. Location is superb with access to Union Square, subways, restaurants, and stores. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again.

I brought my girlfriend here for her birthday and for a night out. Upon entering the hotel we were checked in by a girl named Stella who happened to be incredible nice and personable. So much so, that both my girlfriend and I immediately began liking this hotel. After we checked in I met one of the managers named Marc. He was incredibly professional and so welcoming that I was really impressed! I told him that it was my girlfriend's birthday and he wished her a happy birthday. The room was excellent, featuring 3 huge windows with South and East exposure and it was very clean which is important to us. After, returning to the hotel later in the day, we entered our room and there were a plate of cupcakes and chocolates and a birthday card! The card was signed by the GM of the building I believe named Bill. Obviously, Marc had something to do with this. I have been to a lot of hotels and I definitely know service as I am a real estate broker and heavily involved in service. However, this hotel really knows how to pick and train their staff. Stella and Marc really made us feel welcomed, it was incredible. Thank you very much! We will definitely be back here!

My wife and I used to live in Hoboken NJ, right across the river from Manhattan. We try to get to NYC a couple times per year. This was our first time at the Union Square W Hotel, and had a really nice experience. First, the location was excellent and very centrally located. Furthermore, from the doorman to the front desk people to everyone else, they were very accommodating.

I love this hotel in the Union Square neihborhood. The rooms and views are wonderful and the service is excellent. Outside the hotel are great restaurants, yoga, spin classes and shopping including a farmers market. The location is not as touristy as time square.

The hotel is in an excellent location, with easy access to the metro. The rooms are of a good size giving plenty of space. The air conditioning was excellent considering the temperatures outside. Great bar and restaurant.I certainly will stay here again.

Stayed for a week in W Union Square. Room was of fair size and relatively modern. Isn't ideal for a business stay as I had less hangers in the room than shirts. The fitness centre is small and poorly equipped. It's in the basement and if you are a basketball player you'd have trouble to work out on the treadmills as the ceiling is so low.Staff at the front desk and the concierge were very professional, however the same cannot be said of the doormen. First I was in serious doubt whether they belong to the hotel at all.Location is excellent.

I'm not one to write many reviews, but after staying at the W Union Square for the last ten years at least 3-4 times a year, I thought it was time I shared my wonderful experiences with this hotel. First, the wonderful:- The STAFF. The doormen always remember us and are so pleasant and helpful and just nice welcoming guys. The front desk staff is always accomodating, Wherever/Whenever is great, and checking in, asking for additional amenties etc. is always easy. Marc Rafeld, now part of the management team at the W in Union Square is fantastic. I can't say enough great things about how he has treated my family, especially for my recent anniversary. We go to NY for all of our big celebrations, as we got engaged and ended our honeymoon there, and Marc has just made everything that much better. Hopefully his managers appreciate the caliber of employee they have. LOCATION: I'm not a fan of mid-town Times Square craziness. I love this location. Restaurants in the area are wonderful, your'e a quick walk to Soho, Chinatown, LES, Downtown, Grand Central. The Location has it all. Rooms: Nice rooms, recently re-furbished and good size by NY standards. Now for the good vs. Wonderful: The price. Rooms are on the expensive side, but deals can be found. Beyond that I have no negatives to add. Any time I have ever had an issue in the tens of times we've stayed there it's been resolved. Marc, the front door staff, the welcome desk are all great. We look forward to coming back for a getaway in the next month or so. -

We stayed a long weekend at the W Union Square. The room was a wonderful surprise - so much bigger and more comfortable than other New York hotels we'd used in the past. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. A great location for exploring the city. Well placed for the subway. Easy walking distance to SoHo. We'll definitely be back
user_name:
Debbie B
Leicester, England, United Kingdom

review_body: This is my family's favourite Starwood Hotel. This W is centrally located in Manhattan, across the street from the L, NQR, and 456 subway lines. While the location is great, the crowds can be a negative for some people. Union Square gets very crowded with locals and tourists.As a Platinum SPG member, I have never been upgraded at this hotel. I am not sure if it's because their higher room types are always booked or they do not upgrade. Their renovation of the Living Room to include graffiti lamps and furniture is not exactly my taste, but it still seems popular with the locals who come for after-work drinks.
user_name:
cmarsicek
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the W on Union Square for Christmas 2013 and found it to be a good hotel with friendly staff and large comfortable rooms. We were on the 9th floor in a king room which had been recently refurbished. The bed seemed huge and was very comfortable and the overall room was nicely decorated and a really pleasant place to stay.We didn't use a lot of the hotel facilities as our kids had an apartment on the other side of Union Square but it was a great place to retreat to at night.The Union Square location was also great with the Christmas Markets, shops and subway access which meant we were never that far from anywhere.The hotel staff were friendly and helpful.

Just stayed four nights at the W Union Square. My husband and four college age children, we had three rooms. Our previous trips to NYC were spent in cramped hotel rooms in Times Square and I must say this hotel was PHENOMENAL!!! The rooms and bathrooms are spacious, the staff was over-the-top friendly, and you CANNOT beat the location at Union Square! Check-in was flawless (and we paid with Amex points with NO troubles), check-out without a hitch (thank you Eduardo for your friendliness), and they even arranged our airport transportation the morning we left. I cannot say enough great things about our stay and the W Union Square will be our choice next trip to NYC!

Everything was amazing from the friendly and efficient valet service, to our prompt check-in, to our pristine spacious room. The staff was extremely attentive and friendly. The location is amazing and conveniently located right across from the subway allowing for easy access to everything. This was our first stay in this hotel and will be our first choice for future visits.
user_name:
Heather M
East Northport, New York

review_body: Looks like somebody at Starwood marketing department thought that putting a noisy bar, some color lights, bliss amenities and checking personnel with open collar shirts is enough to make it a W. Well, it is not. Location is great, at Park and Union sq (and that is the reason we choose it in first place) but it is far from usual fancy and trendy W places. Rooms are small (and still, being a Platinum member I apparently got an upgrade; do not dare imaging other rooms) and would benefit from a in-depth cleaning (mostly carpet) and so is 'fitness center' (3 trademills and few other machines). While the service at the front desk is professional, doorman and other people outside, your first and last contact with the hotel, are beyond imagination: "are you sure you are not forgetting something" are the words actually uttered by one of them seconds after putting my bags in the cab, while I was still about to look for the tip money in my pocket. Well, clearly having heard that I forgot it instantly. Unfortunately, looks more like a rule and not an exception, as on the arrival the experience was quite similar

The rooms were well appointed. The service was great. We had a nice lunch at Olives and the staff at the bar went out of their way to accommodate our group. My only complaint was that the room was a little drafty, probably due to the large windows. If you don't like street noise, don't stay here.

Stayed here for 5 days over the American Thanksgiving holidays. Our son's apartment is around the corner so we wanted to be close by - we usually stay in mid-town when we come to NYC so staying in Union Square was a change for us. We had a 'cozy' suite on the 11th floor - you could definitely hear the traffic - so next time I would request a higher floor. The price for this accommodation in NYC was fantastic - I think the value is incredible for the price. The main room was very large and spacious - funky fun furniture - the bathroom, likewise, was a nice size. The bedroom was smaller - but just fine since we had the living space. I loved the bath products - especially the Bliss body butter - a super nice surprise since usually the bath products at hotels are not something you really want to use! in this case, however, in dry wintry NYC I needed more moisturizer than I brought and loved the product. The staff was very nice and responsive - even with a jammed packed hotel they recognized me every time I came past the front desk by name - so great customer service there. I had breakfast in the restaurant - the menu is small - not a great breakfast. We had a mix of service there - one excellent young lady and one very rude young man. Beyond that service glitch and the annoyance of having to pay for internet in your room (paying for internet in hotels is a pet peeve of mine - annoying! Tip for the W - include free internet with your loyalty program) I enjoyed this property and will definitely stay here again.

Our stay @ The fabulous W Hotel (Union Square) NYC was 1st class experience. Holiday market set up in Union Square was festive (free hot cider) & diverse offerings. We bought cannoli to treat friendly hotel staff. Our hotel room on 18th floor was spacious, meticulously clean & great view overlooking the best park in all of NYC. We've stayed in numerous NYC hotels over the past several years. The W is our new favorite. The Olive Bar in the lobby was very accommodating too!!!

No complaints here. Thank you W Union Square! My last visit was excellent. Hotel Manager Gerald Tellez was there. He has a way of making you feel like an old friend. It's been rough traveling around the holidays this year but he and the rest of the staff made me feel as at home as possible. Happy Holidays W Union Square! See you in 2014

Great location and great customer service. We were able to walk just about everywhere. Rooms were comfortable and clean. I liked how the lamps had extra outlets on them to charge all of our electronics.

W, in my mind is glitz, a place to be 'seen' and a 'lifestyle' brand that happens to have a hotel attached to it. Memories of the W in LA and St Petersburg include a catwalk fashion show on repeat in the elevator along with club music; rooms in all white with funky (but impractical) furniture; staff too cool for school and just a lot of pretension. For all of these reasons I avoid the W but this one at Union Square was different.I honestly could have been at just a Sheraton - a tarted up Sheraton. This appears to be a historic building that is a bit darker but beautiful high ceilings and pretty good sized rooms for New York. The lobby bar was nice but I didn't get a headache walking into the lobby, flghting my way through clubbers and partyers - nice.The rooms were pretty plain for a W but that was fine with me - good sized everything - good lighting and pretty standard, generic furniture relatively speaking. There was no pretension in the room, just a lot of practicality. Excellent heating system, nice view over Union Sq - not much more to ask for. Only complaint was the hot water took a long time to heat up. We arrived early for check-in on Sunday. The hotel was full from the night before and we couldn't check in until much later - no problem. Margie was fantastic and a real asset to the company, remembering my name from first encounter to check-out. She is fantastic and so was the encounter with other staff members.Fitness room is pretty modest but did the trick. Breakfast at Olives was nothing special and service was a bit off but no big deal.Definitely no value add items at W - need an umbrella? Pay for it in the room. Want some water - that'll be $9. You get more free stuff at the Sheraton and this is a less glam brand. In conclusion, a good hotel in a great location. This W is the chain's ugly sister and definitely if you want glam, this is not the W for you. If you want good hotel keeping, this one is a keeper.

Great location, close to subway, shops and endless restaurants. Stayed in a mega room which had plenty of space and comfort. Staff attentive especially the doormen! Pretty pricey but it IS NYC. Would stay again!

Spent two nights here in November. Rooms have been refurbished and are comfortable and clean. Excellent bed and good bathroom. I was on the 17th floor at the back of the hotel but it was very noisy at night. Sirens and street noise woke me on several occasions as did the bathroom of a neighbouring room.I had been here ten years ago when the lobby was very much a place to be seen. The hotel has been renovated since then and it is certainly no longer the fashionable place it once was. Lots of families here for shopping.Location is great for shopping and easy walk to Greenwich Village and SoHo. Best thing about the place was the staff. Reception staff were friendly and welcoming. Very personalised check-in and check-out.Bottom line is it's a good place if you get the right price but for 400 dollars a night, I'd be tempted to look elsewhere next time.

I've stayed at this W location a few times over the year. I love its location - it's fairly central with lots of great stuff nearby either walking or biking (CitiBikes!) distance. Plus, it's away from the madness that is Times Square. I do think this W is lacking on the service side. I felt that staff in the lobby weren't that friendly. For example, it bugged me that no one was there to grab the door as they say me approaching, lugging my suitcase, in the rain! The rooms I've stayed in have been on the larger side, especially by New York standards. Although based on the other reviews I've read, I might have just picked the right room at booking. The rooms are clean on the surface, but try not to look too deep because you're bound to find flaws. With all my stays, I've encountered open candy wrappers under the bed and dirty bathroom mirrors. Relatively minor, but you also try not to think too much into it (I mean, if they missed that, what else have they missed...).Given the option, I'd chose another hotel option in NY (to be honest, I've found a new favorite in town anyways). This place just doesn't match my W/SPG expectations. If you ended up staying there too for whatever reason, it's not the end of the world either. Like I said, I do love the location. And while service could be friendlier, you're not spending your timing socializing in the lobby.
