And if there's something dirty in your room, call housekeeping to address it (everything I've seen was manageable).

This W Hotel staff here is Awesome! My second trip here this year. Both times I was impressed how well the staff has been trained. Courteous, Friendly and Helpful. Way Above and Beyond the expected level! Great bar area with WIFI. Rooms are bigger than I would expect in NYC. I won't stay anywhere else when I come to NYC!

I have been coming to NYC yearly now for almost 20 years, the last 10 times I have stayed at the W Union Square. The location is the best as far as I am concerned. There is a wonderful Farmer's Market in the square every Friday and Saturday morning that is fun to stroll through before you start your day. Keith, the doorman is such a delight to see each time my taxi pulls up. The hotel recently updated their rooms with new bedding and paint and carpet. Their beds are just as described, WONDERFUL & HEAVENLY! I never want to get out of bed!

We had a Fantastic Suite on a December weekend and it was a great stay. The room was extremely clean and had a very large bathroom for NYC. The small living room area was also very handy. We had one small issue with a minor leak and Gerald the manager handled very quickly and efficiently. We stayed on the 5th floor and there is some road noise and would probably try for a higher floor room next time. Overall a great experience!

This is one of the nice W hotels in NYC, great lobby and bar for mingling and drinks. Rooms are updated and modern and large by NYC standards. Bliss spa amenities are awesome, save me having to bring my own products. Located right at the square, convenient short walk to lots of great food, shopping and movie theaters. Subway station hub, so you can catch pretty much any lines to access other parts of NYC. But hotel can be pricey but would definitely stay here again if I want to be downtown. Other hotel in starwood chain that I love in NYC is the Parker Meridien if I want to be closer to Central Park or uptown. Was here on a conference, come in early to spend the weekend playing tourist.

I was happy with this hotel. The rooms are the normal ny small, but not too small. The front desk was very nice. We were placed in a quiet area off the street so the noise was minimal. The only issue is that the sound of the room next door's shower (water running) is out of control loud and woke us up.
user_name:
Blondie2846
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed at this Hotel during some of the coldest days in NYC last week! Great location and service, I specially enjoyed the hot apple cider (complimentary) at the reception, since it was a real treat when I rushed inside from the freezing cold. The room we stayed in, although small, was very clean and comfortable. Whenever we needed a Taxi, the doorman stepped outside and found us one... very comforting in the cold weather. My only complaint was that, they should have a coffee maker in every room and not expect guests to call the concierge to get one! in fact it took 2 calls and half an hour to get a coffee maker into our room.

Good location, close to subway. Nice, modern, impeccable room, bigger than what we are used to in Manhattan hotels. We liked their complimentary limo service. We used it several times to go places. You have to reserve it a few hours before and takes you roughly anywhere between 55th street and Lower East Side.

I must preface by stating this review does not include Olives, as both food and service are better than ever. Love the refurb which expanded the bar area into the restaurant. Alas, the W Union Square’s decline in service is akin to what we’ve noticed at all W hotels we’ve visited in the past year. Prior to 2013, the W has been our favorite SPG brand, with this property being our hands-down favorite. In fact, we experienced such exemplary service last December that I wrote a letter of commendation to SPG regarding their staff and management and have rated them as a ‘5’ in two previous TripAdvisor reviews. Well, we’ve stayed 3 more times since then, and alas much has changed in a year. Gone is the big front desk SPG Platinum “welcome” and friendly check-in conversation that always started us off on a stellar note. We were assigned a Spectacular King room, which was exactly what we booked -- no big surprise as we’ve never received an upgrade at W properties as a Platinum member. We normally bring the kids and book two doubles, so this was our first king room and I was very disappointed. While the bedroom is similar, the bathroom was extremely “blah” – nothing special at all. Worse yet, the room wasn’t the cleanest and not well equipped -- dusty baseboards and window frames and no coffee maker. Plus the “new” décor is not my cup of tea, leaving me longing for the pre-refurbishment espresso furniture and purple satin linens. Elevators were not stopping at every floor, forcing some folks to the stairs. After reporting it to multiple staff members the previous evening, it was still not fixed by 11am the following morning. Check out was strangely unprofessional for a supposedly luxury boutique hotel. No inquiry regarding our experience; just a simple “do you need your bill printed” and “I need your valet ticket to stamp it,” even though my husband had given the ticket to valet and was already loading luggage. We have two more W stays booked for the month of December, one of which is at this property. Although we’ve been SPG loyalists for almost 5 years now, we’ve been seriously disappointed with their service at multiple properties on way too many occasions this year (with the exception of the Sheraton brand, whose service has been far superior to our experiences at the Westin, W, and Le Meridien properties all year). If things don't improve, 2014 will most definitely be our last with the program.

My husband and I stayed 2 nights for the Halloween Parade. The staff at the front desk and throughout the hotel could not have been friendlier or more accomodating. The rooms here are expensive, but worth every penny. We travel all over, as well as several times a year, and usually do not expect such friendly service. The front desk staff stored our luggage when we arrived earlier than check in. Then so kindly stored all our shopping bags, along with our luggage, for as long as we wanted after check out so we could continue to walk around and enjoy the City for the rest of the day. No extra charge...a plus! The doorman always had a smile and got our cabs instantly...the management checked on us with a call to our room and made sure we were happy with it...and the bed was one of the most comfortable ever! From the pillows, to the sheets, to the comfortor...and so clean! The room even smelled good. I know it's a bit on the pricey side, but like I said, you get what you pay for. If you plan on staying in this area, in order to get anything decent and clean you need to spend more anyway. Hopefully we can return to the W Union Square again...we really loved this beautiful hotel!

I stayed recently at the W New York - Union Square in a standard room, and it was anything but standard - king-size bed with multiple pillows, comfy mattress, desk, lounge chair, high ceilings, great views, luxe bath, and mini-bar. Price was decent for New York - around $400/night - and the staff was very attentive (even free champagne when we arrived - they were doing a tasting in the lobby). The bar scene downstairs was hopping after hours. Highly recommended for business travelers looking for a less staid and stuffy location than mid-town!

My fiancee and I spent a night at the W New York Union Square this past weekend, and what a great experience it was. We were in town for a rock show at Irving plaza ( which was only a short walk away) and we were blown away by the proximity of the hotel to almost everything.The hotel is expensive,but you really do get what you pay for (Ecsp. in the city), the rooms were large for NYC standards, and very quiet, it was clean and there were high end soaps in the bathroom, you can tell they tried their best to make your stay special.( I recommend the "Olive Burger" from the room service menu, it was HUGE and fresh and really hit the spot. :) )The bed was to die for, I didn't want to get out of it, if there was a way to fit it in the car home I would!! All in all it was an amazing weekend, and we will definitely be staying there again on our next trip to NYC. The one thing I can say about the hotel negatively is that although it is super secure ( you need your key to get almost everywhere!! really made me feel safe!) A very intoxicated homeless man got in the elevator with us (it would have been rude and presumptuous to kick him out, left us in a weird spot!), he was making vulgar remarks toward me and it was uncomfortable, if my fiancee wasn't there I wouldn't have felt safe. With a nightclub downstairs, and being located on a busy street, there has to be a way to make sure people who are in the elevators are allowed there. I mean it was the weekend, at night, in the city, so I was partly to blame, but it was rather uncomfortable. That being said, the bad experience wouldn't sway me from staying there again. I had such an amazing time at the hotel and the location was amazing!!

I booked the hotel for 7 nights and checked in at around 9 pm on a week night. There were no doorman or porter helping with our luggage. After struggling with 4 bags past the heavy doors, there were no offers from the receptionist to help with our luggage. The room decoration is not up to the usual standard of a W Hotel, it sadly need a make over. The air conditioning outlet was half blocked by the curtain and it was loud. The ground floor bar is hip but the lack of insulation made it very loud and impossible to have a conversation. The drinks were experience and the rest rooms are a long flight of stairs up to the first floor. Not pleasant after a few drinks. The guest room is poorly insulated as you can hear plumbing noise from adjoining bath rooms, including the flushing of toilets and guests taking a shower. The nightmare started the second morning, as I was taking a shower, the toilet bowl started to overflow onto the bathroom floor. It was like watching a horror movie when urine was overflowing on to the floor. It was disgusting and most unhygienic, I had to get out of the shower, stepping on the overflown floor to get dressed and call the reception. A maintenance man did turn up pretty quickly. By this stage, we had enough of it, we packed up quickly and asked to be put to another room. First of all, the receptionist tried to tell me that there were no vacant room, having stood at the reception for a good 10 minutes, he found a vacant room 2 floors above which was reserved for other guests. There were no offer of help to move our luggage. The nightmare gets worse, the acoustic insulation in this room is even worse. We could hear every guests walking past outside the corridor and the plumbing noise again. Yes the nightmare continues, toilet flushing, other guests tuning taps on and off. You can hear everything. To top it off, we could hear a coupe arguing, door slamming and shouting in the middle of the night. That's not the end of it. As I was taking a shower, the toilet bowl starts to fill up again....... At this point in time, we have had enough, we packed up immediately, checked out and checked into the Intercontinental Hotel. We had stayed in a number of other W Hotels worldwide, however, this hotel is not up to a W Hotel standard and we will never go back again.

EXPENSIVE. very, very expensive. Lobby was beautiful, we heard a lot of great things about the restaurant but we did not eat there.As we were checking in, they messed up our room. We asked for 2 double beds and they gave us 1 king. They offered to move us to the W in Times Square, but it was 9PM on a Saturday, and we had already parked the car so it would have taken way to long to drive to Times Sq and getting situated there.They gave us a bigger room with a king size bed (couldnt tell the difference) so they could fit 2 beds that they delivered to us once we got upstairs. This was kind of a bummer because I was excited to sleep on a hotel bed and ended up sleeping on a cot.Didnt comp us anything for the mistake. Wifi was $6 for a half an hour. crazy. We only stayed one night so there was no issues we were happy with the room other than the mistake. Doorman was actually quite rude, he asked 'do you need a cab?' and started looking for one, and as he was trying to get one he turned around and yelled 'you know i dont do this for free, i get tips!!' Okayyy.... never did we say we weren't going to tip him or gave that impression. But really? We are paying $700/night for this hotel and thats the way you're going to speak to me?? We ended up getting our own within 5 minutes because I really wanted nothing to do with him. This is why I give it a 3.. which is actually quite a shame because I loved the hotel. Sorry! It would have gotten a 5 if it wasnt for the rude doorman and if they had comped us something (even a free appetizer at the restaurant) for messing up the room. Other than that, it was very clean, very nice rooms, great view, couldnt hear any noises from other rooms or the hallway, and would stay there again... if they get rid of that doorman!Also the front desk people were very nice, and the man at the front desk gave us good recommendations for dinner that night and we were satisfied.

My DIL and I spent 5 days at W New York - Union Square. What a wonderful trip. The W was everything that I have come to expect when I stay at a Starwood hotel. When we checked in, they moved us up to a higher floor than we had been assigned to and the view was incredible. We ordered coffee each morning and it arrived right on time....even the morning after the time change!! I will certainly return to the W New York - Union Square!!

I stay and the W Union Square frequetly for work and always have a great experience. All of the staff are extremely friendly and welcoming, and I really do look forward to seeing them every few weeks. Recently had the pleasure of bringing my wife up to celebrate her birthday, and everyone went above and beyond to make sure we both had a special weekend away from the kids. First time she had stayed, and as the tougher critic in the family, the property and staff even exceeded all of her expectations. Look forward to returning for both business, and another weekend getaway before the end of this year. Thanks W Untion Square staff!

I loved the place and the drinks. A little to the expensive side but what's not expensive in New York. Service could be a little faster but then again i was getting a little slower too. I would recommend eating before coming as the portions are pretty small. The drinks are definitely made well.

We spent a perfect fall weekend in NYC, and it was made all the more perfect because of the staff at The W New York - Union Square. The service was impeccable - friendly, responsive and helpful. The room was huge. We have a 22 month old, and the staff could not have been friendlier to us. This was a business and family trip and I was worried that the W wouldnt be family friendly - but everyone was so gracious and kind. We had rented a full size crib, which was delivered before we arrived. The W staff brought the crib to our room and set it up. We wont stay anywhere else in NYC again.

we decided to spend some time in Union Square. Very nice hotel, Friendly staff, Great service. had drinks at the bar and relaxed in the lobby and bar tenders and waitresses were great. I needed to print a few things out and concierge helped me with a smile without charge. My wife left our iPad in the room and didn't realize until 2 days after we checked out and contacted the W and they had it there waiting for us and we got it back the next day. Honest, friendly, fun location. Would definitely recommend.

This hotel is in a great location, convenient to Union Square and a lot of great restaurants. The room was on the small size. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was great. The restaurant and bar were exceptional.

This hotel had a decent size gym for NYC hotel standards, but the room was pretty small.unbeatable location, but you'd expect that for what you're paying!Typical hotel where the staff looks hipper than any of the guests...
user_name:
Laura V
Panama City, Panama, Panama

review_body: We stayed here to attend a wedding and were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. It was one of the largest we had ever seen in NYC. The price of the room and parking were high, but the location right near NYU and union square is worth it.

I've stayed in several W hotels earlier - boston, Washington Dc etc, but this one doesn't quite live upto the standards set by the rest. The rooms are tiny and service is unremarkable. The lobby is complicated and unimpressive. There is nothing terribly wrong, but nothing too great too.

Hotel was awesome, Check in was awesome, the service so accommodating. I have allergies, and had no idea the hotel has a preferred smell. I called the front desk and inquired about the nice smell, but was turning my allergies inside out. LOL, they immediately asked me to leave the room for 45mins and sent brought this little machine that removed the fragrance from my room. I was beyond elated and happy. Although the smell is still in the covers, I laid my blanket from home on top and slept very nicely.....

Stayed here at the W Union Square for a weekend getaway with the Wife and kid in September, opted for the hotel for the Location. Steps away from Union Square, we enjoy the market here on weekend which was a big plus and also the Union Square Subway lines have great access all over the city. Great dining options all around and a Baby's R Us right next door for all our Baby needs!! Now the hotel itself is getting a bit old and the refurbishment that has been carried out may not be to everyone's taste..the bright colors that they have used in the rooms contrast with the old building creating a bit of a mish mash of designs...especially the blues,oranges and white's in the rooms...The house keeping is on the slower side which is expected in some of the larger hotels I guess...but we had to call and remind them twice for the evening turn down service.This wasn't half as bad as the door men!!Don't expect the Door men at the W for most parts to help you with the door even if you are juggling a stroller, a baby car seat a pizza box and a baby!! There was one Door man out of three who was helpful and friendly but unfortunately I cannot remember his name. The other doormen just hang around the front of the building. Now the front desk is not all that friendly either, except for the gentleman who checked us in I think his name was Leonard...who was genuinely friendly and caring the rest of them seemed to be in a world of their own. We have stayed in so many Hotels around the world and have never seen such indifferent service....In most hotels these days the staff at the front desk and most anywhere in the hotel wish the guests with a friendly greeting throughout the day, which makes guests feel at home and welcome...but here the front desk which looks straight at the bay of elevators that guests use all day rarely make eye contact with any of the guests even when they are not serving guests and are seemingly oblivious to where they are and what they are expected to do..which is be welcoming and friendly to your guests...hospitality is what its all about. I found my self looking eagerly at the staff ready with a "thank you" or "you too" in response to a "have a nice day" or "a good morning" or a smile...but couldn't get them to even acknowledge my presence...anyway I think the W team has to look into this as guests are used to a lot more these days.... a great location can only keep us coming back so many times. There are a few other hotels around Union Square and next time I might give the Hyatt a try.
user_name:
Jerry J
South Bound Brook, New Jersey

review_body: This is probably the high point of this property : location, location, location.By Union square and Park AV, close to all good Manhattan spots this is one of my faves. Check the green market Mon/Wed/Fri

we went to the W to go to the NYCC in october. the staff was amazing and nice . we arrived early and got your room early too. the doormen were nice and we loved the area. we were on the 14th floor and it was quiet. made some requests and got them fast. the front desk was nice and the restaurant was great. i will go there again.

I am a huge W loyalist, trying to always stay at their properties when I travel. Some are really amazing - New Orleans French Quarter, Montreal, Barcelona - others are boring and unmemorable - San Diego, Seattle. This is one of the those hotels. The main selling point of this hotel is its central location, making it easy to get anywhere in Manhattan. The lobby is small, but done in a cool, retro, art deco motif. The staff at this hotel are fine, certainly not exhibiting warm customer service, but getting the job done efficiently enough. The rooms are overpriced for the small size, but this is typical of New York and not a ding against the hotel. We were in a standard "Wonderful" room. It had everything we needed, was clean and comfortable. We were on the 19th floor (we always request a high floor), but the problem with this room is that part of the building's exterior blocks the lower half of the window, so there is no view unless you step up on a stool that is provided (cool idea anyway). It didn't detract from our stay, but be sure to inquire about the room's view upon check-in. We didn't use the hotel's restaurant or bar this time, but they both always seemed to command a large crowd.When in New York again, I would choose a different W. We enjoyed our stay here, but we also enjoy seeing different hotels, and we don't feel like we have to rush back to this one.

My wife and I for the last several years have only stayed at the W - Union Square. The people are friendly and helpful. We love the ambiance of the lobby and the rooms are a decent size. There is a lot of great stuff to do around Union Square and its not a bad walk to Mid-town for shopping or a show. I recommend it to all of our friends.

Got off to a really bad start. I had booked for 8 nights, paid 100% upfront and requested a high room. I was given a room on the 4th floor above the club. Noisy, which is exactly what you want after a long trans-Atlantic flight and hours of standing in line at JFK. Nothing else was available, but they promised to move me te next day to a higher room. If I left my bags packed an 'ambassador' (not my word) would move my things between 2 and 3 pm. When I returned at 3.30 pm nothing had been moved and no I had not been assigned a higher room. But if I waited another hour they would see what they could. It was time to show some muscle. I insisted on seeing the manager. At long last things started to move once I mentioned TripAdvisor. I was immediately assigned a room on the 17th floor. I was given a discount on the first night and fruit, cheese and a bottle of wine were sent up to my room, followed by two phopne calls to check all was ok. (The power of TripAdvisor!).... After this things were fine. I like the rooms, they are roomy and have personality. I had a great view of Union Square. The staff are friendly, especially Mark and Mickey. Front desk is sometimes good and sometimes understaffed. In the evenings the bar/lounge areas are full of young hip things, so if that's your scene, go for it. The location is SUPERB. Breakfast is good (except on the last morning they had no Earl Grey teabags and no English muffins). I would visit again and next time role up my shirt sleeves to show my biceps sooner. It's a pity, but that's life in NYC.

We stayed here from 10/11-10/13 in a Fabulous room (that's their name for it, but it fit). Our trip started ominously enough when our flight was canceled from Chicago to Newark. We called the hotel and they amended our reservation from three nights to two which was awesome. To not make us have to pay for the 3rd night and not cancel our reservation entirely was a huge lift. We got out the next day early and when we went to check in they were able to find us a room. This was so helpful as we were exhausted from the last 24 hours of trying to get a flight out. I would describe the hotel as well suited for New York. It's in an old building, but modernized. It's not big, but what do you expect in NYC. Our room was on the 20th floor and had an awesome view of Union Square and downtown. Every question we asked the staff was answered thoroughly. The only issue we had was at checkout. When we checked in, the person at the front desk offered us a late check out since our flight was at 9p. He said we could have until 5p, but on Sunday we were told that late check outs only go until 4p and we were asked who we spoke with. I didn't get his name at check in, but I'm sure they could have looked up who took care of us (maybe not, but still - does that matter?). We were out by 515p anyway, but it seemed strange to doubt us. Overall it was a great room and a great stay.

Had a mid-week stay for business, and brought my college aged daughter along. Check-in was quick, and our room was ready prior to 4pm check in. Large room for NYC, spotless, and beautiful decor. Comfy bed. The hotel is located on busy Union Square with plenty of dining options nearby, and is yards away from a major subway connection. Starbucks coffee available in the morning in the lobby. Great shop next door for snacks and casual meals, along with takeout options like muffins, fruit, sandwiches, and bottled drinks. Stopped there every morning to pick up a couple things for the day. Hotel lounge, bar, and restaurant is always buzzing. Our flight did not leave until 4:30, and they gave us a 2pm check out. Very nice.

I had a great stay at the w. The staff was so friendly and accomodating. The rooms we used were clean and beautiful. We really enjoyed our stay and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a supee new York experience.

We arrived here for 2 nights (using our spg points) and it was bedlam! Our room was not ready but as we were early that was fair enough, so we went off and had lunch. When we returned it was still not ready and the foyer was like a madhouse- turned out there were 3 huge parties/ groups who had all arrived at pretty much the same moment. After a deal of trouble and misunderstanding by a staff member I called for the manager who was fantastic, really excellent and had sorted everything in a matter of moments. I suspect as a result of what had gone on we were upgraded and the room was fantastic- quiet and very well appointed. The hotel is right on Union Sq and all that the area has to offer, easy transport options, shopping, restaurants pretty much anything you wanted needed. Happy to stay there again

i have been staying at the W Union Sq quite a few times and would say that level of service and experience is very much unpredictable. Last stay with my wife went wrong.- be prepared not to get much regocnition for your Starwood status or loyalty to the hotel: low likelihood for a meaningful up grade, breakfast benefit is very limited and problematic and very unusual compared to other properties.e.g. serials are included buy you need to pay extra for the yogurt.... coffee is included but not capuchino and espresso which most guests like etc - expect bad attitude from front desk.on the other hand rooms are nice and design is impresive. Location is great etc. teception

We stayed he for 5 nights- couple and 21 year old daughter, in a studio suite. The suite had a lounge in a separate living area that was made up as a bed for our daughter. This worked very well and was a great saving over another room in an expensive city, especially as we were there in Fashion week when prices surge.The hotel is ideally located near the union square subway that has several lines that can take you uptown and across to the est of c park. We were here on holidays to see museums, shop and eat, and the hotel is well loctaed for all of these. Hotel staff help make staying here something special. Don't forget to pre-book their complimentary Accura service - we should have used it for the pickup from the airport, but you can use it to go anywhere in the city.We found great italian food at Eatally on Broadway, and had French pastries for breakfast at Kaiser bakery.

I've been staying at the W Union Square for years. Since the renovations the stays have been hit or miss. This recent stay was a big miss. From a fiasco of a checkin to the final second it was one big hot mess. I may officially have to give up on this hotel. Pity because a great location and a few great staff really kept me staying there but this stay the rest of the staff literally forgot all my past stays there and acted like it was my first time at the hotel. Unforgivable. Back to The Mark hotel for me.
user_name:
James C
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: We spent four nights at the W recently and were very satisfied. The hotel is in a terrific Manhattan neighborhood and we had a spacious Mega King room on the 19th floor. While the height didn’t eliminate all street noise, it certainly helped in that regard. Even better, the hotel’s interior is extremely quiet; no disturbances from our neighbors’ TV, or loud talk, etc. I assume this has to do with the original construction having occurred back when builders used superior materials. Whatever the cause, it was certainly welcome.My wife and I are seniors, and she has some significant health challenges, so I wrote ahead to inform the hotel of our situation. The response was all we could have hoped: giving us the room near the top; making it hypoallergenic; scheduling multiple trips for us using the Acura service. All of which leads me to the main point: the W’s staff is simply outstanding at all levels. The good humor, pleasant demeanors, and dedication to customer service were evident every time we made a request or encountered a staff member. There seems to be nothing they’re unwilling to do to make a guest’s stay more pleasant. As a result, we felt very well taken care of.Is the hotel perfect? Of course not. The closets and drawer space weren't really adequate. And, like others, we had to work to remove the charge for the “free” hospitality item we were given by the concierge. But these are small quibbles. If we have to return to Manhattan, this is where we’ll stay.

Overall a good hotel. Loved the location, in the middle of all the action, but still not as hectic as Times Square of Lexington Ave for sure... the room was good size (actually huge for NYC standards!) and staff friendly.The room maintenance was not 100% and could be improved. Generally a good hotel. Would love to go back next time I am in NYC!

Wish I could give the place 10 stars. Have been staying here once a month for over 10 years now. Most recent stay was labor day weekend. Usually I go by myself to visit family but often my wonderful partner accompanies me. It's truly amazing how they keep up the outstanding performance. W Union Square is a beautiful refuge from the hustle and bustle of the city. Some of the staff, including the doormen, the front desk folks, and management have been there as long as I've been staying there. They have the highest standards of hospitality in the industry in my experience. The rooms are just outstanding. They are very stylish, clean, and have many wonderful bells and whistles in terms of amenities. All of them have had a complete makeover during the past year or two and it shows. Some of the best views of any building in New York City. The housekeepers are extremely professional and diligent. Whatever/Whenever room service is just outstanding. Everyone working there could not be more warm and friendly. The guests there commonly rave about the W Union Square amongst themselves when I overhear them in the elevators. You can't beat the location, you can't beat the comfort and detailing of the rooms, and you can't beat the staff's positive upbeat attitude. If you're not happy, they're not happy. But fortunately as it turns out…. Everyone's happy!

I needed a place to stay ASAP due to my wife getting sick the morning of our flight and we had to vacate our apartment rental. Manager took care of us and got us into a room before noon. Staff was great and unusually friendly for such a swank hotel. Room with a King size bed was very nice, with a large bathroom. Great location as well. Love Union Square. It ain't cheap but it was worth it. And besides, cheap hotels in NYC make me nervous...

This hotel was beautiful. The staff was very friendly. We felt like we were staying in a small boutique hotel. The front desk would greet us when we would come and go. The door men were courteous and friendly. The concierge gave us some great dinner recommendations. Our room was amazing!We would definitely stay here again!

Enjoyed our stay at this property due to its perfect location for shopping and eating and would stay again for that reason.The front desk service was friendly but a tad slow in getting the room ready for check-in which seems to be the case at most W hotels. The concierge had a hard time recommending a nearby lunch spot which was surprising but not a huge deal. The front door staff could have been on their toes a bit more as I required help with the door many times and it just wasn't there.The room itself was a suite (I have forgotten if it was fantastic or fabulous) and was suitably spacious for a New York City hotel in an older building. It would have had a great view if the windows weren't partially obstructed by a concrete wall. The bed was very comfortable and the tv swiveled for viewing from the living area or the bed. The bathroom was fine with a separate shower and tub and the usual Bliss amenities. Room service was very quick in delivering morning coffee which was appreciated.All in all, a solidly good not great hotel, with a perfect location.
user_name:
sksaledtan
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the W Union Square while en route to our honeymoon the day after our wedding. We were flying out of JFK early Monday morning so we figured it would be fun to make a night out of it and kick off the honeymoon. At check in, we were talking excitedly about the wedding the night before just to each other, and the woman checking us in upgraded us to a beautiful room with an incredible view of Union Square an lower Manhattan. Because of the upgrade, the room wasn't ready, so we were given a voucher for drinks at the swanky bar! We got a call literally 15 minutes later saying the room was ready and we walked in to the room to find a champagne, chocolate covered strawberries and a card.All in all, this hotel went above and beyond to help us celebrate our marriage. It is a great value and in a great location. We especially loved that the contemporary urban vibe was matched with a warm, friendly staff - a combination you unfortunately don't see very often. This is a great spot for a fun trip into the city- we will definitely be back!
user_name:
gracemcg
New York City, New York

review_body: The rooms are nicely done. I had a basic (i.e., "wonderful") room, which was still large for NYC, especially the bathroom, but I think they may have upgraded me to a "spectacular" room. Note though that rooms come in unique sizes given the building. Their website gives accurate pictures in my mind, though they don't show a lot. The service could use some help though. When I asked for a quiet room, I was given one on the fourth floor but assured it was quiet. That wasn't true - windows are single paned and street noise was noticeable. They also gave me a late check-out as requested, but then deactivated my room key an hour before check-out. But I liked the hotel itself and felt they did a good job with the rooms given the building's age. As a gold SPG member, I guess I would have preferred a bit more on the service.

Great spot to stay while in New Yaork. Rent citibikes right across the street. Great reataurants within blocks in any direction. Easy access to Soho, Greenwich etc etc. Very close to NYU. Great staff, cool decor and fun lobby bar. Easy ride to Laguardia airport, less than 30 minutes by the Queean tunnel. Will stay here again!

Stayed for Labor Day weekend. Easy location. Found the service at the front desk to be slow and not friendly. Rooms seemed dated but I was told recent renovation. Dark and funky interior. Nothing special and so many other great choices.

The W Hotel at Union Square offers a great stay. The hotel is close to subways, shopping and many food outlets and restaurants. You'll also find wine shops, supermarkets and deli style places just outside the door. The hotel is well serviced and the rooms nice. We chose a large room. If you are staying for more than a few nights, the extra cost of a larger room is well worth it. New York hotel rooms are known to be generall very small. The bathroom was also quite large and had a full sized bath and separate shower. We also enjoyed being on the top floor. Nice views and much quieter then rooms on lower floors. Whilst we didn't do much in the way of sight seeing (we've been to NYC countless times), you can easily get to the major attractions via the subway. Union Square was great location in general. I'd never stay near Times Square - too trashy, busy and over priced. Union Square is busy but more so with locals than tourists. Everything we wanted was close or easy to access. My tip is to book early. The hotel offers a range of deals. We saved 25% by booking early and paying upfront. Our rate didn't include wi-fi (unusual as it is generally included in the US) but as we were staying for a long period, the friendly front desk guy offered it to us for free anyway. We will definitely recommend the hotel and probably return.

It was my first time in New York so I was a little apprehensive, but I was quickly put at ease everyone seemed to be smiling. We arrived a few hours before check in time, Priscilla started our check in process and had our bags stored. Having noticed that I was pregnant she told me she was going to get a room worked on immediately. She was very nice and considerate. We did get a phone call from her telling us the room was ready. The room was clean and spacious, the only problems we really encountered were with the elevators and getting a taxi.Nice people all around.

The location is great. Close to subway ,with many shops and restaurants nearby. We had a corner suite which was nice in size.However, we did not feel the service was equal to the price we paid. Unfortunately, we didn't experience the helpful staff like other reviewers. Every time we used room service ,it required a followup call for what we didn't get.No turndown service when we returned at night.The biggest complaint was the room spray. It's overwhelming. We asked them to not do it and even left a note. However, it continued and effected our enjoyment of the room.We really wanted this to be our go to place in NYC but we will keep looking.

Was in NYC for business 2 nights. Stayed here the second night because it was closer to the meeting site. This is one of the few hotels right at Union Square, so the location was excellent and very convenient to the subway and lots of restaurants and shopping and there was even a great farmers market and the service was good. However, the price was astronomical at $349/night with no amenities! I stayed at the Hampton United Nations the previous night in a room just as nice for only $209, was two blocks to Grand Central station with equal access to shopping, subway and attractions, and had free breakfast and did not have all of the overpriced in-room snacks and $9 per bottle Smartwater (I bought one at the cvs next door for $1). So for location I would give them 5, but overall value was probably a 3 because it was not worth the price or hassle of switching hotels.

This hotel exemplifies the W experience that I have come to love.I stayed here on Labor Day weekend after proposing to my (now) fiance. I chose the W because my girlfriend and I have always had the best experiences and the W and this trip was no exception.The whole trip was great. Upon arrival, Faz at the front desk helped me check-in, arranged a late check-out and extended wonderful customer service. Though my Starwood Suite Night Award was denied, I still managed to receive a modest room upgrade due to my SPG Platinum status.The room felt modern and emitted the W vibe that we have come to love. In the morning we had a tasty continental breakfast at the Olives restaurant downstairs.The only negative comment I have is that the Acura Experience was not available during our stay. Book a time slot before you arrive. After having a disappointing experience at the W Buckhead the weeke before, I was very happy to have the W redeem itself with an excellent stay in NYC! Happy to have spent this special occasion at the W.
user_name:
CWGators22
New York City, New York

review_body: We have stayed here a few times since we have a kid at NYU. Clean, comfortable and friendly staff. Modern decor in the rooms is still warm and inviting. Things were a little high energy the last time we were there and it turns out that the first-lady was in house. Even with all that, nothing affected our stay.

My husband, dog and I had a great stay at the W Union Square. Our expectations were exceeded from the moment we checked in to when we checked out. The service from the front desk staff (one gentleman in particular) was exceptional and welcoming. They made us feel welcome with our dog and gave us a room in a quiet part of the hotel. The room (Spectacular category) was a great size for NY and the water in the shower was hot and the pressure was strong. There Whatever/Whenever service was prompt and professional. All bellmen, valets and other staff were friendly and helpful. The location was convenient and allowed us to explore Chelsea, West Village, Meatpacking, Gramercy, Flatiron and East Village on foot.The only two downsides were the slow elevators (one was out of service for security reasons) and housekeeping. Housekeeping was fine, but not as good as other hotels in the W category.
user_name:
J and M M
West Hartford, Connecticut

review_body: We unknowingly had reservations the same weekend as the First Lady so the hotel was a little chaotic with all the Secret Service, etc. However two members of the hotel staff made our stay memorable and I wished to recognize Magy of the Front Desk and Micky the Assistant Manager. Both provided superior service and left us with a favorable impression of the hotel. The location adjacent to, and overlooking Union Square can't be beat. The only demerit is for not having free Wi-fi.
user_name:
Marcus T B
Charlotte, North Carolina

review_body: I've been a loyal SPG guest for many years. I am continually disappointed with the overall aging of their w hotels and the commercial feel when you walk into a room with sell pieces everywhere. Still, location is great and restaurant continue to be a highlight with great service. Facelift time! Tone down the commercial and bring back that true trendy hotel with exceptional customer service.
user_name:
HaphazardGourmet
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed with my teen daughter and found this the perfect balance of hip and conveniently located for what we wanted to do. We got breakfast at the Union Square farmers market and ate in the park before meandering down to NYU and exploring the Village. The metro stop is steps from the hotel, and there's a CVS on the ground floor of the building for cheap stocking up of bottled water and the inevitable items we forgot to pack. As with most W Hotels, rooms were stylish and compact, common areas were comfortable. I would stay here again!

If you prefer to spend your time in the City below 14th Street, this is the spot ! Right outside the the door is Union Square with a Farmers Market on the weekend. Across the Square is Whole Foods and a 15 minute walk to the High-Line.The room was bright, clean and very comfortable. Would have prefer free Wi-FI in the room instead of Lobby area. Staff was please and very helpful and accommodating. It's not cheap but as anything else you get what you pay for.

I am not a huge city fan but this was in the right place where you could walk around and enjoy the city. We were there on the weekend and had a great time. The hotel was amazing and of course you pay for these types of accommodations but worth it.

This was perfect for a short stay - had stayed uptown earlier in the week and moved to Union Square to get a feel of a different community - everything about this part of town was so much better. It had more of a "people" atmosphere rather than just shoppers and business people and I loved the produce markets. The hotel is in a perfect location to enjoy the best of this community.Although it is a "W", it didn't have the over-the-top modern contemporary feel to it - it is a grand old building and it reeks of class and style.Had a corner suite facing the square and this was a wonderful view whether watching the sunset or an early morning sunrise.It's a good base to explore one of my favourite New York areas from the Flatiron district, Gramercy Park, Greenwich Village etc.

I came here after just proposing to my girlfriend. The staff was extremely friendly. Aisha made the experience wonderful by coordinating a flower arrangement to be set up in the hotel room upon arrival. The room was great - clean, nice size, good view of the park. Keith, the door man, was extremely helpful with recommendations, retrieving items we accidently left in the car, and anything else we needed during our stay. Also had fun at the club downstairs as well as at the restaurant. Great place and will probably be back again in the future.
user_name:
Garrett W
Bay Shore, New York

review_body: My family recently enjoyed an all-to-quick weekend stay at the W Union Square. This was only my 2nd stay in the hotel, but I plan to make it my "go-to" hotel, no matter what my reason for being in the city is. The guest relations are phenomenal. Nelson Baez at the front desk always had a smile and always greeted me by name, even if I was just passing through. Aisha Thomas at concierge is exceptional as well. She took care of every last minute reservation/request we needed. The rooms are spacious, clean and bright. The entire staff is efficient, courteous and helpful. I can't wait until my next trip to NYC -- this hotel is a MUST!

Really enjoyed staying here - this was the 3rd or 4th visit to the W Union Sq but the first since they have revamped the rooms. The new rooms are spacious and bright and my friend and I had a lovely twin room on the 8th floor. The staff were efficient, friendly and helpful (a blessing after being delayed by 12 hours getting to NYC!). The location of the hotel is amazing though - walking distance to SoHo and the High Line etc, but also close enough to Time Square to experience some touristy things. Will def stay here again. Only thing is the gym is a little on the light side re the equipment but I used Crunch or Equinox for a fuller work out.

The decor of the hotel is very modern and stylish but not off putting. Once you enter the hotel you receive a complimentary champagne cocktail. The front desk staff were very friendly and check-in was a breeze, and we got an upgrade which really made my day. The room was beautiful, spacious but cozy. The bed was so comfortable it was probably the best sleep I’ve had in years. The best part of the room for me by far is the bathroom we had a walk in shower and a tub the great toiletries are by Bliss and they smelled heavenly also the towels were nice and fluffy. The staff was very nice, helpful and friendly especially since I need help with turning on the radio. I had a wonderful stay. I’m already planning a mini vacation at the same hotel in October.

I like the central yet somewhat calmer location next to Union Square. Good restaurants, and shopping close, but not as crazy as Midtown. The farmers market just outside the hotel on Saturday is fantastic. For me the location outweighs the fact that hotel is starting to feel a little dated. The beds and amenities are nice, and what I have come to expect from W. The entertainment (tv, stereo) needs an upgrade in quality, and the lobby, elevators, and in room lighting could use a freshening up. Bathrooms and towels are basic and clean (don't expect a spa experience). In my opinion, the hotel facilities overall are a solid 4 star. The friendly, helpful and attentive team members (including the Acura drivers) are 5 star. I have stayed several times, and will for sure return.

Not sure about the standards and what to expect out of NYC hotels, but for $360/night (corporate rate), the W didn't satisfy me and I wouldn't stay there again. - Shower had good pressure but the max hot temp was lukewarm at best- Room TV was small with poor clarity- I could not access my guest account from the room TV- The hotel is COLD. When I was there the outside temp was just 70-80 so no need to A/C the heck out of the place. I set my room to 77 (the staff originally set it to 60 when I checked in - come on!), which is how I keep my home, and it still felt like an icebox.- The restaurant on the ground floor (Olives) was overpriced and you can get better "hotel food" from the Hyatt a few blocks away.- Not sure if this is common or rare, but construction and repairs of the street and bldgs were going on all over, making the area ugly and congested- Bed was comfy and wired internet was fast/reliable - but not cheap- Location was pretty good of course

The W Union Square in NYC is great. The hotel is a lovely property with beautiful modern, clean rooms that by NYC standards are quite large with a fabulous modern decor that is at once smooth and clean, yet warm. And, the bed is soooo comfortable. The beautiful, comfortable, and exciting lobby area enhances an already beautiful hotel. Also, the free coffee and apples are a nice touch, as are the top-notch bathroom ammenities, love the soaps, shampoo, and skin cream. Just an aside, the room shower is large and has good water pressure, not bad for the 14th floor.Plus the location on Union Square puts you within walking distance of top restaurants, a variety of shopping, events on Union Square (for example, the farmer's market on Wednesdays), and the subway, so that everything from the Brooklyn Bridge walk, Wall Street, Ground Zero, Battery Park, the Lower East Side, and so on are easily accessible. But it is the staff that sets the W Union Square apart. Each and every encounter with the staff was a delight. The staff could not be warmer while still maintaining a professional demeanor. From the front desk to the staff who brought ice to the room, all are wonderful and make you feel like a valued guest, as if you were the only person in the hotel. A stay at the W Union Square will not disappoint. Try it you'll like it.

I have been visiting the W for a few years & keep returning for one simple reason; the staff, everyone from the two doormen to Nelson on the front desk to the Concierges are great.Helpful, friendly and sincere; and the location isn't bad, either.

The W hotel chain offers an experience that you expect, and yet each property has its own personality. I have stayed at all of the W hotels in NewYork now - from the worst (Times Square) to the most relaxing (TheTuscany / Court) to my new favorite in Union Square. I like the decor, and the neighborhood. Like the Tuscany, it feels less rushed and more intimate than the bigger W hotels. The bed is terrific, you still get a real wake up call, love the Bliss lemon/sage toiletries, and you can walk out to some cool neighborhoods. I was so happy not to be staying in Times Square again,

Stayed here in March this year while on business for four nights. Staff were helpful, rooms are very spacious with very comfortable bed and excellent room service. Food quite alright but on the exepnsive side. I am not sure if i would stay here if I had the family, it is more for business trips and younger couples. My room was at the front so got a bit noisy. Would I stay here again, yes for business but probably not if I am vacation.

The hotel itself was very attractive and clean. The room (mega) was spacious and well appointed. The encounters with staff were disappointing other than the doorman/valet who was friendly and helpful mire than once. The bellman took the luggage cart and left it sitting in the main area of the lobby unattended. When questioned about security of belongings on it, he said, don't worry just go up to your room. At this point, people were having to detour around it. We were uncomfortable leaving it so despite his irritation, we waited till he brought it along. At the room, he put one of our good bags on the floor to hold the door open. Not good for the bag and not first class. He made no otherr offers of help despite our traveling with an infant. The reception staff was curt and never made eye contact. The room was a gift so there was a credit card authorization on file. Despite this, we were asked repeatedly for a credit card and then made to feel like we were kind of shifty instead of welcomed in any way. The key was shoved across the desk and he turned his back. The rest of our stay was fine with no more staff interaction except the helpful doorman. Frankly we've had better reception at virtually all hotels no matter the rate. We would only recommend based on location.

Stayed a few nights for business and came away very impressed. Great location right on Union Square. Wonderful restaurant (Todd English Bonfire) that provides a diverse and compelling menu in a relaxed, but nice environment. Staff is incredible helpful (especially for NY) and rooms are spacious with outstanding furnishings.

Another great stay at the W Union Square. Spent one night - July 5th, and as usual, the stay was great. Exceptional service - upgraded room - and the AC was in good order - which was so nice given then extreme heat of the weekend. Looking forward to my next visit!

Good things:-Awesome location in Union Square (there is a whole foods there, park, farmers' market, great massage place, and subway - all steps away)-Good sized rooms. Spacious, and clean.-Option for scent free/hypoallergenic room (down free pillows too - good thing to request as it is pretty cruel for the animals)-complimentary umbrellas (unfortunately 3 out of the 4 days were literal downpours, so the umbrellas really came in handy, plus they are huge, good to fend off anyone if needed)Not so Good things:-No access to in room movies (this really sucked after a long day of sightseeing in the rain, we wanted a quiet night in, but the 'system' was apparently not working)-TV broke twice! (repair man came, really nice can't remember his name but his accent was strong either from queens or the bronx. regardless, we had to change rooms!)-The compensation offered was not really offered (We were told that we would get 2 free movies by the front desk, and had to really argue it with the front desk, then escalate it with a manager at check out)-Front lobby sprays scent out like some old lady's perfume (regardless it smelled bad, it is also toxic chemicals, these are not organic essential oils here, so not good for anyone's health! It really is not needed. A routinely cleaned and well maintained lobby that has air flow is all that is needed.)-Loud Club music in the elevators (bit awkward for anyone other than the 20 something clubber, makes me wonder what kind of image hotel is looking for, and who exactly are they trying to cater to. This did make me nervous staying here as i was expecting a party hotel. Apparently it was only a party in the elevators for the clubbers. Everyone else just had to grin and bear it. Personally some neutral jazz or relaxed lounge music or such would make the image of the hotel seem 'classier' not so cheap, and cater can any crowd. Something to think about, image is important.)- Air conditioning on our floor was stuck at super freezing (despite our repeated attempts to have it changed to the rest of the hotel, it was a daily/nightly quick dash to the hotel room door off/on the elevator).- Extremely long check out (we're talking about close to an hr! Not sure what happened, there were people there, but not that many, plus the front desk wanted to charge us for the movies again, and had to wait for a manager to finish talking about the following week's schedule (yep i overheard), which made us miss our breakfast. After some frustrating interactions, we finally got her to spot us for a $10 cab to get us to the restaurant for take out before we went to the airport. disappointing yes, resolved, somewhat).Would i stay there again? I don't know honestly. Does the location outweigh everything else? I'm still undecided.

My family and I wanted to express our thanks and gratitude to the W Hotelon Union Square for a wonderful stay 6/30-7/5. After a very bumpy SWA flight and a 70mph taxi ride from Newark Airport through the Lincoln Tunnel around midnight it was nice to walk into such a relaxing, friendly and beautiful hotel. We were greeted by the graveyard shift bell person and welcomed by your front desk staff as if we were old friends. Check in was fast and efficient. We were signed up as SPG members too!The rooms we had were spectacular and we appreciated the sweets placed in the room prior to our arrival. I thought the personalized notes we received throughout our stay were a very nice touch. Later in our stay we even received a personalized note from a local girl named Sofie that the front desk printed for her to be put under our door, thanking us for contacting her to stop by the hotel front desk to pickup her smart phone we found on the ground in the subway at Union Square. I'm sure she was impressed by the hotel front desk staff as well. My spouse also forgot her work blackberry charger and the front desk charged this phone for her just about every night while we were out to dinner.Throughout our week long stay the housekeeping department did a fantastic job in making our rooms look perfect every day. We had my teenage daughters in one of our room so I'm sure that room was a daily challenge. During our stay every encounter at the front desk was always handled by attentive and caring staff. I also wanted to thank Jose at the front door and Aisha/George at the concierge desk for assisting me with detailed suggestions of how best to use every minute of our time in NYC. These folks are true professionals and enjoy there jobs as does everyone on your staff we encountered in the W Hotel!! I have been a Guest Services Manager, Concierge, Bell Captain (including the Grand Hyatt New York) for over 30 years now and know this is not always the case.Even when I was questioned by hotel security, and asked "What Are You Doing?" by a gentleman from your security staff, it was handled in a very considerate manner! I better explain!........I happen to like a music group called "The Kills" and your house music featured them from time to time so one day while waiting for my family to come to the lobby I decided to "film" this music coming out of the elevator speaker to document this (I'm from "Music City"..we do strange things like this!) and when I stepped off the elevator I was met by a large gentlemen who is obviously on top of things in your hotel and cares about keeping your hotel and it's guests/staff safe. When I explained, he smiled, said he understood and I thanked him for being there watching out for questionable actions like the one I just did! I do have his voice on that video clip which is the name the clip now! "What Are You Doing!"....I'll send him residuals if it makes any money anywhere. Kidding, it's for personal use...I'm one of the few folks from Nashville that is NOT involved in the music industry. I'm just a fan.The fruit bowls placed in our rooms the night before our departure were wonderful and so appreciated!Checkout went smoothly, the bell person arranged two taxis at departure, one going local to Brooklyn for my daughter who attends classes at The New School and another taxi for us to go back to Newark. We only went 50mph through the Lincoln Tunnel on the way back to Newark Airport and had a smooth, on time flight on SWA back to Nashville where we will suggest everyone we know traveling to NYC to consider staying at the W Hotel on Union Square.Take Care!Nolan PittmanNashville, TN

The W NY Union Square is a beautiful landmark hotel at a great location & is one of our favorite hotels in the city..The rooms are big and clean , the bed very comfortable, the staff couldn't be nicer and knowledgeable.. We visited before and every time we come it's better & better, this time we got a beautiful corner suite on the 15th fl.- thanks to Eduardo R.at the front desk- that made our visit this time more special..Highly recomend it!!
user_name:
Robokrugie
New York City, New York

review_body: Things got off to a slightly bad start as we didn't realize the reservation only indicated a "preference" for two beds, rather than an actual reservation for two beds. The booking information could have been clearer, and the desk person a little nicer about it. However, after that point everyone we dealt with at the hotel, from the door people, everyone else at the front desk, to the room cleaner, were really friendly and nice. The location is hard to beat - convenient to everywhere we wanted to go, and great people watching on the square. The room itself was larger than I was expecting given my experience with other hotels in NY, and I liked the decor. The bed was very comfortable, and big enough for two non-involved people to share without feeling crowded. All in all a very enjoyable experience.

Never stayed in this area before . loved it very convenient to what we like to do the staff was great . the room was well done, the bar jumping and Olives was terrific for breakfast and small plates great view of new world trade center

I had an early morning business meeting in the midtown area and decided to try the W Union Square. I have stayed at other Ws across the country and have always enjoyed their energy and fun locations. As is becoming all too customary, my flight arrived several hours late the night before. As a result, I showed up at the hotel tired, frustrated and admittedly a bit ornery. I was so grateful to have encountered one of the most pleasant, thoughtful, sincere and caring front desk professionals in all my travels. I do over 100 nights a year in hotels, and Symone at the front desk was perhaps the best I have ever encountered. How someone musters up a pleasant smile and positive attitude at 2am is beyond me. She greeted me with a sympathetic smile, as if she knew what my day had been like. She knew how to handle my room request and particular needs. She was knowledgable about the hotel, and creative about how to meet my needs. She changed a nightmare of a day into a very pleasant evening. The hotel was great, but the front desk was phenomenal!

Theres few W Hotels in New York City. I stayed at the one in Times Square and I preferred the location of that one but the rooms are very boring. For the price you pay, I expected a view, I expected something special ! At the one in Times Square, the rooms are most stylish and you have the views of Times Square. My room was nothing special and was facing a wall. But, the offered me the wi-fi in the room ( it was about time someome recognized people need the wi-fi in their rooms...especially at that price per night ! ) but location is amazing, we walked everywhere. Most popular restaurants are around the corner and Lilium is in the basement of the hotel... very cool ! We found it by mistake but we had a blast. Some very cool features about that hotel... but the rooms are very boring.

I've lived in NYC for almost 20 years but recently relocated. During my first trip back, I decided to stay at the W because after living in the Village and Chelsea for years, it was so hyped up. For the price at over $300 a night, I expected more. My room was as big as my first apartment (aka closet) facing another building on the interior side. Service was lackluster with the desk staff taking forever to check me in (something about finding a room at 1am when they knew I was coming). Comparing notes with a friend who had stayed here many years ago, he had said the place has significantly gone downhill but the rooms looking out to the Union Square generally have nice views. My rating is more because of the prime location. The hotel itself is probably comparable to budget hotels at luxury prices. Door staff was nice, but that was pretty much it.

Agreed that the location is great, but the hotel does not offer much more. Stayed one night and the hotel is nothing special. Not much character. Agree with other reviewers that the doors staff is great - saw them greeting many return visitors by name which was very impressive. The lobby bar is just o.k. and drink prices are reasonable. Standard rooms with a slightly modern touch. Tries to be boutique-y but its not.

I stay here every chance I get. The service is always the best and W style is always a welcome sight. The rooms are spotless and the bed is of course pure heaven. Spotless bathrooms. Love the location and cool bar. A great hotel in every way.

don't stay here!!!! The hotel is too dark, the beds are way too soft. The staff is just not friendly with the exception of the doormen who are fantastic. Simone checked us in and she was so unfriendly, I don't think I've ever met anyone at a hotel who was ruder. She didn't smile and gave us no hotel information. I should have known at that moment. The room was ok, high ceilings made it feel larger but the beds are awful. So soft, the pillows too soft. It seemed like only 1 elevator worked. The location is great if you need to be close to Union Square but honestly I don't know why anyone would stay here a second time. Just not worth the money.

Great hotel and the Bar, Olives, is very popular. The staff are professional and the rooms are a reasonable size by NYC standards. The location could not be better, right off Union Sq. Unfortunately wifi is not complimentary as it is with most of the major hotel chains like Marriott and Hilton.
user_name:
polofson
New York City, New York

review_body: The W New York - Union Square is a great location. It is close to several subway stops, movie theaters, restaurants and of course Union Square. It has a great vibe and I would recommend this hotel. Originally a historic bank, the rooms have been recently redone in reds and blues. The service was excellent and everyone was very helpful. The lobby quite busy most nights. Only complaint was the business center was quite pricey!
user_location: North Salt Lake, Utah, United States
user_name:
Patti M
North Salt Lake, Utah, United States

review_body: We stayed at the W Union Square and loved it. The service from the front desk staff was outstanding, friendly, and helpful. Gerald, one of the managers, was especially helpful. The rooms wer extremely clean and well appointed. We would stay here again in a moment!
user_name:
Ella G
New York City, New York

review_body: Room Renovations are complete, truly amazing common areas, very efficient room service and business traveller friendly. Very bright and clean propertyGreat location so close to many neighborhood services. Fitness center is average

I have over 100 room stays a year, so it is real hard to impress me. From Nelson on the front desk to Joyce in housekeeping on the 6th floor I must say that I was very impressed! Every one wanted to help and they DID! We ask for two room close to each other (next door), help with room set up, where to eat, where to find a good cup of coffee, store our bags for late departure, quick retrieval of our car, all done quickly and efficiently. After we had departed we found we had unknowingly left a garment bag with high value items. These people did about every thing they could to make all of our problems go away. I will be back!

Just spent 3 days at the W hotel in Union Square NY. Our stay there was wonderful. Upon our arrival til the time we left ALL staff were so friendly and accommodating. We cannot say enough about staff member Eduardo Ruiz, he was so very kind and accommodating and was able to answer our many questions. He truly loves his job and is so very friendly to all guests. I am sure like any job it can get exhausting and dealing with tons of personalities too but Eduardo's friendly , joyful demeanor never seemed to waiver.

The lobby is a happening place in the evenings, some cozy couches in the front great for people watching. The hotel allowed us to check in early (9 am!) which was excellent. The room had no view, but we didn't expect it to. The bed was large and comfortable! The shower took quite some time to warm up, however we were staying during a very cold snap in January (2013). The room was spacious, decorated modern/trendy. We did not order room service or visit the hotel restaurant, although the lounge had recently been renovated. Union Square is a great spot - if you can afford it ;)

We had a great time on a girls weekend. Room was pretty small and rolling bathroom door was sort of weird for privacy when sharing room with friends, but all staff was really great, the coffee in the lobby was good and strong and it was in a great central location in Union Sq. Subway is a block away and we used it all the time to get to where we wanted to go. CVS was conveniently next door. I wish the beds had been 2 queens instead of 2 dbls, but it is NYC.

You can't go wrong with a W, but the personal touch and service the staff here has shown me and my family on my last 2 stays in NYC make it stand above every other hotel experience I can remember. The rooms were great. The room service breakfast was as punctual as an alarm clock. But, it was the manager at the desk that really made the stay special, making sure we had what we needed traveling with 2 small children.

Staying in a hotel in New York is not like staying in a hotel other places. As you are likely to eat every meal out, and are quite probably out of the hotel from early until late, you just aren't going to have the usual hotel experience. Unlike other recent reviewers we found that we had virtually no interaction with the staff except for check-in and check-out. No-one we encountered in the bar or restaurant had the slightest idea whether we were staying in the hotel or not. For us, we had a room in New York and that was it. Now, it was a very good room, don't get me wrong... we were in a very large room on the 21st floor; the bed linen was delicious; lots of nice products in the bathroom and, as pointed out by others, the location right on Union Square is fantastic. However, the room rates are high, and given that there is little "value-added", I would go back to On The Ave (OTA) on the Upper West Side next time I'm in New York. Rooms here were also very good (though without the nice products) and prices were much more reasonable. I believe that this was once billed as a no-services hotel explaining the reasonable rates. I see that it now boasts 2 restaurants, which was not the case when I stayed here a couple of years ago. But who needs hotels restaurants in NYC? All you need is a nice room and the rooms at OnThe Ave are perfectly nice enough without the big bill. The location on the Upper West Side with proximity to Central Park is also wonderful.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in May in a 'Spectacular' room and I have no negative reviews at all. Prior to our arrival my husband emailed the hotel to ask if we could have a room with a view. Gerald emailed us back almost immediately with confirmation we would have a high floor with a view of the square. The staff on arrival were lovely and really helpful.The room was really well decorated and a great size. Each night someone knocked with some complimentary chocolates/cakes and water.The location of the hotel is perfect. Union Square subway station is one of the main stations and is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Also shops, restaurants and bars within minutes.In the lobby of the hotel they have a living room where you can use the free wi-fi for a couple of hours per day which is handy.We had a really good deal through British Airways which made the value so good but I think it may be quite expensive without a good deal.We would definitely return to this hotel if we were to go to New York again.

I'm a huge fan of this hotel! Right off the bat I noticed how nice the building and lobby are. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and if we needed anything they were promptly there to help. The double room we stayed in contained two VERY comfortable queen beds, high ceilings and a great view looking downtown. The bathroom was stocked with Bliss products and was very clean and aesthetically appealing.I wouldn't eat anything from the snack box or indulge in any of their mini-bar drinks (as they are crazy expensive); the hotel overall, however, was well worth the price. If you have any plans around the Union Square area the W is a fantastic choice in a fabulous location.

Great hotel The staff was wonderful. The room was spacious and comfortable and the location was fantastic! Union Square is in walking distance to everything. My daughter forgot her pillow in the room and they mailed it to our home address, Great staff!

I stayed at the W from May 27-May 29. I am a frequent traveler and have tons of hotel points so I booked using points for a "wonderful" room. When I checked in, the front desk told me they were upgrading me to a "Fabulous" room which was so nice considering I used points for a free stay. The fabulous room was, indeed, fabulous. It was spacious, comfortable, had 3 large windows (lots of light) and great views. And of course, Bliss products. I came back to my room the first night to a plate of cake pops - which were delicious. Every staff member I encountered couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. You cannot beat the location since you are steps from Union Square (which gives you easy access to the subway to get anywhere in NYC), restaurants, stores, etc. I typically stay in mid-town or the upper east side when I am in New York but I really enjoyed the vibe of the neighborhood and would definitely stay at the W again.

Nothing could have made this stay better! Everything was fabulous and comfortable and I can see why people love this particular location over all others in New York, theres a special feeling, and a wonderful ambiance that the people here create.

I stayed here to treat myself to an in-town "vacation" and was very pleased. I was upgraded to a really nice "Mega" room on the quiet side, high floor, and it was HUGE! even by regular non-NY standards! The staff was really nice on check-in and all times but one when I called for something from the Whatever/Whenever line it came right away. Highly recommended, and worth the points I was using to book the room. I wish I could have stayed longer!!

We stayed here for 4 days and were upgraded upon check in to a large room, which was delightful - as the room was very spacious. We were on the 16th floor and the room was still rather noisy as the double glazing on the windows was poor. There wasn't a bath in the bathroom which was a shame but it was a good size bathroom also. The location of the hotel is excellent and the amenities of the hotel are second to none. The bar has a good vibe, the doormen are very helpful, and the rooms are clean. Downsides of the hotel is the hit and miss service levels from the 'whatever whenever' desk and the check in desk also. Neither were particularly friendly and also my morning newspaper only turned up once without me chasing it up. The ice machine on our floor and the floor above didn't work either. Also we paid $15 for the day for WIFI in our room, which in this day in age I think is outrageous, and then to make matters worse we could not get it to work in our room and had to keep walking out to the lobby to use it! The help desk were unapologetic.However, despite these minor complaints we did enjoy our stay at this hotel and would return as we are loyal to the W brand and have stayed in many other W hotels. Our thoughts are that this particular W hotel is not the best hotel (at this level in their portfolio) mainly due to poor service at times on the reception and 'whatever, whenever' desk.

Union square gives access uptown and downtown easily. Underground, cab, bus, it's all right there. The markets are more for locals than tourists but there are plenty of restaurants right there.The hotel is quite expensive considering that they charge extra for internet but the rooms are clean, the beds comfortable and room service efficient. The turndown service didn't come back for the rest of the week when I declined the first day and the bottled water in the room is very expensive and a bit misleading. There are 2 brands of water in the room, one free and one you have to pay for (the cost of the paid for water is in tiny writing and they put the paid for water in the bathroom and the free water with the mini bar).The bar has a great vibe and the breakfasts at the restaurant are very good (if a little bit pricey).checking in and out can take a while. I'm not sure why but the lines to see the front desk staff seem to take a very long time. The bellmen at the door are also picky about who they open the door for and who they greet. Some of them were great and the others didn't seem interested if they weren't likely to get a tip from you.The female concierge was excellent but the guy was a bit variable in the quality of the advice (sorry I didn't write their names down).Overall it is a great place to stay. They just missed out on the little things to make it great rather than good and sometimes they had some attitude rather than just being helpful. To be fair this was individual rather than a general hotel attitude and some of the staff were excellent.I would go there again based on the location for sure.

My husband and I stayed at the W Union Square. The front desk staff, as well as the parking staff were great. They credited the parking due to the staff making a few errors. Normally, you just don't see people going out of their way to please customers in NYC, but they did. Of course, the beds were heavenly and the room was very clean. The front desk also upgraded us at no charge. I would definitely stay there again. Great location too!

We stayed in a beautiful contemporary king bed room at the W. The neighborhood was great to walk around in with lots of shops and neat places to eat all around. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating. The lounge and restaurant had lots of energy and good people watching. We'd go back any time and stay there!

tho it costs a lot more. No free WiFi or internet. $350 discounted. No free breakfast-- a coffee urn with cardboard cups is about as good as they can do. The room was good; the maid service fine.
