Indeed the workers were friendly and excellent, but one just had the feeling the management was trying to collect every nickel it could.Also, no rooms with 2 queen beds. One king or two doubles only. Small thing but indicative.

The W Union Square felt more like a true boutique hotel then a W. Depending on your perspective, this is either a great thing or a bad thing.The W brand kind of moderates the boutique hotel concept to make it more palatable to luxury travelers. True boutique hotels are edgy, somewhat rough around the edges, and often sacrifice luxury for the sake of "hipness." W's provide the edginess and hip factor without scarificing luxury. This W felt like a true boutique hotel. It was located in a renovated office building. The room was small with a high ceiling. There was not "cozy corner" that is usually a feature in W rooms. The lobby was small. The "living room" was really just the lounge area of the restaurant, Figs. Most Ws I have stayed in felt quite luxurious. This one was a bit more edgy. Some might like a more genuine boutique experience.The restaurant, Figs,is a popular NY restaurant- its a branch of a Boston restaurant. The location is phenomenal- right on Union Square.

This sleek, trendy hotel is a treat! The rooms are very comfortable and so large for NYC. Amenities vary by room, and it's always a pleasant stay. The staff is friendly, helpful, and very responsive to any needs. They're so welcoming, and truly make you feel valued. The "living room" has a great vibe, and the easy access to Todd English's Olives adds a lot to the hotel. Additionally, the location is incredible right on Union Square, and it's a gorgeous landmark building! Like I said, great hotel in a great location.

My four daughters and I would be remiss if we didn't let the world know how welcoming, lovely and accommodating the W Union Square is during our frequent visits to NYC. Importantly, too, the value is - hands down - the best in the city. From the front desk and bell staffs to room service and housekeeping, the property's service is best we've experienced, quite literally, globally to such an extent that it feels odd to refer to the hotel staff providing a "service" because they make you feel like family. In a city of world-class dining, our preference is to roam the City all day and settle-in at night ordering room service and watching movies in rooms that are always so clean and fresh and comfy you forget you're in the busiest city in the world. The centrally located W Union Square is an oasis, a happy, relaxing respite that is absolutely the ideal balance to NYC's incomparable energy in a way that makes me wonder if I come to New York for the experience or the W Union Square!

I was married in Manhattan and had our wedding block here. We also stayed two nights ourselves. The rooms are in excellent shape, but most importantly, they offered tremendous, personalized service at every step. Everything was easy and convivial for us and our guests -- rather unexpected for a corporate-chain hotel. I can't recommend this place enough.

I love the fact that the hotel is centrally located, walking distance to a lot of attractions.I have stayed in many W hotels and I have always been satisfied with their service.The only comment I would make on W Union Square is that the bathroom can be more contemporary as befit a W hotel and its design.

The W Union Square is what you would expect from a nice NYC hotel. The rooms are nice and comfortable, and the staff is courteous. It is quiet and calm, and there are many great restaurants nearby. It is right next to Union Square, and within easy reach of most of Manhattan.I really like staying here.

I have stayed at this hotel countless times and I always enjoy my stays here. The hotel is quirky as it has many rooms and a small lobby which means sometimes the front desk can be overloaded. That said, my service both check in and check out as well as special requests has always been great! Keep in mind that Union Square is on the cusp of the East and West Village as well as being close to Soho and Murray Hill. It is a big subway transit hub for downtown NY as well....So you can get anywhere! The rooms, and I have been in many of them, are quirky. Some of them are weirdly shaped and others have windows higher off the ground etc. The hotel used to be an insurance company building before being converted...so some rooms have strange corners or angles etc. I think it adds to the charm. Cleanliness was great, beds super comfortable, and if you are lucky enough to have the Union Square view....looking over the park to the green of the trees is fabulous. Within a few blocks there are 30+ restaurants and bars...and the food prices downtown, I find to be far cheaper then uptown. The bar is lively, the small lobby is lively and I just so enjoy stepping out the front door and being in the middle of it all! Safe travels and Enjoy!

Just stayed at the W Union square. it is a fantastic hotel where every staff member is committed to customer service. Two in particular, Keith who works the front door and Merly one of the bartenders were extremely helpful and made my stay much better. Thanks

Recently stayed at the W Union Square for a business function. The hotel is in a great location and has been well updated/maintained. Rooms are quite large for New York and function facilities are beautiful. Service at the front desk upon check in and check out was terrific. My one complaint is the ice machines. When I first I arrived, I noticed a loud beeping coming from the machine across the hall from my room. I called the W concierge desk and they said they'd send someone right up, but the noise continued all night. The next night, I noticed the same beeping and called the front desk instead. They actually did send someone to fix the beeping within fifteen minutes. I mentioned the experience upon checkout and the front desk person apologized profusely. She also offered my some SPG points for the inconvenience. When I got home, I had an email from the Director of Front Desk Operations also apologizing for the experience. I thought that was a nice touch and showed that my complaint was escalated and addressed. Definitely will stay at the W Union Square again and if there are any issues, I'll call the front desk.

My wife and I celebrated my birthday in NYC last week. We always stay at the W Union Square when in NYC. We love the hotel, the service, the great location, the rooms and the bar/restaurant. Eduardo Ruiz was so welcoming and made my birthday weekend even more special. Definitely stay here when in NYC!

I stay in W whenever I can. Excellent service, original design and a great vibe. Everything about W has a distinct personality - from the staff, the music in the atrium, to the details in each room. W New York - Union Square is exceptionally good, even when compared to other W hotels. Perfect location for me and super responsive staff. Thanks for a great stay!

I stayed for two nights for a work event a few weeks ago and really enjoyed everything about it. Just walking into the hotel I felt at ease and excited from the great vibes in living room bar area, stylish lobby, and vibrant Union Sq. location. Staff at check-in couldn't have been nicer, and despite a short wait, they were extra gracious and even called my room minutes after I walked in to apologize for the delay and make sure I had what I needed. The room was clean, stylish, and the king bed was so comfortable. I love those pillows so much. In the morning before the event, I wanted a cup of coffee while getting ready and was a little disappointed to find they removed the coffee makers they used to have and instead offered complimentary coffee in the lobby, but I just didn't want to go down there in my pjs. Not a deal-breaker but it seems so standard at hotels these days it surprised me. I had room facing the park which is a reminder of what a great location this hotel is in - unlike the more soul-less mid-town area, it has character and so many restaurants, bars, and shopping within walking distance. Staying there with colleagues it was nice to be able to pop down to the loungey living room bar for a drink before going out or after dinner. When staying in NYC location is so key and staying somewhere you can call home-base between outings- this is it. I am going back again in a few weeks for a leisure trip and will stay here again.

I love this location so much I stay here every time I stay in NYC. Away from most tourist areas yet close enough to get anywhere u want to go in Manhattan. The hotel itself is small (especially the rooms!) and could use renovations to compete with the newer boutique hotels in the area. Another plus was the restaurant downstairs (food not the greatest but a cool place to hang). The best part about my stay was Nelson! He remembered me from my prior stay and once again extremely helpful from check in to check out!

I generally love W hotels but this was bad. Arrived at the W UNion Square at 4pm. Check-in time was listed as 3pm. I was starting a 4 day get away with my 25 year old son. We had dinner reservations that night for 6pm. We were asked to wait in the lounge area and wait for a call to alert us that our room was ready. An hour and ten minutes later STILL no call. I had to approach the desk and tell them we were still waiting and that we would like to fresh up a bit before our dinner reservations. We finally were allowed in our room at 5:20pm....close to 21/2 hours AFTER check in. The exscuse we were given was that the prior occupant had asked for a "late check-out"...and that ends up being MY PROBLEM?? HOw? We were 10 minutes late for our dinner reservation and almost lost our seat. I asked for the hotel to comp our first night for the awful check in experience. Haven't heard a word since. For the price we paid for at this hotel I expected much more...I wont book this place again.

OK so let's get the good bits out of the way first. Excellent location, decent sized rooms, great 'reactive' service and comfortable beds. We were ;looking forward to our stay in the W Hotel as it was our first trip as a family to NYC. We stayed for five nights with a one year old and checked in late at night at about midnight. I'd called ahead requesting for a baby cot and had informed that we will be checking in quite late at night after a long flight from England and will prefer if that was already in the room along with a glass bowl. I needed it to sterilise bottles in milton fluid. None of this was in our room or even in their records as having been requested. We finally settled in after 90 mins minus the glass bowl but were too tired to pursue. The room turned out to have some problem with its heating and we were up in a few hours as a result. Next day we were moved to another room which was bigger and we agreed to pay the difference in price. Had to pursue housekeeping for a whole three hours to get the glass/ceramic bowl finally but to their credit they went and bought one as they didn't have any available in their kitchen (which I found very strange). The carpets in the room and general cleanliness isn't adequate for a hotel of this stature - For three days in a row our room wasn't cleaned until 5 pm and sometimes 7 pm and on all occasions we had to wait in the bar area for them to do a hurried unsatisfactory cleaning job ... Not ideal after a long tiring day in the cold with a one year old ... On complaining to the manager before check out, they offered to add some points to my husband's starwood membership - but that is yet to be delivered ! All in all - not what I expected from a W hotel and more than just a little disappointed.

The W in Union Square is in the perfect location - just across the street from the park and a short walk from some great restaurants. The rooms were pretty spacious for NYC, so that was really nice. The shower had good water pressure and was relatively large for the area. The king bed was very comfortable and provided a good night's sleep. The bar/restaurant downstairs looked busy on the Friday and Saturday nights we spent there, although we didn't go. Now for some constructive feedback...The biggest issue I had was that the walls sounded like they weren't insulated at all - we could hear EVERYTHING going on in the rooms around us, which was really bad. Our view was toward Brooklyn, which was fine, but I wish the window had been bigger! It was pretty tiny and located high on the wall in a corner. I was also surprised to see that Olives (the restaurant) had a B rating from the NYC Dept of Health - NOT impressed. For a hotel restaurant, they should have an A.Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the W - Union Square. Next time, though, I will probably try another hotel.

Stayed at the W for business for two nights, and was not disappointed. The hotel was clean and spacious, and interestingly decorated. Staff upon check-in were courteous, polite, and very friendly. Both the check in and out processes were very quick, which I appreciated. My room was lovely- I was placed on the 16th floor as I'd asked to be up high, and that definitely helped minimize the noise. Clean, comfortable and modern furniture, amazing bathroom, and awesome Bliss amenities (which were replenished after 1 night- I felt quite pampered!).The cons were slight: sleep quality wasn't the best, simply due to noise and over heating. The mini bar and restaurant were both expensive, but it's New York. The breakfast staff at the restaurant left much to be desired in terms of attentiveness. The doorman on duty when I left was quite odd, and expected me to write him a good review before he'd even attended to my service.Great, convenient location. Our event went off without a hitch, and the space was absolutely beautiful. Very professional staff, great catering. Overall, a great stay.

We had a great experience at the W, New York. Wonderful atmosphere, close to "the heart" of New York, and within walking distance of everything you might want to see. The best part of the trip was David, who took care of our luggage, was professional, friendly and courteous and a wealth of knowledge. Always pleasant, with a great smile and easy to talk to, he made us feel comfortable and right at home. The hotel was very nice in terms of rooms and amenities, but David made the difference, and when we go back to New York, I will return to the W because of the service and connection that we made with David. It just goes to show you how important relationships are in terms of getting repeat business. Thanks David, you made the difference.Frank Soriano

We had a suprisingly good week at the W in Union Square, NYC. I say suprisingly since the W is a bit faded and old fashioned for a boutique hotel. The rooms have cluncky furniture and the music is too loud in the elevators. The main lobby area is too large and too noisy. The restaurant stopped serving at 930 pm (it was a Monday nite but this is, after all, New York.) But we had a great time. The service was good and we received an upgrade when our room wasn't ready (after complaining). My NYTimes was devlivered as asked and the views were nice from the suite. Even on the 14th floor it was noisy but that's life in the big city. The location is great--the Coffee Shop is across the street and there was a green market in the square. Coffee and apples in the lobby was a nice touch as were some interesting books in the room.All in all, an excellent stay. We would go back!

I have stayed at the W Union Square several times. The Rooms are larger than many other W properties and the service is great. There are free shuttles anywhere you want to go offered by Acura and they are located close to the Subway stop for the 4, 5 and 6. If you want to be close to midtown yet in a hip area of the city, I would definitely choose the W Union Square.

Picked the hotel to be in a good place to explore NYC. Could not have chosen better. This location bridges downtown and midtown perfectly, and makes subway travel throughout the city easy.The rooms are nice size and really comfortable. Solid bathrooms and good amenities. Our stay was on the top floor. The views were amazing. The bar and restaurant make for a great and relaxing lobby with terrific food and drink. The only downside was front desk and concierge staff who were uniformly unimpressive. Their attitude was not terribly helpful and their speed at checking was notably bad. This is a "hip" environment. While lobby bar staff don't seem biased by this, the desk staff clearly see themselves as "too good to deign to serve" the clientele.

Rooms are clean, neat, and well ventilated. Noise is minimal - we did hear the occasional siren but that's to be expected in NYC. The Acura car service was awesome, and took us close to where we needed to be. The check-in people were courteous, friendly, and helpful, keeping our cupcakes refrigerated until we checked out. Of course there is an excellent restaurant downstairs (Olives) but it was too pricey for our taste and it was just such a short walk to all the restaurants we wanted to go to. I will definitely stay here next time I'm here. This is my new favorite NYC hotel!

We got upgraded to a suite here as it was our anniversary and it was amazing. The normal rooms were great too though and plenty big enough. It's in the best location. Close to the subway, within easy walking distance of some great bars, restaurants and some fantastic places for breakfast (Chocolate by the Bald Man - yum!). You can walk out to Greenwich or down to Soho or easily get a cab outside to where ever! I've been to NY many times so if you've done the main sights before and want to get away from Times Square and eat, drink, shop and feel like you are in 'proper New York' then go here. It's cool and lively with a free coffee fix available in the mornings to get you going!

There is little to not like about this hotel. The rooms are great (clean and stylish), the bar is swanky, and the location is great for the NY vibe. If you are looking to stay in this part of town, then the W Union Square has you covered. And the convenient location to the subway means getting around town is a breeze. I would recommend this for business travelers as well as couples heading to the city for a few days of fun. The bar is also a great place to people watch or just hang out with a cocktail.

Just stayed at this property for a work-related event and was very pleased with the rooms, service, amenities, etc.That said, upon leaving the property, the door man really soured my positive experience by basically asking me if I was going to tip him for hailing my cab to Penn station. It was raining, and I understand this may not be the most enjoyable weather to have to work outside in-- but it made me feel very awkward and uncomfortable, as he did it in a very sarcastic way-- asking me to hold his umbrella and to stand on the street for 5 min to see what it was like to do his job, and then not get tipped. He literally handed me the umbrella as waited for me to react. Overall the hotel experience was very good, but leaving on this note doesn't necessarily make me want to stay here on my next visit to NYC.

I have been staying at this hotel on and off from when they opened. I tend to move stay in a hotel based on where I need to be in the city. CONSISTENTLY, this is one of the best hotels in the city. The front door staff is very friendly and helpful. This is EVEN the case when you are not staying there as sometimes I stop by for dinner or the lounge. what I love!1. The rooms are a good size and while the hotel is not small. It does have a boutique hotel feel to it. 2. The Farmer Market is right across the street.3. Front Door staff are some of the BEST in the city. I have stayed at A LOT of places and some 5 star places that do not even compare. David who works the door is always the best. Greets you with eye contact and has a great vibe to him. He helped us all weekend and could not have been more awesomeI plan on making this more of my permanent hotel in the city.

My husband and I stayed at the W Union Square with our 4 boys, ages 5, 3, and 1 (twins). I was so nervous prior to our trip because our previous trips to NY with just 2 kids had been rather difficult. We had previously stayed at 2 different hotels in Times Square…but the small rooms just didn't have sufficient space for our double stroller, crib, etc. Now keep in mind, I'm a New Yorker. i was born and raised in NY and lived there until I got married at the age of 27. But vacationing in NY with 2 young kids isn't easy…and I couldn't imagine doing it with 4.Well, let me start by saying I am already planning our next vacation in NY for this summer...and we've only been home for 3 days. The staff at the W Union Square really knows how to make a guest feel valued and they will do ANYTHING they can to make your stay as easy and enjoyable as possible. They worked around my schedule to clean my room each day...even cleaning my room after 5 pm one day. On 3 occasions they gave me an evening vacuum (my kids got crumbs all over the floor). Anything I needed they brought me quickly and with a smile. Even the doormen went above and beyond, interacting with my kids to the point that my oldest son ran up to one of the doormen as we were packing up to leave and gave him a huge hug. The rooms are spacious and well designed, and the neighborhood is amazing. There is a HUGE playground right across the street. Union Square has a great farmer's market, and is surrounded by every store you could possibly need. There is a CVS right next to the hotel, a Babies R Us on the next block, a supermarket at the other end of Union Square, every type of cuisine you could possibly want, and much, much, much more. In fact, my 3 year old broke his glasses at the playground. I got on my phone and found an eyeglass shop one block away. We immediately walked over and got his glasses fixed (for FREE) and then went right back to the park. In addition, many buses and trains come into Union Square, so getting around is a piece of cake (unless you have 4 young kids like me…and then you'll just walk everywhere!!!). This hotel was simply AMAZING! I can't wait to go back in a few months!

The W Hotel at Union Square provides a wonderful guest experience, and it is a "go to" place when we're scheduling an NYC visit. I've booked more than a dozen stays at the W and it is always consistent - good size rooms, friendly staff and great cocktails. I recommend you ask for a cosmo in a tumbler, then take it up to your room to kick off the weekend or end the night! The location, for me, can't be beat. You're in the middle of the city, but the hustle is toned down. The High Line is a moderate walk, Gramercy Park is a short walk, and the farmer's market in Union Square is across the street, providing its own source of entertainment. There are also so many great restaurants within walking distance (think Gramercy Tavern, Craft, ABC Kitchen). As a business traveler, I've found the location convenient to stops both downtown and uptown. As a vactioner, it's easy enough to get to Broadway for a show. Even better, the hotel has often made their Acura car service available for those trips!
user_name:
Ron M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Union square is a great neighborhood with lots of restaurants, bars and everything you can think of. Hotel is a great location and is a wonderful place to stay. Getting around is easy. Don't miss union square farmers market. Great selection.

My daughter and I stayed at the W New York in Union Square for the Easter weekend. We were greeted at the doors by David Delvalle. He is most certainly one of the nicest people I have ever met. He was friendly, charming and made us feel right a home. He immedicately took care of all of are bags while answering all of your questions. When we were ready to leave we were once again lucky enough to get David to help us. He made our stay at the W a memorable one. The W is lucky to have a gentleman like David working for them!

A solid property in NYC. We always try to get a room at the back, as the ones facing Union Square are quite noisy. Starwood platinum suite upgrades are a hit or miss, I think I have only gotten a standard suite (fantastic suite?) once at this hotel.Note that if you book through a virtuoso agent, the virtuoso breakfast MUST be had in your room. Very strange, as the spg platinum breakfast can be had in the charming Olives. This should be dealt with.I always have to correct my bill when checking out here, this time they had wrongfully added a mini bar charge.The real gem of this hotel is Ms. Baker, the welcome agent/director. Without her I would probably stay elsewhere, as the rates here are always extremely high.

Stayed here for 3 nights on this New York trip. The hotel is has a great feel - modern but in a great old building with many original features and a great lobby. The rooms are spacious and recently renovated with all the standard W amenities. It wasn't particularly friendly and at times we didn't feel particularly welcomed, although I've noticed this in other Ws. The atmosphere and general ambience however was fabulous.I would certainly consider this over the other New York W Hotels in view of it great location. It's on Union square with great views of the Empire State and the subway station with access to up, down and across town trains is a three minute walk. Above all its close to SoHo and some great restaurants.

My mother and i stood here a couple of weeks ago. I can honestly say i have no complaints. Rooms were very clean, not to mention the bed was amazinggggg. The staff is very friendly. You kind of forget you're in NYC. I had to take down one of the employees names .. Aleksandar Matovic. He got a cab for me, which is impossibleeee to do in this city. Also recommened some great places to eat. Very friendly and made me feel comfortable within my stay. I also checked out the restraunt they have attached to the building "Olives" if i remember correctly. A little pricey but delicious food. I wish the prices were a little cheaper so i could stay here everytime i visit Ny. But if you can afford spending a little extra this hotel is definitly the reason to.

Stayed here for a Saturday night getaway into the city from CT. Booked a "Fabulous" room, and it was. Stayed on the 15th floor. The view was great looking south to the under construction Freedom Tower, and a wonderful view of Union Square Park. The location is great, out of the touristy area. So many places to eat, drink, and shop. Very close to the 4,5,6,N,R,Q, L subway, which will take you every where. Great base location. The entrance is on the corner of Park and 17th street. Pulled up in front on Park South heading North, and valet came right out, took our bags, left the keys to the car and it was very easy. Front desk staff were very helpful. The lobby is nice, and the Living Room lounge looks like a great place to hang out all day if you wanted to. The room was very clean, all the amenities top notch. All of the little touches were excellent. Ordered room service for breakfast. The portions were huge, and delicious. The food arrived in 20 minutes. They have a complimentary Acura car service if you reserve it. Nice touch. We had a wonderful time at this W Hotel. Can not wait to come back.

I love this W hotel. The rooms are much bigger than other Ws in NYC area. It is an older building but the recent renovation makes the room very comfortable. Location: Union Square. Short walk to subway stations, easy connection to Grand Central Station for JFK Connections too.Lobby: Currently they are renovating the lobby but even though it is in an older building so it doesn't seem as chic as W New York - Time Square, but the high ceiling makes this W feels totally different from other Ws nearby.Room: Stayed at cool corner one bedroom suite for two nights. The Suite itself is divided into a separate bedroom and living room. Living room features a full sofa and HDTV. Modern/hip furniture yet very comfortable. Bathroom have separate shower and tub. Excellent shower pressure. Bedroom faces Union Square and totally refurbished. Excellent W Bed that I sleep everyday at home too. Room have very high ceiling too so the open feeling is very unique for NYC hotels. However, the AC/Heater was a bit problematic during my stay. Also due to the older building, sound insulation can be bad so if you are in corner locations like me, you may have hard time to sleep at night if you are a light sleeper. Service: Definitely have rooms for improvement. The people at Wheels are the best. Acura car service is a primary reason that I choose W hotel over other brands in NYC area. Loved the people that works there. They seems to enjoy their job too. However the doorman definitely needs some attention as I caught him few times texting on his phone instead of helping other guests with doors and/or luggage. Front desk/Concierge can be a bit cold depending on who you encountered but generally good. Overall, although this hotel priced higher than other Ws in the city, it is still my favorite W to stay at.

the bed at the W hotel is probably the most comfortable bed i've ever slept in. period. great service and trendy decor. definitely a fantastic hotel, though you definitely pay for it. it's an older building and though the renovations were generally awesome, sometimes you can still see signs of the age. wasn't a fan of how the wifi still cost extra after paying over $350/night, but i was travelling on business so no biggy.

My daughter and I just returned from a weekend in NYC and we used the W New York - Union Square as our base. First off - I think it's a fantastic place to stay - easy to get to anywhere in NYC you might want to go - and an easier neighborhood (fewer crowds, more locals, nicer people) then where a lot of tourists stay when in NYC. Since I am a platinum member we were upgraded to a slightly larger room - which was really good size - especially for NYC - very clean and comfortable with a view of Union Square.The staff were pleasant. My only quibbles are minor and probably snotty - I was not really given the greeting and welcome I am used to as a platinum member and nothing was offered as an amenity or added bonus as it usually is when I check into a Starwood property.Overall though- we will definitely be back - as the location, comfort of the rooms and cleanliness outweighs my spoiled attitude.
user_name:
DC_Traveler46
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: `i have stayed at the w union station a few times and have found that the service is always first rate. the rooms are big for New York encompassing the W funkiness. I really appreciate the Accura transportation service that can take you wherever you need to go (within a reasonable radius) free of charge - its useful and really convenient. Of course like a lot of these hotels it can get a little clubby in the evenings but for the most part there is a nice mix of business clientele and party people, so it doesnt fell like you are always in a club. Service at `olives in the morning can be a little slow and it does take a good 20 minutes to get your room service coffee (even when you are only ordering coffee`) but for the most part i like the vibe and i believe its the staff that makes the difference, they are all really friendly and very accommodating. `the location is great , not too far from uptown or downtown . I find the beds are really comfortable , enjoy the bliss products, feel the spaciousness of the rooms- the hallways can get a little noisy on friday nights but again i sort of expect that at a W- the doormen are especially friendly and hospitable.

My recent Big East weekend was fabulous because of the Louisville Cardinals.,but,additionally,the W Hotel was also a star performer.My wife and I brought 2 other couples from home,and received kudos for picking this very convenient and neighborhood feeling location.The staff was extremely friendly ,especially David Del Valle--the very personable Door Ambassador Extraordinaire.Jeff Underhill

I have stayed at this particular W a few times. I find it to be a reliably great stay when I go to NYC. The staff is always super nice and friendly (front door guys especially). The hotel beds & pillows are comfortable and soft (a key for me!). I always like the Bliss spa soaps/shampoos that are in the room too. We had a double bed room and it was ample space and offered more room than most NYC hotels. This time I also got to use the Acura car service. I think that is a nice perk and a cool feature. The only points I would share for continued improvement:-The scent they use seems to be in heavy use these days. I think they need to cut back a bit on the fresh scent they use. - Internet was expensive. I think today, a hotel like W needs to offer wifi as a standard feature in rooms, not an expensive upgrade feature.

First room was really noisy since it was next to a generator but afterwards, we had a great room with a partial view of the square. The furnishings were nice and modern and a huge desk made it possible to organize all my things. I particularly liked the huge silver throne chair, nice touch!Restaurant was pretty good, too - even though really noisy! Location is really great, we walked to nearly all the sites and the Grammercy Tavern is around the corner. The only drawback was breakfast was really expensive but with a zillion great places around the corner - including Les Halles - there are plenty of places to eat

I stayed at this hotel last Friday night. I really liked this location, as it's less busy than Times Square and very easy off/on the subway.There is a farmer's market on Saturday morning for fresh fruit and fresh deli next door. Olives, in the hotel, is good.My room was great and looked new!

We stayed at this hotel to be close to our son who is at NYU. The room was okay and the bed was exceptionally comfortable. Besides that there is not much to recommend. When we got there on a freezing, windy night, there was no doorman to help with the bags or open the doors. The lobby is tiny and not very welcoming. In the amenties list, it says they have newspapers. I had to call down every day to get a paper delivered. You think after the second day they would have figured out to deliver it the third. There was a nice note and some goodies in the room when we arrived for a person who was not us. We went to Olives for drinks and the young, female bartender there was exceptional; Very friendly and knowledgeable.

My stay at the W Union Square could not have been better. From the moment I checked-in to the moment I checked out the stay could not have been improved upon. The attentive and friendly service began with the doorman, continued with the front desk, and on to the bellman. I wish I had the names of each and every staff member in order to compliment them here.The front desk representative may have been a mind reader, because before I could even ask to break a twenty dollar bill, she was already asking what demoninations would I like (she has been working the front desk for 13 years and made my 3/8 arrival at 12:30 PM very easy, including an upgraded room). The bellman, David Del Valle, was a delight. His warm personality, smile, and genuine desire to help make the stay enjoyable came shining through. The concierge, Nova Mejia, was so helpful and truly thoughtful each and every time I asked for assistance with restuarants and places to visit. She was delightful and so pleasant. Also, the front desk representative ( a young woman from Florida, who works the overnight shift) and Alex, the bellman, could not have been more helpful or pleasant when I needed additional housekeeping services. Truly with a staff like the W Union Square has, the hotel itself would not have to be great, but it is!The building itself is beautiful. The early 20th century look is wonderful and the decor of the lobby and rooms, hallways, and elevator areas are updated yet completely keep the feel of the original building. Down to the tile work in the floors by the elevator echoed in the tile work in the bathroom of the room, the hotel decor is fabulous. The lobby/lounge area just off Olives, the hotel bar and restaurant, is perfectly done in tones of blue, gray, and black with sofas, chairs, and tables that evoke the age of the building while being completely updated and fresh. The same holds true for the lovely large room/suite that I had. It was beautifully appointed, comfortable, fresh, clean, and well thought out. The bath had both a shower and tub, and very nice, soft, large bath towels that were actually large enough to call a bath sheet. The ammenities were great. The shampoos, soaps, body lotions, face cleanser were great and excellent quality. The availability in the bathroom of a disposable razor, a toothbrush with toothpaste, a shower cap, q-tips, nail file, and cotton balls was a great touch. The bed was very comfortable and I was able to sleep well. Complaints about noisy or small rooms at the W New York Union Square are somewhat silly. New York City is noisy and hotel rooms are usually small. The W actually has quite large rooms when considering the location. For New York City the room was huge, especially for the price. If you are planning to go to NYC, I would suggest giving the W New York Union Square a try.

The W hotel was unbelievable; very clean and professional.The staff was courteous and very helpful. A special notice to David Del Valle, hotel ambassador went out of his way to help our group with restaurant / night life reservations, assisting with courtesy shuttle and general services. The hotel check in staff went out of their way to help us procure a better room and upgrade without asking, thank you. The staff at Olives, the restaurant bar on property was excellent!! I will definitely stay at the W Union Square again. I normally Stay at the Gansevoort, meatpacking, but my experience with both David and the staff here at the W have me sold going forward on the only place to stay. Neil from Canada

I've been staying here for years, and I remember loving this hotel. It is worn down and tired now, and my last two stays and meetings were deeply disappointing. From a meetings perspective, I've encountered a bizarre lack of engagement from almost everyone, like no one takes pride in their jobs or like the unionization of the property means that I'm always asking the wrong person for help. Even the room service lacks love - the food arrives messy and tasteless. I wish they'd close down, renovate, purge most of the team, and reopen.
user_name:
CDavid212
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel was "home" because it was near an ambulatory surgical center used by my husband. The encounters and help from the various staff members was efficient, friendly and "whatever we can do" attitude. When we requested a room that would provide maximum quiet, we received a perfect answer to that wish list.Particularly, David Del Valle became an excellent example of what a difference a caring staff member can make when you occupy a temporary space for comfort and convenience. He was warm, friendly and greatly efficient in his work in valet parking, time allotment and our vehicle's availability.Upon checkout, our car was being delayed because of an emergency vehicle. David worked out the delay on his own, in quick order and wished us goodbye and a speedy recovery in the most gracious way possible.We give the W a capital H for hospitality.Alice T.

We wanted to stay in union square area.So this hotel was a perfect choice.But we were surprised how small the room was!And we practically had a room with an awkward view.The lobby was not grand at all.Their bar was nice though.Other than location, I will not refer anybody to stay in this hotel.

The hotel is conveniently located near the 4,5,6 (useful to get to lower Manhattan) and N,R,Q (useful to get to Midtown) subway lines. You can easily walk to many different shops and restaurants and the area seems pretty lively even on a weekday. The room is nicely decorated and in line with other W hotels that I've been to. Also, the concierge was extremely helpful. Would definitely stay there again.
user_name:
kevin c
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Fantastic location, but the rooms could use an update. The bathrooms are small with bathtub stains and the furniture is showing wear.We were also disappointed when we called 3 weeks ahead to shorten our stay from 7 to 4 nights, and they refused to give us a refund or even a credit for a future stay.
user_name:
ZuzziTravels
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is really my favorite place to stay in any city - the fact that it is right in the middle of everyone's favorite city is just a bonus! For me, it's all about the people and how they embody the "whatever, whenever" attitude that their catchphrase promises. A case in point is my favorite staff member, David. He recognized me when I arrived, though I only stay here a few times a year, and I was greeted with a warm smile and a friendly hug. This morning when I came down to forage for coffee, he actually walked me to his favorite coffee bar and we had a great conversation about the city, life, families, everything, and I had what was probably the best coffee in the city (though he claims that an even better brew comes from a coffee truck called Mud, but I will have to wait until next time for that one. It is a pleasure to write about this for me - and to highly recommend this hotel for not only all of the things you want in a hotel, but most especially for their best staff person, David del Valle.

Best part of staying at this hotel was the location. Perfect for shopping and nearby some good restaurants. We stayed here for 5 nights. Our room was a decent size, with a large closet and modern furnishings. Everything was clean and comfortable. Staff was wonderful. Would stay again.

I'm surprised I had the issues I had. It was a cold weekend in NY, and the room I was in had a defective window that let the air in. After speaking to the front desk, they sent engineering up and they realized the window needs to be replaced; they duct taped it and went on their way. The air was still leaking in, so the front desk decided to send up a heater. By 3am, it was finally warm. 3am. And when speaking with the manager the next morning, I was only offered 5,000 starwood points to make up for a poor evening. When asked how many points it costs to stay there, it was 25,000. So I have to pay $400 to stay in a cold room and to make up for it, get 1/5 of the points to repeat the experience?I'm disappointed with the situation and will not be staying at this W moving forward.

Love staying at the W Union Square - I try to stay there every time I'm in NYC - which is pretty frequently! The rooms are awesome. Love the bar and the food at Olives is fantastic. Free coffee in the morning, great workout room and an overall amazing experience every time I'm there.

The W is truly a very modern and friendly place. The lobby is small, but houses a very well designed lounge, with vintage type writers and chess boards. The rooms are very modern, and quite big! The staff was great, they had also gven us an upgrade with a great view. The chocolates under the pillows are delicious. The bathrooms are great, and house nice bath products. Doorman was nice, and so were the reception desk. Good stay

Only stayed one night - first time at this hotel. I was pleased with the size of my room....I have been in hotel rooms in NYC that were basically an oversized closet with a bathroom attached. Room was clean, nice amenities, bed very comfortable. Nice location, right at Union Square. No complaints. Would recommend this hotel!

What a fantastic weekend at the W! Everyone was very pleasant and happy to help me. More so than I have seen in most hotels of this caliber.The concierge(Joseph) and Michael(Beverage) were both very helpful on all of my questions. I would highly recommend this hotel. I was really treated like a guest and not a number. If you want to feel at home in a large hotel, stay at the W, Union Square.

Great hotel, in excellent location just off Union Square. Stayed on business in lovely modern room. Room wasn't huge but quality throughout and this is New York! Comfort and style are the order of the day at the W. Friendly, helpful staff. Worth checking out!

This is a typical W. The location is great, the Todd English resto in it is always buzzing, there's great music playing in the lobby and elevators all the time.The rooms are another story. It's not that they are uncomfortable (W, Westin, all Starwood properties in fact have those incredible "heavenly" beds) but it just looked a little tired, as though it was really cutting-edge and cool when it first opened but could do with a little TLC now. We were upgraded to a better room, but I still found it kind of small and dark- I guess this is to be expected from a hotel in Union Square however. The bathroom was small, the showerstall was small. There was nothing wrong with this hotel per se, but I wouldn't stay again. It wasn't cheap, and for the price I would look around for something less 'cool' and more luxurious. We had a double room (wonderful, they call it).PS I have to say the W's Whatever, Whenever service is excellent and really lives up to its name. I broke a heel on my shoe (first world problems...) while I was out on Friday night and I called them at 2 am when I got back to the hotel. They picked them up from my room right away and had them fixed by midday the next day.

The W in Union Square is a very classy hotel. Upon my last stay, I was upgraded to a spectacular room which had a wonderful view of Union Square. The rooms are quite big for NYC standards, and as with all W hotels, there are some wonderful touches which make a stay quite unique.The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the bathroom and shower clean, large and well fitted with utilities for guest use. Service was also fantastic - I asked if the front desk had any razors, and immediately I was provided with a W shaving kit. It may not have been the best razor, but the provision was highly appreciated.I did not try the food at the hotel, but the bar downstairs is very cool and again service top notch. The gym is a little small and they could do with putting in a few more machines, and A/C into the room.

Great hotel in a great location, right on Union Square. The service could not have been more attentive, and the addition of the hotel SUV adds a great convenience. The only negative comment is that for the second time, we waited an excessive amount of time for our car at checkout, even after calling down first as instructed to do. This hotel will be out "go to" place in NYC.

We stayed here for 4 nights just before new years and it was hectic but found it a much nicer experience than staying at the w just uptown at times square. In fact after coming to NYC numerous times this is our new favorite place to stay. We found the restaurant downstairs fabulous and its position really handy for shopping eating and faffing/walking around. We found it actually really difficult to venture more than 4 blocks away from the hotel for most things because it is so conveniently situated.

Had a Labour Day weekend trip in NYC for shopping, dining and the US Open. Stayed at the W in Chicago the year before, and always wanted to stay at the W Union Square. The rooms were huge and the location was convenient. Great bar at Olives in the hotel - skip the basement bar. The best kep secret is tje Acura car service which was an amazing amenity that saved us a lot on cab fare. Totally worth it, and the drivers were super friendly, professional courteous and very helpful. Service at the front desk upon check in was less than professional and full of attitude. After that incident, all the other staff was great.

The location of this W is fantastic. It is close to many excellent restaurants and bars and it is close to many subway lines that make it very easy to get just about anywhere in New York. Another positive at this hotel is that all the rooms are very large by NYC standards. They have big windows and high ceilings. It is also cool to stay in a very old NYC building.Unfortunately that is where the positives end. Compared to other W's the beds here were very inconsistent. Most other W's I've stayed in have a comfortable feather bed on top of the mattress, and very comfortable pillows. The beds here sometimes had that, sometimes did not. One room I stayed in had an awful plastic wrap around the bed that was noisy and uncomfortable. Another issue I encountered on multiple stays was an awful smell in some of the rooms. It smelled like what I thought was mold. Some of the rooms had an unbearable smell (2101 being one of them) and others had no offensive smell at all. This leads me to the staff. Some of the front desk staff were amazing and helpful. However one front desk staff in particular was incredibly rude. When two weeks in a row I complained of a smelly room and requested to move he suggested that "Maybe this hotel just isn't for you." Um, W's aren't supposed to literally stink! Overall for the price of this hotel, I would not recommend staying here. The location and large rooms are not worth the inconsistent quality of the rooms and the rude service.

We were very happy with our 1-night stay at the W New York - Union Square. The staff are all so friendly and helpful, especially the concierge who made a great recommendation for our Sunday Brunch. Our TV's sound didn't work and the maintenance man was knocking on our door within 5 minutes of our call to fix the problem. The bed was absolutely divine- we actually didn't want to get out of bed in the morning because we were so comfy. The location couldn't be better- centrally located and right next to a subway station.

Good juxtaposition of the "W feel" and a historic space. Has all the usual W features. Friendly staff. Accomodated an early check in. Great location - Union square has great coffeehouses, restaurants, bookstores etc. One of my very favorite places to stay in NY. Rates fluctuate considerably - sometimes a good value - other times a bit on the pricy end - hence the average rating for value. Stayed most recently in January 2013.

Stayed here over a weekend in December. Great location in the heart of Union Square, with restaurants and shopping steps away. Staff was kind enough to get us into one of our rooms early so we didn't have to check luggage. Rooms were fine, not quite as small as many other NY hotels. Our only real issue came after check-out, when my wife realized she left some jewelry on the night table - we were still in the city (only an hour or so after check-out) and called security who stated they would check and to ask for them when we returned after lunch. Well, we came back, but the individual we were supposed to ask for was nowhere to be found, no one else in security knew about our call or lost item, housekeeping and guest services did not know, etc - so we waited 20 minutes for this individual to show up, and he did so empty handed. Disappointing to say the least...

Overall, the W here in Union Square was very nice. It is different than the one in Time Square. The building is an older style so it is not as modern as the other W's in NY. The location is perfect with many nice bars and restaurants right near the hotel. It is not as hectic as the Times Square area, which was nice. The rooms are a good size and nicely decorated.
user_name:
Dain K
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I visit NYC regularly and almost always stay here. The location is perfect for me and the rooms are very comfortable. The beds with the pillowtop are VERY comfortable. A hard mattress with a soft cover and great sheets.My only complaint is that I don't love the new decor. When the hotel first opened it was contemporary but also warm and comfortable. The just redid the rooms and they went a little too modern for my taste.But thats not a big deal. The rooms are a decent size and the service is great.

Absolutely loved the W Union Square. Superb service; super-comfy bed in a large room, well-appointed room; great views. Love the Acura car service too. We didn't try the restaurant, and the club was closed -- but the hotel itself is terrific. Yeah, it's quite expensive (our room was 600ish a night) but quite a treat.
user_name:
OrderedChaos
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I went to NY for a business trip last week and stayed at the W in New York Union Square. I'll start off with the good: 1) the location is fantastic, right next to Union Square and very accessible via the metro as well as fairly central to anywhere you want to go, 2) the rooms are huge and feel fairly nice and new/renovated/well taken care of.The bad: 1) the elevator wait time is ludicrous. I would spend 2-4 minutes every morning or evening waiting for the elevator. Even at 5am when I was leaving to head to the airport, I spent about a minute waiting. It's just rather annoying. 2) The front desk decided to call me at 4am with a wake-up call on my last morning. Problem was, I didn't request a wake up call and wasn't planning on being up quite that early.It's a perfectly nice room, and the price for a central NY location was actually pretty good, but the elevators were just a huge frustration!

After having stayed at the W Hotel on Lexington Avenue uptown, this converted insurance company building out shown it's sister hotel. The room was upscale boutique style with a view of Union Square and beyond. The hotel restaurant, a Todd English creation "Olives," was pricey, but we returned for dinner which featured a variety of selections as did brunch (the egg-white frittata was a favorite). Finding a room with two double beds in New York is just that, a find. Unlike the Lexington Avenue location, we had plenty of room, found the staff incredibly helpful and friendly. While the location is lower Broadway, you are within walking distance of any number of colorful neighborhoods. The Union Square subway is just outside the hotel in the park.

Stayed on my own for 5 nights while visiting my daughter in NYC over Thanksgiving. Usually select smaller hotels but decided to try the W as it gave me Starrwood points. Checkin was slick and staff were helpful; the lobby is always busy but in this location you have to expect that. My room was as booked on a high floor (19th), large and comfortable overlooking Union Sq., but I experienced a lot of traffic and wind noise, because the windows did not fit together. This came to a head on my 3rd night which was very windy; I was kept awake by the 'screaming' nioise; someone came to the room to 'fix' it after I complained the following morning. This consisted of opening and closing it hard a couple of times, then jamming 2 towels in the gap between top and bottom window. It was effective but the promised proper repair never materialised and had not happened before I left, with the towels still hanging over the bottom window. Not what I expect from a hotel of this quality!

Went for a friends wedding and had a glorious time. Staff bent over backwards to make sure everyone was looked after. We had an amazing evening. Food and drinks were delish. Amenities were spotless and extremely well kept. Perfect choice for a wedding location.

We stayed here for 2 nights with our 4 teenage children. We liked the location. The rooms were nice and on the larger side for a NYC hotel. It was pretty clean but could have had better amenities in the bathroom. The room service was prompt and the breakfast good. Beds and room temperature were very comfortable.Not all of the employees were nice. The bell hop had an attitude and was very abrupt. The concierge was helpful. The hotel has a very young crowd with a happening restaurant and bar scene. The lobby sitting area was well kept. I don't believe I saw any children, other than ours, staying at the W.On Saturday we arrived back to our rooms at 2:15PM to find that neither room was cleaned. I called the front desk and they sent someone up right away. They also left food trays outside overnight which I felt was unsanitary. All in all I felt it was a nice hotel and a little above average. A solid 4 star hotel.

I've stayed at many different hotels in new York City and the W was by far my favourite. my husband took me for my 50th birthday and we had an upgraded room -- not a suite just one slightly lager than standard I gather. Well, by New York standards it felt huge, and we had a beautiful open view of Union Square that was a nice change from my normal experience of staring into the concrete wall of a neighbouring tower. the concierge at the W was very helpful and friendly and made an excellent suggestion for a lunch place nearby, and front door and front desk staff were unfailingly courteous and helpful. The room design is sleek and the beds are comfortable with gorgeous sheets and a well stocked mini bar even though we never use mini bars....Everything about the W was great and best of all we heard no noise from traffic, neighbouring rooms or from guests going in and out of their rooms. I could have stayed there happily forever and it is located steps from the subway, great restaurants, and fantastic shopping. HIghly recommended.

We stayed at the W Union Square Friday Nov. 30 - Dec. 2. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. I requested a high floor quiet room. We were given a nice room on the 19th floor. The room was updated, modern and very clean. The size was appropriate for the city! The location was excellent! We are Marriott people and this was our first stay at a W property. We enjoyed our stay and will return in the future!

We stayed here the week after Hurricane Sandy and the hotel had only been reopened for 2 days. You would have never known it. The staff were on their game and the hotel was incredibly clean. Our room was a spacious corner unit. Very quiet with a fantastic view. The location is what really made our experience, though. The shopping, street fairs, park, restaurants and the Union Square subway half a block away could not have been more ideal. We will certainly be staying here again.

Stayed there on the weekend in november. Service was very average. Nothing special. Room was old and it need some TLC. Front desk staff were nice. Could use customer service training as a refresh. I guess the place needs renovation to compete with other luxury hotels. .
user_name:
Mic M
North Bergen, New Jersey

review_body: Love staying at this hotel--we usually go to NYC just for a weekend and enjoy walking around the city. The Union Square location is perfect for this! We love walking to the Highline, Soho, Meatpacking, Tribeca, etc. The rooms are pretty big for NYC and the hotel recently renovated its decor. There is usually a lot of activity in the hotel and there is a nice bar and lounge area in the lobby to enjoy cocktails. There is a Starbucks located conveniently across the square and it is fun to visit the farmers market in the square on the weekends.
user_name:
lizg89
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: HiThe best rate I could find at this very popular hotel (quite big but was full on both nights I stayed here) was USD 620 for a single room - without breakfast!It is indeed very well situated on Union Square, which explains it all. Other than that, it does not stand out for anything. All the rest is very average.For example, look at the bath (pic attached). Also, the TV has to be fixed by the technician after i checked in ag about midnight. Also, the ice machine ln the 16th floor did not work over the period of my stay, no indication that it is broken, one just has to try every day!They have no coffee-making facilities in room as a standard, one has to ask for a machine to be delivered, and then it is NOT a Nespresso, but some cheap substitute (without pressure). On day 2, they also do not automatically replenish the milk, one has to ask for milk (again).I also found a vagrant sleeping on the bench outside my room, when I alerted management they acted quickly, but this raises and issue about safety (he was sleeping there for a while, I was staying on the 16th floor) - it was not a guest, he was later found near the breakfast area again!The gym is very all, and in the basement, I would have expected a bigger gym with a bit of a view?Nice front desk staff with a nice attitude, blow your money here, but only for the location, the W itself is nothing special.

The W's are always a hit in my book - cant go wrong! The hotel is in the best location, right in the center on Union Square and across the street from the subway. There are friendly doormen that open the door too. The hotel has a modern, hip vibe (not ideal for old folks). I had a double bed room with a great view of Union Square. Our rate included free "continental" breakfast, but my roomie and i went a little over and got big breakfasts; we expected the hotel to charge us for it, but they didnt! The only irritating thing is that wifi is $15 a day. Thats a bit much. Just be free, right? However, i would stay there again.

A huge thank you to all the staff at W Union Square for making another trip unforgettable. The Hotel is great and the staff are fabulous. From the moment we got in touch to say we were coming back to the moment we got in our car to the airport, everyone was wonderful. We had a Fantastic Suite (Thanks Gerald!!!!) which lived up to expectations and more - the swivel TV is a nice touch - and the view was breathtaking. Housekeeping were friendly and un-intrusive, the front desk always happy to help and the doormen extremely friendly. If you are looking for an excellent hotel with a good location to explore Manhattan, I can't recommend this hotel enough. Some great eateries nearby (Coffee Shop Bar, Union Sq Cafe and Gotham Bar & Grill all recommended), Subway is well connected and some good shops nearby. All in all a great place to base yourself in New York.

Great room. Big by NY standards. Friendly staff. I think its ridiculous that they charge $15 buck for WIFI. Even flee bay $75 hotel rooms throw in wifi. They should really take a look at how their guest experience suffers from silly add on charges. The wifi charge was just lame. If that kind of think does not bug you like it bugs me, the place is great!

we had a corner [cozy]. great view of Union Square [saw farmers setting up for market, and Tai Chi in early AM hours]. great location. very accommodating staff. easy check-in and check-out. asked for extra towels, etc, and got immediate response. they also provide a free ride to various nearby locations in a new SUV with a very pleasant driver. all-in-all this was a very great experience. the only downside is that this is a noisy location. lots of sirens and even considerable honking even at midnight and the wee hours. I suppose that is NYC, but what is the rush to budge someone immediately when the light turns green even at 1am ? not sure what the hotel itself could do, even with our windows closed. that was the only downside of the stay.
user_name:
nealdc
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: If you are going to enjoy a good quality hotel, W again, sets the bench mark for chain hotels, yes it costs more, but it's the little things that count, and W offers them in abundance.The quality of the fittings and the finish, the attention to detail, and style, says it all.Staff are just at another level, don't get me wrong, just have a pride that you don't seem to get in some other locations.Def a leader in NY, probably better than Times Sq version, just with the location - its a personal thing.Hotel Bar, excellent, although closes quite early.

I travel extensively, and often stay at W hotels around the country. Being in New York, I expected this hotel to have small rooms, and average service like I have received at other hotels in the city. Quite the contrary, my room was large and very clean and well maintained, and every encounter with a staff member was friendly and helpful. The restaurant also had great food and service. Conveniently located, will stay here again.

I realized that I had a reservation issues, however, hotel manager Mr. Tellez had my concerns resolved before my arrival. Stellar service, and exceptionally friendly staff. I could not have asked for a better expereince.

I will start with the ONLY negative I have about this hotel: the elevators are slow and are often full when they stop on your floor. That's it. Now for the positive.From the time we arrived (which was early for check-in) we were treated with respect by the friendly staff. Our room was on the 16th floor, so it was nice and quiet. It wasn't the greatest view, but it was so high up that you could still see for blocks. The room was large by NYC standards, and The W is famous for it's cool, modern decor. You can adjust the temp in the room, which is always appreciated. You can plug your iPod into the dock/player on the nightstand. And how's this for a nice touch – the bedside table lamps have several built-in outlets so you're not crawling around on the floor looking for a place to plug in your devices. Someone else wrote that the bathrooms needed updating, I think they're fine. The towels were fluffy, the pillows and bedding were great. The goodies in the room are a nice selection, even tho they're way overpriced.We did not try the room service, but we did hang out in the lobby for a bit, and we had a glass of wine at the Olive bar. The location is just awesome, I love Union Square.I would definitely stay here again. In fact, I'm looking forward to it.

I stayed here the weekend before Hurricane Sandy. The staff was very helpful and friendly and eager to offer assistance at anytime.The rooms had funky names, I stayed in the "Fabulous" room and it was. The room had a very comfortable bed and pillows, my back felt great sleeping here!.. My only issue with the hotel is that the lights in the elevator are very dim and so it was difficult to see the floor numbers. A minor inconvenience.The location is tops, close to Union Square, Gramercy Park and the Village. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and to go back any time I am in the City.

We live down in the west village on the border of Zone A and the water and decided to evacuate after they announce zone A needed to. Because we have a pet we needed a pet friendly hotel but also wanted a hotel with a generator. I called the W union sq to inquire about both and was told as long as our dog is less than 40 lbs (she is close to that weight) it's ok. Also like every hotel, they are required to have a generator. As we checked in, the front desk agent said they did have a generator and that to her surprise, it covered everything (not just elevator and emergency light). The following review takes into consideration the extreme nature of Sandy. - everywhere in the hotel, the staff was wonderful, a lot of them had to sleep at the hotel because they couldn't go home and stayed to help the guests. THANK YOU. - We wanted a larger room because we knew we might be inside for a couple days so we booked a corner suite, it was nice and indeed large. - very large desk area to work, good wifi (free)- nice Bliss products in the bathroom- coffee by front desk dailyNow here is the negative, most of them would have been the same regardless of the storm, some not. - why, oh why, more and more hotels feel the need to spray fragrances in the rooms. It really was too much, some people are allergic and we spent most of the day with the windows open to air the room, please stop doing this or offer rooms without it for people allergic. - long hair on face towel in the bathroom, very hard to miss, should have not been there (see photo)- The windows are too thin or not properly sealed and you can really hear a lot of street noise, not for light sleepers (even with such a great mattress)- TV's are flat screens, fairly recent but these days they should have either HDMI input or the desk should have some sort of input connectors to work with HDMI to plug in your laptop or iPad - not enough lighting in the bedroom part of the suiteNow, storm related part of the review. - As soon as the power went out, the general manager came on the intercom system to explain what was happening, etc even giving us his cellphone if we needed help- A large bottle of Fiji water was left in front of the door of each room with a note on how to contact their whatever/whenever dpt- Generator kept the elevators working and lights in staircase and hallways (except 7th floor), BUT did not allow for water pump to work so no running water. We had planned and had flashlights. - Olives offered some cold food for people who wanted some and in the morning after the storm they had bagels, etc. The morning after the hurricane, staff was going door to door to rebook guests in other Starwood properties, we decided to go home. Regardless of what happened during the storm (the hotel was great in how they handled it), I wouldn't recommend someone to stay there because of the few negatives, some pretty important). A hair on a towel is not the end of the world, though it's not acceptable but noise and fragrance in room is a big no. Thank you to the staff and management for their help during Sandy.

It didnt have a balcony but the view was very nice, the rooms comfortable and bright, bed comfy, and staff attentive. Great place to spend the weekend if you can afford it. The suite provided plenty of room the have friends stop by, we almost spent more time in the hotel than walking around NYC!

Stayed there for a business trip for 3 nights. Bar is great as always. Breakfast - very good.Rooms and hallways have been renovated (at least the floor I stayed in) = simply wonderful.The darkness is gone, everything appears more lively.Service as always excellent.

I know this is a "great hotel" chain but what constitutes "great." It still comes down to basic services and courtesies. Staff was stiff, we had no help with luggage, had to drag the bags up to room. Front desk staff was not very helpful, small lobby, cold, nowhere to sit. The bar area was nice, large and comfortable. Room was small but well appointed. Maybe this is the culture of hotelling in the big apple, I've seen more gracious staff at a Comfort Inn!

It doesn't get much better than this. . . ideal location, first rate accommodations, incredibly friendly and professional staff. We've tried many other hotels in Manhattan, but always gravitate back to this one . . . our absolute favorite!

This is a very good hotel, which is fine. NYC has some, but not every well known hotel is all that great. This one has good sized rooms, very well appointed, an attentive staff in the lobby (although somewhat "above it all") and those good, old thick walls that make sleeping here a quiet experience, my first criteria, after no bedbugs. I didn't eat here, so can't attest to that, but the neighborhood is preferable, for me, to mid-town which is more difficult to find slightly more relaxed restaurants. It's a great mid-point between uptown business and downtown cool.
user_name:
andrewhmm
New York City, New York

review_body: After reading "I Heart NY" I absolutely wanted to stay at the W Union Square. The hotel is located in a beautiful old building and our room was very big. Bedroom with the signature W design but the bathroom defenitely needs a refurbishing. Staff at the frontdesk was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is ideally located for sightseeing. You can walk into Greenwich Village and SOHO as well as to Time Square. Several subway lines are just outside the door and there a lots of nice shops and restaurants around. I can only recommend this hotel and we will book it again for our next trip to NYC.

My husband and I stayed here for a weekend getaway... honestly wasn't what I expected! I would was expecting a bit more hip, The decor was okay, nothing really to write home about. The bathrooms were clean, but nothing out of the ordinary. I did love the BLISS spa products. That was my favorite part of the stay. The bar in the hotel is okay, but not what I'd expect for a W hotel.It's okay! Would prefer to stay elsewhere next time!

I have stayed at this location many times and have to say that the new decor in the rooms looks like an All Inclusive Hotel Resort Hotel in Cancun. I preferred the more luxurious look they had before but maybe the design/marketing team knows what they are doing. They should take a look at the bathrooms. The tubs are old and white..the caulking yellow and cracked. Showers are weak..tiles and tub seems dirty and stained. I just didn't feel clean in this room. There were hairs (not mine) everywhere even right after maid "cleaned." I do think it's a great location and great service. As I have said in other reviews..I don't understand why the maid isn't the "eyes" of the room and maybe report to management that there is cracked caulking etc. No need for a manager response saying how sorry you are. It should not get to this. Your staff should catch this from the maids on up. They are in the rooms daily..are they not??? No excuse. I think of a hotel as a home away from home. Unfortunately this one needs to be refreshed before I return. Oh BTW it's not just this room. I was there in July..different room but bathroom was the same..weak shower and dated.

Very nicely appointed rooms, friendly staff, great food in the restaurant. Restaurant is quite noisy though, and the front desk has misplaced my conference registration package twice now, this weekend and on my previous trip there. Worse, they lost them and could not find them.

It was so nice being back at the W Union Square. I am starting to feel like family (lol) Gerald was there with a new title of Guest Relations Manager. He and his staff went out of their way to welcome me. My room was clean, the bed was so comfortable and the air conditioner was a delight as California was so hot this summer. I just want to say thank you to Gerald for always making sure my stay is pleasurable and unforgettable. He always has a new restaurant for me to try and I appreciate the suggestions. Thank you W Union Square!!!

My husband and I stayed for one night. The hotel is very clean. The room was small but that is the norm for NYC. The hotel seems new- everything is in nice condition. The bathroom is on the small side as well but fine. It is not ultra luxurious but our room was on a high floor, quiet and the air conditioner kept the room nice and cool and didn't make a lot of noise which is important. I would recommend it.

My husband and I were visiting our son and also celebrating our anniversary. I booked a three night stay at the W Hotel in late September in a "spectacular " room. We have never paid this much for a hotel room but it was worth every penny. Location was outstanding, room, and especially the bed, was soo comfortable, staff was friendly and helpful. And because we were celebrating our anniversary, we received a welcome gift of wine, cheese, crackers and fruit. It's a very fun place to visit with easy access to the subways and in walking distance of many shops and restaurants. On our last visit we stayed in Times Square and, although that was fun too, there is just a special feeling about the Union Square area. And the Farmer's Market, held three days during the week, is a great way to spend a couple hours...or more. And don't forget Trader Joe's and Whole Foods Market. We will definitely return to the W Hotel Union Square. Thanks W staff for a memorable visit!

The location is wonderful, the olives bar a lovely spot, the service and attention was flawless. The service is friendly, housekeeping quick to bring extra towels, soaps and robe, and checkout instant. The bathroom was a little old and could have been cleaner. In a hotel of this location, I am sure they have had so many people through it needs extra scrubs.
user_name:
judManhattan
New York City, New York

review_body: It doesn't get much better than this. . . ideal location, first rate accommodations, incredibly friendly and professional staff. We've tried many other hotels in Manhattan, but always gravitate back to this one . . . our absolute favorite!

Spent a weekend in NY and stayed at the W. My only knock is that the windows are not soundproofed, so be prepared to hear sirens late at night. No problem for heavy sleepers, but not great for me. I travel with earplugs, though, so it was fine. Loved the design, decor, and amenities at the W, and the service was A+. Would definitely stay here again.

I just booked a group here and stayed myself as well. The hotel staff for the most part made the stay enjoyable. This hotel is old and tired and needs a major renovation. As a travel professional I hold hotels to the highest standard. MY STANDARD. This hotel definitely did not make the cut. The huge oversized lamp in my room was broke the shower had mold and the shower curtain? Seriously??? Who uses shower curtains anymore at high end hotels. For goodness sake if you are going to use them then get the bar that extends so when you are lathering up with soap the gross nasty curtain doesn't stick to your body. Plus the hooks were broken all but 3 of the 12 were in working order. Majorly ambarassing for a hotel that TRIES TO ACT hip. I would definitely recommend the Gramercy Park hotel but if your budget does not allow you to stay there then this will suffice. The location of this Starwood chain W hotel is the best! That's what this hotel has going for it. I would not rank it as a Virtuoso hotel one bit. Thank god they have a GREAT staff and even better location otherwise I would say skip it! Another big bonus is the green market in the square along with Whole Foods and Traders joes all within walking distance. Be careful not to pay too high of a rate here otherwise you will be extremely disappointed.

I am a Starwood Gold member and travel quite a bit for my job. I chose the W Union Square because it was within walking distance of my NYC office. Nice enough but not great.! The front desk staff was not as friendly as other W Hotel front desk staff have been to me. They were very indifferent. I wasnt greeted by name and I had to ask them to seek an upgrade for me (they should let me know if one is available and not make me ask). Surprise! No upgrade available. I actually had a very nice room but the shower door handle from the inside was missing. Imagine being in your hot morning shower and realizing that you cannot get the actual shower door closed. I did the best I could, leaving it open about an inch (resulting in water getting all over the shower mat and floor, making it slippery upon my exit), I also wasnt asked what newspaper I wanted delivered to me in the morning and should have been. So, my first morning, I cannot close the shower door, I have no newspaper. Life isnt rough, I can manage. Not the hugest deal in the world. I head downstairs to spend the day in my NYC office and on my way out I stop at the front desk and mention to them that I didnt receive a newspaper and that I have no way of closing my shower door. The front desk person apologized and said she would send someone right up to fix it for me. Yay, on my way to work and forget about my absent shower handle and missing newspaper. Flash forward to 6:30 PM- back from a long day at the office and head to my room. Guess what? The shower door remains unaddressed. Nothing fixed.
