I called the front desk and they again apologized and sent one of the engineers up to "look at it." Up comes the engineer to "look at it" and he says, "Oh yes, there is no handle. Let me see if I can find a handle for you and fix that. Ill have to look around." Off he goes. Surprise! no follow up and no shower handle. I have to take another morning shower with the shower door open and then spend another morning cleaning up the wet floor as a result of it. Seriously, W? How hard is it to fix something like this? Why did I have to repeatedly ask for assistance only to never receive any resolution? Also, my sheets had stains on them, blood stains i think. Not mine, either. You could tell the sheets were clean but seeing someone elses blood stain on them was unnerving. I will note that the room service staff was excellent. They were very helpful and on time. Nice people. I asked for two bananas for breakfast and they sent up a two peeled, cut up bananas in a bowl. Like I was a toddler or something? Must remember to be specific when requesting bananas-making note of this now.

the location is central, the rooms are nice, decent size, clean, the hallways and common areas not so much. i also enjoyed the fitness room, its fully equipped. however, the costumer service is lacking, staff seemed indifferent and as if they couldn't be bothered. not sure if i would stay there again.

I was in town working on a project at Irving Plaza which was just around the corner. Overall the hotel was nice with larger rooms than many NYC hotels in which I stayed. Staff was friendly, the bar was vibrant. Gym was a bit small with three treadmills -- had to run on one this morning because of rain. Good area across from Union Square, lots of restaurants and bars in the area.

I called the concierge before arrival to order flowers for our room, celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. We arrived at the hotel with a really great room upgrade, champagne (perfectly chilled) and a really wonderful dessert tray. Service throughout our stay was top notch. This was the second time staying here, great central location.

The W Union Square has a really enjoyable location that, when you are staying there, makes you feel like a native New Yorker. You walk out the hotel's front door to a mix of high/low characters, shops and restaurants that feels supremely urban and is interesting, especially on days that the Greenmarket (farmer's market as we call it in California) is being held in Union Square Park. The W New York is also one of the few hotels I have found in New York where it is possible to get a room with two queen size beds, a huge plus when traveling with family. Rooms with a view of the park are especially nice. Finding a doorman to help can be pretty random and the desk staff seems pretty uninterested in the clientele. I don't care though, it's a fun hotel.

Let me start with the Ritz Carlton Central Park South has always been my go to Property when in NYC. Now let me tell you about my first stay and the many more that followed. I am a Westie LOVER and when I first found out about a play I wanted to see on Broadway I called to make a hotel reservation and my Ritz Carlton was book solid, this was last min and completely my fault, so since Im a huge SPG fan I started looking for a place to stay with my (at the time) two Westies. I love the Union Sq. area, it's super great and there is a dog park a block away, this is a super plus for a dog freaks like myself!!!! From the time I drove up to the front door, this young man Jose came running up and took my two dogs in his arms and they loved him as well. We will get back to Jose in a minute. Seamless check in and they upgraded me to a lovely corner room with an adjoining room should we need more space. I had more luggage for my two little ones with eight stubby legged family members then for myself. Jose took us up to the fifth floor to a lovely, clean room with allot of space. While Jose was showing us around the room for things we might want to use, there was a knock at the door, is was the dog butler with beds bowls and a dinner 24 hour a day menu... I m not new to this serves, the Ritz Carlton does it as well but I NEVER expected this amazing serves from the W chain. Shame on my preconceived ideas. As I read from other reviews, I agree it's an old building that has been made into a hip, trendy, comfortable hotel with great serves. The area is only second to Central Park. This was our first stay and there were quite a few more, now the hard part to write, my Female, love of my life was having cancer issues and I knew her up coming 13th birthday would be her last, so I called the W Union Sq. and booked the same corner room for her birthday. After checking in we went right to Trixy and Peanut, a WONDERFUL up scale dog boutique, and I gave my birthday girl free run of the shop to pick all that would make her birthday perfect! Yes, I know Im crazy... She was/is a huge sex and the city fan and we found several toys that brought back the memories, I will add a photo to this review, it will show the love of my life and how the W Union Sq. went so out of their way to accommodate any and every need we wanted, learning of the reason for our stay. the night of her birthday I called down and asked if we could bring our two family members and have a few cosmos and appetizers, with out a delay they said we will reserve you the perfect spot and Jose is on tonight and if they need a walk he will do so! We went down and saw what only a world class property would do, the photo will say it all. We miss our girl every day but we have this memory, all thanks to this amazing property and their flawless staff, as hard as it will be to go back, trust me we will (we now have four Westies and I call them my gangsters 16) the number of legs that follow me EVERYWHERE! I highly recommend the W Union Sq. for a plethora of resins. Safe Travels. Enjoy B
user_name:
TheTrvlGuy
New York City, New York

review_body: Was an older building but super nice staff and great location right off Union Square Park…. Lots to do and great places to eat right outside the door. Will go back when I'm in New York. Great delis !!!!

as a frequent traveler I have to say that I stayed in many hotels in my carrer - and this one is the best . .. well , expensive but worth every penny . . .and , Yes , Its all about the service . . .from the reception desk , to the bar to room service . . .you name it . in one word EXCELLENT

Best hotel I have ever stayed in NY so far.Rooms are big, clean and comfortable!The staff is top-class!!! especially the lady at the concierge, very helpful!!! The only disappointment was Olive's Restaurant at the hotel!!! I was there last year and I had an amazing meal, this time they changed the menu, very limited choice, music was very loud and awful service! we were the only table in the room and they completely forgot about us, they cam to order 20min later but we decided to pay for the drinks and leave. Overall, I will come back to the W in Union Square and recommend to everyone

Union Sq is a perfect location. We have stayed in Soho on trips before (and will next time but that is purely because we usually spend most of our time there) but this visit we wanted to be a bit more central.It's a very good location which allows you to cover the whole of Manhattan easily (and Brooklyn) without being stuck in the touristy hell of Times Sq.The hotel is tasteful and understated. Friendly and helpful reception & concierge (got us a few late table bookings) and you can check in and print off boarding cards in the lobby if needed.Rooms are bigger than usual (especially compared to the Paramount) and very comfortable and again tastefully designed. It's just one of those places that has well... good taste. No free wifi but three Starbucks in about a 100 yards. Bit tough getting a seat in the bar area in the evening but some very good local bars around.We wanted a good location, a hotel that had a good reputation for service and quality and we wanted to spoil ourselves a bit. The W delivered on all counts.Highly recommended.

My husband and I have stayed at other hotels in NYC, but after our first time at the W Union Square, we were sold on it. The staff is unfailingly helpful and pleasant. The Union Square location is excellent, the rooms spacious and the new bedding, while not particularly my style, is very comfortable. The hotel lobby and hallways smell great too. Great lobby bar with friendly, prompt service.

Although the W is a larger hotel, it is not a super sized, impersonal convention hotel. We generally prefer to stay at smaller boutique hotel but we chose the W for this visit because of it's location, price and room size (needed space for 3rd person). If you want to escape the over crowded TImes Square/midtown area, this is a good option. Conveniently situated at the corner of bustling Union Square. Lots of activity in the immediate area and just a short walk to Chelsea, Gramercy Park and Greenwich Village. For those who are going to a Broadway show, it is a short subway or taxi ride to that area.The bed was very comfortable. Lighting in the bathroom was excellent.

I spent the weekend in NYC over Memorial Day with my daughter and selected the W New York-Union Square because of the location and reputation of the W Hotel and we weren't disappointed. The area immediately surrounding the hotel has plenty of great food choices (and outdoor eating) and nice shopping boutiques but the Union Square Park is amazing to experience with the street vendors, people watching, and activities all around you. We spent a great deal of time in SOHO, which is an easy cab ride away but always looked forward to coming back to the hotel and greeted by the doorman with a huge welcome smile and always something nice to say. The room was huge, clean and well decorated. The lounge area downstairs was super comfortable to just relax and enjoy a few minutes of comfort before or after our excursions!:-) I would stay here again and again and again....when you walked out the doors of the hotel it felt like you were in a cozy friendly residential area of the big city but with all the excitement and options of a big city. Highly recommended!

The room was spacious and the bed comfortable, but at this price point I would expect the decor to be more harmonious and well thought out. The place looks like it was decorated using a computer algorithm for combining black and red. The bathroom fittings and towels were no better than in a Holiday Inn. Like other reviewers, we found the front desk service to be perfunctory and unwelcoming. The staff uniforms are tacky -- no ties and undershirts peeking above the shirt collar. There was a promotional coupon for a bar in the basement, so we checked it out. It felt like a bar in Moscow for Russian gangsters and their popsies - low ceiling, 70's style decor and lighting, staff draped over the bar yawning. We beat a hasty retreat

This hotel has the feel of a deluxe apartment building. My wife and I have stayed in over a dozen different hotels in NYC and this was certainly one of our favourites. The guests all seemed to have stayed here before, which gave the locatiopn a very comfortable feel. Room was bright, excellent bed, shower with glass wall looking outside was a nice touch. Union square is a great location for dining out in the village, shopping in soho ect. Subway is less then a block away.

The surly and unhelpful front desk staff don't fit with what I've come to expect from a W hotel. Room was fine, location is great on Union Square. Bellboys were horrible, despite calling twice for help with luggage on checkout, no one came for half an hour. When I went down to bring a luggage cart up to just bring everything out myself, I was rudely yelled at that we couldn't bring one up despite there being 4 empty ones, and a group of bellboys huddled together having a conversation.

When I checked into the hotel, they had three people at the desk, while I waited I finally noticed a woman standing at reception, she did not ask me to step forward or indicate she was free, I had to ask, and when I did she told me to step back and she would call me when ready. The entire time she did not smile or indicate anything that I was other than an annoyance. My bathroom did not have any soap, so when I woke up this morning I called for soap, and a toothbrush, three calls later and 58 minutes finally brought my request. A call to the manager has still not be returned. I rarely complain at Hotels, but poor attitude by the receptionist followed by the poor service deserves a BIG 0!

I must admit that W is not my usual "go to" hotel (I prefer Kimpton Hotels for a somewhat similar experience). I picked this place as it was near NYU. No regret on location--being on a major transfer point for various metro lines made a huge difference when you have meetings all over town. Easy to walk to nearby restaurants...etc. The farmer's market on Wed & Sat/Sun were also fun - one get to pick up some fresh bread, produces, diary products...etc. Lots of great retail outlets around the square too. The rooms were bigger than I thought and the hotel did a great job in decoration. Everything one needs is in the room and the bed is as heavenly as the one at the Westin's. Also appreciate the sound insulation that went into the place - having lived in NYC before, I was worried about fire trucks/ garbage trucks early in the morning and I didn't hear them at all. So well done to the W!The service is the part that needs substantial improvement. Here's why:1) My hotel key failed three times. The staff at the front desk must be trained to inform hotel guest to use the phone in the elevator lobby of their room floors when these things happen. However, such repetition of line does the hotel no help. On the first occasion, the key didn't even work in the elevator when I was in the lobby trying to go back to the room. So going back to the front desk is the easiest thing to do. Telling me to use the phone on my floor is just silly--they should have sought to understand the situation first. On the second and third time, I did use the phone on my floor, but no one picked up on the other end after 8 rings. So the hotel needs to be operationally ready before they should offer a service.2) On check out, I left my bags with the front desk for 15 mins and when I return to pick it up, I was told by the front desk staff that the doorman will help me. When I asked the doorman, his response was "I am the doorman, I don't deal with luggage". So I went back the second time to the front desk and it was not until then that they decided to communicate via their walkie talkies that my bags were in the closet right next to him. Meanwhile I had a car parked unattended up front on the street. What kind of service is that? There was no sense of teamwork nor customer service. Could they not have communicated as I was leaving the front desk the first time? 3) My flight arrived late and I didn't reach the hotel until 12:30am. Even though the front desk staff can clearly see that I was struggling to come through the double doors, no one offered any assistance. At all other hotels where I arrived late, there was always someone ready to offer assistance.  Having to dealing with the snobby, unhelpful and uncoordinated staff makes me question if I should come back.

A hotel that has most of the things you want in a hotel but lacks that little extra touch that makes it stand out. Service is ok, but not very inspired, especially not in the reception. Food is alright but again nothing to write home about.

I spent 2 nights. The room was huge for new York City and very nice. I got a nice package that included parking. They let us check in early, and leave the car until 5 with no extra charge. It was supposed to include drinks but I never saw any tickets or vouchers.The parking guys were great, front desk extremely great. It was expensive but the location fantastic- so much to see in the area and great restaurants. Morning coffee in the lobby is nice. Free apples all the day were much appreciated!

Very average and price considered (realizing this is New York!) I'd say below par. Positives: Location, Bliss Shower Products, Restaurant/Bar seems to attract locals in addition to hotel guests, clean rooms. Negatives: Gym is in a basement with very low ceiling, wake up call was late, had to call them to remind about cleaning the room, TV was broken and failed to come up to fix it on first call, Internet was not free (if I am paying +$300, Internet should be free), beds slightly uncomfortable.

We just wrapped up 2 nights at the W and had a great stay. The hotel is conveniently located downtown in Union Square. Eddie at the front desk could not have been any better. He helped us with an early check in and put us in a great room. Excellent customer service. The hotel can be pricey but we booked well in advance to get a decent room rate as well. We would definitely return and recommend the W in Union Square.

Had several billing issues with hotel prior to check in, including being billed twice for my stay, without acknowledgement on my arrival. This resulted in my credit card being declined in other locations and causing embarrassment . Room was nice , but not $500 per night worthy. I stayed for business but would not return considering the billing issues , and that not one person addressed y complaint which I made in writing , and verbally prior to coming to the hotel .

My wife and I spent the weekend in NYC at the W and had a wonderful time. Very nice hotel away from the crowds of Times Square but very close to some excellent shopping and restaurants. Will stay again in the future.

One thing I love about staying at W hotels is that the service and rooms are consistently exceptional, and this stay was no different. My first time in New York was brief, so I wanted to savor it this time. The lobby is more traditional and not as modern as other W Hotels, but it does work in the context since it is housed in a gorgeous old building. The rooms are newly renovated. I could care less for the color combination of orange and navy, but it is nice otherwise. The bathroom is huge. The biggest disadvantage is that sound travels through the rooms very easily. There was a very loud party next door, but fortunately, they stopped at 10 PM. You can hear people speaking faintly if in normal tone the next room over.The location is pretty good. It's overlooking Union Square so it is not overly hectic on the streets outside. Overall, it was a nice stay.

I stayed at the W Union Square last Friday evening for my first night in NY, the service was amazing!! All the staff were extremely helpful in specific requests from the ability to watch the London Opening Ceremonies with cocktails in the lounge, to the concierge pushing restaurant reservations back for us, to the incredible front desk staff who connected us to some great promoters in the city and gave us tips for their favorite shopping. I wish I chose to stay at the W 2 nights in a row, but instead moved to 60 Thompson, who's service level was complete garbage in comparison. Thank you W Union Square for a great stay!

The location is not good compared with hotel like NY Palace on Madison avenue closer to museum (MoMa) and shopping. Price is 20% more expensive especially if you don't book on line. Rooms are small and there is little service. There was not a third bed for my second child. Bathroom was not equiped with real shower. WiFi was not working in my room. I wilkl not advise this hotel and will not come back.

Looking for specials online, i decide to call the hotel and after asking for specials, he finally offered me a buy 2 nights, get 1 free! Great deal. The hotel was clean, great location, very comfortable, nice people, bustling. The only drawback were how sensitive the keys were and how many times we had to have them remade.

I try to always stay here when in manhattan. It has a great downtown vibe and feel . The location is amazing, right on union sq. the hotel has undergone a complete renovation, all the guest rooms have a brand new design - long overdue as the old rooms were definitely looking their age. There is a very creative use of color and texture now. it doesn't get much better than this downtown!

I have stayed at the W Union Square a number of times and I keep returning because the folks at the hotel treat me great. But also the hotel is in a great location. It is close to all the things I enjoy about downtown Manhattan from the farmers market to the High Line.High floor rooms with a park view are the best. And the recent update of the rooms now makes this an even better choice for Manhattan hotels. Great new and stylish furniture. And the improved windows keep out the street noise!Overall a great Manhattan hotel in an excellent location.
Good value, except the wine list which is really expensive. Efficient business hotel.

When you stay at the W Union Square, you truly feel you are experiencing the heartbeat of New York City. The location in Union Square is so much better than being in Times Square. Many of the top rated restaurants of New York are within walking distance,Every member of the staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. From the front door to the front desk to the conceirge, we were delighted with the outstanding service we received. We have been frequent guest here and the service is always consistent. And yes, we will stay here again on our next trip!

Union Square is a good location from which to explore NYC. This W is caddy-corner from Union Square park and subway station. Our reserved room was not available the day we arrived. Lance at the front desk went out of his way to supply an alternative and made us feel well looked-after. The entire hotel staff is friendly and helpful. Our corner room had nice light and urban views. Housekeeping did a great job. Coffee available mornings at the front desk. The fitness center is above-average and supplies complementary earphones if needed. We patronized the restaurant for brunch; high prices and indifferent service.

Enjoyed my stay at the W and will use it more regularly. Friendly staff nto to overbearing, really enjoy the are and walking around - plenty of good places to eat nearby in University Place or head west. Union Sq market is lovely to walk around.Could imporve teh gym a little with soem moer equipement, but I'll be there again.

Hotel was clean, the staff was attentive and pleasant. The location was perfect - close enough to get everywhere. The bathroom shower could stand to provide more room but hey, it's NYC! Would stay here again.

My husband and I recently stayed at this location and we were more than impressed with the service and, most importantly, the cleanliness of the hotel. We got in very late, around midnight, and Nelson at the front desk was very courteous and helpful - really nice when you're tired from traveling! The next morning we asked Aisha at the Concierge desk for brunch recommendations and she suggested Friend of a Farmer, about a block or two away. It was great!! She was also really helpful in printing out our WTC Memorial tickets for us, free of charge. Our room was a corner unit, so had a little more space. The bathroom was really clean. Location was excellent. Will definitely stay here again!
user_name:
mib92568
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Walked in to the hotel to have a look and Katie ( think that was her name) on concierge immidately engaged with us in such a lovely manner, great friendly attitude, offered us the Acura experience to get us back to the station. Next time I'm in manhattan I'm staying in the w just because of her
Nicely located but atmosphere only just OK. Maybe because they were renovating their restaurant, just not all that impressed.

This hotel is in a great location. The rooms are nice, and I thought housekeeping did an excellent job. The service in all other respects left something to be desired. They were very unresponsive to my multiple email requests/questions prior to our arrival. It was very disappointing. At check in, the woman appeared less than excited about assisting us, even though there was no one else in line. Another day, I asked the front desk where I could get coffee and a bagel outside the hotel and the response was again sort of lackluster When I am paying this much for a room, at least pretend to want to talk to me. But even moreso, have the decency to respond to my emails!!Overall, I am not sure whether I would return. I can stay at the ritz and get better service for a similar price.

For over $500 a night on a weeknight I expected this hotel to be properly functioning. First impression was wonderful, the door guys outside look like bouncers in tight black T-shirts so you feel nicely protected... and they were quite frankly gorgeous. They treated me with a calm respect which was a welcome change from some of the yapping sycophants in stupid looking uniforms at the older hotels. I waited in the check-in queue for about 20 minutes before being attended to, the people behind me must have waited a lot longer. The room had a funky decor and the Wifi was consistent. It was, however, quite cold so I increased the temperature on the thermostat. Stayed in the room for a while and went to have a shower but the water was cold. Skipped it, went to get ice for my drink and the ice-machine was broken. So I went out, and when I returned later I told the front desk on the way up that the shower was cold earlier, they sent an engineer up with me who tried the tap and it was warm. Great. Showered. Room was still cold though so I turned the thermostat up again. In the morning the room was absolutely freezing, so I went to warm up in the shower which was cold again. Naked and shivering, I went to call front desk and the bedside phone was broken, completely dead. When I went out, I asked them on the way out to fix the shower and the phone. When I came back my card didn't work in the door for no apparent reason (it wasn't the last day) so I had to traipse back down with shopping to get it re-done. The shower was then warm and there was a brand new phone by the bed but the room was still freezing. I called and said my heater is broken. Response? "There's no heating after May 15". Although the thermostat now said 80 Fahrenheit, it had still been cooling my room with air conditioning. New Yorkers might be comfortable in 60 degrees but I live in Dubai was aiming for at least 73 inside. I would have appreciated being warned (perhaps a little sign near the thermostat) not to literally make myself sick by trying to warm up the room. After an argument they did send up a heater for me but unfortunately by then I'd already caught a cold. When I checked out and nasally told front desk that my stay was not enjoyable, listing the problems I'd experienced (there was another one with the telly), the "lady" basically implied it was my fault for not reporting each problem as and when it arose, then repeating the complaint when it arises again. This annoyed me because I had informed then, but I also believe it is the responsibility of the hotel to ensure that their rooms are functioning, the water is hot, the phone working etc. and not of the person paying in excess of $500 per night to take care of maintenance or guess that a thermostat saying 80 means "COLDER PLEASE". She said a manager would call me but I haven't heard anything. I appreciate I was unlucky on this trip and most people should have a good experience but I have to review based on what happened. Oh, great location near Union Square and subways. The location and the stellar door guys get a point each.

I was in NYC on business and basically came back to the room to sleep so I suppose it was fine. Nothing special if you're looking for a great hotel. Pros: Beds are always comfy at the W. Location is great. Cons: Can't get much smaller of a room and I wasn't in the smallest category. Overall: I'd stay here again because I love the location but for $500 a night I think there are some better options in NYC.

The great thing about a company like Starwood running a hotel like the W, is the consistency. There are certain things you know you should expect at each W you visit. W always delivers. I had never stayed at the Union Square location before, but ended up booking myself and some work colleagues there this month for a one night stay. It was a good choice.The rooms were a good size, by New York standards and featured lots of light and high ceilings. My bathroom had a window and was filled with sunlight when I checked in. (My room was on a high floor facing east.)I'm not sure about the leather, metal and animal print decor though -- not my taste, and not what W typically offers, but how can anyone not love the bed at a W?This was perhaps not the best choice for business as the lobby kind of turns into a club after happy hour at the bar is over-- although it worked for our team. (That said, if you wanted to have a quiet place for an evening meeting with a colleague after sales calls, you'd be out of luck.)I would likely stay here again on future trips, but not if I was travelling with work colleagues as the W is not for everyone.BTW, the breakfast at Olives was very, very good. Don't miss it.

We've been to the W Union Square 3-4 times and always liked it for the location, decor, and service. We've stayed in a variety of rooms, and one time where I slipped someone $60 when checking in, got a great upgrade. Recently though when we checked in, we hated the room. It felt empty for the larger size we got, and the decor was very cold - faded blue and orange on white, with no art on the walls. When we asked if we could be moved to a room with the "new decor" - what we remembered to be plush beige and purple velvets, they said the blue and orange was brand new across the hotel. Yuck! I'm sure they tested and researched it, but it's definately not to our taste. And they have a new policy with the sheets which is to have a built-in moisture barrier (like sheets for toddlers who wet the bed) as part of the mattress pad. My husband was fine with it, but I woke up in a sweat every night because the bed didn't breathe or wick. When I called down they said it was on all the beds and that my only option was to take off the mattress pad (I should have). One problem we generally have with this hotel (which was likely rehabbed from a very old building) is that there is a small air vent near the window. It gets about 50% covered by the curtain (which originates next to it and can't be moved aside to expose the whole vent. So the rooms are generally stuffy and uneven temps. Seems like an easy enough fix to at least allow the vent to not be covered by the curtain. Overall the staff is always very nice and helpful. Be aware that if you buy coffee in the restaurant, they charge $4 per cup, no free refills. Go get the free coffee in the lobby to have with your breakfast.
Clean, trendy rooms. Great location, fairly quiet, by a park. Excellent bed.

I usually stay at the W Midtown but decided to branch out on this trip to NYC and I am glad I did. This W is fantastic. You can't beat the location in Union Square. Easy walking to great restaurants (try Kin Shop), close to SoHo and fun shopping, and an amazing Farmers Market in Union Square on Fridays during the summer. This is now my go to hotel in the City.

We choose this property for it's location in Manhattan as well as to drop off our daughter for her summer intern job/apartment. We checked tripa dvisor and were aware of the mixed reviews It's a bummer that so many minor details added up to take away an excellent review. Having said that, we will likely try it again.Positives: 1) Extraordinary location & beautiful building2) Comfortable beds & decent rooms3) Easy walk to shopping, restaurants, subway etc.4) Doorman (named David)Negatives: 1) coffee service at front desk--My wife arrived at 9:53am (ends at 10:00)and the woman was taking pots away. My wife asked for whatever coffee they had left and the clerk, glared at her and said said no! My wife noted the ending time wasn't for several more minutes to no avail.Doorman (David) overhearing conversation quickly came over,asked my wife what she wanted in her coffee, brought her a cup along with milk and sugar. He really did save just a horrible experience. (Too bad missed the clerks name)2) Olives Restaurant is disappointing--check my review for poor service and bland food.

I stayed in NYC for work and pleasure for six days at three hotels, the Intercontinental Times Square, the Hilton Times Square and the W Union Square. The W was a solid hotel, but i frlt overpriced. The location is terrific however for accesss to so many aprts of the city as so many trains go newr Union Square. It also has amgreat walk score,with easy access to so many great parts of the city. The free apples on the front desk was a nice touch as well. Of the 3 hotels i stayed in that trip,the intercontinental was the newest and had the best rate. It's a gorgeous hotel and near Times Square. Great service, nice staff. Hilton wasn't bad, but lobby was on a high floor, but had a large area for sitting, working and hanging out. Main entrance was under construction so one entered on 41st St. W Union Square was nice, but room not as much light as the other two and also didn't have as good views although it was in a great location. the W was normally more expensive, but I had a discount local rate through work. W's bar area is neat, but also sort of small. For the money at hotels normal rates, the Intercontinental was the best value.

So we drove down to NYC from Ottawa, Canada 9 hrs drive almost. We are greeted by a friendly door man. Go up to the check-in desk, the guy there is so unhelpful and didn't seem to want to be at work. So we go to our room after dealing with this and relax we read the menu to see what was in it as we were hungry and it was late. Food was so expensive, asked for 10$ delivery fee + a tip so for a BLT sandwich ( no sides ) the total would end up being around 30$. We ended up walking down the street to get food. We wanted use the internet in the room but there again was a hefty fee 30$ for 1 hr of internet. 15$ for 30 mins. 10$ for 15 mins. Unlike many other hotels i have travelled to there was on free internet or even a computer in lobby for use. Overall it was not the best but The concierge in the Hotel was amazingly nice, Alisha was the name I think she was very helpful gave us the info we needed got us the tickets for everything on the spot, and told us what the best places to eat were. I think overall I cant give this place more the average because of the lack of amenities. This hotel is more geared towards teens going out to club.

I just completed a 4 night stay and was thoughly impressed with the property. The remodled rooms are commodious and beautiful with top of the line linens and great bliss bath products. I found all interactions with staff from phone to in person to be warm and affable. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble and I always felt like a valued guest. The restaurant , Olives, had great food and the place has a fun vibe. I especially liked the large windows that gives the venue a wonderful open feeling. I have stayed at a number of W hotels and this place is a class act. You can't go wrong here with the prime location.

Many of the negative aspects of my stay have been pointed out on TripAdvisor in other reviews, the fact that these deficiences still existed on my stay, I feel the hotel is clearly not trying or doesnt care.Good stuff:Nice remodeled rooms, great design,.Good restaurant Olives, and room service for breakfast was tasty.Nice bar, good vibe, typical W hotel lobby scene.Bliss bath products! Still the best.I am an SPG gold member and they gave me late checkout. Nice to finally get some perks.Location - unbeatable, walking distance to everything.Awesome beds, good sleep quality.Bad stuff:Useless doormen - they dont open doors, dont get cabs, always on the phone texting, completely pointless why the hotel even has them.Key cards kept on getting demagnetized, had to get my keys reset twice. The bathroom, even in the remodeled room does not have an EXHAUST fan, thus the bathroom and rooms smell like mildew and the hotel staff glosses this over with overwhelming amounts of Febreeze, its way too many smells. How can you not have an exhaust fan???Service from front desk to doormen, its cold and unwelcoming.No newspaper delivered to my door even though other rooms had it in the morning.One bathrobe in room, even though i confirmed 2 people staying in room on reservation.NO trashcan in room!!! We looked and looked and finally had to call for one from guest services.No turndown service.Maid knocked on door bright and early at 815am - waking us up.Loud hallways, noisy type of crowd.I used SPG points, so I didnt pay for the room, but on their own website, the cheapest room was 525/night. There were so many small bothersome things, I dont know how they can justify charging so much and promote themselves as a luxury hotel. I actually asked for a full SPG point refund on checkout and the hotel person told me to contact corporate, which is basically saying, they dont care. I have stayed at 8 W's before and this was the lowest quality one for sure. I would love if the hotel could refund my points.

Super convenient location. I stayed here for work and the location was perfect. But if it weren't a work trip and location mattered less, I'd stay elsewhere. Rooms were nice but not fabulous. Wouldn't be my first choice for a NY hotel.

I stay here periodically for both business and pleasure and always have a great experience. The refurb has made it even better. New style, fresh. Great service. Not cheap but you're paying for a fantastic location and it's far and away my favourite NYC W Hotel.

I had to go to New York on business and I knew right away I was booking at W. This is the second time I've stayed here. My first time was so amazing. I contacted Mr. Tellez (Gerald) who remembered me from my first visit. Im from California and the fact that he remembered me speaks volumes. Anyway, just like last time he took time to greet me and ask about my flight and said how much he loves Cali. This stands out because the hotel was very busy. The rest of the staff is equally amazing. I love W Hotels. I highly recommend all of them. Thanks again. I will be back.

Since I am in the middle of a platinum challenge, I decided to try the Union Square W due to its proximity to our NY office. This was my first time staying at this property as it’s always on the high side for price around the area.After a less-than-average experience at the Gansevoort Park during my last stay in NYC, it was refreshing to have a fantastic stay this time around. All of the rooms have now been refreshed and the hotel staff upgraded me to a mega-room with a partial view of the park.The refreshed rooms were well equipped. The bed was comfortable and there is plenty of space in the room. The Wi-Fi was free in the hotel, which was great because almost every other Starwood I’ve stayed at charges you.Some have mentioned that the lobby staff was not very friendly. I had the opposite experience during check-in, where I was greeted with a very warm and hospitable welcome. Even the maids and the person who brought my room service (try the risotto tater-tots with truffle aioli) were pleasant.Overall, it was a great stay; I will definitely be back as long as the prices are manageable

I've stayed here 4 or 5 times now and every time I visit New York I think about staying somewhere new....then always end up back at the W Union Square. The staff are amazingly friendly, the bar is buzzy and great fun and the rooms are large (amazing for New York), modern, comfortable and well appointed in terms of large flat screen TVs, minibar, free water, wifi etc. This time there were a few glitches (blocked sink, problems getting the wifi to work, not enough bathroom products for two females!) but overall we had another great stay. The wifi costs extra which I don't like, especially since it's not a cheap stay in the first place, but overall it was great and I highly recommend it, especially if like us you are wanting to shop a lot - easy walk to SoHo and not too bad if you want to go uptown too, so the location is excellent. Plus if the weather is nice you can sit in the park too.

I recently stayed at the W Union Square. As soon as I entered the buzzing lobby of the hotel, the W team made me feel like I was at my home away from home. Check-in was seamless and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout my entire stay. My room was great. It was located on the 10th floor overlooking Union Square. It was bright, spacious, and we had this amazing, decorative full-length mirror (aesthetically pleasing and extremely functional at the same time). There was ample closet space and the beds were very comfortable. Definitely not your typical NYC hotel room. The service at the hotel was impeccable. Everyone greeted me and asked if I needed assistance. The staff was proactive and pleasant. Making sure I was as comfortable as possible during my stay. GREAT HOTEL AND GREAT OPERATIONS TEAM!

I didn't enjoy my stay in the W Union Square and will not be returning. The main problem was the service, which was poor: the last thing you want when you arrive late at night direct from a flight from overseas is a receptionist who isn't helpful and gives you incorrect information regarding the hotel's policies - not a great start - and I'm afraid it didn't improve throughout our stay. Unfortunately, the location is not enough to make up for the fact that the staff is just not what you would expect from a hotel that has to compete with the other great options that New York has to offer.

We stayed at W Union Square for two night last week and I've stayed there once before. We were supposed to stay another two nights this week but changed last minute to stay at The James. We were very glad we did.The location is good, but the rooms and the service cannot compete with other offerings in its price range. The rooms are big, but distinctly lacking in light (the hotel is converted from an old office building). The decor is typical W but a feels tired and a bit dirty. The service is just "ok"; the staff were not especially helpful or courteous. I admit that I'm a tough guest, but I found myself getting ready to argue with staff members more than once in two days. We had several specific complaints (though I wouldn't stay at the W again even if we had no specific complaints): no duvet cover on the duvet the first night, no robes in the room, shower drain was blocked; wireless Internet (not free) didn't work with iPad; coffee ordered from room service wasn't enough for two people; hallways were loud; elevators very slow; bell man "passed us off" to the door man after we tipped him (thus encouraging a double tip for what should have been one service).The manager was extremely helpful when I told her about the problems listed above, but it just wasn't enough to make me want to come back. All in all, it's not a very nice hotel. I'm an SPG gold member who usually picks Starwood properties for the points. But from now on, when in New York (unless I'm at the St. Regis) I'll stay elsewhere. If you have 350-500 a night to spend in New York City, I suggest you do the same.

Recently needed a hotel in the Union Square area. Not much else available unless you do B&B or rooming houses. While the W was more expensive, I was able to get a better rate than rack rate. It made it worthwhile and greatly influenced my decision. The hotel is very nice, extremely clean, staff very courteous. The beds were extremely comfortable. Room size good for Manhattan. A decent value for Manhatten, but a reasonably good value for the Union Square area. And the location to all the restaurants in the Union Square area is excellent, including West Village and Chelsea areas. About the only gripe was the add on charge for wifi. In this day and age, it should come with the room, especially at W pricing levels. .

I stayed at the W Hotel Union Square recently, and was happily surprised to see that the hotel had gone through a recent refurbishing, and the rooms and hallways are so much brighter now! My family never had a problem with the darkness of the hallways and rooms, but now that they have new, brighter paint and furnishings, what a great difference! is all I can say. The service is just as great as I have always experienced, with the staff remembering my name after checking in, but now the hotel seems happier with the new, brighter refurbishing. Well worth the extra cost of the hotels in the Soho/Village area. Thanks again for a great stay!

Stopped by here as we had visited before and it was a handy place to meet with friends before going to a restaurant nearby. The bar was smaller, it seems they have sectioned off some to refurbish some parts of the hotel however it was done so well it looked permanent and we could only tell as we had visited before and the bar was larger! Service was attentive, cocktails were a little too strong but ok. NY has lots of lovely bars and its not somewhere to make a special outing too but if you need to meet somewhere in this area its a decent choice.

My mother, sister and I were here to celebrate my birthday with NYC nieces and Boston kids. My mom has major mobility issues, and the room worked for her with her rented wheelchair. The rooms were comfortable - but we arrived in the midst of a 100 degree heat wave! Only one elevator worked at a time (out of three) and there we long waits. Then, on my birthday, I was stuck alone in the elevator. For a claustrophobic person, it was the fear of a lifetime! After 15 minutes or so talking to the staff on the elevator phone, they got it going, thank God. Stella at the desk (desk folk were lovely) promised me Starwood points enough for a night's stay as compensate. When i checked months later to use them, they didn't exist. I've called repeatedly. She hasn't been there once. Frustrating - and a ghastly experience, to boot.We went to the restaurant several times, due to my mom's problems moving around - dinner and brunch. It was decent, but overpriced and not overwhelming. The brunch was better than the dinner.

Just completed our 2012 booking for the W Union Sq. and realized we had neglected to review our wonderful May 2011 stay. We have been traveling to NYC for our anniversary for a number of years and now consider the W Union Sq. our preferred hotel in the city. The hotel is in a wonderful location for shopping and dining...both uptown/downtown. We find the entire staff (doormen/front desk/housekeepers) go out of their way to ensure that we happy and enjoying our stay. On our last visit there was a small issue with our room and Mr.Tellez personally took us up to the new room (the new room was spectacular btw) just to be sure we were completely happy. The staff has also kindly remembered our anniversary each year by sending up a card, champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. Bottom line, we are not high profile/VIP guests but we are always treated as such...you will not be disappointed if you stay here. Looking forward to the newly updated rooms and public spaces for our May 2012 stay.

This hotel was really great. Platinum member at Starwood for years and have stayed at the other 2 W's in Manhattan and this exceeded my expectations. First room I was given was suite on the 4th floor which was nice but way to noisy based on its proximity to the street. We were then moved to the 18th floor where the room were refurbished and this made a world of difference -- not a suite but a really large Fabulous room (room 1810). Elizabeth B. (front desk manager) made our stay. She was extremely pleasant and helpful and sent up a bottle of sparking wine -- free of charge for our room swaps. I would definitely come back.
Upfsted rooms are a bit overdone but clean and spacious for NYC. Restaurant currently closed and restaurants close by are limited. A bit pricey but good location.

The location at Union Square is perfect for whatever activities you're interested in. Close to great shopping, restaurants, and theatre. Just a short taxi or subway ride to lots of New York attractions. Many rooms have been completely renovated and have a new, modern luxurious feel. My room overlooked Union Square on the Park Ave side with a spectacular view by day and night. The staff was very friendly and professional. The restaurant, Olive's, is great with a small but exceptional menu and a bar/lounge area for enjoying drinks and conversation in an intimate setting with small groups.

My family stayed as part of a group who were in NYC for an event. Our upgraded room was pleasant, but a bit worn, and the hallway carpet was in rough shape. Our first day in the hotel, they left us a note to say that the hotel was undergoing a remodel. I think we should have been told that prior to our visit. Meanwhile, the signature restaurant, Olives, was closed. We were not told that fact when we made our reservations. There is a small bar area in the lobby for light food. For breakfast, it took 45 minutes to get our food. I had a banana. To pay the full rack rate when the signature restaurant is closed, and we have the old furnishings prior to the remodel, is ridiculous. With that said, the staff was great and made up for a lot of the flaws.

My wife and I stayed at the W Union Square this past weekend with our young daughter. While we have stayed in many other NY hotels, this was our first time at this one. We had a nice time and found the staff very pleasant. The hotel is located almost adjacent to Union Square, which was a great location for us. The room was nice but small, even by NY standards. In fact, because we needed a roll-away bed for my daughter, we were "upgraded" to a room capable of fitting such a bed. Well, in a literal sense it fit, but with the bed down, there was no room whatsoever to walk. But that was OK as we only put the bed down when we came in at night. The one thing I found truely objectionable, however, was the price for valet parking. With tax it came to just over $70 per day, which is more than I have ever been charged in any city to which I have traveled. This includes many 4 and 5 star hotels. This really comes across as gouging.

The Hotel is amazing, I had a great suite, staff was amazing, but I had a 4PM check out and the house keeping barged in on me even after I told them I was in the bathroom, and they began questioning me about my check out time while I was in the bathroom! CRAZY! I will definitely be back, but they need to work on getting the check out times right and make sure that they deliver on what they promise during the check in period. This stay did NOT end on a good note!

The location and value of this W are pretty good, but it could use some work. We checked in at 5 and our room was not yet clean so we had to wait about 30 mins before getting the keys. Not a great start an then entering our room it reeked of cig smoke. I understand that the hotel cannot control what other guests do in the room but the person who cleaned our room should have noticed the terrible smell. The hotel gave us some SPG points to make up for our troubles which was nice. Otherwise decent stay and the rooms arent bad for NYC standards. The lobby bar needs work and why the lounge bar/club is closed on Sunday nights over holiday weekend was disappointing. Overall I'd stay here again, but this place has nothing on the W Montreal - that was an amazing W experience that I suppose spoiled us.

Upon arrival my room wasn't ready so I dropped off my bags and headed to my company's office just steps away. Upon returning I found my room to be upgraded, a nice welcome for such a long (7 night) stay. The hotel staff was very welcoming and cordial, bellstaff went out of their way to greet me upon each return throughout the week. The room was very clean, comfortable, and the workspace was good too. There were lots of sirens each nice, but that's New York, and too be expected I think in a downtown setting. There is a CVS right next door to get last minute snacks or toiletries, and some good restaurants nearby. Concierge was helpful as I needed to find a tailor to fix my suit. Her recommendation was spot on and the price was reasonable. Overall very pleased, will return.

I had a wonderful stay twice in the last 2 months. My most recent stay was on March 4th, in a newly renovated room. It was terrific! I like the textures, colors, and design that make if more dramatic. The location is superb. I have lived in NY in the past and often stay in the Financial District, Upper West Side or Midtown East when I visit from Boston but like your hotel VERY much. Every staff person went above and beyond to accommodate. I am telling everyone I know about my new found “home” in the City.
I am a New Yorker who now lives in Boston. I travel everywhere now. I love this hotel. The rooms, the service, the location, the people, the front desk people, the restaurant. The best!

I have stayed at this hotel twice, each for one night stays. Front desk staff is always wonderful and friendly and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. Union Square is a great area, and a quieter, cleaner part of New York. I have also stayed at a few other Starwood properties in New York city, including the Sheraton Times Square, W Times Square & Westin Times Square and the W Union Square is by far my favorite out of all of them. I love the area and the building is beautiful and amazing. I plan to return to this hotel when I visit New York again in the future.

The hotel is in a great location and was easy to get around and the anytime anywhere concierge service was handy during our stay. I regret to say that I doubt I'll be staying in a W again, especially given I'm a consultant who spends lots of time in hotels and am a Starwood Hotels fan. I paid my own money for two rooms to stay in a W on this special occasion in NYC; it definitely wasn't worth it.I booked in October/early November for a trip in late January 2012. I was staying for two special occasions, my 30th birthday and my mother's 60th birthday. I requested 2 king size bedrooms on the same floor. Here are some observations and reflections from our stay (Jan 25 - Jan 31 2012):1. When we arrived they tried to put us in a double rooms with no compensation2. Made no reference to my request for two rooms on the same floor - when i brought it up they said a large party decided to extend last minute and couldn't honour it, they told me to try the following day, when i went back the following day they said not to bother as there was construction and we'd be bothered by the noise. Again no apologies that they couldn't do anything to help us3. Two friends sent cards to the hotel with our names and the dates of our stays on them scheduled to arrive for the start of the stay, we were not advised of any cards or mail arriving at the hotel for our attention. Given two friends sent cards, I believe the hotel let us down, rather than the US Postal Service but obviously impossible to know for sure4. The room keys were deactivated every time you put them in the lift to access the room floors. We had to keep one for the lift and the other for the room which meant we each needed to carry around 2 keys! We had to have our room keys reset several times, I mentioned something to the hotel; they sent someone up to reset our room lock, but this was to no avail. They did remove some charges from our room which was nice and appreciated. 5. On checkout on Jan 31st the woman serving us was unpleasant, inaccurate and rude when we enquired if our credit card had been charged for the additional items on the rooms. Not the service I expect from a W hotel. 6. The overall standard of the hotel rooms has declined, the bathroom was looking tired with brown mould in the shower. There was a champagne cork on the floor in the room when we arrived indicating the level of cleaning could use improvement, and our rooms were inconstantly refreshed with toiletries and bathrobes during our stay. 7. I wrote a feedback note at the hotel when we left, no one has contacted me regarding my stay. Such a simple thing to do!

I love Union Square, as a former NY student it was one of my favorite haunts and its a great location for those who want to stay between mid town and downtown Manhattan. This area has one of the best subway networks as well, so its perfect to get around.When a W opened here, i decided it was the perfect hotel and location for my next stay in New York and turns out i was absolutely right.Room was lovely, it was huge by New York standards and the hotel is cosy and has character. Service is as good as it gets at a W. Iv stayed at two other W's in New York, the Times Square one being my favorite in terms of ambience and design. However, I prefer the location at this one as the times square one is a little more touristy.However, If your a first timer in NY and want a room with the quintessential NY view, than this is not the place for you.

The W Hotel Union Square was a great stay. Good location, have to walk or take cab downtown. The lobby is very dark, loud music playing and a little claustrophobic. The rooms are dark as well, but good size for NYC hotel. The beds in this hotel are the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in on vacation. I got sick during the night, and the front desk staff went to CVS to get me medicine at 3:00 a.m. which was extremely nice. The next day, the staff continued to bring me water and chicken soup and buckets of ice. They even sent a "get well" card, which was unexpected. You could tell they actually cared. The staff was exceptional. Would definitely stay again.

When we first stayed in New York, we stayed in a hostel on the upper west side so this was a massive step up. The location was great and we spent a lot of time wandering up and down the easy to navigate streets. Half a block down is a Big Daddy's diner which was great for breakfast (though a little expensive).The Lobby was very impressive, if a little gloomy inside but it was the room that was the most disappointing. I was expecting a little grandeur for the price and the location but it was nothing special. I know it's New York and the rooms aren't going to be huge but it was really tight and the bathroom was on the small side too. The decor was average too, nothing I wouldn't expect from a Holiday Inn or other chain hotels. I don't think we'd be staying here again, we'd probably look for better value for money. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't great. I was hoping for more.

Previous stays in other hotels have always been noisy given the city but this room was silent! Spent most of my time in lower manhattan (soho and chelsea predominantly) and walked everywhere. The room was very clean, it was well priced (expedia) and the staff was very accommodating and lovely about a room change request. Anyone not liking scents would find the common areas off-putting but my room didn't have the strong odour. The king size bed room had a great bathroom but the 2 double beds room had a tiny bathroom and sliding door that didn't really close.
Great location , easy access by foot to top restaurants and areas.Room from the 80`is.Nice bar and breakfast place in the ground foor.
Cramped bathrooms but it's NYC. Great location. Lobby is cool.

This was our second time at the W. Our room was sophisticated looking and quiet, considering how close the building is to Union Square. The weekend rate was reasonable for the area. The room was extremely clean however, the perfumed scent in our guestroom was stomach-turningly strong. When I discussed it with the front desk, the person immediately said "It's the signature W scent. Some maids overdo it." Apparently, it's a concentrated solution that should only be squirted once or twice but workers don't understand that and blast spray "the W Scent" like it's a cheap can of Glade. Clearly, this is a common problem since everyone on duty at the desk understood our complaint (And we aren't people who are scent-sensitive or allergic. This stuff was overpowering, in our room and the hallway). The manager tried to help, putting an ozone machine in the room for a couple of hours when we were gone (along with opening a window as far as it would go) but the odor remained. Next morning, we were moved -- and upgraded (thank you) -- to a room that had no trace of the "W Signature Scent." Please, W Management: hotel guests only want the scent you get from a freshly scrubbed and clean room .. not corporate's idea of what "chi-chi" smells like.

I think The W chain of hotels has become lazy. I recently stayed at The W at Union Square and was somewhat disappointed for the price (almost $400/nt). I'm in NYC often and have stayed at numerous hotels including The Setai (amazing) and The Hudson (also very average) when not staying with friends.First, a hotel that still charges for internet access should be ashamed of themselves. Seeing as this was a quick trip, it was for work, and it was close to our shoot I didn't have much of a choice. Not staying at this particular W before, I figured it would be more than adequate. The radio in the room used to listed to an ipod was broken, the knobs were falling off. The service was pretty good, but being in NYC, many of the staff were pretty rude which I've come to expect from NYC (The Setai being an exception, they have wonderful staff).Anyway, I will make it a point to not stay at this hotel again.
We stayed here the night of our wedding. Very comfortable bed, and romantic decor. We still stop at lounge for drinks every once in a while. Nice size bathroom and very clean.

I just stayed 10 nights at the W Union Square and u can't beat it for location. The restaurants nearby are fantastic and open till late and the proximity to convenience stores and shops are just a stone's throw away. BUT and there are a few BUTS, the service standard of the rooms are quite questionable. I asked for my rather dusty room ( the side lamps in the bedroom revealed a headboard that had only been cleaned to hand level - above that, you could clearly see a thick film of dust!) to be cleaned 4 TIMES, but to no avail - and despite specifically telling each front desk staff what needed to be cleaned, it took a turn-down service staff to be led, by hand, to what was the lovely dusty headboard, a shocked expression from her, and finally, a clean room after my 8th night there! The other thing which is highly wrong are the charges they levy on packages sent or picked up from the hotel. As I had a few packages picked up and sent from my room, the hotel charged me for each and every pick up and drop off ( and I mean just at concierge) for a cost of $10 each time with taxes. And that's on top of my tips and gratuities - I found this shocking and when questioned, the arched eye-brow front manager told me sarcastically that I had already enjoyed quite a few "free" deliveries and that it was stated in their website that they charged for such services! This is the FIRST time I have ever been charged for such things - and I was not at all impressed. I will be taking this up with their management and really, this should not be the case of a top rated hotel like that - SHOCKING! My bill ended up over $200 more due to this service that they charged ( I had to pay for 3 rooms) and I am still reeling for this "charged service"..And this they call their world famous whenever whatever - it should be called whenever, whatever, pay now, question later! Won't be a repeat visit for sure...

I just stayed in the W Union Square, for my semi-annual trip to help my NYU child move into residence. This hotel has become our home away from home, not only because of its proximity to the NYU and wonderful SOHO area of New York. We had arranged for a "mega" room because of all the luggage we had, and the room was great. We lucked into a corner room so we had two different views. The doormen were wonderful helping us with our luggage. The breakfast in Olives, the hotel restaurant was superb! The egg white omelet they make is amazing. The dinner was also great; I didn't feel like anything fancy and the chef was good enough to just give me pasta with tomato sauce, with no fuss at all! The staff were all wonderful, and very pleasant, even wishing my daughter good luck on her next semester. While we were here, an elevator broke down, but the staff were nice enough to let us use the staff elevator, for the one time we had to go up to the room before the elevator was fixed. The gym is small, but well equipped, even with a boxing area for those so inclined.The rooms are a bit dark, but we don't notice it really because we don't stay in the hotel , because we came to be at the university, or explore this great city.Thanks, W Union Square, for another pleasant visit. See you in the spring!

From the perspective of someone that used to live in NY, the location is fabulous. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The room was lovely. The bed was super comfortable. To be picky, they could use new carpeting and new bathtubs to take it up a knotch. But I was very happy with the room overall. My only real complaint is about the room keys. Almost every time we left the room, they stopped working and we had to ask for new ones (they were not next to our phones or anything magnetic). This seems to be a known problem that the corporate company should probably prioritize on its repairs list!
user_name:
lx8
New York City, New York

review_body: We live in the City... so why an overnight? With 2 young children under the age of 3 and trying to celebrate our anniversary, we decided to stay at the W Union Square for an in-the-city getaway. Great great time! From the start, Nelson Baez at the front desk provided a wonderful warm welcome and super upgrade. He was a gentleman and the treat was much appreciated. We hit the bar downstairs (could be more seating and faster service), ordered room service and never left the hotel. The staff was excellent and we would recommend this property.
user_name:
AlysonS_12
New York City, New York

review_body: I did not have a good first-time experience here. What went wrong? 1. No apparent upgrade for my SPG Platinum status, though I was informed on checkin that as a Plat, my "internet was free" and I'd receive "500 Plat Amenity points"...that's the minimum requirement, it's not as if I was being done some sort of favor 2. Doorman busy texting instead of doing his job. 3. Room assignment next to the elevator (#809), thus I was treated to loud guests outside my door until well into the wee hours 4. 8-inch long rust stain in the bathtub, disgusting that housekeeping is apparently so oblivious to maintaining a high standard that it was allowed to be there for a long period of time. I wonder how many weeks or months that stain has been there? How many other guests complained, and nothing was done about it? 5. Breakfast the next morning in Olives, and the waiter served jams with the bread basket...and one of the jams was opened, half-used by a previous guest, and obviously no one in the restaurant bothered to check when they cleared the table from the day before. 6. The hotel overall is in an old building, and the overall appearance is drab, and fairly shouting that a renovation is in order. 7. And I know low lighting is the "style" of W hotels, but at least make the bulbs work on the elevator room numbers. The elevators don't have the same matching numbers array, (i.e., the 1st floor number isn't in the exact same place on the panel in each elevator), and so it forced me each time to have to crouch down to see "1" clearly enough to push the button. 8. An indifferent staff attitude from top to bottom towards me as a customer. This may be "New York" style attitudes, but it doesn't excuse a lack of customer service. Oddly, the only other hotel I've ever experienced within SPG that exhibits this kind of staff indifference to the customer is the Westin Paris. I was told that it was just the "Parisian Way". Whether it's the New York Way, or the Parisian Way, bad customer service doesn't get a free pass from me. I also experienced a great deal of difficulty sending my complaints after the stay to the hotel general manager. The Starwood email giving me his address and asking for my feedback was no use, email sent to the address they gave me bounced back as "undeliverable". Eventually, customer service people contacted me, and while they said all the right words, the only way I'll ever know if their words are sincere and meaningful, and if this hotel is any better than my dreadful experience, is if I return to it again. I'm not sure I have enough courage to want to experience this nonsense again.

Hi all, First time writing a review on here, but after returning from New York back to Melbourne Australia I felt like I needed to share with you all how wonderful the W Hotel in Union Square is. We arrived in New York, my partner, my sister, my brother in law and I after a long flight from Australia and it was approximately 7am. We were tired and the jet lag had really set in, so we thought we'd try the hotel to see if we could get an early check in. The lady at the desk was amazing, she said the cleaners were getting in at 8:30 and she would make sure they do the rooms straight away and allow us in. By about 9:30 the first room was ready so we sent my sister and her husbane up and my partner and I waited. The lady said half an hour but because it took about an hour she was so apologetic and upgraded our room to the 18th floor. WE were the ones that turned up too early yet SHE went out of her way to help us and make us happy. The doormen were the next people I noticed in terms of service. They were amazing. So polite, always willing to give directions, always making sure a taxi is ready so we're not waiting in the cold. Absolutely wonderful. Please tip these guys when you're there because they truly deserve it! Whatever/Whenever (concierge) was again, amazing. From booking tours to giving advice on where to celebrate new years eve. They recommended a restaurant right near times square where we enjoyed an 8 course meal and were then lucky enough to see the ball drop right in the heart of times square. A memory never to be forgotten. The rooms... Beautiful. We were lucky enough to have a room that looked over the park and it was truly beautiful to wake up to every morning. The rooms were always immaculate and everything was always kept well stocked. The bed was really comfy along with the pillows. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. For my first time in New York, it really made me love the experience so much more. Missing New York already!

The staff make this hotel - from the moment we arrived the service we received was outstanding - from Eddie who fixed something in our bathroom within 5 minutes of us making the request to Eddie Ruiz and Vincent Sendra going out of their way to solve problems and just be nice! There was not one staff member who wasn't friendly and obliging. We had 2 stays - the first for 10 nights and the second for 9 nights with a four day side trip out of town in between. On our return we were spoilt with a surprise delivery of cakes to our room - which were stunning, and an invitation for a complimentary breakfast - totally unexpected but a fabulous gesture. Both times we had excellent rooms which were quite large compared to other places I have stayed in New York, with 2 double beds, a bath and a great view over Union Square - rooms 1502 & 1602. My only criticism is that the lighting is insufficient. It would be great if any future refurbishment includes reading lamps over the beds. We experienced room service, breakfast at "Olives" and drinks in the bar area. The room service meals came within the specified time and were very good. Breakfast was excellent and good value with large servings. The drinks in the bar area off the foyer were fine but expect it to be noisy as it seems to be a popular meeting place for locals. The position of the W at Union Square was excellent - there is a huge Barnes and Noble book store nearby as well as Starbucks, Macdonalds, Wholefoods, vegetarian take-away and fabulous restuarants and cafes such as Grammercy Tavern, Rohm (Thai), Union Square Cafe and La Pizza Fresca Ristorante in East 20th Street for wood fired pizzas. The subway is very close and taxis were always available out front. There is a Greenmarket held in the Square a few times a week where organic breads, fruit, cheese and farmer-direct produce can be purchased. Throughout our entire stay the Union Square Christmas Market was held daily with a fabulous selection of interesting stores and gourmet food. Two doors away from the hotel there is a 24 hour "Pharmacy" that stocks most food and personal items you would need. The room had a mini-bar but no tea and coffee facilities but each morning coffee was offered free in the foyer. My two adolescent girls loved the hotel and its position - close to East Village and Soho. When I travel to New York again I will definitely stay at this hotel. Thank you to the staff and management for making our trip to New York so memorable.

The W New York is a small gem in the heart of Union Square with the best service I've experienced at any New York hotel, or any Starwood hotel for that matter. The valet staff, front desk, concierge, and service staff are all shining stars that are true ambassadors of the Starwood organization. A special shout out to Chris, Maria, and Doug (bartender) for going "above and beyond" during our most recent visit. Your warm hospitality and graciousness raised the bar for even such well-traveled folks such as ourselves. My kids are still talking about what you all did for them. A million thanks for creating a memorable weekend we will never forget. Now, about the hotel --a perfect mix of old and new -- and the old marble flooring and steps, ornate elevator trim, and antique office trinkets blend perfectly with the espresso furniture and purple satin linens. Rooms are spacious, well-appointed, and stocked with many amenities. Olives is delish, as are all Todd English restaurants. His signature chicken dish is my kid's absolute favorite meal.The only negative about the hotel is that it is so hip and trendy with twentysomethings that it's difficult to get near the bar or a seat in the "living room" on the weekends. This minor glitch, however, will not keep us away from our new favorite hotel in NYC.

Rooms are decent size and clean. Like the location - union sq is a neat place - although not as convenient to other spots in the city depending on where you are going. Was woken up both nights I was there by loud customers in the room next door (walls must be thin) and I am a good sleeper with ear plugs.

The hotel is well situated, just opposite Union Square. Well worth your while to upgrade if possible to a room overlooking the square. Rooms are spare but comfortable and clean. Fine restaurants, bars, theatres nearby. Easy access to entire city on foot and subway. Good restaurant on site. Three question mark - noise: lots of action on Park Avenue. very noisy bar.Room-cleaner at 09:00 am! No free wireless in rooms!

I have stayed at this property for years since it opened. It's location on Union Square puts it right between the village and midtown....TWO blocks from the Union Square subway stations that can whisk you anywhere in the city via express trains....even crosstown. Times square is a 10 minute subway ride from here.....This location is FLAWLESS. Lots of local restuarants and you are not stuck in a prime "tourist" area where you are eating with the people at 55 other hotels that they are catering to. From here you can walk to over 50+restaurants in a 10 minute radius many of which are well priced and Very Very good. This hotel's location really would get my vote for best location in NYC. Staff are friendly and remember you when you return. It is a converted bank building from the early 1900's so many of the rooms have strange shapes and high ceilings with big window and lots of light. I have only ever booked the park view rooms and they are spectacular viewing over union square park and now onto the in construction "freedom towers" being build about 1 mile south from here. The beds are uber comfortable and the lounge bar in the front is a lovely place to read a book and have some tea. Minibar prices are insane so I always go out and one block south to the 1) Liquor store and 2) deli for bottles of water. The bathrooms are clean and white and we always enjoy the bliss bath products. Sometimes we have had to wait for our room however this trip was a breeze and no waiting....Great. If you want a hotel that puts you smack in the middle of one of most of the fun vibrant areas of NYC this hotel is it. I know they are planning renovations this year as the rooms are a bit tired, however I am not sure when this will begin. There is no breakfast offered here....only an overpriced mediocre restaurant....When you are staying here....just go out and about, you cannot go wrong! Enjoy! NYC

I wasn't expecting much from the W Union square to be honest, yet I must admit it really was fantastic overall. I normally stay at Trump soho, the London NYC or the crosby street hotel - all genuine 5 star hotels, yet given i was in NYC over Xmas, the prices around town were very high. I did get a good rate for their "mega room" which was on the 18th floor. Yes, the hotel is a tad tired, and the gym is very small and showing it's age, however aside from that, the hotel gets top marks and I will stay there again. Firstly, if you can, spend the extra money for a mega room as they are very large and comfortable. The hotel is right near the subway and within walking distance of many good restaurants. The staff made this stay for me. They suggested I join the starwood program on arrival which meant my wireless was free for the week, and a late check out request was given without any drama. The staff make this place. I have stayed at the W times sq and the comparison isn't even close. The staff at other W's tend to treat you like you are at a nightclub, yet here they were brilliant. A really nice surprise

The hotel is wonderfully well situated, just opposite Union Square. Well worth your while to upgrade to a room overlooking the square. Rooms are spare but very comfortable.Excellent restaurants, bars, theatres nearby. Easy access to entire city on foot and subway.Good restaurant on site.Only question mark - noise: lots of action on Park Avenue. And this is New York, so it doesn't let up in the night.

This hotel is absolutely amazing. I highly recommend staying at this hotel in new York city. The hotel rooms are spacious, clean and elegant. The hotel staff went above and beyond in their services. Eddie at the front desk was extremely helpful and overtly polite. He made us feel extremely welcome and answered all our questions.

We spent Christmas weekend at the hotel and really enjoyed it. Location is perfect - far enough away from the tourist madness to be relaxing, but only a quick subway ride if you want to be a part of it all.Pros: location, well-appointed comfortable rooms, Todd English restaurant onsite, the Living Room, Bliss bath products, historical details that they kept in this 100 yr old bldg.
