Cons: parking costs $71/day ! Come on. I know its NYC, but we used the ICON parking website and found a garage just a pleasant 15 minutes stroll away and paid $25/day. Not quite as convenient as just walking out the front door, but for that kind of savings, I was happy to take a walk. Beds: initially, they were very comfortable, but we found them too soft for us. Just personal preference. Loved the pillows. Bath: loved the lighted makeup mirror and Bliss products. No tub, but we're fine with that. Would like to have a show head that is adjustable to different types of spray and flow. Noise: we were on the 11th floor, facing east. Yes, there was some traffic noise, but it is to be expected.We're looking forward to our next stay, in the spring.

My wife, sister in law and brother in law spent a delightful Christmas weekend at my favorite hotel, the W Union Square. The hotel had a festive atmosphere for the holidays, and the extraordinary staff took every opportunity to make the holidays special. Both couples had fantastic views of Union Square, which had a terrific holiday shopping bazaar set up around the southern end of the park. We also enjoyed the farmer's market on Friday and Saturday, which is always a treat. At this point, our expectations for this hotel are enormous, and they never fail to meet or exceed them. The Olives Restaurant and lounge also were delightful. Christmas in New York is always special, but even more when one stays at the W Union Square!
user_name:
fordpat
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I spent 1 night at the W in Union Square. I checked in at 10am and my room was ready which was a good start to the stay. The hotel was really great - front desk staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were beautiful and spacious (much bigger rooms than the W on Lexington). The location is definitely one of the best in NYC. Would definitely stay here again on my next trip to New York!

Had reservations to stay 3 nights at this property with my wife - she insisted we leave after one evening there.Everything seemed worn out and dirty. They haven't maintained or updated this hotel in a long time. Our room was large but only had a bed , a small desk and a mirror in it. Therr was a lot of empty space - Felt like they didn't want to spend the money on an armchair or other furnishings. Room felt like a $80 per night hotel - but it was quite expensive. Location is very good and the staff seemed very nice - but can't make up for its shortcomings. We couldn't wait to get out of there. We won't go back until we hear the hotel has been fully renovated.

Our family spent two nights at the W, and mostly were quite charmed by the hotel and its staff. Every single staff person we encountered, from the doormen helping us out of our cab and into the hotel, to the front desk, the concierge, and the engineering staff (more on that later), were simply great: helpful, friendly, warm, informative. We loved the location and the general vibe of the hotel, as did our 11-year-old daughter. The room was spacious and comfortable,  with a stellar view over Union Square. Our only issue is that the decorative theme of this hotel seems to be "dim." The halls are dimly lit and our room was so dark that we had to ask for more lights. The good news is the staff responded promptly and efficiently, and brought us both a standing light and a desk light.  We'd  love to come back to this lovely, attentive hotel.

I have always wanted to stay at this hotel and finally got a chance a few weeks ago. The hotel was quite busy as it was close to Xmas. The hotel location is very central. I was upgraded to a mega room which was very spacious and well furnished. The bed was very comfortable. I was surprised to find out there was no spa though. After I checked out, the next day they charged me for things I didn't consume from the minibar.I contacted them and they did reverse the charge but it's still work to have to do that. The room rates are higher than the other Ws in New York which I guess is worth it. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay and I will go back to stay!

We chose the hotel primarily because of its location - cant beat the location with union square at your doorstep, especially at the time with the farmers markets and Christmas markets and being such a short walk from gramercy park and multiple subway lines.We got an enormous room (probably the largest room I’ve ever stayed in in NYC, bigger than our apartment when we lived there) with a view of union square (probably because my husband is SPG platinum).The service was excellent. We needed to store luggage a few times and they were always very accomodating. Needless to say we would stay here again on future visits to NYC.

Stayed on 12/17/2011 - the middle of the busiest season in NYC. Our accommodations were great.Bed was perfect and pillows so soft. Room was quiet and spacious (for NYC that means a lot!)No coffee or tea available in the room, but you could have any snack, water, wine or booze for a $$$$$$ price!Hotel has a nice lounge to meet up with folks and a nice bar in the lower level.Our room was clean, but the bathroom (only the bathroom) smelled of stale cigarettes...
Stayed at the hotel for my anniversary. I asked the front desk to arrange a flower delivery. They went above and beyond! Service overall was fantastic, and they made our weekend very special.
user_name:
Jimmy1702
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a fantastic week at the W Union Square. It was pricey but well worth the money. Very convenient location to downtown Manhattan. Hotel is very modern and hip. Very comfortable mattress. We wish we could order the mattress but it is only available in the US so we had to settle for buying just the sheets from the W store.

We spent five days at the W Union Square recently and were even more pleased than on our previous stays, of which there have been many. This hotel continues to be our favorite in New York City. The location is perfect (in fact, it is the only outstanding hotel in the entire Union Square Area) and it permits venturing to Greenwich Village, SoHo, Gramercy Park, etc. without even taking a taxi or subway. There is so much of interest within walking distance. And in the hotel itself, the service continues to be outstanding and very personal (staff makes everyone feel like family), the rooms and housekeeping are immaculate and the entire lodging experience is superb. We'll be back!

Expensive like all Manhatten hotels.On entering the small, casual looking lobby with noisy bar next door (after a tiring taxi ride from JFK) was off-putting. The rooms however are of a decent size, extremely clean....the bed was comfortable with decent pillows and silky sheets. There was no view to speak of from our particular room...luck of the draw on this one. I went against the advice of many in choosing the location...but was not let down by my decision. Union Square is central in many ways. The market and surrounding shops are a bonus. Chelsea, SoHo, TriBeCa are short walks away... Times Square and 5th ave shops etc are likewise walking distance....the subway station on the square is useful if you don't want the walk.

Yes, "hip", whatever that means, and that is part of the problem. Overpriced for what you get, and set up to cater to the younger "hard chargers." Doormen are great, and very helpful. I stayed there quite a bit, probably around 15 times as I come from NY originally and wanted to stay away from midtown. Rooms small, clean, and serviceable.

The rooms are decent; what you would typically expect for a hotel room in the area. The doormen were very accommodating as well as treating me with more respect than I am used to being a young professional on business in NYC. Would definitely stay here again if I have business to attend in the area.
user_location: Hilton Head Island, South Carolina, United States
user_name:
Ryan S
Hilton Head Island, South Carolina, United States

review_body: Spent 4 nights over Thanksgiving at the W, everything about our stay was top notch. From the moment we checked in Percilla at the front desk set the tone for the rest of our stay-excellent service!! Our room was very clean and spacious. The location is great just steps away from the subway entrance, with great food choices in the area. We will be back next year!

A great week's stay in NY in early November for the big 40. Nice, good-sized room, friendly, helpful staff, fantastic location - couldn't ask for more. Okay, more shower gel would have been nice (what is it with those tiny bottles?) but maybe that's just me. Usual beefs, but these are in no way specific to this hotel: overpriced minibar and room service delivery charge (why? What else am I going to do? Collect it from the kitchen?)Don't miss breakfast at The Coffee Shop, on the opposite side of Union Square, and treat yourself to a gourmet dog from Dogmatic, close by. Also, respect to Mr Gerald Tellez, Guest Relations Manager - if you read, this, sir, kudos for being the hardest working man on Trip Advisor!

As a very frequent guest at the W Union Square, and a frequent traveler for business all over the world, I feel very qualified to write this amazing review about the most perfect experience a person should have when staying away from home. You will never find a better and more professional staff anywhere. And the best thing....they remember you and make you feel so welcomed, every time. It just doesn't get better than this, and...they love my french bulldog Mitchell. Best beds, best pillows, which you can buy, and great food, love it love it love it!!!

I have stayed at the W on Union Square a number of times with my wife and also on business, so the fact I'm a repeat customer shows that it must have been doing something right for me! It's in a great location and the rooms are always spacious with good bathrooms and great Bliss products. Has a great bar downstairs as well, and lots of restaurants in close proximity . The main drawback is that it isn't cheap, but it certainly won't let you down if you do stay here

I really loved this hotel. The rooms were nice and the beds were so comfortable with wonderful silky smooth bed sheets.Downstairs it has a cool bar to enjoy really good cocktails and delicious snacks including cheesy fries which were to die for.A very good location with some excellent breakfast places to choose 2 minutes away.

We have stayed in The W mid-town before but decided to try this one. We weren't disappointed, it is in a great location, half way between the shops on 5th Ave and Soho, so a taxi ride to both is just 15mins. Our room was surprisingly big for NY standards and had a lovely view overlooking the Park. As with all W hotels it was very comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful, without having to ask on check-in I was offered a late check-out on the Sunday.

The W Union Square is a fun place to stay in one of New York's best neighborhoods. The rooms are large by NY and W standards and the location is very good for both business and enjoying the City.For SPG elite guests, make sure that you request an upgrade at check in. Even if you have reserved a small room, the floor plan has many of the larger rooms. Great breakfast at Olive's btw.

The lobby is nothing impressive, the doormen are useless (I had read comments about that, I'm even wondering if they don't do that on purpose ...)One of the bar is closed due to work (I asked about it, it's been more than a year, and it is not precise on their beautiful website).The maid woke me up at 10h30, with my hangover I was pretty upset. I went for just for one saturday night (it might not be enough to fully enjoy the hotel, as suggested by the receptionist). The bar was small but full (W reputation ?). I ordered some food overnight, it was good. The room are spacious, even tough the mirror was not even fixed on the wall. And yeah the bliss product are nice.The staff is so so (except the last receptionist when I checked out).Ok, but far from being "cool" and obviously overpriced.

In the past I have always stayed here and it has been very good. Now it has changed. The bathroom had no soap. I had to request it be brought. The room cards repeatedly do not work and it requires you go back to the front desk to get a new card. This happened everytime I left the room. The wireless connection is spotty and slow and costs extra. The helpfulness and friendliness of the staff has deteriorated.The location is great.I will not pay the prices they charge to stay here again.

What a great stay! We stayed just 1 night, Aug 20th. Beautiful hotel, very comfortable with large bedroom and bathroom and wonderful location! Very clean. We have never stayed in the Union Square area before, and we loved it! The staff was great also! They recommeded a restaurant for dinner (Abe & Arthur's, also wonderful!) Just a terrific place to stay!

Maybe I'm just getting older and more less hip but the pulsating music at the W hotels, the dim lighting in the elevators and hallways, the crazy bar scene in the lobby all seem kind of pretentious and irritating. I still love the Bliss bath products -- they are my favorite products in any hotel I've ever stayed at -- but the purple satin coverlets on the two queen sized beds in my room weren't that appealing. The room was very spacious but dim, dim, dim. And I had only a mediocre (then again I only paid for a standard room).The people at the front desk are cheerful and helpful, and the location on Union Square is perfect. The W interior seems more dated than trendy these days although I still like the pots of fresh grass they have in the W lobbies (when I left at 5:30 a.m., there was a guy actually mowing it!).

I shared a room this weekend with my friends for a girls' weekend out. The room was spacious with 2 full sized beds (would have been nice if they were queen but it was ok). The bathroom was good and we enjoyed all of the Bliss spa products. The concierge is really nice and my girlfriend couldn't keep her eyes off the cute guy taking our luggage into storage. I would come back to this hotel again if I were staying overnight in NYC! Easy and central location to all modes of transportation and the area is right in the center to many great restaurants and bars.

This hotel isn't what it used to be. Granted the location is perfect, but room details need improvement. Beds used to have feartherbeds under the sheets, but that service is gone. The bed and pillows were not comfortable, but the housekeeping service was excellent. The chair in the room was dated, worn out, and needed re-upholstering. I would stay here again if I received a very good rate, but it's not worth the everyday price this hotel charges. Yes, the Bliss products in the bathroom are a nice touch.

Location of the hotel was amazing, the hotel bar and bar staff were amazing!! Loved it there. The rooms were quite spacious for New York standards, however the rooms looked tired and didn't feel 100% clean. If i got a good deal I would go back.

I stayed one night for business. I love this location because it is close to everything but you don' t have hordes of tourists everywhere. I had the basic room type on the 10th floor (rm 1006) but it was pretty spacious, quiet, and had a nice little view of union square. The bed is very comfortable and I still get excited about the Bliss bath products. Plenty of nice towels and a robe. Good desk for doing work although worth mentioning that the room is dark, both in its design aesthetic (dark woods, dark carpet) and in the natural light it received. Internet access at 15/day! Yuck. All of my interactions with the staff were good, from check-in to the concierge desk. Doorman at the front were extremely helpful- David in particular was extra friendly! Appreciated the complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning as well.

A great hotel for the things that matter - decent sized rooms (for New York), and fantastic service, particularly from the concierge desk, who seem to know everything about everything and bend over backwards to help. True, the doormen are a bit hit-and-miss with the front door, but the only time we ever needed their help - with bags and wanting a cab - they were right there. My only complaint is the $2 charge for calling a toll-free number from the room - if you're going to charge for this, it should be spelled out in big red letters on the phone. At the prices the W is charging, I don't expect to have to pay for a toll-free call.

We stayed at this gotel for 8 nights. Very well located if you want transportation to explore Manhattan and Brooklin (great subway hub). I got a bigger room, that was pricy but worth it. Comfortable, clean and trendy place.

Hear all about W hotels and was looking forward to my stay, the staff were great and very friendly and helpful, the bar is good the restaurant food is good, but the rooms need some attention. Good size but very boringly fitted out. Needs a revamp SOON. Would not rush back

Came to New York on a girls trip and knew the W name is synomous with luxury but I've had better service at a Best Western. At a 5 star hotel you would expect door men who actually open the door. In 5 days of staying here only a few times did anyone bother to open a door for a customer including myself. I was shocked to see conciere door men stand there and text while your struggling to get the doors open. The men who work the front area are far from cordial and mainly just flat out rude. Then when you are in the lobby no one behind the front desk even acknowledges you to say hello or smile or anything. Now the housekeeper on our floor was exceptionally friendly and so very nice but that was far from the rest of the hotel staff including the wait staff in Olivers. The view is also pathetic. There really isnt a view so for the money I would say stay elsewhere!!!!

Stayed for 3 nights and from arrival to departure we couldn't have asked for more. The hotel is located in a beautiful building and has a very welcoming and relaxing vibe with nothing too much trouble for any of the friendly & courteous staff. The hotel decor is contemporary and the lounge areas have a warm ambience and are perfect to sit back and watch the world go by. We have stayed in many areas of New York and would regard this hotel and location as the best hands down and wouldn't stay anywhere else when visiting New York. I had mentioned it was our anniversary and some cute cupcakes accompanied by a card were left in our room and I must say a huge thank-you to Gerald Telliz the W Hotels Guest Services Coach who really made our stay a special one.

I stayed here for 3 nights in July, attending a wedding reception held at the hotel. Our stay was exceptional from check-in to check-out. The valets held our car while we checked in and while we retrieved luggage from our rooms upon leaving even though we parked the car elsewhere. Bedding waso instantly changed to cope with my allergies. Staff was consistently pleasant and competent - I'm always on the lookout in this regard having worked previously in sales for a top-rated hotel myself. The wedding reception was perfect as well - ready early, ever evident, all details tended to. Very nice touches like candles along the hallway everywhere. The food was to rave about - and we all did. In short, everything was perfect. Sterling service and facilities.

I had 5 nights at the W and couldn't wait to leave on the first day. Terrible service at the front desk... I'm Starwood gold member. Called in that morning to request a quiet room as I know that NY hotels can be noisy. Told when I'm checked in that I was upgraded to a great quiet room on a high floor. In reality was a low room facing the street. Went down, put me in another room in a similar predicament. the third room was a handicapped room on a higher floor where someone had been smoking so it was horrible. I gave up and stayed there but asked to move the next day. The 4th room was barely OK. Beds in both rooms were soft and uncomfortable. I can't remember complaining about a bed. Usually don't have a problem sleeping as I travel a tonne, but didn't have a good nights rest there. The rooms are outdated. There's no turn down service. The safe broke down one day and the door keys stopped working periodically. The elevators are extremely slow and you can wait forever to get something delivered to your room or to go down. When you walk in and out of the hotel, noone looks up and greats you. In fact, the front desk staff just seem so busy and annoyed when you ask for assistance. The shining light in the hotel is the bar area. Great staff. Helpful and inviting. Nice to sit in in the evening and relax or in the morning to read the paper.

I stayed at the W Union Square twice in the past 3 weeks (took a break to Boston in between). First stay was on the 3rd floor and second on the 7th. I didn't get a bathrobe, ipod dock or extra pillow during the first stay but they appeared on the second stay, which I thought was weird, because the price categories for both rooms (Spectacular King) were the same. The bathroom of the second room was significantly larger as well (granted there was no tub this time) and although there was a bathrobe in there, high time to replace that grey frayed robe with a new one! Not something one would expect of the W.I agree with other reviews that it is somewhat dated but the concierge was helpful and the checkout efficient. I liked that they offered options on extending the checkout to 4pm because I had a late flight.Location is very convenient, with dining options around the area, the subway a stone's throw from the hotel and the green market is always fun to walk through. The Underbar was closed for renovations which was a disappointment but I'll live.Overall it was fine, but not sure if I would stay again or check out other hotels in New York.

I love the W Hotels, very expensive, never less than $500 a night but really wonderful. I went to the location on Union Square in New York City and at first i was not too happy that i had a room on a low floor. I know New York City very well, when you go there you want a room on the highest floor possible otherwise you cant sleep. But this location has a small balcony facing Union Square on the fifth floor, i opened the huge window and had a great party with my friends. Sometime lower is better.

Really amazing team of people, it put my honeymoon to shame, we went to a Sandals in the Bahamas (note, don't go to the Nassau Sandals). W's beds were so comfortable, the second you picked up the phone for anything they were there, on the first ring often, calling you by name. Door man great, fresh coffee in the lobby, quick elevators. Very impressive! Little details added to the experience, Bliss products in the bathroom and fluffed up pillows.

Here's the breakdown:Pros:- Location (easy access to the East Village, Union Square and the 4,5,6)- Toiletries (like every W) are wonderful- Room service is deliciousCons:- Attitude and steadily declining service levels (especially when compared to the Le Meridien, Library and now defunct W Tuscany and W Court)- Rooms desperately need a refresh (very late capitalism)- Price high compared to other hotels in similar price tiersI used to really love this hotel - it was the first W I've stayed at and five years ago was really top of the line. But my past few visits have been less than satisfactory and this one, in particular, took the cake for abysmal service. First, the staff was consistently rude and surprisingly unresponsive. Things were consistently late - for example, requesting a robe at 11:30 and getting it an hour later, or having to call twice for basics like toothpaste. On Saturday night, the front desk was unstaffed and the woman at the concierge casually informed me that I would have to wait for them to come back up. When I asked if she would call because we had been waiting for ten minutes, she told me "they saw it on the security cameras and would come up when they could." Also, despite being in the hotel for five days, the hotel couldn't figure out a way to make my keys work every single time...I ended up just getting a new key every time I finished to avoid the hassle. Last night, I asked to place an order for room service and Whatever Whenever told me that they couldn't take my order because room service was "out." I called back and India said she couldn't help me and that they would call me when they were ready. Finally, I called the Platinum Concierge to REROUTE me to room service, which is absolutely ridiculous. The food was great but aggravation a good condiment does not make.Terrible service plus the outdated furnishings, awful elevator traffic, unresponsive staff and dated gym have pushed me over the edge. I'm never coming back. If you have to stay in a Starwood hotel, go to the Library, Le Meridien or St. Regis. If you have the flexibility, go check out the Ace or the Setai. Just stay away from this disaster.

I love this hotel and have stayed several times over the past 8 years. The location is perfect and the service top notch.The rooms are large by NYC standards. My only complaint - the furnishings are showing their age. This hotel is due for a remodel. Would give 5 stars otherwise.

I stayed here with my husband and daughter for a week. The lobby is nice and the restaurant Olives looks very nice. We didn't have dinner there but did have drinks a couple of times and was nice. The rooms are a little on the small side, specially for a family of three with a stroller and a portable crib, but we managed. The rooms were very clean and stocked with healthy snacks, drinks and even an umbrella which was great since it rained almost everyday we were there. The location is great, and having a babies r us a block away comes very handy when traveling with kids. Definitely would recommend this hotel to everyone.

I stayed here on business and found it to be refreshing and extremely relaxing. Not being in the theatre district, it provided a great option near my business location on Park Ave.The staff was welcoming and courteous. The room was spotless, and the restaurant was a nice dining experience. I would like to suggest that the restaurant expand it's menu options, but the food was still prepared very well.I would definitely return if I need to be in this section of Manhattana again.

In this hotel’s defense, I am probably not its target guest. I am not young or hip; I favor khakis and button down shirts, subways over stretch limos and a tuna fish sandwich over tuna tartar. No one put a gun to my head and made me stay at The W on Union Square, but for the price paid, $429 a night, it came up short.Negatives, and some are nitpicky, but I think when you shell out a grand for two nights in a 221 square foot room you have the right to be nitpicky: no upholstered side chair in Room 616, as pictured on the hotel’s website for their entry level class of room, the “Wonderful Room.” There was a suitable desk chair, but that was it. … the desk clerk struggled with English and had a dickens of a time communicating with me in order to locate my reservation even though I handed her a piece of paper with my confirmation number and name. … my first two keycards did not work in the elevator. … there is no ramp from the street entrance to the front desk, just stairs, which means rolling luggage is of little benefit. … the really neat looking radio in my room did not work and when I called for assistance no one could explain to me how it worked. … the water control in the shower would not permit a strong flow of moderately hot water: the choice was excellent pressure of scalding hot water, or a trickle of enjoyably hot water. … the mattress pad was a couple of inches too short, head and foot, for the bed, which was not conducive for a good night’s sleep. … plenty of lamps, but lighting was too dim at night for work. … view from my window was into a generally grim back interior of the hotel.Positives: housekeeping was polite, accommodating and worked around my schedule. … I felt safe on the property. … room service breakfast was delivered on time. … well renovated, repurposed 100-year old building, with significant architectural integrity preserved.Would I have voiced these complaints had I paid $275-to-$325 a night, which is pretty standard in Manhattan for a comfortable, well-located room? Probably not, but I do think I paid too much in relation to what I received, and value is important to me. In fact, it is the single most important factor in selecting a place to spend my money, or when recommending to others where they spend theirs.

My wife and I really enjoyed our stay here. It was far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Times Sq and Central Park, but also just a short cab ride away. We spent our 5 yr anniversary there and couldn't have been happier. Free room upgrade, champagne, and fantastic service from the hotel staff. It is definitely on the high price range for NY, but worth it for special occasions. We were able to make reservations at Gramercy Tavern, which was a short walk from the hotel.
user_name:
Sean D
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The W Union Square is the best of the W hotel selections in NYC. The rooms are a little more spacious with high ceilings creating a more open environment. The room decor is a little dated but contemporary and comfortable. Ask for a mega room upgrade as the regular rooms can be small. Their signature heavenly beds are just that's, heavenly. The lobby is small but contemporary in design. The bar right off the lobby is a great place for cocktails after a long day and Olives restaurant is worth a try for dinner. The hotel is centrally located and an easy cab or subway ride uptown or downtown. Front desk manager Mike Dunbar is a pro and Jose curb side will put a smile on your face. The W Union Square is worth a visit.

Hotel was somehow below expectation; given that it was a W. Perhaps after coming from W@TImes Square where there are lights, sights & hype everywhere, we were expecitng an even better stay at W@Union Square but alas! It was not so. The 1st impression at the check-in was not great! Staff was not very friendly, aloof is a better description. Then our room was not ready even after 4pm! When we finally got into our room, it was not fantastic either. Room was dark and gloomy and furniture looks dated. Traffic noise was constant. Location-wise only so-so. Not as convenient as TImes Square and not much to do around the surroundings. We actually regretted moving hotel from W@ TImes Square to W@ Union Square and the rate at Union Square was more expensive!

Hello Thomas,I don’t have the Words to express my delight with my recent W experience. I’ve never been disappointed With W in any Way, and this trip was no exception. I am a die-hard W Woman and Whether you Want me or not, you’ve got me for life. Keep up the good Work and thanks for making me (a recent Widow on a mission to sprinkle ashes at Macy’s fireWorks) and my bffitWWW Women feel so Wonderfully Welcome. We had a Wickedly Wild time While there, splendidly relishing the W experience in every Way.I’m looking forward to our next visit to the Wonderful World of W.Many, many Thanks!Toni VanZant

Good friend and I stayed at the W-Hotel Union Square while attending the US Open. Was a good trip "back home" for us and the location in Union Square is great for quick strolls to restaurants (Gramercy Tavern or Gothan Grill) as well as quick walk to subway stops. The rooms are clean and surprising large for a older NYC hotel. We had a corner room, so that may have explained the extra room. Design and decor is standard W hotel fare, which is pleasant, albeit a little "tired" from use in this location. That didn't deter from the enjoyment of the heavenly bed, though. Carpet in the hallway could use some refreshing. Staff was friendly and effective. Concierge arranged for car service for us from the airport upon our arrival and the service was spot on time even with our 45 early arrival and whisked us off in a new Mercedes S-class. Nice way to start the trip. I've stayed in all of the W-hotels in NYC at this point, and I think this was the best one, so far. Got a half-off rate as a Starwoods Member, but was still a bit pricey at 300/night.

Just finished a two night stay at this hotel. Pluses: - fantastic location, especially if you do not want or need to be close to the most touristy areas (Time Square and around) in Manhattan.- comfy rooms.- great follow up from managment after providing some feedback from the stay. Minuses: - the office buidling next door har direct view into our bathroom, so the curtains had to be closed all the time - sloppy service: No turn down service on day two, same goes for newspaper. Found some garbage under the sink at the bathroom floor. - only the window in the bedroom area seemed to soundproof (we had a suite). - air con pretty noisey (looked old) - some attitude from staff (the W syndrome), e.g.: at check in, we asked if the room was in a quiet location. Answer: "Its New York, nothing is quiet here." Had to clearify that we of course knew that and that the question was if there was anything available on a higher floor (we got 11 out of 22) or if any of the sides were more quiet than the others. - errors in the bill, but those were correct upon check out. Neutral: - bar/restaurant is very popular and lively. Great choice for a pre- or post-dinner drink. However, the sound level does probably mean that the lower hotel floors should be avoided.All in all, pretty expensive for what you get. But would probably return due to the unbeatable location if I could snag a good rate.

Upon arrival they were so nice to keep our luggage while we went to sightsee a bit before checking in. Although the room was small it offered all that was needed. Very clean and had Bliss amenities and a Bliss store in the hotel! Free apples, a great lounge and the best location within walking to anywhere in Manhattan! Would love to go back soon.

Spent a week at the W Hotel Union Square in New York City, for our son's wedding, although we were delayed by 2 days due to Hurricane Irene. The staff at the W are exceptional, nothing is too much trouble and the hotel itself is lovely. The beds are the best, so comfy. The only negative thing I will say is that we thought the rooms were a little dark due to the fact that we had trouble opening the curtains, which were huge. Other than that everything else is terrific, nice bar area, great breakfast in the restaurant (no dodgy buffets here) and the door ambassadors were fabulous. The gents on shift while we were there were Jose and David and did they make our stay memorable. Having such great guys on the front line really gets your vacation off to a terrific start. The location is perfect, with the subway right there in Union Square and plenty of restaurants to choose from.

This W hotel was so impressive and we will most definitely return next time we want to be downtown. First off, the architecture. It's a former life insurance building, built in 1911, which has retained not only its exterior glory but also touches of its grand past inside. The accent work at the elevators on guest room floors is beautiful and the vintage hall telephones add to the atmosphere. The room was much larger than I would ever expect with a brand new bathroom, comfy bed and great windows that blocked out most of the Union Square area noise. We could actually sleep in this Manhattan hotel. We had a nightcap at the bar, which was gorgeous and stylish and had quite a 'view'. (Seems like there was a professional or two in the room but it was subtle and didn't bother us) The only unfortunate thing: we were only in town for one night. Next time, we'll stay longer.

We live in the area but stayed here during a week we were unable to be in our apartment. It's a great property. It is very, very busy: it's a city hotel after all and like every W pulsing music in the elevators, lobby, etc. We stayed on SPG points and got a great deal...otherwise I do think it's pricy for the quality and size of the room - but not for the location, which, in my opinion, is a GREAT location for tourists/visitors to the city. Proximity to Union Square subway station allows you to travel quickly all over the city. MUCH more fun, more "authentic" and less overwhelming than midtown and certainly better than Times Square. Rooms aren't huge and bathrooms could stand an update - but when you are visiting New York I imagine you are rarely in your room! Try to get a room with a view of Union Square. Thought the service was terrific. It's located in a really great neighborhood. Don't miss checking out Gramercy Park, the Union Square farmers' market, Irving Place (try Friend of a Farmer for brunch or Casa Mono for dinner), ABC Home (and the restaurants in it!). I am not crazy about Todd English's Olives in the hotel but others love it. Great place to stay - especially if you can swing it on SPG points! As a tourist I think this would be a much better option than the W in Times Square or the several Ws in midtown.
user_name:
ParkAve10065
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a fantastic week at this hotel. Even though we experienced a earthquake and a hurricane during our week we still had a great stay. The communication during these times was excellent keeping us up to date with Irene's movements!Christopher, CIci, our housekeeper Maria to name a few all gave us very good service.As far as location goes you couldnt get better as you have a variety of shops and restaurants walkable and the subway was 100 metres away so you had the best of both worlds.We look forward to returning.

This was a pleasant stay. We were not able to have a room with two beds but the rollpout bed was comfortable. The staff was helpful and pleasant. While the lobby was busy and the lounge had a nice crowd and energy every night, the floors were quiet and the housekeeping staff was very nice.As usual, I am tired of the constant hand out of tips. The staff has as one guy that carries your bag 10 feet to give it to another guy who carries it 5 feet and puts his hand out too. Maybe that is just me. ( I hope it is not just me)I guess this is just how it is in the service industry. They were always professional.The dining area had good but not amazing food. The bartenders were quick and very friendly. The lounge was very nice and felt a little like a Las Vegas Ultra Lounge. Good drinks.The W is located in an exciting part of the city and central to a lot of activities. The Hurricane came through during our time and we always felt safe at the hotel. I would recommend this hotel and will use it again.

I generally go to New York city twice a year for some leisure time and when I do I always choose to stay with the W chain. I have stayed at several of the W properties, however Union Square tends to be my preference. Every time I stay, it's always a pleasure. My most recent visit was in August 2011. I always find the staff extremely helpful & very attentive. They really are the reason my stay is always so enjoyable. They care enough to address you by name (on sight, not because they've looked it up on a computer). Also, to call your room throughout your stay to ensure everything is to your satisfaction. For me, they really have set the bar for the standard in EXCELLENT client service.

We decided for the neighbourhood but finally booked on W Union Square after searching for an option in front of the park. Yes it has a view which is difficult to find in the city. But decor is somber, rooms are small and yes noisy even in the upper floors.Restaurant Olives is quite good but in the expensive side and the bar aside of it is very noisy and crowded at night.So we will not recommend it if you want tranquility even in one of the most peacefull areas in the city, the W does not keep a peaceful atmosphere.We wiil not come back to this hotel.

Rooms are nice, and location is great. They have this help desk called "Whatever," where they claim to solve all your problems and even answer the phone with, "What is your wish?" But they were unable to give us any help: They told us that they would only charge us one fee for using their internet, but charged us $28 for every device in the room that connected; they have a poor selection of TV stations, they refuse to recycle in the hotel.... In short, they were not accomodating in any way. For such an expensive hotel where they aren't embarrassed to charge $6 for a plastic bottle of water, it would be nice if they made good their pledge to do anything we ask at their Whatever desk.
Love this hotel. Great location, friendly staff. A special shoutout to David, a doorman, who particularly helped me out.

My Husband and I stay here for our Wedding anniversary (19-21). I was checked in by Natalie Scott, she was very professional and attentive; we even got an upgrade to our room and champagne!The bathtub kept flooding we had maintainence at our door with in minutes and he was very polite and professional (forgot his name :s )Hotel decor made u feel like u were out of state, lobby was clean and smelt really good!The location is perfect, u can practically walk anywhere, train station I minutes away, restaurants and park right in front of you!One thing I would say is the carpet in the room smelt like it needed cleaning and the bath tub could do with an upgrade, other than that, we enjoyed our stay!Thank You to the W for making our Anniversary staycation worth while!!Thanks to the W for making our anniversary staycation worthwhile!
user_name:
Selina W
Deer Park, New York

review_body: Reception staff were not friendly at all, very short and wanted you dealt with asap - it didn't seem that busy?Room was good, although a hot-shower was hit and miss (twice without). view was rubbish (i suppose a lot of NY hotels are though). Had a desk and wi-fi - perfect for work.Great location on Union Sq (not so touristy), also has a great Market on the Sunday.Hotel bar was good, very nice staff. Breakfast was okay, not amazing.Would definitely go back, but i can't help but think there is better out there for this kind of price.

This is by far my favorite hotel in NYC which is why I keep returning. The location at Union Square is excellent and it is close to all the things I want to do in the neighborhood.As a return guest and loyal SPG member, the folks at the hotel treat me great and make sure that I get the best room possible.Rooms are spacious including nice amenities and most with excellent park views!Going back in a couple of weeks...

From the decor of the lobby to the rooms, this hotel is your everyday hotel, not the trendy type that the W is known for. The room that I was assigned to was horrible! The curtains are hard to shut, the shower stall was small. The bathroom door is so big that if you leave the door open, you take half of the space in the bathroom. But the most disconcerting part of my stay was that around 8:00PM a weird LOUD humming noise started! I thought it was a fire alarm or something. I called concierge and sent security to check the upper floor. In the end, the security guy stopped outside of my room and even he heard the loud noise. Until this day I still don't know what it was. The next day I checked out, the manager didn't seem apologetic about the disturbance and didn't seem to care at all. Just said that there was a problem along the '12 line'. I'm assuming all rooms in the same area must hear that noise too. To recap: this hotel was not worth my money and time. Huge disappointed.

I haven't had the best of luck with NYC hotels in the past but this one was pretty good.The location really helps as you're never too far away from a good (and reasonably priced) eatery and it's not a long walk to the attractions of Times Sq and 5th Avenue.The room was a decent size, especially for NYC, (Starwood call it a "spectacular" room). The bathroom was simple but adequate with a good sized shower but no tub.What contact I had with staff was friendly and helpful although service at the the bar got slow late in the evenings as the place packed out (not a place to relax with a drink...more a place to be seen apparently).Overall a pretty good experience and I'd definitely recommend the hotel to anyone looking in this area.

I've stayed in many a New York hotel and this is my new favorite. For a W, it's quieter and not so hip that I feel like I'm sleeping at a club. The door men are great and friendly and the rooms themselves are large. Biggest room I've had in NY yet. The Union Square area is a great centralized area and has great shopping and food just steps away. The only reason I can't give 5 stars is that the internet is horrible. If you are planning on working from your room all day sadly I have to say, don't stay here. The internet cuts me off every other minute and I ended up having to just "Hotspot" my phone and work off that.

We stayed at the W Hotel this weekend and had a fabulous time in NYC. The hotel staff is very professional and Joseph the Consierge was really helpful with restaurant suggestions. Breakfast at the Olives Restaurant in the hotel was delicious, especially the lemon crepes. This location is great. Out of the maddening crowd and yet close enough to the Theater District and sights. Highlly recommend staying there.

This hotel feels a bit like any Western airline. A solid pedigree and a polished facade, but that illusion of luxury quickly fades as you realize they'll charge you $9 for a bottle of water, and $15 for 24h of Internet access - PER device. That's beyond cheap. If you pay a premium to stay at a place like this you expect such things to be included. Sadly, this tarnishes an otherwise excellent experience so far. I would easily recommend the hotel if not for this. As it stands, I don't know.

We hosted a block of guests in the hotel for our wedding weekend -- 22 rooms in all. We had a beautiful corner suite. The service was outstanding, the rooms we visited were a very large size for a NY hotel and were extremely well appointed. Most importantly, Charmaine, Christophe and the rest of the team did their best to make us extra special on our wedding weekend. We, along with our family and friends, had a fantastic experience. Thanks W!
user_name:
yossarian03
New York City, New York

review_body: I love Westin's and W's so I was excited to stay at the Union Square location. First they do not have a lobby to sit in. There is a little bar area right there next to the check in desk but if you sit there, even just on the window sill they seemed annoyed if you don't buy a drink. I was staying in a MEGA king room.....really? We had a rollaway in the room which we had to pay extra for, its was so bad that you would feel the springs digging into your skin. When I went to the front desk about it they said they would send up a few extra blankets (thin, very thin). Didn't help at all. The staff seems to have an attitude like you are bothering them instead of the normal welcoming one you would expect. I did email the manager after our stay and they did reimburse us for the rollaway. Won't stay there again.

In early July 2011, we stayed one night at the W at Union Square in lower Manhattan. The front desk clerk, Nelson, was fun and friendly and very efficient. He upgraded us without us asking, giving us a spacious and very quiet room at the end of a hallway with a great view. Everything about the room and spa-like bathroom was top notch. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Love this hotel, right in the heart of Union Square, close enough to LGA. A great bar on the first level, along with a club in the basement. The rooms are nice and the employees are very helpful and nice. The hotel offers a free car that will take you around, within limits and when available.

Our first room's a/c did not work, TV did not work, wi-fi did not work, and my husband had to fix the plumbing in the shower. 2nd room - telephone did not work and 1/2 drank beverage in the fridge. The meeting facility was also lacking... Later I was charged for items from the honor bar that we did not use. The "Whatever" line was rude. The bright spot of the stay were the doormen and the bar staff from our conference happy hour.

Ended up getting a huge room on this stay, which was a great start to the trip. Not that there's really a bad place for good restaurants in New York City, but the W is a short walk to some amazing meals. The staff is friendly and on this particular trip were overtly helpful in managing bags, restaurant reservations- just a great stay.

Arrived at the W New York - Union Square around 2:00 pm July 14. The lobby area is beautiful with fresh flowers in large standing vases. The sweeping stair case was gorgeous as well. Was greeted promptly and was checked in quickly. This hotel is in a terrific location, close to the Yellow N Q R trains and the Green 4 5 6 trains. The hotel is across from Union Square Park which always has something going on. I was in room 1407 which was right outside of the elevator (they had 4 elevators that I remember). This concerned me at first, however, I never heard the elevator all night. The room was spacious, elegant and clean and overlooked the park and 14th Street and on down. The bathroom was roomy as well with a sliding door. The beds were so comfortable with wonderful pillows. I did hear street noise, even from 14 floors up, but it is something you come to expect in New York City. Overall, this was a wonderful hotel and I would recommend to friends and family visiting New York City.
user_name:
klocco1
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Having read the reviews and stayed in many other NY hotels, I was expecting more of the W. Firstly I’ll point out i did use (many many) AA miles to book the room which might explain why ours was more like a dark cave than a 5* hotel room - 2 tall windows looking out at a brick wall with another building next door - i had to stand by the window and look directly up to even see a tiny patch of sky. The room was certainly large for NY, but would have preferred less space and a teeny tiny view/daylight. There was only one of the doormen who ever held the door open and no-one offered to help us with our bags to our room when we arrived. Additionally, I thought that the communal areas lacked space and wow factor. There were no seats in the lobby and never any free seats in the small bar and the lobby bathrooms were dated and utilitarian. We have stayed in the Crosby St & Soho Grand and much preferred both for ambiance.To be fair, if you had a room with daylight and used the hotel staff a lot (who, it is said, are very helpful), perhaps you would have a very different view. But I am a low maintenance guest who likes lobby space & design in a hotel, so I guess Union Sq W just isn’t for me.

Keep coming back here 100% of the time because this place is so special. It really is a home away from home. You know from the time you walk in that people are communicating with each other to make your stay the best possible, from the valet to the front desk to the "Whenever, Whatever" room service. Rooms are very comfortable. The hotel is just starting to rejuvenate the décor and furniture, not that they desperately need to because the rooms are still really nice. My fussy girlfriend always mentions how comfortable the beds are. The management and staff are expert at taking away all the stress that travel and being away from home can cause. When you're happy, they're happy. Great alternative to midtown.

This was the fifth time I stayed here.  Overall a solid hotel. Location is not the best for tourism but for business can be OK depending on your meetings.High quality, new (or renovated) room with all amenities. nice to stay in these rooms. Room service can be a bit expensive. Eg 1L bottle for $9 a bit expensive but if you like there are 3 grocery/sandwich/liqueur stores 30 seconds away. Cool lobby bar with chess board. Lobby restaurant can be a bit busy. Waitresses of different quality - some can be really rude during lunch. Quality of food good but not great. Reception fast and easy. Bellboys helpful. There is always a green apple on the reception desk.

Everything about this trip was the way I planned it. Arrival was efficient and fast. We didn't get an upgrade but we did want a room with a tub. I went back to the desk and asked the hotel manager, Gerald, for help. He sensed that I was not satisfied with the room and did everything in his power to make sure that our stay was enjoyable. As we were preparing to check out he called from home to make follow up see that we had a fabulous time. I will definitely be back. I only wish all hotels had staff as attentive and courteous as Gerald and the rest of the staff at the W. Cheers!

We booked a wonderful room on a lower floor but got upgraded to a spectacular room on a higher floor upon check-in. They also let us check in at 11am. I assumed we would have to wait while they got our room ready.I had been to Manhattan several times on the past but this was my first time staying in the city. Usually my visits had been composed of some combination of times square, central park, and a museum. That gets old very quickly. This time we wanted to get a different feel and see more of the city and the union square location definitely delivered. We walked everywhere- little Italy, across the Brooklyn bridge, Greenwich village, south street seaport, Madison square park, and others. When we got tired of walking, which we did, the subway stop fit the bill. We felt safe everywhere including walking from people's improv theatre at midnight.

We spent 4 nights @ W Union Square. Positive: ideally located - very close to Soho and Meatpacking. Negatives: The Hotel is rather old and needs a renovation to catch up with the other W Hotels arround the globe. Rooms are small and prices are rather topish. I do miss complimentary water and free internet. Service could be a touch more benign...

I usually don't stay in this part of the city, for business or pleasure, but I would come back here again. The room I had was spacious, clean, quiet and comfortable. Service was great. A little out of the way from the usual tourist spots, but on the plus side it was less crowded and hectic in the area. Convenient parking right around the corner. Good restaurants nearby.

I'm a business traveller that stays over 200 nights a year in hotels.THE GOODGreat location and nice rooms. W Hotels have a standard that you expect. Certainly the property itself here meets those. Close to Union Sq and easy to get around the city from there. Great food options nearby. The room was nicely decorated, not ultra modern and very comfortable. Much bigger rooms than other W properties in New York so you get better value. Surprisingly very quiet for a hotel in New York City. THE BADI think service could be better at the front desk and the valet. Not quiet friendly, but not totally rude. More indifferent than anything. Maybe it's a New York thing. I left my wallet and camera in the safe here by accident once. Security was professional and very good at handling the situation. However, trying to get my stuff back when I came back for it took forever.
user_name:
Anthony L
New York City, New York

review_body: We have stayed at many top rated hotels in NYC during numerous visits over the years, but we have settled on The W Hotel at Union Square as our all-time favorite. The location is perfect, the rooms are well appointed, the housekeeping is impeccable, but the best part of the hotel experience is the entire staff. The doormen, front desk people, housekeepers, and management all go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Every special request is tended to promptly and with courtesy and there is never the feeling of staying at a large, metropolitan hotel . . . the atmosphere is intimate and inviting. A gem in the middle of Manhattan!

I love W Union Square. I had wonderful service . In fact the young woman who checked me in remembered my name during my whole stay, and greeted me by name whenever I got to the main lobby. The area is great, right near NYU and in Union Square. It is a great area. Soho. The Village. All nearby. Close to subway. I didn't notice the darkness of the rooms, but then I didn't stay in the hotel very long during the day anyway. The hotel can be pricey, but certainly not bad for the area in which it is located. Thanks W Union Square. Couldn't have asked for more . I will be back.

if you want a dark outdated unfriendly hotel in not so nice of a area stay here. the room was no better than the marriott, no turndown service. no hello or goodbye at the hotel. not even a hello at ck in only photo id and triple a card. the bed was so bad i need to see the chiropractor today. the bathroom had the same piece of hair for 2 days not ours gross. stay somewhere else.

Great location for shopping and restaurants (pretty close to meatpacking district).Rooms: comfortable bed, view consisted of a piece of wall, products from Bliss in bathroom, bad lighting and a noisy not very efficient aircondtioning. Everything extra from umbrellas to water and WIFI were available for very high prices (as in all expensive hotels..). The room felt fresh and modern in style.Bathroom: In our room no bathtub only shower. Pressure in shower below average.Service: The hotel's guest service helped us to book restaurants and clubs during the entire length of our stay. Very convenient for international travellers who have no clue about what is in or out in NYC!!

I will never stay in another hotel in NYC. This hotel is fantastic. We loved the location, so easy to get around everywhere. The hotel itself is gorgeous, the room good size, clean and well appointed. Nice and quiet at night, which is not easy in NYC. The doormen and concierge are the best in the city. Friendly, with a yes attitude and never act like they don't see you. I wrote a letter to the management regarding our excellent stay , which I rarely do anymore b/c service isn't the same as it used to be.

I have called beforehand informing Guest relation staff to arrange a welcome letter for my husband who visited NYC the first time. Upon arrival we were greeted and told we were upgraded. That was nice. But being in the industry it also meant the message will not in the room :( It was not and it turned out the room was not what the Manager had in mind for us the first place. The bed was old and slept in plenty times. Our preference is the firm mattress. As we have not really enjoyed the room upon arrival we did not even know until we returned after a long day in the city. We alerted the staff who tried their best to accommodate our request. But Unions and late hour prevented it. The note by the way was now in the room. The next day I approached the Manager on duty and long behold he called me while we were out and about that he found another room with a firmer / newer bed. When we returned we were in heaven. The follow up was great, the service phenomenal and the bed fantastic. We were also given a high floor room.We did not like the loud elevator music. Even though W stands for the hipper younger bar crowd the music does not need to be that loud.Look out for the door man Jose. A unique experience.Great - the free of charge drop off in Hyundai car from 10 to 6 daily.

This was the first time I visited New York and wanted to stay in a central location close to the tourist attractions and I was not disappointed. First the location is superb--the subway station is a quick walk, the union square area is clean (well as clean as New York can get) and close to many restaurants (fast food and more unique like Max Brenner). If you get a room facing the Metronome (the clock) you'll get the bonus of the skyline as well. The Green market also is across the street but due to it being Winter i was not able to visit.Going inside the hotel lobby its small but cozy but also with a modern charm. The front desk was very pleasant. When we got into our room I was pleasantly surprised, while the room was dark (due to the dark drapes and interior) it continued with the modern motive. The room was a bit small but I think the higher ceilings leveled it out. The bed was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a bit narrow but since it was clean i again overlooked the size, the only complaint i had about the bathroom is the dial on the shower was broken and the hotel's idea of a quick fix was using a bandage like tape that no longer served its purpose...with that said i found myself turning the dial all through out my shower. Considering we were in a pretty busy area the hotel room was quiet; from the outside we couldn't hear noise and we heard no sound from our neighboring rooms.
Uncaring Staff and a HUGH RAT outside front door, a terrible experience
user_name:
TerriGirl79
New York City, New York

review_body: There's nothing special about this hotel besides the location. No perks. The amenities are bare-boned. You call for room service and you need to specify that you want water with your meal, and that it should come on a cart. The room service takes FOREVER, the food is terrible, and it comes with a mandatory twenty percent gratuity. No wonder why the staff doesn't care about making guests happy. The elevator blasts techno music at all hours, the staff is not overly accommodating. This place is lame. I can't believe how much they are charging for the room $600/night?? Rather stay somewhere truly luxurious. Don't waste your time or money

Hello Mr. Christophe, I just spent 4 days at the W Hotel in Union Square and had a wonderful time. My two daughters and I were celebrating a graduation and my birthday. Thank you for the room upgrade and birthday cupcakes and strawberry sweets that were left in our room. The service was great and attention to our comfort was very much appreciated. Since my older daughter lives in NYC and I do come for visits, I will certainly book with you again. Thanks to you and your staff for making our stay special.Germaine Parra

If you want to feel like someone special, stay at the W Union Square. The staff there makes you feel right at home from the front door, to the front desk, to the bar and most impressive, the concierge. It truly is Whatever, Whenever.

Checked into the W Union Square after a couple of nights in the W Midtown. Both properties couldn’t be more different in terms of style and setup, and both have their pros and cons, but I found this to be the better one. The location, on the edge of SoHo makes for a much more interesting holiday location than midtown. Subway station just outside the hotel, and many great restaurants within easy walking distance.First impressions were slightly poor – no one at the door to help with our bags/open the heavy doors. This was a recurring theme of our stay (more on this later). Reception staff however were very ncie and although an early check-in was not possible, we were given a great upgrade thanks to SPG Platinum status. The corner room was really spacious and at least twice as big as the one we had in the W Midtown. Noise from outside wasn't an issue at all. The furnishings were also much classier and made for an altogether more relaxing experience. Bed was very comfy and the bathroom was enormous andhad a classy-classic décor to it.Concierge had very good tips for restaurants, much appreciated. Breakfast at the restaurant was a bit unremarkable so we weren’t enticed to try other meals.Main complaint with this place involved door staff and Acura service. Contrary to most other W hotels, there isn’t a dedicated Acura desk to book the rides, it needs to be arranged directly with the driver and there are no pre-bookings. This led to a funny situation, where we were haggling with the doormen, who seemed to act like “agents” of the driver. A request for a 10-block ride to Soho at 2:00PM was met with loads of excuses about traffic, and a none too subtle reminder that although the ride was free, we needed to tip the driver generously! Other cases of less than optimal behaviour by door staff involved them watching us struggling to open the doors with bags of shopping and simply staring, or simply not being anywhere near the door most of the time. Management, please give these people correct training, and include a dedicated person to pre-book the Acura rides.

Overall the stay was fine, but I wanted to let people know that for the price of the room it's pretty standard and there are much better options out there. Olives restaurant where you go for breakfast has the worst, slowest service ever and some of the staff couldn't crack a smile even if they tried. Miserable. Cups & glasses were dirty (I never normally complain about this sort of thing) but this was like they'd JUST been used and then reused. Food was OK. Overall I would say, really friendly front desk. Really nice door guys and room service cleaners were very nice but aside from that, nothing stuck out in my mind. Room was standard, more like a 3 star hotel and what griped me the most was the rate was 500+ a night and then internet / breakfast / water was all extra and at extortionate rates. The internet didn't work well on the 20th floor (I had 1 bar on wireless) and if you ahve multiple devices you had to pay 2 - 3 times for the internet. My room was right opposite the elevators so I had them going throughout the night. As I said, the hotel itself was OK, but much much better options out there for the rate they charge!

Gorgeous, well laid-out room. Very quiet inside rooms - you don't hear neighbors. Only 2 downsides: club music constantly plays in lobby & elevators; and bed, although beautiful, was way too soft. Would give 5 stars if the bed was as good as everything else.

I was unimpressed with a recent weekend stay here. We arrived super late night (think 1 a.m.) and there was no doorman nor anyone to help with our bags. We noticed over the course of our three-night stay that this was the norm. There was rarely a doorman, and when there was, he was usually too busy chatting with people on the street (girls) to actually do his job.There was a family of three checking in before us who took forever. Couldn’t seem to decide what room they wanted. So when it was finally our turn, we were told we had been upgraded. We got a room on the 21st floor but I’m still trying to figure out what the upgrade was. The room was very average and poorly laid out, but maybe just a bit more spacious than the typical NYC hotel room? Either way, it seemed pretty shabby for a W. The air conditioner made an annoying whirring sound, the lighting was bad (the desk lamp didn’t even work), the shower could’ve used a good thorough scrubbing (though the shower pressure itself was great), the closet door got stuck on the room door (hard to explain) and so on. Just a lot of little things that weren’t so obtrusive that we needed a new room, but things that you shouldn’t have to deal with when you’re spending this much $ on a room. The bed was the main saving grace—incredibly comfortable. Oh, and the Bliss products!My biggest peeve—the pesky wifi fee… Why some hotels charge for this still is beyond me. We thought since my husband is an SPG member, it was complimentary. Nope. That’s only for their top-tier members apparently. Ridiculous.The service was rather lackluster. Aside from the doorman issue, the people at the front desk weren’t the most helpful. Our first day there, my room key wouldn’t work in the elevator. The woman at the front desk checked it and told me it should be working, then agreed to give me a new key. The room was in my husband’s name so she couldn’t give me a new key without talking to him first—despite the fact that I already had a key to the room to begin with, and despite the fact that I showed her my ID which had the same last name as the one on the reservation.The location is great but unfortunately the hotel is not. It really doesn't live up to the standard one would expect from W Hotels.

Excellent service, great big room, love the bath products. The wherever/whenever operator was like out of a commercial for the W. I asked for the weather and she gave me the most helpful answer on the weather, the breeze, and what outerwear she would recommend. Beyond helpful! As a former resident of NYC this is the absolute best location you can stay in. Only silly thing is charging $15/day for wireless. Please make that silliness go away. On a positive note they had delish flavored water in the lobby and a nice free coffee bar set up in the morning. My trip was a mix of business and then family (2 small kids) and they lovely to all of us. I would absolutely stay here again!

We were advised by friends not to stay at Union Square but in a hotel in midtown. This is purely because of the location of the hotel. However, we have had a bad experience in a well-known hotel in NYC - where the room was old and the shower head fell off. We decided to go with the Union Square W Hotel after all because it was Newer than many NYC hotels in the Starwood chain. We were pleasantly surprised. Check in and Reception staff were very polite and helpful. The doormen were very helpful - they knew the area well. We had good recommendations on where to go for breakfast each morning. We particularly liked square across from the hotel - there are shops and cafes, and Wholefoods as well. Walk a couple of blocks up and you can see Barnes and Noble as well as H&M, as well as other well known brands. Soho is a short taxi ride away. We travelled to mid-town quite a lot (to get to Times Square and all the other sights) and spend an average of $12 on cab-fare per ride. The subway station is located in Union Square and this is a very convenient and inexpensive transportation alternative to taxis. We couldn't take the subway because of my elderly mum. As family travellers, we were pleasantly surprised that the hotel is located in such pleasant surroundings. It is quiet in the mornings (NYC standards), It does however, gets busy in the ground floor lounges in the evenings. This does not bother us as the rooms are well-insulated and we don't hear anything once we shut the room door. If you do plan to stay, ask for the larger rooms on the upper floors that face the Square. It's very roomy, has large windows that let in lots of light and you get to see the activity of Union Square below.

Having read so much about how wonderful this hotel was we thought it was possibly the ideal place to book....so from a location perspective it was ideal both to go way downtown or uptown and too be truthful the best location I,ve stayed in when visiting NYC. With respect to he hotel, our room wasn't, ready even thou we were checking in at 4.30pm..not ideal in light of the fact we had being travelling all day. After a bit of too'ing and fro'ing our room was ready (told it would be 45 mins, in the end 5 mins!), then....no briefing of the hotel facilities, no offer of assistance with our bags! We had booked a mega room which was mega in size (for NYC), however, the it's layout was poor in terms of furnishings, that said fantasically comfortable. Therefore on after we literally just used the hotel for somewhere to rest our heads, expensive head resting!!!Coffee shop across the square was excellent for breakfast and people watching....

The location is very handy to the subway and stores and restaurants. The staff at this hotel were fantastic and very helpful. The gym is the best I have ever seen. It was spotless, with modern treadmills, bikes and elipticals and also free weights, balls, and more. The room was beautiful and the beds were comfortable. Wireless internet cost $14.95/day.

I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff were almost great except for one staff that gave us wrong directions, otherwise, the service was great. The room is fairly spacious by NYC standards. We had dinner at Olives on the first evening and our meals and service was exceptional. The hotel is nearby the Metro, bus stop, open market, Whole Foods and some shopping. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

I stayed here for 6 nights in April. It rained most of the time but I still had an amazing time whenever in the confides of the W. Treated like royalty from all the staff, people that I hadn't even met somehow would know your name. They were always smiling and happy to have a chat. The bar staff, waiters were not only beautiful on the outside but on the inside too. The room and bed was great. Slept like a baby every night. Location, location. Right outside Union Square, you can't do any better. I can't wait stay their agan.

This was our first trip to NYC and the staff at the hotel made this a fantastic experience. The concierge was extremely helpful in suggesting restaurants/sights/locations and also in securing great reservations even at the last minute. The room we had was very clean and the doormen always had great advice for navigating the city. The location of this hotel is perfect for walking to almost all destinations. Next time we are in NYC we will stay at the W Union Square.

SPG Gold Status member. Booked a mega room via spg.com. Upon arrival was asked (by the most darling front desk attendant) if I could wait until 3 PM and that it would be worth it. I did, and what I was given was beyond my expections. An amazing high floor corner one bedroom suite. Room was spotless, as were the two bathrooms.Room service fantastic.Private entrance to Underbar.I have to say, I have stayed at many, many W's in my time, always happy with them, but this one is top notch.
user_name:
Mako32
New York City, New York

review_body: I would stay here again without hesitation. From check in to check out, the customer service was outstanding. The staff is friendly and helpful, even providing complimentary transportation to short distances in a chauffered Acura. We did not get to try the restaurant,as there are many sorrounding the hotel. (The location is unbeatable) But the bar off the lobby was very nice and lively. The hotel itself is very modern and clean. Accomodations were without fault. I cannot say enough about the W union square. I will definately be back.

First trip to New York and stayed a week on business with colleagues. Hotel just simply couldn't have been better - staff especially were excellent - so thank you! My personal favourite moment in the hotel was when I asked if the concierge might be able to find a digi cam to borrow as I had forgotten mine and she produced some complimentary black and white disposables for me - what a great touch.Rooms are big and the beds massive and comfy, showers always had perfect hot water and decent pressure.My ONLY complaint is the $15 a night WiFi charge - come on guys this is just silly in this day in age. WiFi is, however, free in the bar and restaurant area so I can't complain too much. Can't wait to retun in June

I purchased a room for my friends to stay during their anniversary weekend. I received a note a few days before the date from the “W Insider” team asking me if there was anything they can do to make my stay more enjoyable (dinner reservations, etc.). I mentioned that the room was for my friends and I thought they would enjoy the W service. The W Insider team (Christopher Thomas and Elizabeth Baker) took the initiative to add their names to the reservation, gave them a double upgrade to a mega room and provided a complimentary anniversary amenity (Champaign and chocolate covered strawberries). Now that’s a hotel that knows the meaning of service. I’ve always be happy at W Hotels put personal touches like this really widen the gap between good and great hotels. The W Hotel in Union Square is a great hotel.
user_name:
ChristopFer
New York City, New York

review_body: I stay often at this hotel and have reviewed it before, but just wanted tosubmit an update because they just keep amazing and delighting me. In many meaningful ways, the extraordinary management and staff anticipate and address every need. They make me feel like the W Union Square is my home away from home. Many thanks to Christophe and his entire magnificent team. Bravo!
user_name:
fordpat
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: W New York - Union Square was the first hotel I stayed in New, and I had in fact a very nice stay.Check in was quick and efficient, and I was quickly in the lift heading to a high floor room.The room was big (according to my standard which is mainly London, where they may classify as a suite something over 250sqf -or even less-).Then I waited for a colleague who arrived 2 days before, but was leaving the Hilton Millennium due to the noise associated to ground zero building site. (to be honest this Hilton is a better choice for us since our NYC offices are located in the World Financial Center Just across ground zero building site)As soon as he checked, direction Concierge to book a table at the strip house for 3, my boss had called to ask what were the plan for the night (very good steak and usual poor/amateurish service you can expect in NYC, strangely enough only in Restaurant).For me and my colleague as 2 French persons (our boss is English) the most important part of the day was done (securing food) we headed for the UNDERBAR, so we passed near the Fitness room (not very attractive, but I am not a sport person) which looks very attractive base on some reviews for our first G&T, this was a disappointment, dark and gloomy, mainly looked like the interior of a bunker (and we were nearly the only ones).No problem then up to the bar in the lobby, where we were supposed to meet our boss (and our 2nd G&T) the place is heaving looks so trendy, really a place to see (and be seen ?, will leave this one to NYC residents) after a third G&T... (no we stopped at 2, we were having dinner with our boss, you may have a look at Strip House New York for more info -but still not written-) we headed for dinner (we had the 3rd one back in the hotel).the location is great, Tube/Subway? is just round the corner and as soon as you understand how it works you can be anywhere in Manhattan within minutes. and if you want something special you can get have a look at the Union Square Farmer's Market (Mon,Wed,Fri,Sat looked at internet to give accurate information) the market is across the street and provide quite a choice of food from the New-England and Canada as well as American natives art)Very good as well for the one, who do not like restaurant on their own, there is a Whole Food across the square (for the non US reader, Whole Food is a grocery/supermarket providing normal vegetable, take away foods AND a dining area and microwave after the tills. My favourite choice on a city tour.Checkout was very efficient and it was time for fly back to Germany for a week before visiting the Waldorf Astoria. Final judgement:I will definitely recommend the place, (without GF, except if she looks like a top model, since a lot of girls in the lobby bar do look like it)localisation is perfect.only issue was the price, got a lot of more enjoyable stays at at other (Starwood) properties in NYC/NJ, However this place may be attractive for me but not other people (W Hoboken, stay tuned)

I can sum up my recent visit at the W Hotel in Union Square with one word – FABULOUS! I have stayed at many hotels in NYC, and I can say without hesitation that the W Union Square has been my best experience.
