Every single person on the hotel team was exceptional from the front desk staff to the bellmen to the housekeeping staff. This hotel knows how to provide exceptional customer service. And the room was spacious and very comfortable. I will never stay anywhere else in NYC!

Room was bedbug-free. Service was excellent. Concierge was helpful and friendly. Bartenders were hot and the hotel bar seemed to be popular with both guests and locals. I stayed there in August 2010 and had the same experience. There is a Dunkin Donuts about 50 yards away (I learned of the last morning of our stay), but great for on-the-go hangover breakfast.

I have stayed at this property multiple times on business. They are consistently the very best in NYC! They set the bar very high! Each time I have arrived they know me by name. Every person that works at the hotel greets me by my first name. I have stayed here numerous times during my birthday and each time they know it without any one letting them know. They surprised me on my latest stays with flowers, sparkling wine and cupcakes that were amazing! They service is incredible. The rooms are amazing and large by NYC standards. They have an amazing gym downstairs as well as business center, concierge who will make all of your wishes come to fruition, the restaurant is amazing, a hip bar that is great for meeting people, the views are amazing, it overlooks union square. You can go to the farmers market on the weekend. It is within walking distance to soho and centrally located within the city. They do have the acura driver who will take you anywhere you want to go. This would be a great place to go for that special event occasion. they are THE BEST!

The W is one of my favourite hotels in NYC. The staff is extremely professional and helpful. The rooms are clean and modern (and bigger than other W Hotel rooms in NYC). The amenities are fabulous too - Bliss bath products, comfy beds, and delicious room service (try the eggs benedict).Plus, the location of the W at Union Sq. is ideal. Only steps from all the major subway lines, its great for getting around the city. Plus, there are heaps of restaurants and shops right on your doorstep.
Stayed at the W hotel for one night on SPG points. Upgraded room was large, had nice amenities, and was well located. Although i only stayed for one night, I found the staff to be very accomodating.

Stayed for 1 night for my weekly trip to NYC. Hotel is in a great location for my office as well as for exploring. Check in was quick and friendly. Apparently got upgraded to a nicer view because of my SPG status. I was on a high floor in a king room overlooking Park Avenue. Room was large and clean. I really loved the bench in front of the bed - so convenient and means I didn't have to throw my bag and briefcase on the bed as I got settled. Clearly got someone else's room as there was a note from the manager along with a snack and some bottled water but that was ok with me. Bathroom had a large vanity and plenty of towels. Shower had great pressure and plenty of room to maneuver. Wasn't feeling well so was going to order room service however the prices were shockingly high even for an expense report meal so many convenient choices just steps away so I ventured out in the cold. Lobby was hopping with bar goers and dining patrons -- definitely would not have felt comfortable dining alone there.After dinner, returned to the room and discovered there was quite a draft coming from the window. Had trouble getting the room to the right temperature but once settled the comforts of the W bed helped me get a great night's sleep. Room was very quiet with no noise from hallway however street noise was another thing --- lots of sirens all night long.Because of the location will keep this on my list however very expensive for what I need -- would like to bring my wife here on a three day weekend in the city.

What's not to like?Great location. Great Service. Large, updated, clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Great linens and towels. Quiet, quiet, quiet.........no noise from other rooms whatsoever!!Staff is outstanding!We have stayed in many Starwood and other boutique hotels in NYC. I think this is our new favorite!

I've stayed at other NYC W hotels but this is first stay at Union Square and I think the best of the lot. At $300 p.n. (inc tax), I thought this was good value for NYC given location and that my room was spacious. Added plus is that there is a great restaurant, Olives (Todd English), on the ground floor. The gym is decent size.

My husband and I stayed at the W Union Square because of its proximity to NYU (where our son is a student). The location was perfect! Upon arrival, we were given a room upgrade for no particular reason; and our room was elegant and quite large by NYC standards. The bed was comfy, and the decor quite lovely. We were just a brief walk away from some of the city's best restaurants (quite the perk when you're in NYC in the dead of winter) and there is a bustling farmer's market right across the street. There's a youthful energy and vibe to the W...but don't let that stop you from staying here. Even us middle-aged folks were treated like VIPs by the staff. We will definitely be back.

I stayed in this hotel for one night with friends in a suite for a bachelorette party. It was perfect for a group! The suite was big and there were two bathrooms. The hotel is very trendy and modern in design and decoration. The rooms were clean, quiet, and location was great! There are many people walking and shopping nearby in Union Square. The hotel also has valet parking, which is rare in NYC (although it will cost you the same as paying in a garage). My only two complaints are that the hotel staff said they would send up an extra cot for one of us to sleep on, but they never did and one of us ended up sleeping on the couch. However, the couch was comfortable so we didn't mind too much. Our other complaint was that neither of the two TVs in the room worked, but we didn't bother calling down to the desk because we weren't in the room long enough to want to watch TV...we were out and about in the city! The price is not necessarily the best; it was fine to be spit between a group, but when we considered staying there in a regular room for each couple for the bride's wedding, the price was too high for any of us to consider as individual couples.

I stayed here 3 nights in early January and was not disappointed. Location on Union Square means that East/West Villages are a stone's throw from the hotel.. which means lots of great places for eating, drinking and shopping. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. The bar on the main floor, while I did not use, looked very trendy. My hotel room had a very comfortable bed, a nice big desk and tv and some very thoughtful amenities like a iPod speaker port.Room service, which I had for a dinner and two breakfasts, was very nice, albeit quite expensive for what it was (but that's room service in the heart of NY for you).All in all an excellent stay - I would happily choose the W at Union Square again.

WOW ! Simply WOW! My husband and I went to NYC for a romantic weekend getaway and we stayed at the W Union Square. The hotel was beautiful, well located, very close to the subway. The staff at the front desk were very friendly, courteous and efficient. We got an amazing spacious room on the 21st floor. The bed was so comfortable. Nova the concierge was the best! She helped us with our numerous requests and made awesome suggestions regarding restaurants and bars. I would highly recommend this hotel. We could have asked for a better New York experience.

I recently stayed here with some friends for a bachelorette party. The location is great; you can walk to many shops and restaurants in the area. The hotel is in a very hip part of NYC. We stayed in a “Mega” room and it was very large. The room had high ceilings and plenty of space for four girls and all of their stuff. The décor is trendy and simple. At night the Living Room bar was crowded with young people, just what we wanted! This hotel is great, I can’t wait to go back!

The W is a wonderful hotel, the staff was fantastic. The rooms are very comfortable. We ate at Olive's (just outside the lobby) twice the food and service was excellent. The bartender Albert was absolutly charming and gave us some great tips on things we must see while in New York City.

As I travel a lot, it is not my idea of reviewing every hotel I visit. Only the extremely good or bad gets one.I normally stay at another hotel in NY. They were full (except the last minute deal they offered: 14.000$ for 6 nights...). As a member of SPG and having stayed at another W (W Times Square) a while ago the choice was quickly made. First contact: SMILE! At reception: SMILES and an upgrade to a mega room! Friendly notes from the Stylist (housekeeping) in the room. Terrific toiletries. Plush towels. Great food. And more SMILES, SMILES, SMILES... Need I say more? My friends stayed at the Hudson and ran away to the W. The first thing they said when they were greeted at the door: oh, look at the friendly smiles... They also received an upgrade ànd an adjacent room for their daughter. That's called service and customer care. Thank you for the Wonderful stay.Just one "critic"... The gym has only cardio equipment. Of course, silly me, it's called Sweat...

I recently visited NYC which I do annually. I booked a reservation at the W New York on Lexington but they were not able to accomodate my needs and suggested I stay at the W Union Square. The location is great of the Union Square W it is in the middle of great shopping and very close to the Subway. That was my favorite part of this hotel. The rooms are larger than the W New York, but I found them to not be as well 'styled'. Also, the building is very old... and one big problem is you can hear a lot between the walls. The other issue I had with this W is that the service is not up to par with other W's I have stayed at. The front desk manager was excellent. Front desk and doormen/bell staff was just 'OK'. Upon check-in I requested a roll-a-way bed and never got it. I had to call again hours later to ask again. Also, the doormen/bell staff are not as friendly/eager to assist with getting you a taxi or taking your luggage. The yes I would recommend is a 'barely' recommend. Unless you need a large room and must have the Union Square location I would highly recommend you stay at the W New York on Lexington Ave. The rates are generally lower at the W New York, also.

My wife ran the New York Marathon this past November and we stayed at the W New York-Union Square. We really enjoyed our stay and thought that it was better to stay a bit of a distance away from the craziness that is Times Square. The staff even had a care package/gift bag for my wife when returned from the marathon. They even noted that she was a participant and had a copy of Monday's New York Times at our door the next day because the paper publishes the names of all the sub-5 hour finishers of the marathon. Very thoughtful. The rooms were a good size for Manhattan standards and offered every amenity. We didn't think that the Todd English restaurant in the lobby was all that special, but only went there for a quick lunch.

Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.Mr Tellez and his team go far beyond the call of duty to ensure your every wish is catered for.Will never stay elsewhere in NYC now.Well done and sincere thanks to all at the amazing "W"

I rarely go out of my way to write a review for a hotel, but the customer service at the W Union Square prompted me to devote a few minutes here. I am a very frequent traveler and a Starwood hotel lover with SPG elite status. Chris Thomas and Nelson at the front desk were outstanding in ensuring that I got the room I needed. The hotel was booked solid and the room I'd requested was not available at first. Chris went out of his way and more than made up for this issue. He really took care of us and proved that some hotels know how to value relationships over transactions. This was, bar none, the finest customer service I've seen at a Starwood hotel. They instantly turned a potentially negative experience into a uniquely positive one. (I also ended up in the room I'd requested!)Location: If you're a young solo traveler or a young couple, you'd do well to avoid Midtown. It's best to avoid the crush of tourists around Rockefeller Center and Times Square. This hotel is perfectly situated at the crossroads of Midtown and Downtown and a block away from a major subway hub. Unless you want a standard New York tourist experience, you'll probably find yourself going out to restaurants and bars in the Village/Soho/Lower East Side area. You could stay in those neighborhoods, but that puts you much farther from the daytime activities like the Met, Fifth Avenue shopping, and Central Park. Everything is within striking distance from this hotel.Rooms: When it comes to room quality, it's all relative in New York. You can't expect a Texas-sized room (or bathtub) just off Union Square. But W delivers with above-average rooms for this city. Bathrooms could benefit from a Westin-style upgrade. Amenities: For a Category 6 Starwood hotel, I'd expect to get more than a basement gym and a hip lobby scene. If there was an Aloft hotel next door, it would have the same amenities, and they'd probably rate it as Category 4. There is no spa, no pool (that I could find), and a gym with a little more equipment than your average Holiday Inn Express. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. You don't go to New York to hang out in a hotel room, after all, and the things that really matter in that city -- a comfortable bed, enough room to move around, and welcoming staff -- were there in spades.
user_name:
livetwice
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The W Union Square is a in a terrific location for tourists. Close to the subway and fun shops and restaurants it’s also away from the crazy overpopulation of Times Square. The hotel itself is very typical W which appeals to many, but not to all. There is a great energy and Vibe about the place without being too pretentious which some W properties fall prey to.The rooms are decent sizes by New York standards and some are quite large. Ask for corner rooms on upper floors. My one gripe - - the rooms are getting tired looking. I’ve been staying at this hotel for years and the décor and finishes were cool 10 years ago but are looking a bit dark and dreary now. The bed and bedding is great – a hallmark of W Hotels. The bathroom is cramped and dated and for some reason the water temperature was impossible to regulate on this past stay…either frigid or scalding.There are better boutique hotels if that’s what you are looking for. I stay here because I’m loyal to Starwood and like to earn the points. If you are traveling with people who prefer more traditional environs (i.e. no loud music in lobby, no busy bar scene) you might want to consider other options like the Le Meridien or the new Intercontinental. All that said - - I will be back as I really do like the hotel and the location…just hope a decorator stops by soon.

Front office desk staff were efficient but nothing special. Hotel is a narrow building, so the lobby is unimpressive, elevators tiny and dark. 'Living room' on the side is cold in the winter, but there is free wifi down there. Sometimes a door man, sometimes not, if there sometimes he'll open the door, sometimes not. What kind of four - five star hotel doesn't have a door man opening the door all the time during business hours??Had a room w 2DB, which was spacious I thought, esp for NY standards. But beds were a bit soft and could use new mattresses. Cleanliness/maintenance OK, but not spic and span. Soot by the windows and stains here and there, some rusting in the tub area. Can hear honking and cars go by also. Not the best to sleep through. Called 'whenever/whatever' for a toothbrush, had to call twice before it came after 20-30 mins. Again, not 4-5 star service. But did request 2pm checkout and got it, kudos for that. All starwoods i've stayed out have not had a problem with late checkout request.Overall very unimpressed with this property, and feel bad if you had to pay a lot of money for it since i know room rates can go up very high for this property. Plain regular W hotel, but location is ideal with shopping/subway/restaurants nearby. Just don't expect anything cool or hip with this place.
user_name:
hktravelblog
New York City, New York

review_body: Without going into specifics, I would honestly say that my family and I have had the most extraordinary travel experience ever. The staff at the W Union Square went so above and beyond to create a memorable experience for us that I am left speechless. I am a fairly seasoned traveler and have stayed at W Hotels before as well as other comparable properties. The property itself is splendid as is the location, but again it is the staff from top to bottom here that are really unique. These people work well together, appear to enjoy doing so and really want to make a guests' visit the most memorable possible. This is an extraordinary group of people in an extraordinary property who are working harder to create extraordinary memories.

We stayed at the W last November and it was noisy and not really clean, but the 2 days we spent there last weekend for the Marathon were great! Clean and pretty quiet, considering it's in a busy area, and so easy to get around the city from the hotel--not to mention everything that goes on in Union Square-Green Market, shops, etc. Brunch at Olives was delicious. Beds are sooo comfy!We'd stay here again!
We just got back from our stay at the W union square. Our fourth visit this year and it keeps getting better. Wonderful location and staff. Can not wait for our next visit
chic and sexyhuge, quite, plush roomsbest, best, best bathroom productsgreat serviceawesome bar

Stayed for a night in October with DH. You just can't beat the location for the restaurants and nightlife around Union Square. Light sleepers beware! The hotel is on a very busy intersection and we were bothered by the noise. But the room was enormous and the bed was so comfortable we didn't want to leave in the morning! The linens were so soft! Service was professional, but snooty.Enjoy New York!

I have stayed at this particular W a few times over the past several years and generally found it a comfortable experience. It occurred to me during my most recent (sept 2010) stay that not much has changed here in the past 7 years or so and that the property is starting to look a bit worn out and run down. Olives, the restaurant/bar is more or less the same and the rooms and decor are starting to have a tired and aging look. There are newer and more modern downtown Manhattan hotels for the same or less money, maybe these properties are passing the Starwood chain by.Anyway, Park ave location is great and can't be beat, Union square never fails to disappoint with lots of action day and night. Hotel services are generally pretty good.I probably will give this property a miss next time I'm in town and check out a newer venue.
user_name:
IslandHopper888
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location. The room was a decent size with nice, high ceilings. But the rooms are pretty tired. I remember staying here when it first opened years ago and thinking it was pretty nice. But it looks like they haven't done much to update it since. The furniture in my room showed a lot of wear and tear, as did the carpeting, the walls, and the fixtures, such as the lamps. The phone next to the bed did not work. The iPod docking station did not work.Nevertheless, the room was relatively clean and the bed was very comfortable.The location here is great. But for the price, I think you could do better.

I've stayed at the W Union Square Manhattan before and always been impressed, however there's always the opportunity to take it up another notch. Last weekend I stayed at four different Starwood properties and there's no question that the W Union Square is heads and shoulders above the rest. Great staff, comfortable beds and extravagant bathrooms, and by the way did I mention great staff? Repeat repeat repeat. Don't even bother considering other hotels in NYC. Watching the sunset at night and waking up to the Union Square farmers market in the morning is not going to happen anywhere else. Treat yourself!

The hotel, building and rooms are quite nice. The lobby is very stylish. The location is very good, right on Union Square with lots of things to see, 15-20 min walking distance to SoHo. The service was not so good though. The front dest staff was not so friendly, and the restaurant service was extremely slow with very high price. I think you can find better hotels for this value, and definitely eat better somewhere else.

Just returned from a fantastic weekend at the W Union Square. They were amazingly accomodating of all my requests and surprised me with a special Birthday treat of Champagne and Cupcakes. THANK YOU "W". The room was very clean and the bed extremely comfortable. We even had a great view of Union Square. I will definitely return. This hotel is very convenient for getting to all parts of the city. We highly recommend it.

Dirty rooms, dirty corridors. First night had a dark room with absolutely no light for more than 400 dollars, had to ask for a change...Room service extremely expensive for less than average quality.Will never come back

The hotel is in a great location but I feel the price is too expensive. Make sure to take advantage of the free Acura car service. The lobby is great spot to people watch.I would stay here again if the price was right.

Ok, the rooms are larger than in some other W Hotels (in particular the W Hotel on Lexington Avenue) but charging more than $500 for a standard room is not justified.Also, I asked to be contacted by the manager to negotiate better rates for future stays, however, I was only contacted three days later (after my departure) and after having asked for a call back twice. That's not what the famous W service should look like.

First off, I am a very loyal SPG Member and travel very frequently. We tend to stick with W or Westin hotels. This hotel is old and needs updating. It is not trendy and definitely not hip. But it advertises itself to be. Was I upgraded at checkin? Hard to say as the guy never told me. Was there a newspaper every morning? No. The concierge even gave me wrong directions! The doorman, when there was one, was not very polite. The beds were old and sagging. The gym was small but adequate. I asked for a specific number of towels and I didn't get them. However the one good thing is that you can print out your boarding passes for free in the business center. But the hotel doesn't advertise that fact. You have to go into the Wired room and look on the computer screen and follow the directions. Other than good location, I can't praise anything about this hotel.

I had a wonderful time, the service was professional and made my first overnight trip to New York really special. Stella at the welcome desk and Richard the overnight welcome ambassador were especially nice and fun to speak to. Aisha at the concierge desk was helpful with directions and activity planning, all and all it was fabulous and I can't wait to return.
The interior of the hotel is artsy and inviting, the staff is inviting, and the location hard to beat if you love the city.

The W at Union Square has gone steeply downhill. This used to be our favorite hotel in the country. Now we will never go back. Service is unpredictable and lax. The front desk staff are incompetent to the point of being harmful. The management simply does not care. We were overcharged due to a clerk mistake and were made to feel like we were criminals as the front desk manager argued with me until I cried in frustration. That is very uncool. The hotel is clean (no bed bugs) and safe. You can get better quality service for a much lower price at a Holiday Inn.

Stayed here with my wife for anniversary trip. Am SPG Plat but stayed on points. So, I will not comment on value for dollar as have no clue what rate was on our stay. First, the manager was very responsive and accomodating to certain of my requests. I did receive a bottle of sparkling wine and chocolate strawberries for our anniversary from the management. That was a great gesture and was indicative of how managment treated us during the stay. The location of the hotels is great for seeing the city. Right next to Union Square station which is perfect for subway access uptow and a quick ride on the F to Williamsburg if you want to see the hipsters there. Also perfect to walk to Chelsea, SOHO, Greenwhich and even Midtown.Room cleanliness was average. For example, shower curtain was quite stinky (but they did replace immediately upon my request). Maid service, however, was fine and prompt.Staff was adequate. By that I mean they always were responsive--not overly friendly but not abrasive either. Room was quite for NY especially since hotel is on Park. We were on 7 which is fairly low floor but NYC noise was not an issue.So, I recommend this place as a jumping off point for seeing NYC and props to the management for being so great.

I travel for business frequently and routinely seek out Starwood properties first. This particular trip was to celebrate our wedding anniversary, so I did some research to select the perfect place. I've stayed at a number of the NYC Starwood properties, but this one is my new favorite. The location was perfect. Each staff member we came in contact with was extremely friendly. They genuinely seemed interested in making our stay enjoyable. Room was delightful...roomy, clean and chic. Amenities were fantastic and ample. Great ambiance in lobby. Decent fitness center, too. For as seldom as we get to enjoy leisure travel, this property and the staff made it an all around wonderful experience for us. I can't wait to return..............................

We spent our 10th anniversary in New York passed weekend and stayed at the W Union Square. We experienced very good service from the concierge and other staff. The room was spacious with a nice view over the square (we booked a "spectacular room").We walked everywhere; to Central park, SOHO, NOHO, Nolita, Little Italy, Midtown and Chelsea. The location was perfect!

I stayed here for business. It's in a fantastic location and staff could not have been kinder or more willing to help. The rooms are huge by NY standards! The trendy W was its typical techno modern feel with dark halls and hip music in the elevator. When I woke up at night, I could smell "dirty person" on my pillow and sheets. I moved to the other bed. It seems they neglected to clean bed linens from the last guest which is GROSS. I won't ding them too hard on this, but it needed to be noted.

I had a reservation in this hotel during very busy time, and being busy myself I asked 4 different people for an email address a week ahead so I can write down my questions or possible requests (NOT demands, only requests as I understood the hotel is busy and I had a very cheap rate, I only wanted to place a request), all 4 of those people started their answers with annoyed "Ugh!" and all of them refused to give me anyone's email. I booked room with 2 dbls, but the hotel operator was literaly cutting me off before finishing my sentence saying i booked 1 bed. I offered to forward her my confirmation, she again cut me off with "ugh! No no no you booked one bed i have it right in front of me". I didnt have time to fight so I said, ok its one bed, can you please place a request if anything opens up to do 2 beds or place extra pillows and blankets so we can sleep on a floor", she repeated I booked a king. I said " I am not asking you to switch anything I am asking you to place a request". She got irritated and trasfered to FD. I'm not even going to continue, but I can tell you-I know I pay low rate therefore I really dont expect to be treated great, but this was a bit too much. Luckily there was another hotel available so at the last minute I switched hotels, I would be ashamed to take my family to this hotel and have them be treated like this.

I live in the neighborhood and needed to move to stay in a hotel very last minute late on a Sunday night. W Union Square was available (very lucky). Check in was quick and perfect. Lobby is beautiful. Guestroom was on a high floor in the back of the building with a nice view east over Irving Place. Everything perfect, super comfy bed, good room size, really high ceilings, beautiful bathroom, great Bliss amenities, friendly employees, both wake up call and backup wake up call came on time and did I mention the awesome bed?Hope to never need a hotel under these circumstances again, but either way, the place came through in a pinch. Very grateful.

I have stayed in 2 W hotels before - Minneapolis and New Orleans. Both were great. The W Union Square was in a great location. It had a nice lobby and bar and was relatively clean. They let us check in early to one of our two rooms. The concierge was wonderful. We could barely hear any other guests and our room was on the back side and you'd never guess we were on Park Ave. BUT...front desk staff were hurried and unfriendly (I am a native northeasterner so I am used to east-coast attitudes) - not up to the expectation I'd have for a W. I wasn't asked if I had a starwood number, which I did, even though I didn't put it on the reservation. They just, always ask - but not this time since they were in such a hurry (no one else was waiting). The room we stayed in was a good size, with a great bathroom, but the hallway and room had the lingering odor of smoke covered up by air freshener. Our friends were never notified when their room was available, as promised;their room didn't smell, but they could hear the Park Ave noise. The hall rugs were stained from what looked like some water damage. The bill for the room across the hall was slid under our door. The final letdown was that the turndown staff stole my powder makeup (really? makeup?). And when I told the front desk person, I got the same hurried, mumbled, robot-like response ('my apologies for the inconvenience'...that's about it.).I also just found out that the hotel filed for bankruptcy in May. So I would guess that the prospect of any improvements is low and that the hotel will slowly keep going downhill unless starwood intervenes. I won't stay here next time I'm in NYC.

Had a great night on the town with my sis, and we stayed at the W on the 4th floor. The location couldn't be beat and there was surprising little street noise from the room. I recommend a martini at Olives, and make friends with the doormen. They know what they're doing and can get you anywhere you need to go.

Although still quite stylish its an older building and its not quite up to W standards.Had a corner suite looking out over the square but was relatively small. If you can get good rates then maybe worthwhile but at $900 a night it felt overpriced.

Had a great stay at the W, from the moment I walked in, to the time I checked out. We requested a room with two double beds, and the only room they had available was a sub-par room. We were upgraded, by our generous guest service agent, to a beautiful corner king room with an extremely comfortable cot bed, with no charge. The bed was very comfortable, only one less to the Westin Beds. The location is also great, as its right in Union Square and a populated subway station.Compared to any other W I have stayed at, this was my favorite one, since it wasn't obnoxiously in your face TREND. Great for any age, and a definite choice for another stay in the city.

We had four rooms at the W-Union Square to celebrate a very special Birthday. This was our first time at the W and I was concerned because it was found by the teens in the group. But my concerns were soon quieted. This is a WONDERFUL hotel for any age. It is right at the corner of 17 and Park Avenue South. Minutes from the Village and close to subways going to East/West side. There is a CVS drugstore right next door that carries food, beverages and wine. There are 3 Starbucks within a few blocks. There are restaurants everywhere and a Barnes and Noble down the street. These are all good things, but the thing that makes this hotel stand out is the staff that will be there greeting you. Give your car to Keith as you go and check-in. Call for extra towels and they will be there before you can hang up the phone. Like the Bliss products? Mention that you need extra anything and it will be delivered with a smile. Tired after sightseeing all day and wondering what t the 20-somethings will do while you sleep? The famous Underbar is in the basement. The rooms are spacious and quiet. This is a happening place that will have you coming back again and again. Go now!! You will not be sorry!

After reading some negative reviews was a little apprehensive about staying here. Was completely impressed and thrilled with the location, amenities, services and incredible staff. This is great location, the outdoor market, shopping and restaurants.Mod, comfortable rooms. Traveled with 7 year old. Very quiet at night, incredible.

We booked a Spectacular Room for one night (8/7/10) looking forward to what was promoted on their website: "More spacious than our Wonderful Room, with sunlight-filled views of Union Square or the storied downtown neighborhood. Lounge, wrapped in soft terry robes, in the overstuffed velvet armchair with Munchie Box delights."Instead we received a small dark room with a tiny window, no terry robes, no bathtub as pictured on website, no munchie box delights.We had to call for the robes, and were told the "munchie delights" were in the refrigerator for a charge and not all Spectacular rooms had bathtubs as pictured on website. The location was great but disappointed in the room and the attitude of the front desk.
user_name:
crtrip087
New York City, New York

review_body: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the W and will definitely stay here again. Plusses:- Great service, with a special shout out to Natalie, who was so kind and helpful.- Great location. Central to everything and within walking distance to East and West Villages, Chelsea and Meatpacking District.- Good value if you're using SPG points+cash. We stayed in the Spectacular Room, which is a nice size for rooms in NYC. The bed was spacious and so comfortable.OKs:- Room decor probably doesn't measure up to the new W hotels, and isn't much to write home about. Also, the one window in the room is pretty small, and doesn't allow for much viewing or light.- Fitness center is small, but clean and tidy.Minuses:- It cost $10 to print 1 page. That is a bit excessive.

I have been to W's before---but this location the best I have stayed at. My room was large for NYC. Great Breakfast at Olives. Staff genuinely friendly and helpful--not just the hipsters in black who are too cool that I have experienced at other W's. Packed a great airplane pack lunch for return flight (and thank goodness because of delays of flights I was the only happy person at the airport) I will return

My wife and I visited New York city for the first time July.22-27.2010 and chose to stay at the W Union Square based on our previous wonderful experience staying at the amazing W Fort Lauderdale in Florida which was WOW..literally. (you may want to read my review about it).The W Union Square is nicely located in the city. A 10 minute taxi-ride or subway-ride will take you to Times Square. The hotel is in a 100 year old landmark buidling that's nice, clean and quiet. The staff are amazing. Check in was a breeze with the phenomenal Tamara who went out of her way to make us feel welcome. We stayed at a mega room, which was OK for size, not as big or luxurious as you would expect for almost $500 per night. Nothing bad here, but we sort of expected the room and the hotel in general to be as amazing as the one in Fort Lauderdale, which wasn't the case unfortunately. I'm told that hotels in NYC have smaller rooms anyway. As I said, we didn't have any specific complaints about the hotel but we were not "wow'ed" !!So basically, it's a nice clean hotel that meets the standards of the industry but no extras here. No spa, pool, or large lobby to relax at. In other words, there's very little luxury but all the basic needs are met. Again, for the price you pay, you'd expect more than the basics. Would I stay at another W ? Absolutely.Would I stay at this W ? Probably not ! Unless the rates drop significantly.

Stayed at the W Union Square for two nights this month (July) while apartment hunting. Myself and two daughters enjoyed our roomy upgraded accommodations. What made our stay so pleasurable was the staff at The W Union Square. The Door Men, Front Desk, Concierge and Housekeeping all made it their business to ensure our stay was wonderful. Direction, suggestions, you name it.Good Location & restaurants in the area, check with the concierge she had great suggestions.Enjoy!

I booked two rooms at the W for myself and friends who were coming from out of town. We were meeting for a mini college reunion. I often find it hard to pick a hotel because I am concerned mainly that it won't be clean and comfortable. The W was immaculate! The room with a king bed was spacious and the bed was so comfortable. I was also impressed with the service. Check in was so easy and quick. Everyone at The W was helpful and friendly. I would love to have another stay. My friends who came from other parts of the country were also extremely pleased with their stay.

We stayed at the W over the weekend and were blown away by how seriously they take their mantra of 'wherever, whenever'. Nelson checked us into the top floor of the hotel and was ready to answer all of our questions and make us feel welcome. After we unpacked, we went down to see the concierge staff - both Nova and Aisha were superlative in their suggestions of where to go and what to do. We sort of goofed on Saturday night and ended up at a restaurant we hadn't expected to be at. When we told Aisha the next day, she made sure we had her card so that we could call her if we found ourselves in the same situation during the day Sunday. In the meantime, she made our dinner reservations for us and was prompt about calling us to confirm them.When we got back to the hotel on Sunday night, we felt like we were safe and at home. NYC is exciting but also a little scary if you're not used to it. It felt like the staff at the W had our back and were ready to help us forget about the hustle and bustle outside. Everyone greeted us with a smile.The hotel room itself was much larger than we expected and the amenities had us looking for a 'Bliss' store in NYC so we could pick some up for ourselves. The room was clean and we slept like logs - not something we expected to do in NYC. We had breakfast at Olives on Monday morning - it was great. The lemon crepes were filling enough to last me a ride back to Boston that day. Kudos to the excellent wait staff in the restuarant for delivering piping hot food quickly and efficiently.We had a beautiful visit to this hotel and are planning on going back next year sometime. We were actually celebrating our 3-year marriage anniversary to each other and thought it was the perfect weekend get-away.

We had a WONDERFUL! time while staying at the W! Everyone was extremely friendly, helpful, and courteous. The suite was fabulous and spacious and the bed was so comfortable. We enjoyed the view from our room of the park at Union Square. The cheese/fruit tray and wine was much appreciated after a long exhausting trip. All of the staff at the W did an awesome job. The atmosphere was outstanding which was shown by the friendly smiles and the appearance of the staff working effortlessly together. Everyone seems to love being employed at the W. Thank you so much for an amazing stay. We do hope to return to the W.

My wife and I had stayed here 5 years ago during the US Open and found the hotel to be immaculately kept, staffed my capable, friendly people and sylishly decorated without being too precious. We returned for a quick weekend getway this past May... we found all the same superlatives to be true still. It is in a great location. close enough to all the MidTown attractions, but also close to downtown, Chinatown, Greenwich Village.. all that.. The staff were great.. their hospitality was exemplary... here's an example: I had left my iPod in their iPod dock in my room. I didn't discover this until I had made it back to my home in Arlington, VA. Even though it was 1 AM, the staff never blanced and immediately went and personally searched for it. they found it. I had it back in 2 days.I would give this hotel good marks without this last story... out of the W's in Manhattan, i think this is the best one...
Stayed there many times, consistently good, was given room upgrade without requesting.

This was my fourth stay at this hotel and it is by far my favorite. I have stayed at several other hotels in NYC, but I always try to stay at the W Union Square when I can. The hotel is located across the street from a farmers market held on Friday's and Saturday's which is always a treat. The subway is also located close by. The beds are like sleeping on a cloud, absolutely to die for! I highly recommend the W Union Square.

Stayed in the W Union Square for 1 week and I proposed to my girlfriend. I wrote to the hotel if they could help me with my proposal and so they did. I could make use of the rooftop to pop the question with the best view of Manhattan and Brooklyn. There was Champagne as well. I would like to thank especially Mrs. Elizabeth Baker and Temara Exton for all the preparation, communication and help during my stay. They make my proposal memorable and special. So a big THANK YOU again.

Have been staying at this property for 9 years, on average 8 times a year. Staff are magnificent. They are beyond professional, knowing what you want before you know what you want. The front desk staff, room service (Whatever, Whenever), and management are intuitive about their guests and use that to their advantage to make everyone feel more than welcome but at home. The rooms are fresh, spacious, and many have terrific views of the park. Amenities are excellent, including the Bliss bath products. Housekeeping is always on top of things. The attitude of the place is: just pick up the phone and we'll make it happen.Olive's (one of the first Todd English, Boston spinoffs) has the best menu with food prepared by a very talented kitchen. Server's are helpful and knowledgeable. Great for breakfast, brunch, and dinner. Underbar has a wonderful selection of drinks, a full selection of beverages, and delightful bartenders. These places can get loud at night but the rooms are always very quiet.Neighborhood is one of the best in NYC. Great central location. Only downside is they are not inexpensive but they are worth the price (especially if you hunt for special deals on the website). Hard to imagine someone staying at W Union Square and not feeling great!

My husband and i stayed at the W Union square for the weekend two weeks ago and were blown away with this hotel. The staff is extremely friendly and professional, ready to help you with whatever you wish. The hotel amenities are also amazing. Union square is a great location with something always going on. You are also a short cab ride from some of the greatest parts of the city.

After having a snafu with the reservation at the hotel last year, they more than made up for it this year. It had literally been a year since I'd last stayed at the hotel, but they remembered the issue we had last year and did everything to make my stay pleasant. The location is great, the lobby bar (with free wireless access) is fun and the beds are amazingly comfortable. They also have a nice bar in the basement. It is not the cheapest option in NY, but if you want to treat yourself, it's a great choice.

Our stay was brief , but extremely enjoyable. I can't wait to stay there, again. From our check-in and the healthy Granny Smith apples available for the taking, to our room's comfortable bed, more than adequate bathroom, and amenities from the general manager, we couldn't have asked for a better "glad you are here" feeling and reception. This W hotel really knows how to treat and pamper a guest!!!

Stayed here for just one night and was not impressed with much about this hotel. Check in desk was efficient but quite disinterested and abrupt.Room was clean and quite large for NYC. They tried to charge us $25.00 for a cot, but I called the manager and told her that we were promised a free cot when I made the reservations. She didn't seem to believe me but said there would be no charge for it. The cot was to be brought up to our room during the day but when we returned at 1:00 a.m. it still hadn't been delivered. Only three bath towels in our room and after an hour of waiting for more towels...still none. After a phone call to the front desk to inquire about the towels, two different housekeepers showed up with towels! Asked bellman to hold our luggage in a room and upon our return walked by our unattended luggage on a cart at the front door. My husband's computer, etc. were sitting there for at least an hour without anybody guarding it...the luggage was right next to the front door!This hotel was fine for what we were looking for on this trip...a place to crash for the night. There was really nothing special about it. Just average.

The W Union Square is in a great location if you want to be closer to the Village/Soho but we found the room to be somewhat average and disappointing for the price. One would expect that at over $450/night the hotel could at least provide a shower cap and more than one soap so you don't have to share the soap between the bathroom sink and the shower. Do I really need to call housekeeping to request these amenities that should be standard?? We also arrived at check in at 3-something after a long flight from the west coast and despite early check in and late check out promises due to our Starwood membership, the room was not made available until 6pm. TOTALLY unacceptable. The hotel did offer me a glass of wine and breakfast for two to make up for it, but this shouldn't have happened. On the plus side, the concierge was very helpful in getting us all our desired dinner reservations and the front desk manager was nice to offer the wine and breakfast. Overall, I would only go back if the price is right as there are far nicer hotels for the price.

I have to tell you I travel and stay in hotels 300+ days a year. I stayed in this hotel in December. I originally made a reservation at the Crowne Plaza I am platinum with both. They were rather rude to me on the phone. I have stayed there MANY times. I called the W and they were VERY nice. I had a very nice room with a view of Union Square. Room service was amazing, as was service! I needed to ship a package fedex they brought me up a box and shipped it out. They notified me when my package I was expecting came on my cell phone. They more then met all my expectations! I made a reservation again in January. I was still in the cab when the doorman was pulling out my suit case from the back of the cab and welcomed me back by name OMG! The bellman also welcomed me back by name. When I checked into the hotel they welcomed me back and wished me a happy birthday. In all my stays I can only think of two properties I have been at that they know me on sight by name. Both of which I have stayed at for years and they did not know me after one stay! Throughout the day as I came and left (I was working) everyone I came in contact with passed by on my way to the elevators called me by name and wished me a happy birthday. This evening I heard a knock at my door and I was about to turn in. I went to the door it was the manager with champagne, strawberries dipped in chocolate and 2 Magnolia cupcakes! For those of you who do not know Magnolia you have not lived! They were featured in Sex and the City (Series). This was quite unexpected and WONDERFUL! Albeit I have platinum status with Starwood but I can honestly say they really go the extra mile! They treat you like you are their only guest! ***** WELL WORTH STAYING!!!! Food is excellent, service impeccable, rooms beautiful, beds comfortable, view amazing, weekends feature farmers market within walking distance, near subways, cabs, centrally located, state of the art gym, SECURE key access to floors (a must for NYC), walking distance to restaurants, and shopping.

The W Union Square is simply the best-in-class among high-end business hotels in New York and across the country. My assessment is based on many stays at this hotel and extensive experience with other fine hotels in New York, in major cities around the United Stastes, and in other parts of the world. The physical reasons are plentiful: excellent location with easy access uptown or downtown -- a neighborhood with some of the city's greatest restaurants a short walk away (Gramercy Tavern, Blue Water Grill, Gotham Bar & Grill, Union Square Cafe, Veritas, and literally hundreds of the best are nearby). Business entertaining is thus easy and pleasant, and could include the hotel's Olives Restaurant, run by celebrity chef Todd English, where I often hold business breakfasts.The rooms are spacious, with great beds, great showers/bathrooms, and an outstanding work area with high-speed internet access. The very good rasio alarms also have Ipod docking stations. I get tons of work done very productively there. Across the street, Union Square always is bustling, and on at least three days a week it boasts the finest farmer's market in the city. What a treat! After visiting the terrific restaurants, sushi bars, seafood houses, barbeque joint, and green market within a two-block radius, the W allows you to work off the calories in a superb fitness center stocked with first-rate equipment. The rooms are cleaned and stiocked masterfully by the excellenrt "room stylists," who always address even the most minor special request (e.g., extra linens or such). But those are just physical attributes. As with human beings, the true beauty of a fine hotel goes way beyond physical beauty. The spirit that sets this place apart comes from an extraordinary team of people, and their passion for true hospitality. I've always been delighted by the service at W hotels (have stayed very often at the one in San Francisco, Los Angeles, and elsewhere, including the superb Court and Tuscany hotels on E. 39th St.). At the W Union Square, it's the W spitrit on steroids. The good feeling starts with the best front door team (known as welcome ambassadors), to an amazing front desk team, to extremely helpful concierges, and to great customer relations specialists and managers. I know many of them by name and would like to mention them here, but I am afraid to omit anyone. They consitently come through for me every time a stay there, and they make me feel like family -- on every visit, at least a couple of the guys at the door ask for my wife, who they've met; it means so much to me that they also make her feel at home when she comes. The W Union Square gets my strongest recommendation, as many of my friends and colleagues know. I'm a huge fan.
user_name:
fordpat
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: A very warm and personal greeting from the doorman led on to an excellent check in service, where the receptionist recognised us from a phone call the week before when we thought we may have to cancel our trip due to the volcanic ash cloud (note that although we were on a non refundable advance purchase rate, they confirmed they would provide a full refund) and we received an upgrade to suite. The suite was amazing with a lovely bathroom with huge window and tub and shower. Free wifi in the lounge, and the ability to check in online and print off our boarding passes, plus an excellent concierge service are all those little extras that add up to a great stay.
this is a terrific hotel, Downtown NYC is a fine place to stay with excellent restaurants, the High Line and the SOHO Chelsea areas close by. Clean good service and great staff
This upscale hotel is a gem. A stay here gives you faith that there still are hotels that are clean, classy, and guest oriented. The bathrooms are spacious and spotless, with

Stayed 1 night using Starwood's "cash&points" option. The hotel went "all out" with regard to our stay being for my big birthday. Normal upgrade became a suite, complimentary birthday bottle of champagne, fabulous mini & large cupcakes delivered too (much to our surprise!).I cannot say enough about their attention to detail. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!

My stay at the W Hotel could not have been more perfect. From the smiley doormen to the wonderful staff everyone was terrific.The Hotel is clean and spotless 24 hours a day and the maid service is the best in NY City. Whatever it is that you do to train the staff at the W Hotel please do not change a thing because you do not fine customer service like this anywhere. From the moment you arrive to the time you leave the staff makes you feel so special and all you want to do is stay or come back as soon as you can. Thank you again for a amazing time at the W Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The experience of commuting into the city on a friday nite is enough to make anyone sick.I travel for business all the time and stay at 4 star hotels. I have to commend the hotel property and insiders on the staff,from the moment I stepped out of the car with my wife and 15 girls(birthday party sleepover for a 13yr old) and luggage everyone was so kind I thought I was on a vacation. The doorman even greeted me by my name when I returned from my night out and even the next day! The insider (manager on duty) Liz was extremely helpful in making sure everything was fine during my stay.This was my first time staying at a "W" and I will defintely try to stay at one everytime I travel.
user_name:

review_body: Best Hotel in NYC for Business or Personal Trip. Beautiful hotel, very clean, & trendy. Location is GREAT, in the heart of NYC. Anthony (Front Desk Manager) was very helpful during my last stay -- he was beyond helpful and nice!!!

Room were very small, charge/fee were high for the size of the room.You need a key card to access the elevator, it almost never work. It is not a place for family with children. There is nothing for children to do in hotel.
